module Network.AWS.DMS.Types.Certificate

-- | The SSL certificate that can be used to encrypt connections between
--   the endpoints and the replication instance.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCertificate</a> smart constructor.
data Certificate
Certificate' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Base64 -> Maybe Int -> Maybe POSIX -> Certificate

-- | The owner of the certificate.
[$sel:certificateOwner:Certificate'] :: Certificate -> Maybe Text

-- | The signing algorithm for the certificate.
[$sel:signingAlgorithm:Certificate'] :: Certificate -> Maybe Text

-- | The beginning date that the certificate is valid.
[$sel:validFromDate:Certificate'] :: Certificate -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The contents of a <tt>.pem</tt> file, which contains an X.509
--   certificate.
[$sel:certificatePem:Certificate'] :: Certificate -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the certificate.
[$sel:certificateArn:Certificate'] :: Certificate -> Maybe Text

-- | The date that the certificate was created.
[$sel:certificateCreationDate:Certificate'] :: Certificate -> Maybe POSIX

-- | A customer-assigned name for the certificate. Identifiers must begin
--   with a letter and must contain only ASCII letters, digits, and
--   hyphens. They can't end with a hyphen or contain two consecutive
--   hyphens.
[$sel:certificateIdentifier:Certificate'] :: Certificate -> Maybe Text

-- | The location of an imported Oracle Wallet certificate for use with
--   SSL.
[$sel:certificateWallet:Certificate'] :: Certificate -> Maybe Base64

-- | The key length of the cryptographic algorithm being used.
[$sel:keyLength:Certificate'] :: Certificate -> Maybe Int

-- | The final date that the certificate is valid.
[$sel:validToDate:Certificate'] :: Certificate -> Maybe POSIX

--

module Network.AWS.DMS.Types.Connection

-- | Status of the connection between an endpoint and a replication
--   instance, including Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) and the last error
--   message issued.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newConnection</a> smart constructor.
data Connection
Connection' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Connection

-- | The connection status. This parameter can return one of the following
--   values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>"successful"</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>"testing"</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>"failed"</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>"deleting"</pre></li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:status:Connection'] :: Connection -> Maybe Text

-- | The ARN of the replication instance.
[$sel:replicationInstanceArn:Connection'] :: Connection -> Maybe Text

-- | The identifier of the endpoint. Identifiers must begin with a letter
--   and must contain only ASCII letters, digits, and hyphens. They can't
--   end with a hyphen or contain two consecutive hyphens.
[$sel:endpointIdentifier:Connection'] :: Connection -> Maybe Text

-- | The replication instance identifier. This parameter is stored as a
--   lowercase string.
[$sel:replicationInstanceIdentifier:Connection'] :: Connection -> Maybe Text

-- | The ARN string that uniquely identifies the endpoint.
[$sel:endpointArn:Connection'] :: Connection -> Maybe Text

-- | The error message when the connection last failed.
[$sel:lastFailureMessage:Connection'] :: Connection -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Connection</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:Connection'</a>, <a>connection_status</a> - The
--   connection status. This parameter can return one of the following
--   values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>"successful"</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>"testing"</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>"failed"</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>"deleting"</pre></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:replicationInstanceArn:Connection'</a>,
--   <a>connection_replicationInstanceArn</a> - The ARN of the replication
--   instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endpointIdentifier:Connection'</a>,
--   <a>connection_endpointIdentifier</a> - The identifier of the endpoint.
--   Identifiers must begin with a letter and must contain only ASCII
--   letters, digits, and hyphens. They can't end with a hyphen or contain
--   two consecutive hyphens.
--   
--   <a>$sel:replicationInstanceIdentifier:Connection'</a>,
--   <a>connection_replicationInstanceIdentifier</a> - The replication
--   instance identifier. This parameter is stored as a lowercase string.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endpointArn:Connection'</a>, <a>connection_endpointArn</a> -
--   The ARN string that uniquely identifies the endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastFailureMessage:Connection'</a>,
--   <a>connection_lastFailureMessage</a> - The error message when the
--   connection last failed.
newConnection :: Connection

-- | The connection status. This parameter can return one of the following
--   values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>"successful"</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>"testing"</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>"failed"</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>"deleting"</pre></li>
--   </ul>
connection_status :: Lens' Connection (Maybe Text)

-- | The ARN of the replication instance.
connection_replicationInstanceArn :: Lens' Connection (Maybe Text)

-- | The identifier of the endpoint. Identifiers must begin with a letter
--   and must contain only ASCII letters, digits, and hyphens. They can't
--   end with a hyphen or contain two consecutive hyphens.
connection_endpointIdentifier :: Lens' Connection (Maybe Text)

-- | The replication instance identifier. This parameter is stored as a
--   lowercase string.
connection_replicationInstanceIdentifier :: Lens' Connection (Maybe Text)

-- | The ARN string that uniquely identifies the endpoint.
connection_endpointArn :: Lens' Connection (Maybe Text)

-- | The error message when the connection last failed.
connection_lastFailureMessage :: Lens' Connection (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.DMS.Types.Connection.Connection
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.DMS.Types.Connection.Connection
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.DMS.Types.Connection.Connection
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.DMS.Types.Connection.Connection
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.DMS.Types.Connection.Connection
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.DMS.Types.Connection.Connection
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.DMS.Types.Connection.Connection

module Network.AWS.DMS.Types.DmsTransferSettings

-- | The settings in JSON format for the DMS Transfer type source endpoint.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDmsTransferSettings</a> smart constructor.
data DmsTransferSettings
DmsTransferSettings' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> DmsTransferSettings

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) used by the service access IAM role.
--   The role must allow the <tt>iam:PassRole</tt> action.
[$sel:serviceAccessRoleArn:DmsTransferSettings'] :: DmsTransferSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the S3 bucket to use.
[$sel:bucketName:DmsTransferSettings'] :: DmsTransferSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DmsTransferSettings</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:serviceAccessRoleArn:DmsTransferSettings'</a>,
--   <a>dmsTransferSettings_serviceAccessRoleArn</a> - The Amazon Resource
--   Name (ARN) used by the service access IAM role. The role must allow
--   the <tt>iam:PassRole</tt> action.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bucketName:DmsTransferSettings'</a>,
--   <a>dmsTransferSettings_bucketName</a> - The name of the S3 bucket to
--   use.
newDmsTransferSettings :: DmsTransferSettings

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) used by the service access IAM role.
--   The role must allow the <tt>iam:PassRole</tt> action.
dmsTransferSettings_serviceAccessRoleArn :: Lens' DmsTransferSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the S3 bucket to use.
dmsTransferSettings_bucketName :: Lens' DmsTransferSettings (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.DMS.Types.DmsTransferSettings.DmsTransferSettings
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.DMS.Types.DmsTransferSettings.DmsTransferSettings
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.DMS.Types.DmsTransferSettings.DmsTransferSettings
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.DMS.Types.DmsTransferSettings.DmsTransferSettings
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.DMS.Types.DmsTransferSettings.DmsTransferSettings
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.DMS.Types.DmsTransferSettings.DmsTransferSettings
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.DMS.Types.DmsTransferSettings.DmsTransferSettings
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.DMS.Types.DmsTransferSettings.DmsTransferSettings

module Network.AWS.DMS.Types.ElasticsearchSettings

-- | Provides information that defines an Elasticsearch endpoint.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newElasticsearchSettings</a> smart constructor.
data ElasticsearchSettings
ElasticsearchSettings' :: Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Text -> Text -> ElasticsearchSettings

-- | The maximum percentage of records that can fail to be written before a
--   full load operation stops.
--   
--   To avoid early failure, this counter is only effective after 1000
--   records are transferred. Elasticsearch also has the concept of error
--   monitoring during the last 10 minutes of an Observation Window. If
--   transfer of all records fail in the last 10 minutes, the full load
--   operation stops.
[$sel:fullLoadErrorPercentage:ElasticsearchSettings'] :: ElasticsearchSettings -> Maybe Int

-- | The maximum number of seconds for which DMS retries failed API
--   requests to the Elasticsearch cluster.
[$sel:errorRetryDuration:ElasticsearchSettings'] :: ElasticsearchSettings -> Maybe Int

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) used by the service to access the IAM
--   role. The role must allow the <tt>iam:PassRole</tt> action.
[$sel:serviceAccessRoleArn:ElasticsearchSettings'] :: ElasticsearchSettings -> Text

-- | The endpoint for the Elasticsearch cluster. DMS uses HTTPS if a
--   transport protocol (http/https) is not specified.
[$sel:endpointUri:ElasticsearchSettings'] :: ElasticsearchSettings -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ElasticsearchSettings</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:fullLoadErrorPercentage:ElasticsearchSettings'</a>,
--   <a>elasticsearchSettings_fullLoadErrorPercentage</a> - The maximum
--   percentage of records that can fail to be written before a full load
--   operation stops.
--   
--   To avoid early failure, this counter is only effective after 1000
--   records are transferred. Elasticsearch also has the concept of error
--   monitoring during the last 10 minutes of an Observation Window. If
--   transfer of all records fail in the last 10 minutes, the full load
--   operation stops.
--   
--   <a>$sel:errorRetryDuration:ElasticsearchSettings'</a>,
--   <a>elasticsearchSettings_errorRetryDuration</a> - The maximum number
--   of seconds for which DMS retries failed API requests to the
--   Elasticsearch cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:serviceAccessRoleArn:ElasticsearchSettings'</a>,
--   <a>elasticsearchSettings_serviceAccessRoleArn</a> - The Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN) used by the service to access the IAM role. The
--   role must allow the <tt>iam:PassRole</tt> action.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endpointUri:ElasticsearchSettings'</a>,
--   <a>elasticsearchSettings_endpointUri</a> - The endpoint for the
--   Elasticsearch cluster. DMS uses HTTPS if a transport protocol
--   (http/https) is not specified.
newElasticsearchSettings :: Text -> Text -> ElasticsearchSettings

-- | The maximum percentage of records that can fail to be written before a
--   full load operation stops.
--   
--   To avoid early failure, this counter is only effective after 1000
--   records are transferred. Elasticsearch also has the concept of error
--   monitoring during the last 10 minutes of an Observation Window. If
--   transfer of all records fail in the last 10 minutes, the full load
--   operation stops.
elasticsearchSettings_fullLoadErrorPercentage :: Lens' ElasticsearchSettings (Maybe Int)

-- | The maximum number of seconds for which DMS retries failed API
--   requests to the Elasticsearch cluster.
elasticsearchSettings_errorRetryDuration :: Lens' ElasticsearchSettings (Maybe Int)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) used by the service to access the IAM
--   role. The role must allow the <tt>iam:PassRole</tt> action.
elasticsearchSettings_serviceAccessRoleArn :: Lens' ElasticsearchSettings Text

-- | The endpoint for the Elasticsearch cluster. DMS uses HTTPS if a
--   transport protocol (http/https) is not specified.
elasticsearchSettings_endpointUri :: Lens' ElasticsearchSettings Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.DMS.Types.ElasticsearchSettings.ElasticsearchSettings
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.DMS.Types.ElasticsearchSettings.ElasticsearchSettings
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.DMS.Types.ElasticsearchSettings.ElasticsearchSettings
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.DMS.Types.ElasticsearchSettings.ElasticsearchSettings
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.DMS.Types.ElasticsearchSettings.ElasticsearchSettings
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.DMS.Types.ElasticsearchSettings.ElasticsearchSettings
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.DMS.Types.ElasticsearchSettings.ElasticsearchSettings
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.DMS.Types.ElasticsearchSettings.ElasticsearchSettings

instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.DMS.Types.EndpointSettingTypeValue.EndpointSettingTypeValue
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.DMS.Types.EndpointSettingTypeValue.EndpointSettingTypeValue
instance GHC.Classes.Ord Network.AWS.DMS.Types.EndpointSettingTypeValue.EndpointSettingTypeValue
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.DMS.Types.EndpointSettingTypeValue.EndpointSettingTypeValue
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.DMS.Types.EndpointSettingTypeValue.EndpointSettingTypeValue
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.DMS.Types.EndpointSettingTypeValue.EndpointSettingTypeValue


module Network.AWS.DMS.Types.EndpointSetting

-- | Endpoint settings.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEndpointSetting</a> smart constructor.
data EndpointSetting
EndpointSetting' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe EndpointSettingTypeValue -> Maybe [Text] -> EndpointSetting

-- | A value that marks this endpoint setting as sensitive.
[$sel:sensitive:EndpointSetting'] :: EndpointSetting -> Maybe Bool

-- | The maximum value of an endpoint setting that is of type <tt>int</tt>.
[$sel:intValueMax:EndpointSetting'] :: EndpointSetting -> Maybe Int

-- | The relevance or validity of an endpoint setting for an engine name
--   and its endpoint type.
[$sel:applicability:EndpointSetting'] :: EndpointSetting -> Maybe Text

-- | The name that you want to give the endpoint settings.
[$sel:name:EndpointSetting'] :: EndpointSetting -> Maybe Text

-- | The minimum value of an endpoint setting that is of type <tt>int</tt>.
[$sel:intValueMin:EndpointSetting'] :: EndpointSetting -> Maybe Int

-- | The unit of measure for this endpoint setting.
[$sel:units:EndpointSetting'] :: EndpointSetting -> Maybe Text

-- | The default value of the endpoint setting if no value is specified
--   using <tt>CreateEndpoint</tt> or <tt>ModifyEndpoint</tt>.
[$sel:defaultValue:EndpointSetting'] :: EndpointSetting -> Maybe Text

-- | The type of endpoint. Valid values are <tt>source</tt> and
--   <tt>target</tt>.
[$sel:type':EndpointSetting'] :: EndpointSetting -> Maybe EndpointSettingTypeValue

-- | Enumerated values to use for this endpoint.
[$sel:enumValues:EndpointSetting'] :: EndpointSetting -> Maybe [Text]

-- | Create a value of <a>EndpointSetting</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:sensitive:EndpointSetting'</a>,
--   <a>endpointSetting_sensitive</a> - A value that marks this endpoint
--   setting as sensitive.
--   
--   <a>$sel:intValueMax:EndpointSetting'</a>,
--   <a>endpointSetting_intValueMax</a> - The maximum value of an endpoint
--   setting that is of type <tt>int</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:applicability:EndpointSetting'</a>,
--   <a>endpointSetting_applicability</a> - The relevance or validity of an
--   endpoint setting for an engine name and its endpoint type.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:EndpointSetting'</a>, <a>endpointSetting_name</a> - The
--   name that you want to give the endpoint settings.
--   
--   <a>$sel:intValueMin:EndpointSetting'</a>,
--   <a>endpointSetting_intValueMin</a> - The minimum value of an endpoint
--   setting that is of type <tt>int</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:units:EndpointSetting'</a>, <a>endpointSetting_units</a> - The
--   unit of measure for this endpoint setting.
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultValue:EndpointSetting'</a>,
--   <a>endpointSetting_defaultValue</a> - The default value of the
--   endpoint setting if no value is specified using
--   <tt>CreateEndpoint</tt> or <tt>ModifyEndpoint</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':EndpointSetting'</a>, <a>endpointSetting_type</a> - The
--   type of endpoint. Valid values are <tt>source</tt> and
--   <tt>target</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:enumValues:EndpointSetting'</a>,
--   <a>endpointSetting_enumValues</a> - Enumerated values to use for this
--   endpoint.
newEndpointSetting :: EndpointSetting

-- | A value that marks this endpoint setting as sensitive.
endpointSetting_sensitive :: Lens' EndpointSetting (Maybe Bool)

-- | The maximum value of an endpoint setting that is of type <tt>int</tt>.
endpointSetting_intValueMax :: Lens' EndpointSetting (Maybe Int)

-- | The relevance or validity of an endpoint setting for an engine name
--   and its endpoint type.
endpointSetting_applicability :: Lens' EndpointSetting (Maybe Text)

-- | The name that you want to give the endpoint settings.
endpointSetting_name :: Lens' EndpointSetting (Maybe Text)

-- | The minimum value of an endpoint setting that is of type <tt>int</tt>.
endpointSetting_intValueMin :: Lens' EndpointSetting (Maybe Int)

-- | The unit of measure for this endpoint setting.
endpointSetting_units :: Lens' EndpointSetting (Maybe Text)

-- | The default value of the endpoint setting if no value is specified
--   using <tt>CreateEndpoint</tt> or <tt>ModifyEndpoint</tt>.
endpointSetting_defaultValue :: Lens' EndpointSetting (Maybe Text)

-- | The type of endpoint. Valid values are <tt>source</tt> and
--   <tt>target</tt>.
endpointSetting_type :: Lens' EndpointSetting (Maybe EndpointSettingTypeValue)

-- | Enumerated values to use for this endpoint.
endpointSetting_enumValues :: Lens' EndpointSetting (Maybe [Text])
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.DMS.Types.EndpointSetting.EndpointSetting
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.DMS.Types.EndpointSetting.EndpointSetting
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.DMS.Types.EndpointSetting.EndpointSetting
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.DMS.Types.EndpointSetting.EndpointSetting
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.DMS.Types.EndpointSetting.EndpointSetting
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.DMS.Types.EndpointSetting.EndpointSetting
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.DMS.Types.EndpointSetting.EndpointSetting


module Network.AWS.DMS.Types.EventCategoryGroup

-- | Lists categories of events subscribed to, and generated by, the
--   applicable DMS resource type. This data type appears in response to
--   the <a>DescribeEventCategories</a> action.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEventCategoryGroup</a> smart constructor.
data EventCategoryGroup
EventCategoryGroup' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> EventCategoryGroup

-- | The type of DMS resource that generates events.
--   
--   Valid values: replication-instance | replication-server |
--   security-group | replication-task
[$sel:sourceType:EventCategoryGroup'] :: EventCategoryGroup -> Maybe Text

-- | A list of event categories from a source type that you've chosen.
[$sel:eventCategories:EventCategoryGroup'] :: EventCategoryGroup -> Maybe [Text]

-- | Create a value of <a>EventCategoryGroup</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   <a>eventCategoryGroup_sourceType</a> - The type of DMS resource that
--   generates events.
--   
--   Valid values: replication-instance | replication-server |
--   security-group | replication-task
--   
--   <a>$sel:eventCategories:EventCategoryGroup'</a>,
--   <a>eventCategoryGroup_eventCategories</a> - A list of event categories
--   from a source type that you've chosen.
newEventCategoryGroup :: EventCategoryGroup

-- | The type of DMS resource that generates events.
--   
--   Valid values: replication-instance | replication-server |
--   security-group | replication-task
eventCategoryGroup_sourceType :: Lens' EventCategoryGroup (Maybe Text)

-- | A list of event categories from a source type that you've chosen.
eventCategoryGroup_eventCategories :: Lens' EventCategoryGroup (Maybe [Text])

module Network.AWS.DMS.Types.EventSubscription

-- | Describes an event notification subscription created by the
--   <tt>CreateEventSubscription</tt> operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEventSubscription</a> smart constructor.
data EventSubscription
EventSubscription' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe [Text] -> EventSubscription

-- | The status of the DMS event notification subscription.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   Can be one of the following: creating | modifying | deleting | active
--   | no-permission | topic-not-exist
--   
--   The status "no-permission" indicates that DMS no longer has permission
--   to post to the SNS topic. The status "topic-not-exist" indicates that
--   the topic was deleted after the subscription was created.
[$sel:status:EventSubscription'] :: EventSubscription -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Web Services customer account associated with the DMS event
--   notification subscription.
[$sel:customerAwsId:EventSubscription'] :: EventSubscription -> Maybe Text

-- | The DMS event notification subscription Id.
[$sel:custSubscriptionId:EventSubscription'] :: EventSubscription -> Maybe Text

-- | The topic ARN of the DMS event notification subscription.
[$sel:snsTopicArn:EventSubscription'] :: EventSubscription -> Maybe Text

-- | Boolean value that indicates if the event subscription is enabled.
[$sel:enabled:EventSubscription'] :: EventSubscription -> Maybe Bool

-- | The type of DMS resource that generates events.
--   
--   Valid values: replication-instance | replication-server |
--   security-group | replication-task
[$sel:sourceType:EventSubscription'] :: EventSubscription -> Maybe Text

-- | The time the DMS event notification subscription was created.
[$sel:subscriptionCreationTime:EventSubscription'] :: EventSubscription -> Maybe Text

-- | A lists of event categories.
[$sel:eventCategoriesList:EventSubscription'] :: EventSubscription -> Maybe [Text]

-- | A list of source Ids for the event subscription.
[$sel:sourceIdsList:EventSubscription'] :: EventSubscription -> Maybe [Text]

-- | Create a value of <a>EventSubscription</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:EventSubscription'</a>, <a>eventSubscription_status</a>
--   - The status of the DMS event notification subscription.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   Can be one of the following: creating | modifying | deleting | active
--   | no-permission | topic-not-exist
--   
--   The status "no-permission" indicates that DMS no longer has permission
--   to post to the SNS topic. The status "topic-not-exist" indicates that
--   the topic was deleted after the subscription was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:customerAwsId:EventSubscription'</a>,
--   <a>eventSubscription_customerAwsId</a> - The Amazon Web Services
--   customer account associated with the DMS event notification
--   subscription.
--   
--   <a>$sel:custSubscriptionId:EventSubscription'</a>,
--   <a>eventSubscription_custSubscriptionId</a> - The DMS event
--   notification subscription Id.
--   
--   <a>$sel:snsTopicArn:EventSubscription'</a>,
--   <a>eventSubscription_snsTopicArn</a> - The topic ARN of the DMS event
--   notification subscription.
--   
--   <a>$sel:enabled:EventSubscription'</a>,
--   <a>eventSubscription_enabled</a> - Boolean value that indicates if the
--   event subscription is enabled.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sourceType:EventSubscription'</a>,
--   <a>eventSubscription_sourceType</a> - The type of DMS resource that
--   generates events.
--   
--   Valid values: replication-instance | replication-server |
--   security-group | replication-task
--   
--   <a>$sel:subscriptionCreationTime:EventSubscription'</a>,
--   <a>eventSubscription_subscriptionCreationTime</a> - The time the DMS
--   event notification subscription was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:eventCategoriesList:EventSubscription'</a>,
--   <a>eventSubscription_eventCategoriesList</a> - A lists of event
--   categories.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sourceIdsList:EventSubscription'</a>,
--   <a>eventSubscription_sourceIdsList</a> - A list of source Ids for the
--   event subscription.
newEventSubscription :: EventSubscription

-- | The status of the DMS event notification subscription.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   Can be one of the following: creating | modifying | deleting | active
--   | no-permission | topic-not-exist
--   
--   The status "no-permission" indicates that DMS no longer has permission
--   to post to the SNS topic. The status "topic-not-exist" indicates that
--   the topic was deleted after the subscription was created.
eventSubscription_status :: Lens' EventSubscription (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Web Services customer account associated with the DMS event
--   notification subscription.
eventSubscription_customerAwsId :: Lens' EventSubscription (Maybe Text)

-- | The DMS event notification subscription Id.
eventSubscription_custSubscriptionId :: Lens' EventSubscription (Maybe Text)

-- | The topic ARN of the DMS event notification subscription.
eventSubscription_snsTopicArn :: Lens' EventSubscription (Maybe Text)

-- | Boolean value that indicates if the event subscription is enabled.
eventSubscription_enabled :: Lens' EventSubscription (Maybe Bool)

-- | The type of DMS resource that generates events.
--   
--   Valid values: replication-instance | replication-server |
--   security-group | replication-task
eventSubscription_sourceType :: Lens' EventSubscription (Maybe Text)

-- | The time the DMS event notification subscription was created.
eventSubscription_subscriptionCreationTime :: Lens' EventSubscription (Maybe Text)

-- | A lists of event categories.
eventSubscription_eventCategoriesList :: Lens' EventSubscription (Maybe [Text])

-- | A list of source Ids for the event subscription.
eventSubscription_sourceIdsList :: Lens' EventSubscription (Maybe [Text])
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.DMS.Types.EventSubscription.EventSubscription
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.DMS.Types.EventSubscription.EventSubscription
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.DMS.Types.EventSubscription.EventSubscription
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.DMS.Types.EventSubscription.EventSubscription
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.DMS.Types.EventSubscription.EventSubscription
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.DMS.Types.EventSubscription.EventSubscription
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.DMS.Types.EventSubscription.EventSubscription


module Network.AWS.DMS.Types.Filter

-- | Identifies the name and value of a filter object. This filter is used
--   to limit the number and type of DMS objects that are returned for a
--   particular <tt>Describe*</tt> call or similar operation. Filters are
--   used as an optional parameter for certain API operations.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newFilter</a> smart constructor.
data Filter
Filter' :: Text -> [Text] -> Filter

-- | The name of the filter as specified for a <tt>Describe*</tt> or
--   similar operation.
[$sel:name:Filter'] :: Filter -> Text

-- | The filter value, which can specify one or more values used to narrow
--   the returned results.
[$sel:values:Filter'] :: Filter -> [Text]

-- | Create a value of <a>Filter</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:Filter'</a>, <a>filter_name</a> - The name of the filter
--   as specified for a <tt>Describe*</tt> or similar operation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:values:Filter'</a>, <a>filter_values</a> - The filter value,
--   which can specify one or more values used to narrow the returned
--   results.
newFilter :: Text -> Filter

-- | The name of the filter as specified for a <tt>Describe*</tt> or
--   similar operation.
filter_name :: Lens' Filter Text

-- | The filter value, which can specify one or more values used to narrow
--   the returned results.
filter_values :: Lens' Filter [Text]
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.DMS.Types.Filter.Filter
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.DMS.Types.Filter.Filter
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.DMS.Types.Filter.Filter
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.DMS.Types.Filter.Filter
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.DMS.Types.Filter.Filter
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.DMS.Types.Filter.Filter
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.DMS.Types.Filter.Filter


module Network.AWS.DMS.Types.IBMDb2Settings

-- | Provides information that defines an IBM Db2 LUW endpoint.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newIBMDb2Settings</a> smart constructor.
data IBMDb2Settings
IBMDb2Settings' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> IBMDb2Settings

-- | Fully qualified domain name of the endpoint.
[$sel:serverName:IBMDb2Settings'] :: IBMDb2Settings -> Maybe Text

-- | For ongoing replication (CDC), use CurrentLSN to specify a log
--   sequence number (LSN) where you want the replication to start.
[$sel:currentLsn:IBMDb2Settings'] :: IBMDb2Settings -> Maybe Text

-- | Enables ongoing replication (CDC) as a BOOLEAN value. The default is
--   true.
[$sel:setDataCaptureChanges:IBMDb2Settings'] :: IBMDb2Settings -> Maybe Bool

-- | The full Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role that specifies DMS
--   as the trusted entity and grants the required permissions to access
--   the value in <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt>. The role must allow the
--   <tt>iam:PassRole</tt> action. <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> has the
--   value of the Amazon Web Services Secrets Manager secret that allows
--   access to the Db2 LUW endpoint.
--   
--   You can specify one of two sets of values for these permissions. You
--   can specify the values for this setting and
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecretId</tt>. Or you can specify clear-text values
--   for <tt>UserName</tt>, <tt>Password</tt>, <tt>ServerName</tt>, and
--   <tt>Port</tt>. You can't specify both. For more information on
--   creating this <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> and the
--   <tt>SecretsManagerAccessRoleArn</tt> and
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecretId</tt> required to access it, see <a>Using
--   secrets to access Database Migration Service resources</a> in the
--   <i>Database Migration Service User Guide</i>.
[$sel:secretsManagerAccessRoleArn:IBMDb2Settings'] :: IBMDb2Settings -> Maybe Text

-- | Endpoint connection user name.
[$sel:username:IBMDb2Settings'] :: IBMDb2Settings -> Maybe Text

-- | Endpoint connection password.
[$sel:password:IBMDb2Settings'] :: IBMDb2Settings -> Maybe (Sensitive Text)

-- | Database name for the endpoint.
[$sel:databaseName:IBMDb2Settings'] :: IBMDb2Settings -> Maybe Text

-- | The full ARN, partial ARN, or friendly name of the
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> that contains the Db2 LUW endpoint
--   connection details.
[$sel:secretsManagerSecretId:IBMDb2Settings'] :: IBMDb2Settings -> Maybe Text

-- | Maximum number of bytes per read, as a NUMBER value. The default is 64
--   KB.
[$sel:maxKBytesPerRead:IBMDb2Settings'] :: IBMDb2Settings -> Maybe Int

-- | Endpoint TCP port. The default value is 50000.
[$sel:port:IBMDb2Settings'] :: IBMDb2Settings -> Maybe Int

-- | Create a value of <a>IBMDb2Settings</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:serverName:IBMDb2Settings'</a>,
--   <a>iBMDb2Settings_serverName</a> - Fully qualified domain name of the
--   endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:currentLsn:IBMDb2Settings'</a>,
--   <a>iBMDb2Settings_currentLsn</a> - For ongoing replication (CDC), use
--   CurrentLSN to specify a log sequence number (LSN) where you want the
--   replication to start.
--   
--   <a>$sel:setDataCaptureChanges:IBMDb2Settings'</a>,
--   <a>iBMDb2Settings_setDataCaptureChanges</a> - Enables ongoing
--   replication (CDC) as a BOOLEAN value. The default is true.
--   
--   <a>$sel:secretsManagerAccessRoleArn:IBMDb2Settings'</a>,
--   <a>iBMDb2Settings_secretsManagerAccessRoleArn</a> - The full Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role that specifies DMS as the trusted
--   entity and grants the required permissions to access the value in
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt>. The role must allow the
--   <tt>iam:PassRole</tt> action. <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> has the
--   value of the Amazon Web Services Secrets Manager secret that allows
--   access to the Db2 LUW endpoint.
--   
--   You can specify one of two sets of values for these permissions. You
--   can specify the values for this setting and
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecretId</tt>. Or you can specify clear-text values
--   for <tt>UserName</tt>, <tt>Password</tt>, <tt>ServerName</tt>, and
--   <tt>Port</tt>. You can't specify both. For more information on
--   creating this <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> and the
--   <tt>SecretsManagerAccessRoleArn</tt> and
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecretId</tt> required to access it, see <a>Using
--   secrets to access Database Migration Service resources</a> in the
--   <i>Database Migration Service User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:username:IBMDb2Settings'</a>, <a>iBMDb2Settings_username</a> -
--   Endpoint connection user name.
--   
--   <a>$sel:password:IBMDb2Settings'</a>, <a>iBMDb2Settings_password</a> -
--   Endpoint connection password.
--   
--   <a>$sel:databaseName:IBMDb2Settings'</a>,
--   <a>iBMDb2Settings_databaseName</a> - Database name for the endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:secretsManagerSecretId:IBMDb2Settings'</a>,
--   <a>iBMDb2Settings_secretsManagerSecretId</a> - The full ARN, partial
--   ARN, or friendly name of the <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> that
--   contains the Db2 LUW endpoint connection details.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxKBytesPerRead:IBMDb2Settings'</a>,
--   <a>iBMDb2Settings_maxKBytesPerRead</a> - Maximum number of bytes per
--   read, as a NUMBER value. The default is 64 KB.
--   
--   <a>$sel:port:IBMDb2Settings'</a>, <a>iBMDb2Settings_port</a> -
--   Endpoint TCP port. The default value is 50000.
newIBMDb2Settings :: IBMDb2Settings

-- | Fully qualified domain name of the endpoint.
iBMDb2Settings_serverName :: Lens' IBMDb2Settings (Maybe Text)

-- | For ongoing replication (CDC), use CurrentLSN to specify a log
--   sequence number (LSN) where you want the replication to start.
iBMDb2Settings_currentLsn :: Lens' IBMDb2Settings (Maybe Text)

-- | Enables ongoing replication (CDC) as a BOOLEAN value. The default is
--   true.
iBMDb2Settings_setDataCaptureChanges :: Lens' IBMDb2Settings (Maybe Bool)

-- | The full Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role that specifies DMS
--   as the trusted entity and grants the required permissions to access
--   the value in <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt>. The role must allow the
--   <tt>iam:PassRole</tt> action. <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> has the
--   value of the Amazon Web Services Secrets Manager secret that allows
--   access to the Db2 LUW endpoint.
--   
--   You can specify one of two sets of values for these permissions. You
--   can specify the values for this setting and
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecretId</tt>. Or you can specify clear-text values
--   for <tt>UserName</tt>, <tt>Password</tt>, <tt>ServerName</tt>, and
--   <tt>Port</tt>. You can't specify both. For more information on
--   creating this <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> and the
--   <tt>SecretsManagerAccessRoleArn</tt> and
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecretId</tt> required to access it, see <a>Using
--   secrets to access Database Migration Service resources</a> in the
--   <i>Database Migration Service User Guide</i>.
iBMDb2Settings_secretsManagerAccessRoleArn :: Lens' IBMDb2Settings (Maybe Text)

-- | Endpoint connection user name.
iBMDb2Settings_username :: Lens' IBMDb2Settings (Maybe Text)

-- | Endpoint connection password.
iBMDb2Settings_password :: Lens' IBMDb2Settings (Maybe Text)

-- | Database name for the endpoint.
iBMDb2Settings_databaseName :: Lens' IBMDb2Settings (Maybe Text)

-- | The full ARN, partial ARN, or friendly name of the
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> that contains the Db2 LUW endpoint
--   connection details.
iBMDb2Settings_secretsManagerSecretId :: Lens' IBMDb2Settings (Maybe Text)

-- | Maximum number of bytes per read, as a NUMBER value. The default is 64
--   KB.
iBMDb2Settings_maxKBytesPerRead :: Lens' IBMDb2Settings (Maybe Int)

-- | Endpoint TCP port. The default value is 50000.
iBMDb2Settings_port :: Lens' IBMDb2Settings (Maybe Int)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.DMS.Types.IBMDb2Settings.IBMDb2Settings
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.DMS.Types.IBMDb2Settings.IBMDb2Settings
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.DMS.Types.IBMDb2Settings.IBMDb2Settings
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.DMS.Types.IBMDb2Settings.IBMDb2Settings
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.DMS.Types.IBMDb2Settings.IBMDb2Settings
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.DMS.Types.IBMDb2Settings.IBMDb2Settings
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.DMS.Types.IBMDb2Settings.IBMDb2Settings


module Network.AWS.DMS.Types.KafkaSecurityProtocol
newtype KafkaSecurityProtocol
KafkaSecurityProtocol' :: Text -> KafkaSecurityProtocol
[fromKafkaSecurityProtocol] :: KafkaSecurityProtocol -> Text
pattern KafkaSecurityProtocol_Plaintext :: KafkaSecurityProtocol
pattern KafkaSecurityProtocol_Sasl_ssl :: KafkaSecurityProtocol
pattern KafkaSecurityProtocol_Ssl_authentication :: KafkaSecurityProtocol
pattern KafkaSecurityProtocol_Ssl_encryption :: KafkaSecurityProtocol

pattern MessageFormatValue_Json_unformatted :: MessageFormatValue

module Network.AWS.DMS.Types.KinesisSettings

-- | Provides information that describes an Amazon Kinesis Data Stream
--   endpoint. This information includes the output format of records
--   applied to the endpoint and details of transaction and control table
--   data information.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newKinesisSettings</a> smart constructor.
data KinesisSettings
KinesisSettings' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe MessageFormatValue -> Maybe Bool -> KinesisSettings

-- | Provides detailed transaction information from the source database.
--   This information includes a commit timestamp, a log position, and
--   values for <tt>transaction_id</tt>, previous <tt>transaction_id</tt>,
--   and <tt>transaction_record_id</tt> (the record offset within a
--   transaction). The default is <tt>false</tt>.
[$sel:includeTransactionDetails:KinesisSettings'] :: KinesisSettings -> Maybe Bool

-- | Includes any data definition language (DDL) operations that change the
--   table in the control data, such as <tt>rename-table</tt>,
--   <tt>drop-table</tt>, <tt>add-column</tt>, <tt>drop-column</tt>, and
--   <tt>rename-column</tt>. The default is <tt>false</tt>.
[$sel:includeTableAlterOperations:KinesisSettings'] :: KinesisSettings -> Maybe Bool

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the IAM role that DMS uses to write
--   to the Kinesis data stream. The role must allow the
--   <tt>iam:PassRole</tt> action.
[$sel:serviceAccessRoleArn:KinesisSettings'] :: KinesisSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | Prefixes schema and table names to partition values, when the
--   partition type is <tt>primary-key-type</tt>. Doing this increases data
--   distribution among Kinesis shards. For example, suppose that a
--   SysBench schema has thousands of tables and each table has only
--   limited range for a primary key. In this case, the same primary key is
--   sent from thousands of tables to the same shard, which causes
--   throttling. The default is <tt>false</tt>.
[$sel:partitionIncludeSchemaTable:KinesisSettings'] :: KinesisSettings -> Maybe Bool

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the Amazon Kinesis Data Streams
--   endpoint.
[$sel:streamArn:KinesisSettings'] :: KinesisSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | Shows detailed control information for table definition, column
--   definition, and table and column changes in the Kinesis message
--   output. The default is <tt>false</tt>.
[$sel:includeControlDetails:KinesisSettings'] :: KinesisSettings -> Maybe Bool

-- | Set this optional parameter to <tt>true</tt> to avoid adding a '0x'
--   prefix to raw data in hexadecimal format. For example, by default, DMS
--   adds a '0x' prefix to the LOB column type in hexadecimal format moving
--   from an Oracle source to an Amazon Kinesis target. Use the
--   <tt>NoHexPrefix</tt> endpoint setting to enable migration of RAW data
--   type columns without adding the '0x' prefix.
[$sel:noHexPrefix:KinesisSettings'] :: KinesisSettings -> Maybe Bool

-- | Shows the partition value within the Kinesis message output, unless
--   the partition type is <tt>schema-table-type</tt>. The default is
--   <tt>false</tt>.
[$sel:includePartitionValue:KinesisSettings'] :: KinesisSettings -> Maybe Bool

-- | The output format for the records created on the endpoint. The message
--   format is <tt>JSON</tt> (default) or <tt>JSON_UNFORMATTED</tt> (a
--   single line with no tab).
[$sel:messageFormat:KinesisSettings'] :: KinesisSettings -> Maybe MessageFormatValue

-- | Include NULL and empty columns for records migrated to the endpoint.
--   The default is <tt>false</tt>.
[$sel:includeNullAndEmpty:KinesisSettings'] :: KinesisSettings -> Maybe Bool

-- | Create a value of <a>KinesisSettings</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:includeTransactionDetails:KinesisSettings'</a>,
--   <a>kinesisSettings_includeTransactionDetails</a> - Provides detailed
--   transaction information from the source database. This information
--   includes a commit timestamp, a log position, and values for
--   <tt>transaction_id</tt>, previous <tt>transaction_id</tt>, and
--   <tt>transaction_record_id</tt> (the record offset within a
--   transaction). The default is <tt>false</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:includeTableAlterOperations:KinesisSettings'</a>,
--   <a>kinesisSettings_includeTableAlterOperations</a> - Includes any data
--   definition language (DDL) operations that change the table in the
--   control data, such as <tt>rename-table</tt>, <tt>drop-table</tt>,
--   <tt>add-column</tt>, <tt>drop-column</tt>, and <tt>rename-column</tt>.
--   The default is <tt>false</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:serviceAccessRoleArn:KinesisSettings'</a>,
--   <a>kinesisSettings_serviceAccessRoleArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name
--   (ARN) for the IAM role that DMS uses to write to the Kinesis data
--   stream. The role must allow the <tt>iam:PassRole</tt> action.
--   
--   <a>$sel:partitionIncludeSchemaTable:KinesisSettings'</a>,
--   <a>kinesisSettings_partitionIncludeSchemaTable</a> - Prefixes schema
--   and table names to partition values, when the partition type is
--   <tt>primary-key-type</tt>. Doing this increases data distribution
--   among Kinesis shards. For example, suppose that a SysBench schema has
--   thousands of tables and each table has only limited range for a
--   primary key. In this case, the same primary key is sent from thousands
--   of tables to the same shard, which causes throttling. The default is
--   <tt>false</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:streamArn:KinesisSettings'</a>,
--   <a>kinesisSettings_streamArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for
--   the Amazon Kinesis Data Streams endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:includeControlDetails:KinesisSettings'</a>,
--   <a>kinesisSettings_includeControlDetails</a> - Shows detailed control
--   information for table definition, column definition, and table and
--   column changes in the Kinesis message output. The default is
--   <tt>false</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:noHexPrefix:KinesisSettings'</a>,
--   <a>kinesisSettings_noHexPrefix</a> - Set this optional parameter to
--   <tt>true</tt> to avoid adding a '0x' prefix to raw data in hexadecimal
--   format. For example, by default, DMS adds a '0x' prefix to the LOB
--   column type in hexadecimal format moving from an Oracle source to an
--   Amazon Kinesis target. Use the <tt>NoHexPrefix</tt> endpoint setting
--   to enable migration of RAW data type columns without adding the '0x'
--   prefix.
--   
--   <a>$sel:includePartitionValue:KinesisSettings'</a>,
--   <a>kinesisSettings_includePartitionValue</a> - Shows the partition
--   value within the Kinesis message output, unless the partition type is
--   <tt>schema-table-type</tt>. The default is <tt>false</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:messageFormat:KinesisSettings'</a>,
--   <a>kinesisSettings_messageFormat</a> - The output format for the
--   records created on the endpoint. The message format is <tt>JSON</tt>
--   (default) or <tt>JSON_UNFORMATTED</tt> (a single line with no tab).
--   
--   <a>$sel:includeNullAndEmpty:KinesisSettings'</a>,
--   <a>kinesisSettings_includeNullAndEmpty</a> - Include NULL and empty
--   columns for records migrated to the endpoint. The default is
--   <tt>false</tt>.
newKinesisSettings :: KinesisSettings

-- | Provides detailed transaction information from the source database.
--   This information includes a commit timestamp, a log position, and
--   values for <tt>transaction_id</tt>, previous <tt>transaction_id</tt>,
--   and <tt>transaction_record_id</tt> (the record offset within a
--   transaction). The default is <tt>false</tt>.
kinesisSettings_includeTransactionDetails :: Lens' KinesisSettings (Maybe Bool)

-- | Includes any data definition language (DDL) operations that change the
--   table in the control data, such as <tt>rename-table</tt>,
--   <tt>drop-table</tt>, <tt>add-column</tt>, <tt>drop-column</tt>, and
--   <tt>rename-column</tt>. The default is <tt>false</tt>.
kinesisSettings_includeTableAlterOperations :: Lens' KinesisSettings (Maybe Bool)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the IAM role that DMS uses to write
--   to the Kinesis data stream. The role must allow the
--   <tt>iam:PassRole</tt> action.
kinesisSettings_serviceAccessRoleArn :: Lens' KinesisSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | Prefixes schema and table names to partition values, when the
--   partition type is <tt>primary-key-type</tt>. Doing this increases data
--   distribution among Kinesis shards. For example, suppose that a
--   SysBench schema has thousands of tables and each table has only
--   limited range for a primary key. In this case, the same primary key is
--   sent from thousands of tables to the same shard, which causes
--   throttling. The default is <tt>false</tt>.
kinesisSettings_partitionIncludeSchemaTable :: Lens' KinesisSettings (Maybe Bool)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the Amazon Kinesis Data Streams
--   endpoint.
kinesisSettings_streamArn :: Lens' KinesisSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | Shows detailed control information for table definition, column
--   definition, and table and column changes in the Kinesis message
--   output. The default is <tt>false</tt>.
kinesisSettings_includeControlDetails :: Lens' KinesisSettings (Maybe Bool)

-- | Set this optional parameter to <tt>true</tt> to avoid adding a '0x'
--   prefix to raw data in hexadecimal format. For example, by default, DMS
--   adds a '0x' prefix to the LOB column type in hexadecimal format moving
--   from an Oracle source to an Amazon Kinesis target. Use the
--   <tt>NoHexPrefix</tt> endpoint setting to enable migration of RAW data
--   type columns without adding the '0x' prefix.
kinesisSettings_noHexPrefix :: Lens' KinesisSettings (Maybe Bool)

-- | Shows the partition value within the Kinesis message output, unless
--   the partition type is <tt>schema-table-type</tt>. The default is
--   <tt>false</tt>.
kinesisSettings_includePartitionValue :: Lens' KinesisSettings (Maybe Bool)

-- | The output format for the records created on the endpoint. The message
--   format is <tt>JSON</tt> (default) or <tt>JSON_UNFORMATTED</tt> (a
--   single line with no tab).
kinesisSettings_messageFormat :: Lens' KinesisSettings (Maybe MessageFormatValue)

-- | Include NULL and empty columns for records migrated to the endpoint.
--   The default is <tt>false</tt>.
kinesisSettings_includeNullAndEmpty :: Lens' KinesisSettings (Maybe Bool)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.DMS.Types.KinesisSettings.KinesisSettings
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.DMS.Types.KinesisSettings.KinesisSettings
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.DMS.Types.KinesisSettings.KinesisSettings
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.DMS.Types.KinesisSettings.KinesisSettings
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.DMS.Types.KinesisSettings.KinesisSettings
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.DMS.Types.KinesisSettings.KinesisSettings
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.DMS.Types.KinesisSettings.KinesisSettings
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.DMS.Types.KinesisSettings.KinesisSettings


module Network.AWS.DMS.Types.KafkaSettings

-- | Provides information that describes an Apache Kafka endpoint. This
--   information includes the output format of records applied to the
--   endpoint and details of transaction and control table data
--   information.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newKafkaSettings</a> smart constructor.
data KafkaSettings
KafkaSettings' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe MessageFormatValue -> Maybe KafkaSecurityProtocol -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Bool -> KafkaSettings

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the client private key used to
--   securely connect to a Kafka target endpoint.
[$sel:sslClientKeyArn:KafkaSettings'] :: KafkaSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | Provides detailed transaction information from the source database.
--   This information includes a commit timestamp, a log position, and
--   values for <tt>transaction_id</tt>, previous <tt>transaction_id</tt>,
--   and <tt>transaction_record_id</tt> (the record offset within a
--   transaction). The default is <tt>false</tt>.
[$sel:includeTransactionDetails:KafkaSettings'] :: KafkaSettings -> Maybe Bool

-- | Includes any data definition language (DDL) operations that change the
--   table in the control data, such as <tt>rename-table</tt>,
--   <tt>drop-table</tt>, <tt>add-column</tt>, <tt>drop-column</tt>, and
--   <tt>rename-column</tt>. The default is <tt>false</tt>.
[$sel:includeTableAlterOperations:KafkaSettings'] :: KafkaSettings -> Maybe Bool

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the client certificate used to
--   securely connect to a Kafka target endpoint.
[$sel:sslClientCertificateArn:KafkaSettings'] :: KafkaSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the private certificate authority
--   (CA) cert that DMS uses to securely connect to your Kafka target
--   endpoint.
[$sel:sslCaCertificateArn:KafkaSettings'] :: KafkaSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | Prefixes schema and table names to partition values, when the
--   partition type is <tt>primary-key-type</tt>. Doing this increases data
--   distribution among Kafka partitions. For example, suppose that a
--   SysBench schema has thousands of tables and each table has only
--   limited range for a primary key. In this case, the same primary key is
--   sent from thousands of tables to the same partition, which causes
--   throttling. The default is <tt>false</tt>.
[$sel:partitionIncludeSchemaTable:KafkaSettings'] :: KafkaSettings -> Maybe Bool

-- | The topic to which you migrate the data. If you don't specify a topic,
--   DMS specifies <tt>"kafka-default-topic"</tt> as the migration topic.
[$sel:topic:KafkaSettings'] :: KafkaSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | Shows detailed control information for table definition, column
--   definition, and table and column changes in the Kafka message output.
--   The default is <tt>false</tt>.
[$sel:includeControlDetails:KafkaSettings'] :: KafkaSettings -> Maybe Bool

-- | Set this optional parameter to <tt>true</tt> to avoid adding a '0x'
--   prefix to raw data in hexadecimal format. For example, by default, DMS
--   adds a '0x' prefix to the LOB column type in hexadecimal format moving
--   from an Oracle source to a Kafka target. Use the <tt>NoHexPrefix</tt>
--   endpoint setting to enable migration of RAW data type columns without
--   adding the '0x' prefix.
[$sel:noHexPrefix:KafkaSettings'] :: KafkaSettings -> Maybe Bool

-- | The secure password you created when you first set up your MSK cluster
--   to validate a client identity and make an encrypted connection between
--   server and client using SASL-SSL authentication.
[$sel:saslPassword:KafkaSettings'] :: KafkaSettings -> Maybe (Sensitive Text)

-- | The password for the client private key used to securely connect to a
--   Kafka target endpoint.
[$sel:sslClientKeyPassword:KafkaSettings'] :: KafkaSettings -> Maybe (Sensitive Text)

-- | Shows the partition value within the Kafka message output unless the
--   partition type is <tt>schema-table-type</tt>. The default is
--   <tt>false</tt>.
[$sel:includePartitionValue:KafkaSettings'] :: KafkaSettings -> Maybe Bool

-- | The output format for the records created on the endpoint. The message
--   format is <tt>JSON</tt> (default) or <tt>JSON_UNFORMATTED</tt> (a
--   single line with no tab).
[$sel:messageFormat:KafkaSettings'] :: KafkaSettings -> Maybe MessageFormatValue

-- | Set secure connection to a Kafka target endpoint using Transport Layer
--   Security (TLS). Options include <tt>ssl-encryption</tt>,
--   <tt>ssl-authentication</tt>, and <tt>sasl-ssl</tt>. <tt>sasl-ssl</tt>
--   requires <tt>SaslUsername</tt> and <tt>SaslPassword</tt>.
[$sel:securityProtocol:KafkaSettings'] :: KafkaSettings -> Maybe KafkaSecurityProtocol

-- | The secure user name you created when you first set up your MSK
--   cluster to validate a client identity and make an encrypted connection
--   between server and client using SASL-SSL authentication.
[$sel:saslUsername:KafkaSettings'] :: KafkaSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | A comma-separated list of one or more broker locations in your Kafka
--   cluster that host your Kafka instance. Specify each broker location in
--   the form <tt> broker-hostname-or-ip:port </tt>. For example,
--   <tt>"ec2-12-345-678-901.compute-1.amazonaws.com:2345"</tt>. For more
--   information and examples of specifying a list of broker locations, see
--   <a>Using Apache Kafka as a target for Database Migration Service</a>
--   in the <i>Database Migration Service User Guide</i>.
[$sel:broker:KafkaSettings'] :: KafkaSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | The maximum size in bytes for records created on the endpoint The
--   default is 1,000,000.
[$sel:messageMaxBytes:KafkaSettings'] :: KafkaSettings -> Maybe Int

-- | Include NULL and empty columns for records migrated to the endpoint.
--   The default is <tt>false</tt>.
[$sel:includeNullAndEmpty:KafkaSettings'] :: KafkaSettings -> Maybe Bool

-- | Create a value of <a>KafkaSettings</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:sslClientKeyArn:KafkaSettings'</a>,
--   <a>kafkaSettings_sslClientKeyArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN)
--   for the client private key used to securely connect to a Kafka target
--   endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:includeTransactionDetails:KafkaSettings'</a>,
--   <a>kafkaSettings_includeTransactionDetails</a> - Provides detailed
--   transaction information from the source database. This information
--   includes a commit timestamp, a log position, and values for
--   <tt>transaction_id</tt>, previous <tt>transaction_id</tt>, and
--   <tt>transaction_record_id</tt> (the record offset within a
--   transaction). The default is <tt>false</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:includeTableAlterOperations:KafkaSettings'</a>,
--   <a>kafkaSettings_includeTableAlterOperations</a> - Includes any data
--   definition language (DDL) operations that change the table in the
--   control data, such as <tt>rename-table</tt>, <tt>drop-table</tt>,
--   <tt>add-column</tt>, <tt>drop-column</tt>, and <tt>rename-column</tt>.
--   The default is <tt>false</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sslClientCertificateArn:KafkaSettings'</a>,
--   <a>kafkaSettings_sslClientCertificateArn</a> - The Amazon Resource
--   Name (ARN) of the client certificate used to securely connect to a
--   Kafka target endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sslCaCertificateArn:KafkaSettings'</a>,
--   <a>kafkaSettings_sslCaCertificateArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name
--   (ARN) for the private certificate authority (CA) cert that DMS uses to
--   securely connect to your Kafka target endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:partitionIncludeSchemaTable:KafkaSettings'</a>,
--   <a>kafkaSettings_partitionIncludeSchemaTable</a> - Prefixes schema and
--   table names to partition values, when the partition type is
--   <tt>primary-key-type</tt>. Doing this increases data distribution
--   among Kafka partitions. For example, suppose that a SysBench schema
--   has thousands of tables and each table has only limited range for a
--   primary key. In this case, the same primary key is sent from thousands
--   of tables to the same partition, which causes throttling. The default
--   is <tt>false</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:topic:KafkaSettings'</a>, <a>kafkaSettings_topic</a> - The
--   topic to which you migrate the data. If you don't specify a topic, DMS
--   specifies <tt>"kafka-default-topic"</tt> as the migration topic.
--   
--   <a>$sel:includeControlDetails:KafkaSettings'</a>,
--   <a>kafkaSettings_includeControlDetails</a> - Shows detailed control
--   information for table definition, column definition, and table and
--   column changes in the Kafka message output. The default is
--   <tt>false</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:noHexPrefix:KafkaSettings'</a>,
--   <a>kafkaSettings_noHexPrefix</a> - Set this optional parameter to
--   <tt>true</tt> to avoid adding a '0x' prefix to raw data in hexadecimal
--   format. For example, by default, DMS adds a '0x' prefix to the LOB
--   column type in hexadecimal format moving from an Oracle source to a
--   Kafka target. Use the <tt>NoHexPrefix</tt> endpoint setting to enable
--   migration of RAW data type columns without adding the '0x' prefix.
--   
--   <a>$sel:saslPassword:KafkaSettings'</a>,
--   <a>kafkaSettings_saslPassword</a> - The secure password you created
--   when you first set up your MSK cluster to validate a client identity
--   and make an encrypted connection between server and client using
--   SASL-SSL authentication.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sslClientKeyPassword:KafkaSettings'</a>,
--   <a>kafkaSettings_sslClientKeyPassword</a> - The password for the
--   client private key used to securely connect to a Kafka target
--   endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:includePartitionValue:KafkaSettings'</a>,
--   <a>kafkaSettings_includePartitionValue</a> - Shows the partition value
--   within the Kafka message output unless the partition type is
--   <tt>schema-table-type</tt>. The default is <tt>false</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:messageFormat:KafkaSettings'</a>,
--   <a>kafkaSettings_messageFormat</a> - The output format for the records
--   created on the endpoint. The message format is <tt>JSON</tt> (default)
--   or <tt>JSON_UNFORMATTED</tt> (a single line with no tab).
--   
--   <a>$sel:securityProtocol:KafkaSettings'</a>,
--   <a>kafkaSettings_securityProtocol</a> - Set secure connection to a
--   Kafka target endpoint using Transport Layer Security (TLS). Options
--   include <tt>ssl-encryption</tt>, <tt>ssl-authentication</tt>, and
--   <tt>sasl-ssl</tt>. <tt>sasl-ssl</tt> requires <tt>SaslUsername</tt>
--   and <tt>SaslPassword</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:saslUsername:KafkaSettings'</a>,
--   <a>kafkaSettings_saslUsername</a> - The secure user name you created
--   when you first set up your MSK cluster to validate a client identity
--   and make an encrypted connection between server and client using
--   SASL-SSL authentication.
--   
--   <a>$sel:broker:KafkaSettings'</a>, <a>kafkaSettings_broker</a> - A
--   comma-separated list of one or more broker locations in your Kafka
--   cluster that host your Kafka instance. Specify each broker location in
--   the form <tt> broker-hostname-or-ip:port </tt>. For example,
--   <tt>"ec2-12-345-678-901.compute-1.amazonaws.com:2345"</tt>. For more
--   information and examples of specifying a list of broker locations, see
--   <a>Using Apache Kafka as a target for Database Migration Service</a>
--   in the <i>Database Migration Service User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:messageMaxBytes:KafkaSettings'</a>,
--   <a>kafkaSettings_messageMaxBytes</a> - The maximum size in bytes for
--   records created on the endpoint The default is 1,000,000.
--   
--   <a>$sel:includeNullAndEmpty:KafkaSettings'</a>,
--   <a>kafkaSettings_includeNullAndEmpty</a> - Include NULL and empty
--   columns for records migrated to the endpoint. The default is
--   <tt>false</tt>.
newKafkaSettings :: KafkaSettings

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the client private key used to
--   securely connect to a Kafka target endpoint.
kafkaSettings_sslClientKeyArn :: Lens' KafkaSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | Provides detailed transaction information from the source database.
--   This information includes a commit timestamp, a log position, and
--   values for <tt>transaction_id</tt>, previous <tt>transaction_id</tt>,
--   and <tt>transaction_record_id</tt> (the record offset within a
--   transaction). The default is <tt>false</tt>.
kafkaSettings_includeTransactionDetails :: Lens' KafkaSettings (Maybe Bool)

-- | Includes any data definition language (DDL) operations that change the
--   table in the control data, such as <tt>rename-table</tt>,
--   <tt>drop-table</tt>, <tt>add-column</tt>, <tt>drop-column</tt>, and
--   <tt>rename-column</tt>. The default is <tt>false</tt>.
kafkaSettings_includeTableAlterOperations :: Lens' KafkaSettings (Maybe Bool)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the client certificate used to
--   securely connect to a Kafka target endpoint.
kafkaSettings_sslClientCertificateArn :: Lens' KafkaSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the private certificate authority
--   (CA) cert that DMS uses to securely connect to your Kafka target
--   endpoint.
kafkaSettings_sslCaCertificateArn :: Lens' KafkaSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | Prefixes schema and table names to partition values, when the
--   partition type is <tt>primary-key-type</tt>. Doing this increases data
--   distribution among Kafka partitions. For example, suppose that a
--   SysBench schema has thousands of tables and each table has only
--   limited range for a primary key. In this case, the same primary key is
--   sent from thousands of tables to the same partition, which causes
--   throttling. The default is <tt>false</tt>.
kafkaSettings_partitionIncludeSchemaTable :: Lens' KafkaSettings (Maybe Bool)

-- | The topic to which you migrate the data. If you don't specify a topic,
--   DMS specifies <tt>"kafka-default-topic"</tt> as the migration topic.
kafkaSettings_topic :: Lens' KafkaSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | Shows detailed control information for table definition, column
--   definition, and table and column changes in the Kafka message output.
--   The default is <tt>false</tt>.
kafkaSettings_includeControlDetails :: Lens' KafkaSettings (Maybe Bool)

-- | Set this optional parameter to <tt>true</tt> to avoid adding a '0x'
--   prefix to raw data in hexadecimal format. For example, by default, DMS
--   adds a '0x' prefix to the LOB column type in hexadecimal format moving
--   from an Oracle source to a Kafka target. Use the <tt>NoHexPrefix</tt>
--   endpoint setting to enable migration of RAW data type columns without
--   adding the '0x' prefix.
kafkaSettings_noHexPrefix :: Lens' KafkaSettings (Maybe Bool)

-- | The secure password you created when you first set up your MSK cluster
--   to validate a client identity and make an encrypted connection between
--   server and client using SASL-SSL authentication.
kafkaSettings_saslPassword :: Lens' KafkaSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | The password for the client private key used to securely connect to a
--   Kafka target endpoint.
kafkaSettings_sslClientKeyPassword :: Lens' KafkaSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | Shows the partition value within the Kafka message output unless the
--   partition type is <tt>schema-table-type</tt>. The default is
--   <tt>false</tt>.
kafkaSettings_includePartitionValue :: Lens' KafkaSettings (Maybe Bool)

-- | The output format for the records created on the endpoint. The message
--   format is <tt>JSON</tt> (default) or <tt>JSON_UNFORMATTED</tt> (a
--   single line with no tab).
kafkaSettings_messageFormat :: Lens' KafkaSettings (Maybe MessageFormatValue)

-- | Set secure connection to a Kafka target endpoint using Transport Layer
--   Security (TLS). Options include <tt>ssl-encryption</tt>,
--   <tt>ssl-authentication</tt>, and <tt>sasl-ssl</tt>. <tt>sasl-ssl</tt>
--   requires <tt>SaslUsername</tt> and <tt>SaslPassword</tt>.
kafkaSettings_securityProtocol :: Lens' KafkaSettings (Maybe KafkaSecurityProtocol)

-- | The secure user name you created when you first set up your MSK
--   cluster to validate a client identity and make an encrypted connection
--   between server and client using SASL-SSL authentication.
kafkaSettings_saslUsername :: Lens' KafkaSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | A comma-separated list of one or more broker locations in your Kafka
--   cluster that host your Kafka instance. Specify each broker location in
--   the form <tt> broker-hostname-or-ip:port </tt>. For example,
--   <tt>"ec2-12-345-678-901.compute-1.amazonaws.com:2345"</tt>. For more
--   information and examples of specifying a list of broker locations, see
--   <a>Using Apache Kafka as a target for Database Migration Service</a>
--   in the <i>Database Migration Service User Guide</i>.
kafkaSettings_broker :: Lens' KafkaSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | The maximum size in bytes for records created on the endpoint The
--   default is 1,000,000.
kafkaSettings_messageMaxBytes :: Lens' KafkaSettings (Maybe Int)

-- | Include NULL and empty columns for records migrated to the endpoint.
--   The default is <tt>false</tt>.
kafkaSettings_includeNullAndEmpty :: Lens' KafkaSettings (Maybe Bool)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.DMS.Types.KafkaSettings.KafkaSettings
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.DMS.Types.KafkaSettings.KafkaSettings
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.DMS.Types.KafkaSettings.KafkaSettings
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.DMS.Types.KafkaSettings.KafkaSettings
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.DMS.Types.KafkaSettings.KafkaSettings
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.DMS.Types.KafkaSettings.KafkaSettings
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.DMS.Types.KafkaSettings.KafkaSettings


module Network.AWS.DMS.Types.MigrationTypeValue
newtype MigrationTypeValue
MigrationTypeValue' :: Text -> MigrationTypeValue
[fromMigrationTypeValue] :: MigrationTypeValue -> Text
pattern MigrationTypeValue_Cdc :: MigrationTypeValue
pattern MigrationTypeValue_Full_load :: MigrationTypeValue
pattern MigrationTypeValue_Full_load_and_cdc :: MigrationTypeValue
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.ToXML Network.AWS.DMS.Types.MigrationTypeValue.MigrationTypeValue
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.DMS.Types.MigrationTypeValue.MigrationTypeValue

instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.DMS.Types.MigrationTypeValue.MigrationTypeValue


module Network.AWS.DMS.Types.NeptuneSettings

-- | Provides information that defines an Amazon Neptune endpoint.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newNeptuneSettings</a> smart constructor.
data NeptuneSettings
NeptuneSettings' :: Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Int -> Text -> Text -> NeptuneSettings

-- | The maximum size in kilobytes of migrated graph data stored in a .csv
--   file before DMS bulk-loads the data to the Neptune target database.
--   The default is 1,048,576 KB. If the bulk load is successful, DMS
--   clears the bucket, ready to store the next batch of migrated graph
--   data.
[$sel:maxFileSize:NeptuneSettings'] :: NeptuneSettings -> Maybe Int

-- | The number of times for DMS to retry a bulk load of migrated graph
--   data to the Neptune target database before raising an error. The
--   default is 5.
[$sel:maxRetryCount:NeptuneSettings'] :: NeptuneSettings -> Maybe Int

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the service role that you created
--   for the Neptune target endpoint. The role must allow the
--   <tt>iam:PassRole</tt> action. For more information, see <a>Creating an
--   IAM Service Role for Accessing Amazon Neptune as a Target</a> in the
--   <i>Database Migration Service User Guide.</i>
[$sel:serviceAccessRoleArn:NeptuneSettings'] :: NeptuneSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | If you want Identity and Access Management (IAM) authorization enabled
--   for this endpoint, set this parameter to <tt>true</tt>. Then attach
--   the appropriate IAM policy document to your service role specified by
--   <tt>ServiceAccessRoleArn</tt>. The default is <tt>false</tt>.
[$sel:iamAuthEnabled:NeptuneSettings'] :: NeptuneSettings -> Maybe Bool

-- | The number of milliseconds for DMS to wait to retry a bulk-load of
--   migrated graph data to the Neptune target database before raising an
--   error. The default is 250.
[$sel:errorRetryDuration:NeptuneSettings'] :: NeptuneSettings -> Maybe Int

-- | The name of the Amazon S3 bucket where DMS can temporarily store
--   migrated graph data in .csv files before bulk-loading it to the
--   Neptune target database. DMS maps the SQL source data to graph data
--   before storing it in these .csv files.
[$sel:s3BucketName:NeptuneSettings'] :: NeptuneSettings -> Text

-- | A folder path where you want DMS to store migrated graph data in the
--   S3 bucket specified by <tt>S3BucketName</tt>
[$sel:s3BucketFolder:NeptuneSettings'] :: NeptuneSettings -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>NeptuneSettings</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxFileSize:NeptuneSettings'</a>,
--   <a>neptuneSettings_maxFileSize</a> - The maximum size in kilobytes of
--   migrated graph data stored in a .csv file before DMS bulk-loads the
--   data to the Neptune target database. The default is 1,048,576 KB. If
--   the bulk load is successful, DMS clears the bucket, ready to store the
--   next batch of migrated graph data.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxRetryCount:NeptuneSettings'</a>,
--   <a>neptuneSettings_maxRetryCount</a> - The number of times for DMS to
--   retry a bulk load of migrated graph data to the Neptune target
--   database before raising an error. The default is 5.
--   
--   <a>$sel:serviceAccessRoleArn:NeptuneSettings'</a>,
--   <a>neptuneSettings_serviceAccessRoleArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name
--   (ARN) of the service role that you created for the Neptune target
--   endpoint. The role must allow the <tt>iam:PassRole</tt> action. For
--   more information, see <a>Creating an IAM Service Role for Accessing
--   Amazon Neptune as a Target</a> in the <i>Database Migration Service
--   User Guide.</i>
--   
--   <a>$sel:iamAuthEnabled:NeptuneSettings'</a>,
--   <a>neptuneSettings_iamAuthEnabled</a> - If you want Identity and
--   Access Management (IAM) authorization enabled for this endpoint, set
--   this parameter to <tt>true</tt>. Then attach the appropriate IAM
--   policy document to your service role specified by
--   <tt>ServiceAccessRoleArn</tt>. The default is <tt>false</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:errorRetryDuration:NeptuneSettings'</a>,
--   <a>neptuneSettings_errorRetryDuration</a> - The number of milliseconds
--   for DMS to wait to retry a bulk-load of migrated graph data to the
--   Neptune target database before raising an error. The default is 250.
--   
--   <a>$sel:s3BucketName:NeptuneSettings'</a>,
--   <a>neptuneSettings_s3BucketName</a> - The name of the Amazon S3 bucket
--   where DMS can temporarily store migrated graph data in .csv files
--   before bulk-loading it to the Neptune target database. DMS maps the
--   SQL source data to graph data before storing it in these .csv files.
--   
--   <a>$sel:s3BucketFolder:NeptuneSettings'</a>,
--   <a>neptuneSettings_s3BucketFolder</a> - A folder path where you want
--   DMS to store migrated graph data in the S3 bucket specified by
--   <tt>S3BucketName</tt>
newNeptuneSettings :: Text -> Text -> NeptuneSettings

-- | The maximum size in kilobytes of migrated graph data stored in a .csv
--   file before DMS bulk-loads the data to the Neptune target database.
--   The default is 1,048,576 KB. If the bulk load is successful, DMS
--   clears the bucket, ready to store the next batch of migrated graph
--   data.
neptuneSettings_maxFileSize :: Lens' NeptuneSettings (Maybe Int)

-- | The number of times for DMS to retry a bulk load of migrated graph
--   data to the Neptune target database before raising an error. The
--   default is 5.
neptuneSettings_maxRetryCount :: Lens' NeptuneSettings (Maybe Int)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the service role that you created
--   for the Neptune target endpoint. The role must allow the
--   <tt>iam:PassRole</tt> action. For more information, see <a>Creating an
--   IAM Service Role for Accessing Amazon Neptune as a Target</a> in the
--   <i>Database Migration Service User Guide.</i>
neptuneSettings_serviceAccessRoleArn :: Lens' NeptuneSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | If you want Identity and Access Management (IAM) authorization enabled
--   for this endpoint, set this parameter to <tt>true</tt>. Then attach
--   the appropriate IAM policy document to your service role specified by
--   <tt>ServiceAccessRoleArn</tt>. The default is <tt>false</tt>.
neptuneSettings_iamAuthEnabled :: Lens' NeptuneSettings (Maybe Bool)

-- | The number of milliseconds for DMS to wait to retry a bulk-load of
--   migrated graph data to the Neptune target database before raising an
--   error. The default is 250.
neptuneSettings_errorRetryDuration :: Lens' NeptuneSettings (Maybe Int)

-- | The name of the Amazon S3 bucket where DMS can temporarily store
--   migrated graph data in .csv files before bulk-loading it to the
--   Neptune target database. DMS maps the SQL source data to graph data
--   before storing it in these .csv files.
neptuneSettings_s3BucketName :: Lens' NeptuneSettings Text

-- | A folder path where you want DMS to store migrated graph data in the
--   S3 bucket specified by <tt>S3BucketName</tt>
neptuneSettings_s3BucketFolder :: Lens' NeptuneSettings Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.DMS.Types.NeptuneSettings.NeptuneSettings
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.DMS.Types.NeptuneSettings.NeptuneSettings
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.DMS.Types.NeptuneSettings.NeptuneSettings
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.DMS.Types.NeptuneSettings.NeptuneSettings
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.DMS.Types.NeptuneSettings.NeptuneSettings
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.DMS.Types.NeptuneSettings.NeptuneSettings
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.DMS.Types.NeptuneSettings.NeptuneSettings
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.DMS.Types.NeptuneSettings.NeptuneSettings


module Network.AWS.DMS.Types.NestingLevelValue
newtype NestingLevelValue
NestingLevelValue' :: Text -> NestingLevelValue
[fromNestingLevelValue] :: NestingLevelValue -> Text
pattern NestingLevelValue_None :: NestingLevelValue
pattern NestingLevelValue_One :: NestingLevelValue
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.ToXML Network.AWS.DMS.Types.NestingLevelValue.NestingLevelValue
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.DMS.Types.NestingLevelValue.NestingLevelValue
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSONKey Network.AWS.DMS.Types.NestingLevelValue.NestingLevelValue
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.DMS.Types.NestingLevelValue.NestingLevelValue
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSONKey Network.AWS.DMS.Types.NestingLevelValue.NestingLevelValue
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.DMS.Types.NestingLevelValue.NestingLevelValue
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.DMS.Types.NestingLevelValue.NestingLevelValue
instance Network.AWS.Data.Headers.ToHeader Network.AWS.DMS.Types.NestingLevelValue.NestingLevelValue
instance Network.AWS.Data.Log.ToLog Network.AWS.DMS.Types.NestingLevelValue.NestingLevelValue
