instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.DMS.Types.NestingLevelValue.NestingLevelValue


module Network.AWS.DMS.Types.MongoDbSettings

-- | Provides information that defines a MongoDB endpoint.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMongoDbSettings</a> smart constructor.
data MongoDbSettings
MongoDbSettings' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe AuthMechanismValue -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> Maybe NestingLevelValue -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe AuthTypeValue -> Maybe Int -> MongoDbSettings

-- | The name of the server on the MongoDB source endpoint.
[$sel:serverName:MongoDbSettings'] :: MongoDbSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | The full Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role that specifies DMS
--   as the trusted entity and grants the required permissions to access
--   the value in <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt>. The role must allow the
--   <tt>iam:PassRole</tt> action. <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> has the
--   value of the Amazon Web Services Secrets Manager secret that allows
--   access to the MongoDB endpoint.
--   
--   You can specify one of two sets of values for these permissions. You
--   can specify the values for this setting and
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecretId</tt>. Or you can specify clear-text values
--   for <tt>UserName</tt>, <tt>Password</tt>, <tt>ServerName</tt>, and
--   <tt>Port</tt>. You can't specify both. For more information on
--   creating this <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> and the
--   <tt>SecretsManagerAccessRoleArn</tt> and
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecretId</tt> required to access it, see <a>Using
--   secrets to access Database Migration Service resources</a> in the
--   <i>Database Migration Service User Guide</i>.
[$sel:secretsManagerAccessRoleArn:MongoDbSettings'] :: MongoDbSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | The authentication mechanism you use to access the MongoDB source
--   endpoint.
--   
--   For the default value, in MongoDB version 2.x, <tt>"default"</tt> is
--   <tt>"mongodb_cr"</tt>. For MongoDB version 3.x or later,
--   <tt>"default"</tt> is <tt>"scram_sha_1"</tt>. This setting isn't used
--   when <tt>AuthType</tt> is set to <tt>"no"</tt>.
[$sel:authMechanism:MongoDbSettings'] :: MongoDbSettings -> Maybe AuthMechanismValue

-- | The user name you use to access the MongoDB source endpoint.
[$sel:username:MongoDbSettings'] :: MongoDbSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | The KMS key identifier that is used to encrypt the content on the
--   replication instance. If you don't specify a value for the
--   <tt>KmsKeyId</tt> parameter, then DMS uses your default encryption
--   key. KMS creates the default encryption key for your Amazon Web
--   Services account. Your Amazon Web Services account has a different
--   default encryption key for each Amazon Web Services Region.
[$sel:kmsKeyId:MongoDbSettings'] :: MongoDbSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | The password for the user account you use to access the MongoDB source
--   endpoint.
[$sel:password:MongoDbSettings'] :: MongoDbSettings -> Maybe (Sensitive Text)

-- | Specifies either document or table mode.
--   
--   Default value is <tt>"none"</tt>. Specify <tt>"none"</tt> to use
--   document mode. Specify <tt>"one"</tt> to use table mode.
[$sel:nestingLevel:MongoDbSettings'] :: MongoDbSettings -> Maybe NestingLevelValue

-- | The database name on the MongoDB source endpoint.
[$sel:databaseName:MongoDbSettings'] :: MongoDbSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | Indicates the number of documents to preview to determine the document
--   organization. Use this setting when <tt>NestingLevel</tt> is set to
--   <tt>"one"</tt>.
--   
--   Must be a positive value greater than <tt>0</tt>. Default value is
--   <tt>1000</tt>.
[$sel:docsToInvestigate:MongoDbSettings'] :: MongoDbSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | The MongoDB database name. This setting isn't used when
--   <tt>AuthType</tt> is set to <tt>"no"</tt>.
--   
--   The default is <tt>"admin"</tt>.
[$sel:authSource:MongoDbSettings'] :: MongoDbSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | The full ARN, partial ARN, or friendly name of the
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> that contains the MongoDB endpoint
--   connection details.
[$sel:secretsManagerSecretId:MongoDbSettings'] :: MongoDbSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies the document ID. Use this setting when <tt>NestingLevel</tt>
--   is set to <tt>"none"</tt>.
--   
--   Default value is <tt>"false"</tt>.
[$sel:extractDocId:MongoDbSettings'] :: MongoDbSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | The authentication type you use to access the MongoDB source endpoint.
--   
--   When when set to <tt>"no"</tt>, user name and password parameters are
--   not used and can be empty.
[$sel:authType:MongoDbSettings'] :: MongoDbSettings -> Maybe AuthTypeValue

-- | The port value for the MongoDB source endpoint.
[$sel:port:MongoDbSettings'] :: MongoDbSettings -> Maybe Int

-- | Create a value of <a>MongoDbSettings</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:serverName:MongoDbSettings'</a>,
--   <a>mongoDbSettings_serverName</a> - The name of the server on the
--   MongoDB source endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:secretsManagerAccessRoleArn:MongoDbSettings'</a>,
--   <a>mongoDbSettings_secretsManagerAccessRoleArn</a> - The full Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role that specifies DMS as the trusted
--   entity and grants the required permissions to access the value in
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt>. The role must allow the
--   <tt>iam:PassRole</tt> action. <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> has the
--   value of the Amazon Web Services Secrets Manager secret that allows
--   access to the MongoDB endpoint.
--   
--   You can specify one of two sets of values for these permissions. You
--   can specify the values for this setting and
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecretId</tt>. Or you can specify clear-text values
--   for <tt>UserName</tt>, <tt>Password</tt>, <tt>ServerName</tt>, and
--   <tt>Port</tt>. You can't specify both. For more information on
--   creating this <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> and the
--   <tt>SecretsManagerAccessRoleArn</tt> and
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecretId</tt> required to access it, see <a>Using
--   secrets to access Database Migration Service resources</a> in the
--   <i>Database Migration Service User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:authMechanism:MongoDbSettings'</a>,
--   <a>mongoDbSettings_authMechanism</a> - The authentication mechanism
--   you use to access the MongoDB source endpoint.
--   
--   For the default value, in MongoDB version 2.x, <tt>"default"</tt> is
--   <tt>"mongodb_cr"</tt>. For MongoDB version 3.x or later,
--   <tt>"default"</tt> is <tt>"scram_sha_1"</tt>. This setting isn't used
--   when <tt>AuthType</tt> is set to <tt>"no"</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:username:MongoDbSettings'</a>, <a>mongoDbSettings_username</a>
--   - The user name you use to access the MongoDB source endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:kmsKeyId:MongoDbSettings'</a>, <a>mongoDbSettings_kmsKeyId</a>
--   - The KMS key identifier that is used to encrypt the content on the
--   replication instance. If you don't specify a value for the
--   <tt>KmsKeyId</tt> parameter, then DMS uses your default encryption
--   key. KMS creates the default encryption key for your Amazon Web
--   Services account. Your Amazon Web Services account has a different
--   default encryption key for each Amazon Web Services Region.
--   
--   <a>$sel:password:MongoDbSettings'</a>, <a>mongoDbSettings_password</a>
--   - The password for the user account you use to access the MongoDB
--   source endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:nestingLevel:MongoDbSettings'</a>,
--   <a>mongoDbSettings_nestingLevel</a> - Specifies either document or
--   table mode.
--   
--   Default value is <tt>"none"</tt>. Specify <tt>"none"</tt> to use
--   document mode. Specify <tt>"one"</tt> to use table mode.
--   
--   <a>$sel:databaseName:MongoDbSettings'</a>,
--   <a>mongoDbSettings_databaseName</a> - The database name on the MongoDB
--   source endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:docsToInvestigate:MongoDbSettings'</a>,
--   <a>mongoDbSettings_docsToInvestigate</a> - Indicates the number of
--   documents to preview to determine the document organization. Use this
--   setting when <tt>NestingLevel</tt> is set to <tt>"one"</tt>.
--   
--   Must be a positive value greater than <tt>0</tt>. Default value is
--   <tt>1000</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:authSource:MongoDbSettings'</a>,
--   <a>mongoDbSettings_authSource</a> - The MongoDB database name. This
--   setting isn't used when <tt>AuthType</tt> is set to <tt>"no"</tt>.
--   
--   The default is <tt>"admin"</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:secretsManagerSecretId:MongoDbSettings'</a>,
--   <a>mongoDbSettings_secretsManagerSecretId</a> - The full ARN, partial
--   ARN, or friendly name of the <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> that
--   contains the MongoDB endpoint connection details.
--   
--   <a>$sel:extractDocId:MongoDbSettings'</a>,
--   <a>mongoDbSettings_extractDocId</a> - Specifies the document ID. Use
--   this setting when <tt>NestingLevel</tt> is set to <tt>"none"</tt>.
--   
--   Default value is <tt>"false"</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:authType:MongoDbSettings'</a>, <a>mongoDbSettings_authType</a>
--   - The authentication type you use to access the MongoDB source
--   endpoint.
--   
--   When when set to <tt>"no"</tt>, user name and password parameters are
--   not used and can be empty.
--   
--   <a>$sel:port:MongoDbSettings'</a>, <a>mongoDbSettings_port</a> - The
--   port value for the MongoDB source endpoint.
newMongoDbSettings :: MongoDbSettings

-- | The name of the server on the MongoDB source endpoint.
mongoDbSettings_serverName :: Lens' MongoDbSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | The full Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role that specifies DMS
--   as the trusted entity and grants the required permissions to access
--   the value in <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt>. The role must allow the
--   <tt>iam:PassRole</tt> action. <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> has the
--   value of the Amazon Web Services Secrets Manager secret that allows
--   access to the MongoDB endpoint.
--   
--   You can specify one of two sets of values for these permissions. You
--   can specify the values for this setting and
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecretId</tt>. Or you can specify clear-text values
--   for <tt>UserName</tt>, <tt>Password</tt>, <tt>ServerName</tt>, and
--   <tt>Port</tt>. You can't specify both. For more information on
--   creating this <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> and the
--   <tt>SecretsManagerAccessRoleArn</tt> and
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecretId</tt> required to access it, see <a>Using
--   secrets to access Database Migration Service resources</a> in the
--   <i>Database Migration Service User Guide</i>.
mongoDbSettings_secretsManagerAccessRoleArn :: Lens' MongoDbSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | The authentication mechanism you use to access the MongoDB source
--   endpoint.
--   
--   For the default value, in MongoDB version 2.x, <tt>"default"</tt> is
--   <tt>"mongodb_cr"</tt>. For MongoDB version 3.x or later,
--   <tt>"default"</tt> is <tt>"scram_sha_1"</tt>. This setting isn't used
--   when <tt>AuthType</tt> is set to <tt>"no"</tt>.
mongoDbSettings_authMechanism :: Lens' MongoDbSettings (Maybe AuthMechanismValue)

-- | The user name you use to access the MongoDB source endpoint.
mongoDbSettings_username :: Lens' MongoDbSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | The KMS key identifier that is used to encrypt the content on the
--   replication instance. If you don't specify a value for the
--   <tt>KmsKeyId</tt> parameter, then DMS uses your default encryption
--   key. KMS creates the default encryption key for your Amazon Web
--   Services account. Your Amazon Web Services account has a different
--   default encryption key for each Amazon Web Services Region.
mongoDbSettings_kmsKeyId :: Lens' MongoDbSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | The password for the user account you use to access the MongoDB source
--   endpoint.
mongoDbSettings_password :: Lens' MongoDbSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies either document or table mode.
--   
--   Default value is <tt>"none"</tt>. Specify <tt>"none"</tt> to use
--   document mode. Specify <tt>"one"</tt> to use table mode.
mongoDbSettings_nestingLevel :: Lens' MongoDbSettings (Maybe NestingLevelValue)

-- | The database name on the MongoDB source endpoint.
mongoDbSettings_databaseName :: Lens' MongoDbSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | Indicates the number of documents to preview to determine the document
--   organization. Use this setting when <tt>NestingLevel</tt> is set to
--   <tt>"one"</tt>.
--   
--   Must be a positive value greater than <tt>0</tt>. Default value is
--   <tt>1000</tt>.
mongoDbSettings_docsToInvestigate :: Lens' MongoDbSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | The MongoDB database name. This setting isn't used when
--   <tt>AuthType</tt> is set to <tt>"no"</tt>.
--   
--   The default is <tt>"admin"</tt>.
mongoDbSettings_authSource :: Lens' MongoDbSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | The full ARN, partial ARN, or friendly name of the
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> that contains the MongoDB endpoint
--   connection details.
mongoDbSettings_secretsManagerSecretId :: Lens' MongoDbSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the document ID. Use this setting when <tt>NestingLevel</tt>
--   is set to <tt>"none"</tt>.
--   
--   Default value is <tt>"false"</tt>.
mongoDbSettings_extractDocId :: Lens' MongoDbSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | The authentication type you use to access the MongoDB source endpoint.
--   
--   When when set to <tt>"no"</tt>, user name and password parameters are
--   not used and can be empty.
mongoDbSettings_authType :: Lens' MongoDbSettings (Maybe AuthTypeValue)

-- | The port value for the MongoDB source endpoint.
mongoDbSettings_port :: Lens' MongoDbSettings (Maybe Int)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.DMS.Types.MongoDbSettings.MongoDbSettings
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.DMS.Types.MongoDbSettings.MongoDbSettings
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.DMS.Types.MongoDbSettings.MongoDbSettings
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.DMS.Types.MongoDbSettings.MongoDbSettings
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.DMS.Types.MongoDbSettings.MongoDbSettings
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.DMS.Types.MongoDbSettings.MongoDbSettings
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.DMS.Types.MongoDbSettings.MongoDbSettings


module Network.AWS.DMS.Types.DocDbSettings

-- | Provides information that defines a DocumentDB endpoint.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDocDbSettings</a> smart constructor.
data DocDbSettings
DocDbSettings' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> Maybe NestingLevelValue -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Int -> DocDbSettings

-- | The name of the server on the DocumentDB source endpoint.
[$sel:serverName:DocDbSettings'] :: DocDbSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | The full Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role that specifies DMS
--   as the trusted entity and grants the required permissions to access
--   the value in <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt>. The role must allow the
--   <tt>iam:PassRole</tt> action. <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> has the
--   value of the Amazon Web Services Secrets Manager secret that allows
--   access to the DocumentDB endpoint.
--   
--   You can specify one of two sets of values for these permissions. You
--   can specify the values for this setting and
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecretId</tt>. Or you can specify clear-text values
--   for <tt>UserName</tt>, <tt>Password</tt>, <tt>ServerName</tt>, and
--   <tt>Port</tt>. You can't specify both. For more information on
--   creating this <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> and the
--   <tt>SecretsManagerAccessRoleArn</tt> and
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecretId</tt> required to access it, see <a>Using
--   secrets to access Database Migration Service resources</a> in the
--   <i>Database Migration Service User Guide</i>.
[$sel:secretsManagerAccessRoleArn:DocDbSettings'] :: DocDbSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | The user name you use to access the DocumentDB source endpoint.
[$sel:username:DocDbSettings'] :: DocDbSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | The KMS key identifier that is used to encrypt the content on the
--   replication instance. If you don't specify a value for the
--   <tt>KmsKeyId</tt> parameter, then DMS uses your default encryption
--   key. KMS creates the default encryption key for your Amazon Web
--   Services account. Your Amazon Web Services account has a different
--   default encryption key for each Amazon Web Services Region.
[$sel:kmsKeyId:DocDbSettings'] :: DocDbSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | The password for the user account you use to access the DocumentDB
--   source endpoint.
[$sel:password:DocDbSettings'] :: DocDbSettings -> Maybe (Sensitive Text)

-- | Specifies either document or table mode.
--   
--   Default value is <tt>"none"</tt>. Specify <tt>"none"</tt> to use
--   document mode. Specify <tt>"one"</tt> to use table mode.
[$sel:nestingLevel:DocDbSettings'] :: DocDbSettings -> Maybe NestingLevelValue

-- | The database name on the DocumentDB source endpoint.
[$sel:databaseName:DocDbSettings'] :: DocDbSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | Indicates the number of documents to preview to determine the document
--   organization. Use this setting when <tt>NestingLevel</tt> is set to
--   <tt>"one"</tt>.
--   
--   Must be a positive value greater than <tt>0</tt>. Default value is
--   <tt>1000</tt>.
[$sel:docsToInvestigate:DocDbSettings'] :: DocDbSettings -> Maybe Int

-- | The full ARN, partial ARN, or friendly name of the
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> that contains the DocumentDB endpoint
--   connection details.
[$sel:secretsManagerSecretId:DocDbSettings'] :: DocDbSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies the document ID. Use this setting when <tt>NestingLevel</tt>
--   is set to <tt>"none"</tt>.
--   
--   Default value is <tt>"false"</tt>.
[$sel:extractDocId:DocDbSettings'] :: DocDbSettings -> Maybe Bool

-- | The port value for the DocumentDB source endpoint.
[$sel:port:DocDbSettings'] :: DocDbSettings -> Maybe Int

-- | Create a value of <a>DocDbSettings</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:serverName:DocDbSettings'</a>, <a>docDbSettings_serverName</a>
--   - The name of the server on the DocumentDB source endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:secretsManagerAccessRoleArn:DocDbSettings'</a>,
--   <a>docDbSettings_secretsManagerAccessRoleArn</a> - The full Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role that specifies DMS as the trusted
--   entity and grants the required permissions to access the value in
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt>. The role must allow the
--   <tt>iam:PassRole</tt> action. <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> has the
--   value of the Amazon Web Services Secrets Manager secret that allows
--   access to the DocumentDB endpoint.
--   
--   You can specify one of two sets of values for these permissions. You
--   can specify the values for this setting and
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecretId</tt>. Or you can specify clear-text values
--   for <tt>UserName</tt>, <tt>Password</tt>, <tt>ServerName</tt>, and
--   <tt>Port</tt>. You can't specify both. For more information on
--   creating this <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> and the
--   <tt>SecretsManagerAccessRoleArn</tt> and
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecretId</tt> required to access it, see <a>Using
--   secrets to access Database Migration Service resources</a> in the
--   <i>Database Migration Service User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:username:DocDbSettings'</a>, <a>docDbSettings_username</a> -
--   The user name you use to access the DocumentDB source endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:kmsKeyId:DocDbSettings'</a>, <a>docDbSettings_kmsKeyId</a> -
--   The KMS key identifier that is used to encrypt the content on the
--   replication instance. If you don't specify a value for the
--   <tt>KmsKeyId</tt> parameter, then DMS uses your default encryption
--   key. KMS creates the default encryption key for your Amazon Web
--   Services account. Your Amazon Web Services account has a different
--   default encryption key for each Amazon Web Services Region.
--   
--   <a>$sel:password:DocDbSettings'</a>, <a>docDbSettings_password</a> -
--   The password for the user account you use to access the DocumentDB
--   source endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:nestingLevel:DocDbSettings'</a>,
--   <a>docDbSettings_nestingLevel</a> - Specifies either document or table
--   mode.
--   
--   Default value is <tt>"none"</tt>. Specify <tt>"none"</tt> to use
--   document mode. Specify <tt>"one"</tt> to use table mode.
--   
--   <a>$sel:databaseName:DocDbSettings'</a>,
--   <a>docDbSettings_databaseName</a> - The database name on the
--   DocumentDB source endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:docsToInvestigate:DocDbSettings'</a>,
--   <a>docDbSettings_docsToInvestigate</a> - Indicates the number of
--   documents to preview to determine the document organization. Use this
--   setting when <tt>NestingLevel</tt> is set to <tt>"one"</tt>.
--   
--   Must be a positive value greater than <tt>0</tt>. Default value is
--   <tt>1000</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:secretsManagerSecretId:DocDbSettings'</a>,
--   <a>docDbSettings_secretsManagerSecretId</a> - The full ARN, partial
--   ARN, or friendly name of the <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> that
--   contains the DocumentDB endpoint connection details.
--   
--   <a>$sel:extractDocId:DocDbSettings'</a>,
--   <a>docDbSettings_extractDocId</a> - Specifies the document ID. Use
--   this setting when <tt>NestingLevel</tt> is set to <tt>"none"</tt>.
--   
--   Default value is <tt>"false"</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:port:DocDbSettings'</a>, <a>docDbSettings_port</a> - The port
--   value for the DocumentDB source endpoint.
newDocDbSettings :: DocDbSettings

-- | The name of the server on the DocumentDB source endpoint.
docDbSettings_serverName :: Lens' DocDbSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | The full Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role that specifies DMS
--   as the trusted entity and grants the required permissions to access
--   the value in <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt>. The role must allow the
--   <tt>iam:PassRole</tt> action. <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> has the
--   value of the Amazon Web Services Secrets Manager secret that allows
--   access to the DocumentDB endpoint.
--   
--   You can specify one of two sets of values for these permissions. You
--   can specify the values for this setting and
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecretId</tt>. Or you can specify clear-text values
--   for <tt>UserName</tt>, <tt>Password</tt>, <tt>ServerName</tt>, and
--   <tt>Port</tt>. You can't specify both. For more information on
--   creating this <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> and the
--   <tt>SecretsManagerAccessRoleArn</tt> and
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecretId</tt> required to access it, see <a>Using
--   secrets to access Database Migration Service resources</a> in the
--   <i>Database Migration Service User Guide</i>.
docDbSettings_secretsManagerAccessRoleArn :: Lens' DocDbSettings (Maybe Text)

docDbSettings_username :: Lens' DocDbSettings (Maybe Text)

--   replication instance. If you don't specify a value for the
--   <tt>KmsKeyId</tt> parameter, then DMS uses your default encryption
--   key. KMS creates the default encryption key for your Amazon Web
--   Services account. Your Amazon Web Services account has a different
--   default encryption key for each Amazon Web Services Region.
docDbSettings_kmsKeyId :: Lens' DocDbSettings (Maybe Text)

--   source endpoint.
docDbSettings_password :: Lens' DocDbSettings (Maybe Text)

--   document mode. Specify <tt>"one"</tt> to use table mode.
docDbSettings_nestingLevel :: Lens' DocDbSettings (Maybe NestingLevelValue)

-- | The database name on the DocumentDB source endpoint.
docDbSettings_databaseName :: Lens' DocDbSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | Indicates the number of documents to preview to determine the document
--   organization. Use this setting when <tt>NestingLevel</tt> is set to
--   <tt>"one"</tt>.
--   
--   Must be a positive value greater than <tt>0</tt>. Default value is
--   <tt>1000</tt>.
docDbSettings_docsToInvestigate :: Lens' DocDbSettings (Maybe Int)

--   is set to <tt>"none"</tt>.
