module Network.AWS.DMS.Types.PostgreSQLSettings

-- | Provides information that defines a PostgreSQL endpoint.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPostgreSQLSettings</a> smart constructor.
data PostgreSQLSettings
PostgreSQLSettings' :: Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe PluginNameValue -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> PostgreSQLSettings

-- | Sets the client statement timeout for the PostgreSQL instance, in
--   seconds. The default value is 60 seconds.
--   
--   Example: <tt>executeTimeout=100;</tt>
[$sel:executeTimeout:PostgreSQLSettings'] :: PostgreSQLSettings -> Maybe Int

-- | Specifies the maximum size (in KB) of any .csv file used to transfer
--   data to PostgreSQL.
--   
--   Example: <tt>maxFileSize=512</tt>
[$sel:maxFileSize:PostgreSQLSettings'] :: PostgreSQLSettings -> Maybe Int

-- | When set to <tt>true</tt>, this value causes a task to fail if the
--   actual size of a LOB column is greater than the specified
--   <tt>LobMaxSize</tt>.
--   
--   If task is set to Limited LOB mode and this option is set to true, the
--   task fails instead of truncating the LOB data.
[$sel:failTasksOnLobTruncation:PostgreSQLSettings'] :: PostgreSQLSettings -> Maybe Bool

-- | Fully qualified domain name of the endpoint.
[$sel:serverName:PostgreSQLSettings'] :: PostgreSQLSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | The schema in which the operational DDL database artifacts are
--   created.
--   
--   Example: <tt>ddlArtifactsSchema=xyzddlschema;</tt>
[$sel:ddlArtifactsSchema:PostgreSQLSettings'] :: PostgreSQLSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | Sets the name of a previously created logical replication slot for a
--   change data capture (CDC) load of the PostgreSQL source instance.
--   
--   When used with the <tt>CdcStartPosition</tt> request parameter for the
--   DMS API , this attribute also makes it possible to use native CDC
--   start points. DMS verifies that the specified logical replication slot
--   exists before starting the CDC load task. It also verifies that the
--   task was created with a valid setting of <tt>CdcStartPosition</tt>. If
--   the specified slot doesn't exist or the task doesn't have a valid
--   <tt>CdcStartPosition</tt> setting, DMS raises an error.
--   
--   For more information about setting the <tt>CdcStartPosition</tt>
--   request parameter, see <a>Determining a CDC native start point</a> in
--   the <i>Database Migration Service User Guide</i>. For more information
--   about using <tt>CdcStartPosition</tt>, see
--   <a>CreateReplicationTask</a>, <a>StartReplicationTask</a>, and
--   <a>ModifyReplicationTask</a>.
[$sel:slotName:PostgreSQLSettings'] :: PostgreSQLSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | The full Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role that specifies DMS
--   as the trusted entity and grants the required permissions to access
--   the value in <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt>. The role must allow the
--   <tt>iam:PassRole</tt> action. <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> has the
--   value of the Amazon Web Services Secrets Manager secret that allows
--   access to the PostgreSQL endpoint.
--   
--   You can specify one of two sets of values for these permissions. You
--   can specify the values for this setting and
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecretId</tt>. Or you can specify clear-text values
--   for <tt>UserName</tt>, <tt>Password</tt>, <tt>ServerName</tt>, and
--   <tt>Port</tt>. You can't specify both. For more information on
--   creating this <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> and the
--   <tt>SecretsManagerAccessRoleArn</tt> and
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecretId</tt> required to access it, see <a>Using
--   secrets to access Database Migration Service resources</a> in the
--   <i>Database Migration Service User Guide</i>.
[$sel:secretsManagerAccessRoleArn:PostgreSQLSettings'] :: PostgreSQLSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | Endpoint connection user name.
[$sel:username:PostgreSQLSettings'] :: PostgreSQLSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | Sets the WAL heartbeat frequency (in minutes).
[$sel:heartbeatFrequency:PostgreSQLSettings'] :: PostgreSQLSettings -> Maybe Int

-- | Endpoint connection password.
[$sel:password:PostgreSQLSettings'] :: PostgreSQLSettings -> Maybe (Sensitive Text)

-- | Database name for the endpoint.
[$sel:databaseName:PostgreSQLSettings'] :: PostgreSQLSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | For use with change data capture (CDC) only, this attribute has DMS
--   bypass foreign keys and user triggers to reduce the time it takes to
--   bulk load data.
--   
--   Example: <tt>afterConnectScript=SET
--   session_replication_role='replica'</tt>
[$sel:afterConnectScript:PostgreSQLSettings'] :: PostgreSQLSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | The full ARN, partial ARN, or friendly name of the
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> that contains the PostgreSQL endpoint
--   connection details.
[$sel:secretsManagerSecretId:PostgreSQLSettings'] :: PostgreSQLSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | To capture DDL events, DMS creates various artifacts in the PostgreSQL
--   database when the task starts. You can later remove these artifacts.
--   
--   If this value is set to <tt>N</tt>, you don't have to create tables or
--   triggers on the source database.
[$sel:captureDdls:PostgreSQLSettings'] :: PostgreSQLSettings -> Maybe Bool

-- | Specifies the plugin to use to create a replication slot.
[$sel:pluginName:PostgreSQLSettings'] :: PostgreSQLSettings -> Maybe PluginNameValue

-- | Endpoint TCP port.
[$sel:port:PostgreSQLSettings'] :: PostgreSQLSettings -> Maybe Int

-- | Sets the schema in which the heartbeat artifacts are created.
[$sel:heartbeatSchema:PostgreSQLSettings'] :: PostgreSQLSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | The write-ahead log (WAL) heartbeat feature mimics a dummy
--   transaction. By doing this, it prevents idle logical replication slots
--   from holding onto old WAL logs, which can result in storage full
--   situations on the source. This heartbeat keeps <tt>restart_lsn</tt>
--   moving and prevents storage full scenarios.
[$sel:heartbeatEnable:PostgreSQLSettings'] :: PostgreSQLSettings -> Maybe Bool

-- | Create a value of <a>PostgreSQLSettings</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:executeTimeout:PostgreSQLSettings'</a>,
--   <a>postgreSQLSettings_executeTimeout</a> - Sets the client statement
--   timeout for the PostgreSQL instance, in seconds. The default value is
--   60 seconds.
--   
--   Example: <tt>executeTimeout=100;</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxFileSize:PostgreSQLSettings'</a>,
--   <a>postgreSQLSettings_maxFileSize</a> - Specifies the maximum size (in
--   KB) of any .csv file used to transfer data to PostgreSQL.
--   
--   Example: <tt>maxFileSize=512</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:failTasksOnLobTruncation:PostgreSQLSettings'</a>,
--   <a>postgreSQLSettings_failTasksOnLobTruncation</a> - When set to
--   <tt>true</tt>, this value causes a task to fail if the actual size of
--   a LOB column is greater than the specified <tt>LobMaxSize</tt>.
--   
--   If task is set to Limited LOB mode and this option is set to true, the
--   task fails instead of truncating the LOB data.
--   
--   <a>$sel:serverName:PostgreSQLSettings'</a>,
--   <a>postgreSQLSettings_serverName</a> - Fully qualified domain name of
--   the endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ddlArtifactsSchema:PostgreSQLSettings'</a>,
--   <a>postgreSQLSettings_ddlArtifactsSchema</a> - The schema in which the
--   operational DDL database artifacts are created.
--   
--   Example: <tt>ddlArtifactsSchema=xyzddlschema;</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:slotName:PostgreSQLSettings'</a>,
--   <a>postgreSQLSettings_slotName</a> - Sets the name of a previously
--   created logical replication slot for a change data capture (CDC) load
--   of the PostgreSQL source instance.
--   
--   When used with the <tt>CdcStartPosition</tt> request parameter for the
--   DMS API , this attribute also makes it possible to use native CDC
--   start points. DMS verifies that the specified logical replication slot
--   exists before starting the CDC load task. It also verifies that the
--   task was created with a valid setting of <tt>CdcStartPosition</tt>. If
--   the specified slot doesn't exist or the task doesn't have a valid
--   <tt>CdcStartPosition</tt> setting, DMS raises an error.
--   
--   For more information about setting the <tt>CdcStartPosition</tt>
--   request parameter, see <a>Determining a CDC native start point</a> in
--   the <i>Database Migration Service User Guide</i>. For more information
--   about using <tt>CdcStartPosition</tt>, see
--   <a>CreateReplicationTask</a>, <a>StartReplicationTask</a>, and
--   <a>ModifyReplicationTask</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:secretsManagerAccessRoleArn:PostgreSQLSettings'</a>,
--   <a>postgreSQLSettings_secretsManagerAccessRoleArn</a> - The full
--   Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role that specifies DMS as the
--   trusted entity and grants the required permissions to access the value
--   in <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt>. The role must allow the
--   <tt>iam:PassRole</tt> action. <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> has the
--   value of the Amazon Web Services Secrets Manager secret that allows
--   access to the PostgreSQL endpoint.
--   
--   You can specify one of two sets of values for these permissions. You
--   can specify the values for this setting and
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecretId</tt>. Or you can specify clear-text values
--   for <tt>UserName</tt>, <tt>Password</tt>, <tt>ServerName</tt>, and
--   <tt>Port</tt>. You can't specify both. For more information on
--   creating this <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> and the
--   <tt>SecretsManagerAccessRoleArn</tt> and
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecretId</tt> required to access it, see <a>Using
--   secrets to access Database Migration Service resources</a> in the
--   <i>Database Migration Service User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:username:PostgreSQLSettings'</a>,
--   <a>postgreSQLSettings_username</a> - Endpoint connection user name.
--   
--   <a>$sel:heartbeatFrequency:PostgreSQLSettings'</a>,
--   <a>postgreSQLSettings_heartbeatFrequency</a> - Sets the WAL heartbeat
--   frequency (in minutes).
--   
--   <a>$sel:password:PostgreSQLSettings'</a>,
--   <a>postgreSQLSettings_password</a> - Endpoint connection password.
--   
--   <a>$sel:databaseName:PostgreSQLSettings'</a>,
--   <a>postgreSQLSettings_databaseName</a> - Database name for the
--   endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:afterConnectScript:PostgreSQLSettings'</a>,
--   <a>postgreSQLSettings_afterConnectScript</a> - For use with change
--   data capture (CDC) only, this attribute has DMS bypass foreign keys
--   and user triggers to reduce the time it takes to bulk load data.
--   
--   Example: <tt>afterConnectScript=SET
--   session_replication_role='replica'</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:secretsManagerSecretId:PostgreSQLSettings'</a>,
--   <a>postgreSQLSettings_secretsManagerSecretId</a> - The full ARN,
--   partial ARN, or friendly name of the <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt>
--   that contains the PostgreSQL endpoint connection details.
--   
--   <a>$sel:captureDdls:PostgreSQLSettings'</a>,
--   <a>postgreSQLSettings_captureDdls</a> - To capture DDL events, DMS
--   creates various artifacts in the PostgreSQL database when the task
--   starts. You can later remove these artifacts.
--   
--   If this value is set to <tt>N</tt>, you don't have to create tables or
--   triggers on the source database.
--   
--   <a>$sel:pluginName:PostgreSQLSettings'</a>,
--   <a>postgreSQLSettings_pluginName</a> - Specifies the plugin to use to
--   create a replication slot.
--   
--   <a>$sel:port:PostgreSQLSettings'</a>, <a>postgreSQLSettings_port</a> -
--   Endpoint TCP port.
--   
--   <a>$sel:heartbeatSchema:PostgreSQLSettings'</a>,
--   <a>postgreSQLSettings_heartbeatSchema</a> - Sets the schema in which
--   the heartbeat artifacts are created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:heartbeatEnable:PostgreSQLSettings'</a>,
--   <a>postgreSQLSettings_heartbeatEnable</a> - The write-ahead log (WAL)
--   heartbeat feature mimics a dummy transaction. By doing this, it
--   prevents idle logical replication slots from holding onto old WAL
--   logs, which can result in storage full situations on the source. This
--   heartbeat keeps <tt>restart_lsn</tt> moving and prevents storage full
--   scenarios.
newPostgreSQLSettings :: PostgreSQLSettings

-- | Sets the client statement timeout for the PostgreSQL instance, in
--   seconds. The default value is 60 seconds.
--   
--   Example: <tt>executeTimeout=100;</tt>
postgreSQLSettings_executeTimeout :: Lens' PostgreSQLSettings (Maybe Int)

-- | Specifies the maximum size (in KB) of any .csv file used to transfer
--   data to PostgreSQL.
--   
--   Example: <tt>maxFileSize=512</tt>
postgreSQLSettings_maxFileSize :: Lens' PostgreSQLSettings (Maybe Int)

-- | When set to <tt>true</tt>, this value causes a task to fail if the
--   actual size of a LOB column is greater than the specified
--   <tt>LobMaxSize</tt>.
--   
--   If task is set to Limited LOB mode and this option is set to true, the
--   task fails instead of truncating the LOB data.
postgreSQLSettings_failTasksOnLobTruncation :: Lens' PostgreSQLSettings (Maybe Bool)

-- | Fully qualified domain name of the endpoint.
postgreSQLSettings_serverName :: Lens' PostgreSQLSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | The schema in which the operational DDL database artifacts are
--   created.
--   
--   Example: <tt>ddlArtifactsSchema=xyzddlschema;</tt>
postgreSQLSettings_ddlArtifactsSchema :: Lens' PostgreSQLSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | Sets the name of a previously created logical replication slot for a
--   change data capture (CDC) load of the PostgreSQL source instance.
--   
--   When used with the <tt>CdcStartPosition</tt> request parameter for the
--   DMS API , this attribute also makes it possible to use native CDC
--   start points. DMS verifies that the specified logical replication slot
--   exists before starting the CDC load task. It also verifies that the
--   task was created with a valid setting of <tt>CdcStartPosition</tt>. If
--   the specified slot doesn't exist or the task doesn't have a valid
--   <tt>CdcStartPosition</tt> setting, DMS raises an error.
--   
--   For more information about setting the <tt>CdcStartPosition</tt>
--   request parameter, see <a>Determining a CDC native start point</a> in
--   the <i>Database Migration Service User Guide</i>. For more information
--   about using <tt>CdcStartPosition</tt>, see
--   <a>CreateReplicationTask</a>, <a>StartReplicationTask</a>, and
--   <a>ModifyReplicationTask</a>.
postgreSQLSettings_slotName :: Lens' PostgreSQLSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | The full Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role that specifies DMS
--   as the trusted entity and grants the required permissions to access
--   the value in <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt>. The role must allow the
--   <tt>iam:PassRole</tt> action. <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> has the
--   value of the Amazon Web Services Secrets Manager secret that allows
--   access to the PostgreSQL endpoint.
--   
--   You can specify one of two sets of values for these permissions. You
--   can specify the values for this setting and
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecretId</tt>. Or you can specify clear-text values
--   for <tt>UserName</tt>, <tt>Password</tt>, <tt>ServerName</tt>, and
--   <tt>Port</tt>. You can't specify both. For more information on
--   creating this <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> and the
--   <tt>SecretsManagerAccessRoleArn</tt> and
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecretId</tt> required to access it, see <a>Using
--   secrets to access Database Migration Service resources</a> in the
--   <i>Database Migration Service User Guide</i>.
postgreSQLSettings_secretsManagerAccessRoleArn :: Lens' PostgreSQLSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | Endpoint connection user name.
postgreSQLSettings_username :: Lens' PostgreSQLSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | Sets the WAL heartbeat frequency (in minutes).
postgreSQLSettings_heartbeatFrequency :: Lens' PostgreSQLSettings (Maybe Int)

-- | Endpoint connection password.
postgreSQLSettings_password :: Lens' PostgreSQLSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | Database name for the endpoint.
postgreSQLSettings_databaseName :: Lens' PostgreSQLSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | For use with change data capture (CDC) only, this attribute has DMS
--   bypass foreign keys and user triggers to reduce the time it takes to
--   bulk load data.
--   
--   Example: <tt>afterConnectScript=SET
--   session_replication_role='replica'</tt>
postgreSQLSettings_afterConnectScript :: Lens' PostgreSQLSettings (Maybe Text)

--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> that contains the PostgreSQL endpoint
--   connection details.
postgreSQLSettings_secretsManagerSecretId :: Lens' PostgreSQLSettings (Maybe Text)

--   database when the task starts. You can later remove these artifacts.
--

--   triggers on the source database.
postgreSQLSettings_captureDdls :: Lens' PostgreSQLSettings (Maybe Bool)

postgreSQLSettings_pluginName :: Lens' PostgreSQLSettings (Maybe PluginNameValue)

postgreSQLSettings_port :: Lens' PostgreSQLSettings (Maybe Int)

postgreSQLSettings_heartbeatSchema :: Lens' PostgreSQLSettings (Maybe Text)

--   transaction. By doing this, it prevents idle logical replication slots
--   from holding onto old WAL logs, which can result in storage full
--   situations on the source. This heartbeat keeps <tt>restart_lsn</tt>
--   moving and prevents storage full scenarios.
postgreSQLSettings_heartbeatEnable :: Lens' PostgreSQLSettings (Maybe Bool)

module Network.AWS.DMS.Types.RedshiftSettings

-- | Provides information that defines an Amazon Redshift endpoint.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRedshiftSettings</a> smart constructor.
data RedshiftSettings
RedshiftSettings' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe EncryptionModeValue -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> RedshiftSettings

-- | A value that specifies whether DMS should migrate empty CHAR and
--   VARCHAR fields as NULL. A value of <tt>true</tt> sets empty CHAR and
--   VARCHAR fields to null. The default is <tt>false</tt>.
[$sel:emptyAsNull:RedshiftSettings'] :: RedshiftSettings -> Maybe Bool

-- | If Amazon Redshift is configured to support case sensitive schema
--   names, set <tt>CaseSensitiveNames</tt> to <tt>true</tt>. The default
--   is <tt>false</tt>.
[$sel:caseSensitiveNames:RedshiftSettings'] :: RedshiftSettings -> Maybe Bool

-- | The maximum size (in KB) of any .csv file used to load data on an S3
--   bucket and transfer data to Amazon Redshift. It defaults to 1048576KB
--   (1 GB).
[$sel:maxFileSize:RedshiftSettings'] :: RedshiftSettings -> Maybe Int

-- | A value that specifies to replaces the invalid characters specified in
--   <tt>ReplaceInvalidChars</tt>, substituting the specified characters
--   instead. The default is <tt>"?"</tt>.
[$sel:replaceChars:RedshiftSettings'] :: RedshiftSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the Amazon Redshift cluster you are using.
[$sel:serverName:RedshiftSettings'] :: RedshiftSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | A value that sets the amount of time to wait (in milliseconds) before
--   timing out, beginning from when you initially establish a connection.
[$sel:connectionTimeout:RedshiftSettings'] :: RedshiftSettings -> Maybe Int

-- | The amount of time to wait (in milliseconds) before timing out of
--   operations performed by DMS on a Redshift cluster, such as Redshift
--   COPY, INSERT, DELETE, and UPDATE.
[$sel:loadTimeout:RedshiftSettings'] :: RedshiftSettings -> Maybe Int

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role that has access to the
--   Amazon Redshift service. The role must allow the <tt>iam:PassRole</tt>
--   action.
[$sel:serviceAccessRoleArn:RedshiftSettings'] :: RedshiftSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | This setting is only valid for a full-load migration task. Set
--   <tt>ExplicitIds</tt> to <tt>true</tt> to have tables with
--   <tt>IDENTITY</tt> columns override their auto-generated values with
--   explicit values loaded from the source data files used to populate the
--   tables. The default is <tt>false</tt>.
[$sel:explicitIds:RedshiftSettings'] :: RedshiftSettings -> Maybe Bool

-- | An S3 folder where the comma-separated-value (.csv) files are stored
--   before being uploaded to the target Redshift cluster.
--   
--   For full load mode, DMS converts source records into .csv files and
--   loads them to the <i>BucketFolder/TableID</i> path. DMS uses the
--   Redshift <tt>COPY</tt> command to upload the .csv files to the target
--   table. The files are deleted once the <tt>COPY</tt> operation has
--   finished. For more information, see <a>COPY</a> in the <i>Amazon
--   Redshift Database Developer Guide</i>.
--   
--   For change-data-capture (CDC) mode, DMS creates a <i>NetChanges</i>
--   table, and loads the .csv files to this
--   <i>BucketFolder/NetChangesTableID</i> path.
[$sel:bucketFolder:RedshiftSettings'] :: RedshiftSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | A value that specifies to truncate data in columns to the appropriate
--   number of characters, so that the data fits in the column. This
--   parameter applies only to columns with a VARCHAR or CHAR data type,
--   and rows with a size of 4 MB or less. Choose <tt>true</tt> to truncate
--   data. The default is <tt>false</tt>.
[$sel:truncateColumns:RedshiftSettings'] :: RedshiftSettings -> Maybe Bool

-- | The full Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role that specifies DMS
--   as the trusted entity and grants the required permissions to access
--   the value in <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt>. The role must allow the
--   <tt>iam:PassRole</tt> action. <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> has the
--   value of the Amazon Web Services Secrets Manager secret that allows
--   access to the Amazon Redshift endpoint.
--   
--   You can specify one of two sets of values for these permissions. You
--   can specify the values for this setting and
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecretId</tt>. Or you can specify clear-text values
--   for <tt>UserName</tt>, <tt>Password</tt>, <tt>ServerName</tt>, and
--   <tt>Port</tt>. You can't specify both. For more information on
--   creating this <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> and the
--   <tt>SecretsManagerAccessRoleArn</tt> and
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecretId</tt> required to access it, see <a>Using
--   secrets to access Database Migration Service resources</a> in the
--   <i>Database Migration Service User Guide</i>.
[$sel:secretsManagerAccessRoleArn:RedshiftSettings'] :: RedshiftSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | A list of characters that you want to replace. Use with
--   <tt>ReplaceChars</tt>.
[$sel:replaceInvalidChars:RedshiftSettings'] :: RedshiftSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | An Amazon Redshift user name for a registered user.
[$sel:username:RedshiftSettings'] :: RedshiftSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the intermediate S3 bucket used to store .csv files before
--   uploading data to Redshift.
[$sel:bucketName:RedshiftSettings'] :: RedshiftSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | The type of server-side encryption that you want to use for your data.
--   This encryption type is part of the endpoint settings or the extra
--   connections attributes for Amazon S3. You can choose either
--   <tt>SSE_S3</tt> (the default) or <tt>SSE_KMS</tt>.
--   
--   For the <tt>ModifyEndpoint</tt> operation, you can change the existing
--   value of the <tt>EncryptionMode</tt> parameter from <tt>SSE_KMS</tt>
--   to <tt>SSE_S3</tt>. But you canâ€™t change the existing value from
--   <tt>SSE_S3</tt> to <tt>SSE_KMS</tt>.
--   
--   To use <tt>SSE_S3</tt>, create an Identity and Access Management (IAM)
--   role with a policy that allows <tt>"arn:aws:s3:::*"</tt> to use the
--   following actions: <tt>"s3:PutObject", "s3:ListBucket"</tt>
[$sel:encryptionMode:RedshiftSettings'] :: RedshiftSettings -> Maybe EncryptionModeValue

-- | The date format that you are using. Valid values are <tt>auto</tt>
--   (case-sensitive), your date format string enclosed in quotes, or NULL.
--   If this parameter is left unset (NULL), it defaults to a format of
--   'YYYY-MM-DD'. Using <tt>auto</tt> recognizes most strings, even some
--   that aren't supported when you use a date format string.
--   
--   If your date and time values use formats different from each other,
--   set this to <tt>auto</tt>.
[$sel:dateFormat:RedshiftSettings'] :: RedshiftSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | A value that specifies to remove surrounding quotation marks from
--   strings in the incoming data. All characters within the quotation
--   marks, including delimiters, are retained. Choose <tt>true</tt> to
--   remove quotation marks. The default is <tt>false</tt>.
[$sel:removeQuotes:RedshiftSettings'] :: RedshiftSettings -> Maybe Bool

-- | The password for the user named in the <tt>username</tt> property.
[$sel:password:RedshiftSettings'] :: RedshiftSettings -> Maybe (Sensitive Text)

-- | The name of the Amazon Redshift data warehouse (service) that you are
--   working with.
[$sel:databaseName:RedshiftSettings'] :: RedshiftSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | A value that indicates to allow any date format, including invalid
--   formats such as 00/00/00 00:00:00, to be loaded without generating an
--   error. You can choose <tt>true</tt> or <tt>false</tt> (the default).
--   
--   This parameter applies only to TIMESTAMP and DATE columns. Always use
--   ACCEPTANYDATE with the DATEFORMAT parameter. If the date format for
--   the data doesn't match the DATEFORMAT specification, Amazon Redshift
--   inserts a NULL value into that field.
[$sel:acceptAnyDate:RedshiftSettings'] :: RedshiftSettings -> Maybe Bool

-- | Code to run after connecting. This parameter should contain the code
--   itself, not the name of a file containing the code.
[$sel:afterConnectScript:RedshiftSettings'] :: RedshiftSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | The full ARN, partial ARN, or friendly name of the
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> that contains the Amazon Redshift
--   endpoint connection details.
[$sel:secretsManagerSecretId:RedshiftSettings'] :: RedshiftSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | The size (in KB) of the in-memory file write buffer used when
--   generating .csv files on the local disk at the DMS replication
--   instance. The default value is 1000 (buffer size is 1000KB).
[$sel:writeBufferSize:RedshiftSettings'] :: RedshiftSettings -> Maybe Int

-- | If you set <tt>CompUpdate</tt> to <tt>true</tt> Amazon Redshift
--   applies automatic compression if the table is empty. This applies even
--   if the table columns already have encodings other than <tt>RAW</tt>.
--   If you set <tt>CompUpdate</tt> to <tt>false</tt>, automatic
--   compression is disabled and existing column encodings aren't changed.
--   The default is <tt>true</tt>.
[$sel:compUpdate:RedshiftSettings'] :: RedshiftSettings -> Maybe Bool

-- | A value that specifies to remove the trailing white space characters
--   from a VARCHAR string. This parameter applies only to columns with a
--   VARCHAR data type. Choose <tt>true</tt> to remove unneeded white
--   space. The default is <tt>false</tt>.
[$sel:trimBlanks:RedshiftSettings'] :: RedshiftSettings -> Maybe Bool

-- | The time format that you want to use. Valid values are <tt>auto</tt>
--   (case-sensitive), <tt>'timeformat_string'</tt>, <tt>'epochsecs'</tt>,
--   or <tt>'epochmillisecs'</tt>. It defaults to 10. Using <tt>auto</tt>
--   recognizes most strings, even some that aren't supported when you use
--   a time format string.
--   
--   If your date and time values use formats different from each other,
--   set this parameter to <tt>auto</tt>.
[$sel:timeFormat:RedshiftSettings'] :: RedshiftSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | The KMS key ID. If you are using <tt>SSE_KMS</tt> for the
--   <tt>EncryptionMode</tt>, provide this key ID. The key that you use
--   needs an attached policy that enables IAM user permissions and allows
--   use of the key.
[$sel:serverSideEncryptionKmsKeyId:RedshiftSettings'] :: RedshiftSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | The port number for Amazon Redshift. The default value is 5439.
[$sel:port:RedshiftSettings'] :: RedshiftSettings -> Maybe Int

-- | The number of threads used to upload a single file. This parameter
--   accepts a value from 1 through 64. It defaults to 10.
--   
--   The number of parallel streams used to upload a single .csv file to an
--   S3 bucket using S3 Multipart Upload. For more information, see
--   <a>Multipart upload overview</a>.
--   
--   <tt>FileTransferUploadStreams</tt> accepts a value from 1 through 64.
--   It defaults to 10.
[$sel:fileTransferUploadStreams:RedshiftSettings'] :: RedshiftSettings -> Maybe Int

-- | Create a value of <a>RedshiftSettings</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:emptyAsNull:RedshiftSettings'</a>,
--   <a>redshiftSettings_emptyAsNull</a> - A value that specifies whether
--   DMS should migrate empty CHAR and VARCHAR fields as NULL. A value of
--   <tt>true</tt> sets empty CHAR and VARCHAR fields to null. The default
--   is <tt>false</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:caseSensitiveNames:RedshiftSettings'</a>,
--   <a>redshiftSettings_caseSensitiveNames</a> - If Amazon Redshift is
--   configured to support case sensitive schema names, set
--   <tt>CaseSensitiveNames</tt> to <tt>true</tt>. The default is
--   <tt>false</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxFileSize:RedshiftSettings'</a>,
--   <a>redshiftSettings_maxFileSize</a> - The maximum size (in KB) of any
--   .csv file used to load data on an S3 bucket and transfer data to
--   Amazon Redshift. It defaults to 1048576KB (1 GB).
--   
--   <a>$sel:replaceChars:RedshiftSettings'</a>,
--   <a>redshiftSettings_replaceChars</a> - A value that specifies to
--   replaces the invalid characters specified in
--   <tt>ReplaceInvalidChars</tt>, substituting the specified characters
--   instead. The default is <tt>"?"</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:serverName:RedshiftSettings'</a>,
--   <a>redshiftSettings_serverName</a> - The name of the Amazon Redshift
--   cluster you are using.
--   
--   <a>$sel:connectionTimeout:RedshiftSettings'</a>,
--   <a>redshiftSettings_connectionTimeout</a> - A value that sets the
--   amount of time to wait (in milliseconds) before timing out, beginning
--   from when you initially establish a connection.
--   
--   <a>$sel:loadTimeout:RedshiftSettings'</a>,
--   <a>redshiftSettings_loadTimeout</a> - The amount of time to wait (in
--   milliseconds) before timing out of operations performed by DMS on a
--   Redshift cluster, such as Redshift COPY, INSERT, DELETE, and UPDATE.
--   
--   <a>$sel:serviceAccessRoleArn:RedshiftSettings'</a>,
--   <a>redshiftSettings_serviceAccessRoleArn</a> - The Amazon Resource
--   Name (ARN) of the IAM role that has access to the Amazon Redshift
--   service. The role must allow the <tt>iam:PassRole</tt> action.
--   
--   <a>$sel:explicitIds:RedshiftSettings'</a>,
--   <a>redshiftSettings_explicitIds</a> - This setting is only valid for a
--   full-load migration task. Set <tt>ExplicitIds</tt> to <tt>true</tt> to
--   have tables with <tt>IDENTITY</tt> columns override their
--   auto-generated values with explicit values loaded from the source data
--   files used to populate the tables. The default is <tt>false</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bucketFolder:RedshiftSettings'</a>,
--   <a>redshiftSettings_bucketFolder</a> - An S3 folder where the
--   comma-separated-value (.csv) files are stored before being uploaded to
--   the target Redshift cluster.
--   
--   For full load mode, DMS converts source records into .csv files and
--   loads them to the <i>BucketFolder/TableID</i> path. DMS uses the
--   Redshift <tt>COPY</tt> command to upload the .csv files to the target
--   table. The files are deleted once the <tt>COPY</tt> operation has
--   finished. For more information, see <a>COPY</a> in the <i>Amazon
--   Redshift Database Developer Guide</i>.
--   
--   For change-data-capture (CDC) mode, DMS creates a <i>NetChanges</i>
--   table, and loads the .csv files to this
--   <i>BucketFolder/NetChangesTableID</i> path.
--   
--   <a>$sel:truncateColumns:RedshiftSettings'</a>,
--   <a>redshiftSettings_truncateColumns</a> - A value that specifies to
--   truncate data in columns to the appropriate number of characters, so
--   that the data fits in the column. This parameter applies only to
--   columns with a VARCHAR or CHAR data type, and rows with a size of 4 MB
--   or less. Choose <tt>true</tt> to truncate data. The default is
--   <tt>false</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:secretsManagerAccessRoleArn:RedshiftSettings'</a>,
--   <a>redshiftSettings_secretsManagerAccessRoleArn</a> - The full Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role that specifies DMS as the trusted
--   entity and grants the required permissions to access the value in
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt>. The role must allow the
--   <tt>iam:PassRole</tt> action. <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> has the
--   value of the Amazon Web Services Secrets Manager secret that allows
--   access to the Amazon Redshift endpoint.
--   
--   You can specify one of two sets of values for these permissions. You
--   can specify the values for this setting and
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecretId</tt>. Or you can specify clear-text values
--   for <tt>UserName</tt>, <tt>Password</tt>, <tt>ServerName</tt>, and
--   <tt>Port</tt>. You can't specify both. For more information on
--   creating this <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> and the
--   <tt>SecretsManagerAccessRoleArn</tt> and
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecretId</tt> required to access it, see <a>Using
--   secrets to access Database Migration Service resources</a> in the
--   <i>Database Migration Service User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:replaceInvalidChars:RedshiftSettings'</a>,
--   <a>redshiftSettings_replaceInvalidChars</a> - A list of characters
--   that you want to replace. Use with <tt>ReplaceChars</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:username:RedshiftSettings'</a>,
--   <a>redshiftSettings_username</a> - An Amazon Redshift user name for a
--   registered user.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bucketName:RedshiftSettings'</a>,
--   <a>redshiftSettings_bucketName</a> - The name of the intermediate S3
--   bucket used to store .csv files before uploading data to Redshift.
--   
--   <a>$sel:encryptionMode:RedshiftSettings'</a>,
--   <a>redshiftSettings_encryptionMode</a> - The type of server-side
--   encryption that you want to use for your data. This encryption type is
--   part of the endpoint settings or the extra connections attributes for
--   Amazon S3. You can choose either <tt>SSE_S3</tt> (the default) or
--   <tt>SSE_KMS</tt>.
--   
--   For the <tt>ModifyEndpoint</tt> operation, you can change the existing
--   value of the <tt>EncryptionMode</tt> parameter from <tt>SSE_KMS</tt>
--   to <tt>SSE_S3</tt>. But you canâ€™t change the existing value from
--   <tt>SSE_S3</tt> to <tt>SSE_KMS</tt>.
--   
--   To use <tt>SSE_S3</tt>, create an Identity and Access Management (IAM)
--   role with a policy that allows <tt>"arn:aws:s3:::*"</tt> to use the
--   following actions: <tt>"s3:PutObject", "s3:ListBucket"</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:dateFormat:RedshiftSettings'</a>,
--   <a>redshiftSettings_dateFormat</a> - The date format that you are
--   using. Valid values are <tt>auto</tt> (case-sensitive), your date
--   format string enclosed in quotes, or NULL. If this parameter is left
--   unset (NULL), it defaults to a format of 'YYYY-MM-DD'. Using
--   <tt>auto</tt> recognizes most strings, even some that aren't supported
--   when you use a date format string.
--   
--   If your date and time values use formats different from each other,
--   set this to <tt>auto</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:removeQuotes:RedshiftSettings'</a>,
--   <a>redshiftSettings_removeQuotes</a> - A value that specifies to
--   remove surrounding quotation marks from strings in the incoming data.
--   All characters within the quotation marks, including delimiters, are
--   retained. Choose <tt>true</tt> to remove quotation marks. The default
--   is <tt>false</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:password:RedshiftSettings'</a>,
--   <a>redshiftSettings_password</a> - The password for the user named in
--   the <tt>username</tt> property.
--   
--   <a>$sel:databaseName:RedshiftSettings'</a>,
--   <a>redshiftSettings_databaseName</a> - The name of the Amazon Redshift
--   data warehouse (service) that you are working with.
--   
--   <a>$sel:acceptAnyDate:RedshiftSettings'</a>,
--   <a>redshiftSettings_acceptAnyDate</a> - A value that indicates to
--   allow any date format, including invalid formats such as 00/00/00
--   00:00:00, to be loaded without generating an error. You can choose
--   <tt>true</tt> or <tt>false</tt> (the default).
--   
--   This parameter applies only to TIMESTAMP and DATE columns. Always use
--   ACCEPTANYDATE with the DATEFORMAT parameter. If the date format for
--   the data doesn't match the DATEFORMAT specification, Amazon Redshift
--   inserts a NULL value into that field.
--   
--   <a>$sel:afterConnectScript:RedshiftSettings'</a>,
--   <a>redshiftSettings_afterConnectScript</a> - Code to run after
--   connecting. This parameter should contain the code itself, not the
--   name of a file containing the code.
--   
--   <a>$sel:secretsManagerSecretId:RedshiftSettings'</a>,
--   <a>redshiftSettings_secretsManagerSecretId</a> - The full ARN, partial
--   ARN, or friendly name of the <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> that
--   contains the Amazon Redshift endpoint connection details.
--   
--   <a>$sel:writeBufferSize:RedshiftSettings'</a>,
--   <a>redshiftSettings_writeBufferSize</a> - The size (in KB) of the
--   in-memory file write buffer used when generating .csv files on the
--   local disk at the DMS replication instance. The default value is 1000
--   (buffer size is 1000KB).
--   
--   <a>$sel:compUpdate:RedshiftSettings'</a>,
--   <a>redshiftSettings_compUpdate</a> - If you set <tt>CompUpdate</tt> to
--   <tt>true</tt> Amazon Redshift applies automatic compression if the
--   table is empty. This applies even if the table columns already have
--   encodings other than <tt>RAW</tt>. If you set <tt>CompUpdate</tt> to
--   <tt>false</tt>, automatic compression is disabled and existing column
--   encodings aren't changed. The default is <tt>true</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:trimBlanks:RedshiftSettings'</a>,
--   <a>redshiftSettings_trimBlanks</a> - A value that specifies to remove
--   the trailing white space characters from a VARCHAR string. This
--   parameter applies only to columns with a VARCHAR data type. Choose
--   <tt>true</tt> to remove unneeded white space. The default is
--   <tt>false</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:timeFormat:RedshiftSettings'</a>,
--   <a>redshiftSettings_timeFormat</a> - The time format that you want to
--   use. Valid values are <tt>auto</tt> (case-sensitive),
--   <tt>'timeformat_string'</tt>, <tt>'epochsecs'</tt>, or
--   <tt>'epochmillisecs'</tt>. It defaults to 10. Using <tt>auto</tt>
--   recognizes most strings, even some that aren't supported when you use
--   a time format string.
--   
--   If your date and time values use formats different from each other,
--   set this parameter to <tt>auto</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:serverSideEncryptionKmsKeyId:RedshiftSettings'</a>,
--   <a>redshiftSettings_serverSideEncryptionKmsKeyId</a> - The KMS key ID.
--   If you are using <tt>SSE_KMS</tt> for the <tt>EncryptionMode</tt>,
--   provide this key ID. The key that you use needs an attached policy
--   that enables IAM user permissions and allows use of the key.
--   
--   <a>$sel:port:RedshiftSettings'</a>, <a>redshiftSettings_port</a> - The
--   port number for Amazon Redshift. The default value is 5439.
--   
--   <a>$sel:fileTransferUploadStreams:RedshiftSettings'</a>,
--   <a>redshiftSettings_fileTransferUploadStreams</a> - The number of
--   threads used to upload a single file. This parameter accepts a value
--   from 1 through 64. It defaults to 10.
--   
--   The number of parallel streams used to upload a single .csv file to an
--   S3 bucket using S3 Multipart Upload. For more information, see
--   <a>Multipart upload overview</a>.
--   
--   <tt>FileTransferUploadStreams</tt> accepts a value from 1 through 64.
--   It defaults to 10.
newRedshiftSettings :: RedshiftSettings

-- | A value that specifies whether DMS should migrate empty CHAR and
--   VARCHAR fields as NULL. A value of <tt>true</tt> sets empty CHAR and
--   VARCHAR fields to null. The default is <tt>false</tt>.
redshiftSettings_emptyAsNull :: Lens' RedshiftSettings (Maybe Bool)

-- | If Amazon Redshift is configured to support case sensitive schema
--   names, set <tt>CaseSensitiveNames</tt> to <tt>true</tt>. The default
--   is <tt>false</tt>.
redshiftSettings_caseSensitiveNames :: Lens' RedshiftSettings (Maybe Bool)

-- | The maximum size (in KB) of any .csv file used to load data on an S3
--   bucket and transfer data to Amazon Redshift. It defaults to 1048576KB
--   (1 GB).
redshiftSettings_maxFileSize :: Lens' RedshiftSettings (Maybe Int)

-- | A value that specifies to replaces the invalid characters specified in
--   <tt>ReplaceInvalidChars</tt>, substituting the specified characters
--   instead. The default is <tt>"?"</tt>.
redshiftSettings_replaceChars :: Lens' RedshiftSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the Amazon Redshift cluster you are using.
redshiftSettings_serverName :: Lens' RedshiftSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | A value that sets the amount of time to wait (in milliseconds) before
--   timing out, beginning from when you initially establish a connection.
redshiftSettings_connectionTimeout :: Lens' RedshiftSettings (Maybe Int)

-- | The amount of time to wait (in milliseconds) before timing out of
--   operations performed by DMS on a Redshift cluster, such as Redshift
--   COPY, INSERT, DELETE, and UPDATE.
redshiftSettings_loadTimeout :: Lens' RedshiftSettings (Maybe Int)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role that has access to the
--   Amazon Redshift service. The role must allow the <tt>iam:PassRole</tt>
--   action.
redshiftSettings_serviceAccessRoleArn :: Lens' RedshiftSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | This setting is only valid for a full-load migration task. Set
--   <tt>ExplicitIds</tt> to <tt>true</tt> to have tables with
--   <tt>IDENTITY</tt> columns override their auto-generated values with
--   explicit values loaded from the source data files used to populate the
--   tables. The default is <tt>false</tt>.
redshiftSettings_explicitIds :: Lens' RedshiftSettings (Maybe Bool)

-- | An S3 folder where the comma-separated-value (.csv) files are stored
--   before being uploaded to the target Redshift cluster.
--   
--   For full load mode, DMS converts source records into .csv files and
--   loads them to the <i>BucketFolder/TableID</i> path. DMS uses the
--   Redshift <tt>COPY</tt> command to upload the .csv files to the target
--   table. The files are deleted once the <tt>COPY</tt> operation has
--   finished. For more information, see <a>COPY</a> in the <i>Amazon
--   Redshift Database Developer Guide</i>.
--   
--   For change-data-capture (CDC) mode, DMS creates a <i>NetChanges</i>
--   table, and loads the .csv files to this
--   <i>BucketFolder/NetChangesTableID</i> path.
redshiftSettings_bucketFolder :: Lens' RedshiftSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | A value that specifies to truncate data in columns to the appropriate
--   number of characters, so that the data fits in the column. This
--   parameter applies only to columns with a VARCHAR or CHAR data type,
--   and rows with a size of 4 MB or less. Choose <tt>true</tt> to truncate
--   data. The default is <tt>false</tt>.
redshiftSettings_truncateColumns :: Lens' RedshiftSettings (Maybe Bool)

-- | The full Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role that specifies DMS
--   as the trusted entity and grants the required permissions to access
--   the value in <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt>. The role must allow the
--   <tt>iam:PassRole</tt> action. <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> has the
--   value of the Amazon Web Services Secrets Manager secret that allows
--   access to the Amazon Redshift endpoint.
--   
--   You can specify one of two sets of values for these permissions. You
--   can specify the values for this setting and
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecretId</tt>. Or you can specify clear-text values
--   for <tt>UserName</tt>, <tt>Password</tt>, <tt>ServerName</tt>, and
--   <tt>Port</tt>. You can't specify both. For more information on
--   creating this <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> and the
--   <tt>SecretsManagerAccessRoleArn</tt> and
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecretId</tt> required to access it, see <a>Using
--   secrets to access Database Migration Service resources</a> in the
--   <i>Database Migration Service User Guide</i>.
redshiftSettings_secretsManagerAccessRoleArn :: Lens' RedshiftSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | A list of characters that you want to replace. Use with
--   <tt>ReplaceChars</tt>.
redshiftSettings_replaceInvalidChars :: Lens' RedshiftSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | An Amazon Redshift user name for a registered user.
redshiftSettings_username :: Lens' RedshiftSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the intermediate S3 bucket used to store .csv files before
--   uploading data to Redshift.
redshiftSettings_bucketName :: Lens' RedshiftSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | The type of server-side encryption that you want to use for your data.
--   This encryption type is part of the endpoint settings or the extra
--   connections attributes for Amazon S3. You can choose either
--   <tt>SSE_S3</tt> (the default) or <tt>SSE_KMS</tt>.
--   
--   For the <tt>ModifyEndpoint</tt> operation, you can change the existing
--   value of the <tt>EncryptionMode</tt> parameter from <tt>SSE_KMS</tt>
--   to <tt>SSE_S3</tt>. But you canâ€™t change the existing value from
--   <tt>SSE_S3</tt> to <tt>SSE_KMS</tt>.
--   
--   To use <tt>SSE_S3</tt>, create an Identity and Access Management (IAM)
--   role with a policy that allows <tt>"arn:aws:s3:::*"</tt> to use the
--   following actions: <tt>"s3:PutObject", "s3:ListBucket"</tt>
redshiftSettings_encryptionMode :: Lens' RedshiftSettings (Maybe EncryptionModeValue)

-- | The date format that you are using. Valid values are <tt>auto</tt>
--   (case-sensitive), your date format string enclosed in quotes, or NULL.
--   If this parameter is left unset (NULL), it defaults to a format of
--   'YYYY-MM-DD'. Using <tt>auto</tt> recognizes most strings, even some
--   that aren't supported when you use a date format string.
--   
--   If your date and time values use formats different from each other,
--   set this to <tt>auto</tt>.
redshiftSettings_dateFormat :: Lens' RedshiftSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | A value that specifies to remove surrounding quotation marks from
--   strings in the incoming data. All characters within the quotation
--   marks, including delimiters, are retained. Choose <tt>true</tt> to
--   remove quotation marks. The default is <tt>false</tt>.
redshiftSettings_removeQuotes :: Lens' RedshiftSettings (Maybe Bool)

-- | The password for the user named in the <tt>username</tt> property.
redshiftSettings_password :: Lens' RedshiftSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the Amazon Redshift data warehouse (service) that you are
--   working with.
redshiftSettings_databaseName :: Lens' RedshiftSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | A value that indicates to allow any date format, including invalid
--   formats such as 00/00/00 00:00:00, to be loaded without generating an
--   error. You can choose <tt>true</tt> or <tt>false</tt> (the default).
--   
--   This parameter applies only to TIMESTAMP and DATE columns. Always use
--   ACCEPTANYDATE with the DATEFORMAT parameter. If the date format for
--   the data doesn't match the DATEFORMAT specification, Amazon Redshift
--   inserts a NULL value into that field.
redshiftSettings_acceptAnyDate :: Lens' RedshiftSettings (Maybe Bool)

-- | Code to run after connecting. This parameter should contain the code
--   itself, not the name of a file containing the code.
redshiftSettings_afterConnectScript :: Lens' RedshiftSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | The full ARN, partial ARN, or friendly name of the
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> that contains the Amazon Redshift
--   endpoint connection details.
redshiftSettings_secretsManagerSecretId :: Lens' RedshiftSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | The size (in KB) of the in-memory file write buffer used when
--   generating .csv files on the local disk at the DMS replication
--   instance. The default value is 1000 (buffer size is 1000KB).
redshiftSettings_writeBufferSize :: Lens' RedshiftSettings (Maybe Int)

-- | If you set <tt>CompUpdate</tt> to <tt>true</tt> Amazon Redshift
--   applies automatic compression if the table is empty. This applies even
--   if the table columns already have encodings other than <tt>RAW</tt>.
--   If you set <tt>CompUpdate</tt> to <tt>false</tt>, automatic
--   compression is disabled and existing column encodings aren't changed.
--   The default is <tt>true</tt>.
redshiftSettings_compUpdate :: Lens' RedshiftSettings (Maybe Bool)

-- | A value that specifies to remove the trailing white space characters
--   from a VARCHAR string. This parameter applies only to columns with a
--   VARCHAR data type. Choose <tt>true</tt> to remove unneeded white
--   space. The default is <tt>false</tt>.
redshiftSettings_trimBlanks :: Lens' RedshiftSettings (Maybe Bool)

-- | The time format that you want to use. Valid values are <tt>auto</tt>
--   (case-sensitive), <tt>'timeformat_string'</tt>, <tt>'epochsecs'</tt>,
--   or <tt>'epochmillisecs'</tt>. It defaults to 10. Using <tt>auto</tt>
--   recognizes most strings, even some that aren't supported when you use
--   a time format string.
--   
--   If your date and time values use formats different from each other,
--   set this parameter to <tt>auto</tt>.
redshiftSettings_timeFormat :: Lens' RedshiftSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | The KMS key ID. If you are using <tt>SSE_KMS</tt> for the
--   <tt>EncryptionMode</tt>, provide this key ID. The key that you use
--   needs an attached policy that enables IAM user permissions and allows
--   use of the key.
redshiftSettings_serverSideEncryptionKmsKeyId :: Lens' RedshiftSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | The port number for Amazon Redshift. The default value is 5439.
redshiftSettings_port :: Lens' RedshiftSettings (Maybe Int)

-- | The number of threads used to upload a single file. This parameter
--   accepts a value from 1 through 64. It defaults to 10.
--   
--   The number of parallel streams used to upload a single .csv file to an
--   S3 bucket using S3 Multipart Upload. For more information, see
--   <a>Multipart upload overview</a>.
--   
--   <tt>FileTransferUploadStreams</tt> accepts a value from 1 through 64.
--   It defaults to 10.
redshiftSettings_fileTransferUploadStreams :: Lens' RedshiftSettings (Maybe Int)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.DMS.Types.RedshiftSettings.RedshiftSettings
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.DMS.Types.RedshiftSettings.RedshiftSettings
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.DMS.Types.RedshiftSettings.RedshiftSettings
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.DMS.Types.RedshiftSettings.RedshiftSettings
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.DMS.Types.RedshiftSettings.RedshiftSettings
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.DMS.Types.RedshiftSettings.RedshiftSettings
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.DMS.Types.RedshiftSettings.RedshiftSettings

module Network.AWS.DMS.Types.RefreshSchemasStatus

-- | Provides information that describes status of a schema at an endpoint
--   specified by the <tt>DescribeRefreshSchemaStatus</tt> operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRefreshSchemasStatus</a> smart constructor.
data RefreshSchemasStatus
RefreshSchemasStatus' :: Maybe RefreshSchemasStatusTypeValue -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> RefreshSchemasStatus

-- | The status of the schema.
[$sel:status:RefreshSchemasStatus'] :: RefreshSchemasStatus -> Maybe RefreshSchemasStatusTypeValue

-- | The date the schema was last refreshed.
[$sel:lastRefreshDate:RefreshSchemasStatus'] :: RefreshSchemasStatus -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the replication instance.
[$sel:replicationInstanceArn:RefreshSchemasStatus'] :: RefreshSchemasStatus -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) string that uniquely identifies the
--   endpoint.
[$sel:endpointArn:RefreshSchemasStatus'] :: RefreshSchemasStatus -> Maybe Text

-- | The last failure message for the schema.
[$sel:lastFailureMessage:RefreshSchemasStatus'] :: RefreshSchemasStatus -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>RefreshSchemasStatus</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:RefreshSchemasStatus'</a>,
--   <a>refreshSchemasStatus_status</a> - The status of the schema.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastRefreshDate:RefreshSchemasStatus'</a>,
--   <a>refreshSchemasStatus_lastRefreshDate</a> - The date the schema was
--   last refreshed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:replicationInstanceArn:RefreshSchemasStatus'</a>,
--   <a>refreshSchemasStatus_replicationInstanceArn</a> - The Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN) of the replication instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endpointArn:RefreshSchemasStatus'</a>,
--   <a>refreshSchemasStatus_endpointArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name
--   (ARN) string that uniquely identifies the endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastFailureMessage:RefreshSchemasStatus'</a>,
--   <a>refreshSchemasStatus_lastFailureMessage</a> - The last failure
--   message for the schema.
newRefreshSchemasStatus :: RefreshSchemasStatus

-- | The status of the schema.
refreshSchemasStatus_status :: Lens' RefreshSchemasStatus (Maybe RefreshSchemasStatusTypeValue)

-- | The date the schema was last refreshed.
refreshSchemasStatus_lastRefreshDate :: Lens' RefreshSchemasStatus (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the replication instance.
refreshSchemasStatus_replicationInstanceArn :: Lens' RefreshSchemasStatus (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) string that uniquely identifies the
--   endpoint.
refreshSchemasStatus_endpointArn :: Lens' RefreshSchemasStatus (Maybe Text)

-- | The last failure message for the schema.
refreshSchemasStatus_lastFailureMessage :: Lens' RefreshSchemasStatus (Maybe Text)

module Network.AWS.DMS.Types.OrderableReplicationInstance

-- | In response to the <tt>DescribeOrderableReplicationInstances</tt>
--   operation, this object describes an available replication instance.
--   This description includes the replication instance's type, engine
--   version, and allocated storage.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newOrderableReplicationInstance</a> smart constructor.
data OrderableReplicationInstance
OrderableReplicationInstance' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe ReleaseStatusValues -> Maybe Int -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> OrderableReplicationInstance

-- | The version of the replication engine.
[$sel:engineVersion:OrderableReplicationInstance'] :: OrderableReplicationInstance -> Maybe Text

-- | The minimum amount of storage (in gigabytes) that can be allocated for
--   the replication instance.
[$sel:minAllocatedStorage:OrderableReplicationInstance'] :: OrderableReplicationInstance -> Maybe Int

-- | The value returned when the specified <tt>EngineVersion</tt> of the
--   replication instance is in Beta or test mode. This indicates some
--   features might not work as expected.
--   
--   DMS supports the <tt>ReleaseStatus</tt> parameter in versions 3.1.4
--   and later.
[$sel:releaseStatus:OrderableReplicationInstance'] :: OrderableReplicationInstance -> Maybe ReleaseStatusValues

-- | The amount of storage (in gigabytes) that is allocated for the
--   replication instance.
[$sel:includedAllocatedStorage:OrderableReplicationInstance'] :: OrderableReplicationInstance -> Maybe Int

-- | List of Availability Zones for this replication instance.
[$sel:availabilityZones:OrderableReplicationInstance'] :: OrderableReplicationInstance -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The minimum amount of storage (in gigabytes) that can be allocated for
--   the replication instance.
[$sel:maxAllocatedStorage:OrderableReplicationInstance'] :: OrderableReplicationInstance -> Maybe Int

-- | The compute and memory capacity of the replication instance as defined
--   for the specified replication instance class. For example to specify
--   the instance class dms.c4.large, set this parameter to
--   <tt>"dms.c4.large"</tt>.
--   
--   For more information on the settings and capacities for the available
--   replication instance classes, see <a>Selecting the right DMS
--   replication instance for your migration</a>.
[$sel:replicationInstanceClass:OrderableReplicationInstance'] :: OrderableReplicationInstance -> Maybe Text

-- | The default amount of storage (in gigabytes) that is allocated for the
--   replication instance.
[$sel:defaultAllocatedStorage:OrderableReplicationInstance'] :: OrderableReplicationInstance -> Maybe Int

-- | The type of storage used by the replication instance.
[$sel:storageType:OrderableReplicationInstance'] :: OrderableReplicationInstance -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>OrderableReplicationInstance</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:engineVersion:OrderableReplicationInstance'</a>,
--   <a>orderableReplicationInstance_engineVersion</a> - The version of the
--   replication engine.
--   
--   <a>$sel:minAllocatedStorage:OrderableReplicationInstance'</a>,
--   <a>orderableReplicationInstance_minAllocatedStorage</a> - The minimum
--   amount of storage (in gigabytes) that can be allocated for the
--   replication instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:releaseStatus:OrderableReplicationInstance'</a>,
--   <a>orderableReplicationInstance_releaseStatus</a> - The value returned
--   when the specified <tt>EngineVersion</tt> of the replication instance
--   is in Beta or test mode. This indicates some features might not work
--   as expected.
--   
--   DMS supports the <tt>ReleaseStatus</tt> parameter in versions 3.1.4
--   and later.
--   
--   <a>$sel:includedAllocatedStorage:OrderableReplicationInstance'</a>,
--   <a>orderableReplicationInstance_includedAllocatedStorage</a> - The
--   amount of storage (in gigabytes) that is allocated for the replication
--   instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:availabilityZones:OrderableReplicationInstance'</a>,
--   <a>orderableReplicationInstance_availabilityZones</a> - List of
--   Availability Zones for this replication instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxAllocatedStorage:OrderableReplicationInstance'</a>,
--   <a>orderableReplicationInstance_maxAllocatedStorage</a> - The minimum
--   amount of storage (in gigabytes) that can be allocated for the
--   replication instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:replicationInstanceClass:OrderableReplicationInstance'</a>,
--   <a>orderableReplicationInstance_replicationInstanceClass</a> - The
--   compute and memory capacity of the replication instance as defined for
--   the specified replication instance class. For example to specify the
--   instance class dms.c4.large, set this parameter to
--   <tt>"dms.c4.large"</tt>.
--   
--   For more information on the settings and capacities for the available
--   replication instance classes, see <a>Selecting the right DMS
--   replication instance for your migration</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultAllocatedStorage:OrderableReplicationInstance'</a>,
--   <a>orderableReplicationInstance_defaultAllocatedStorage</a> - The
--   default amount of storage (in gigabytes) that is allocated for the
--   replication instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:storageType:OrderableReplicationInstance'</a>,
--   <a>orderableReplicationInstance_storageType</a> - The type of storage
--   used by the replication instance.
newOrderableReplicationInstance :: OrderableReplicationInstance

-- | The version of the replication engine.
orderableReplicationInstance_engineVersion :: Lens' OrderableReplicationInstance (Maybe Text)

-- | The minimum amount of storage (in gigabytes) that can be allocated for
--   the replication instance.
orderableReplicationInstance_minAllocatedStorage :: Lens' OrderableReplicationInstance (Maybe Int)

-- | The value returned when the specified <tt>EngineVersion</tt> of the
--   replication instance is in Beta or test mode. This indicates some
--   features might not work as expected.
--   
--   DMS supports the <tt>ReleaseStatus</tt> parameter in versions 3.1.4
--   and later.
orderableReplicationInstance_releaseStatus :: Lens' OrderableReplicationInstance (Maybe ReleaseStatusValues)

-- | The amount of storage (in gigabytes) that is allocated for the
--   replication instance.
orderableReplicationInstance_includedAllocatedStorage :: Lens' OrderableReplicationInstance (Maybe Int)

-- | List of Availability Zones for this replication instance.
orderableReplicationInstance_availabilityZones :: Lens' OrderableReplicationInstance (Maybe [Text])

-- | The minimum amount of storage (in gigabytes) that can be allocated for
--   the replication instance.
orderableReplicationInstance_maxAllocatedStorage :: Lens' OrderableReplicationInstance (Maybe Int)

-- | The compute and memory capacity of the replication instance as defined
--   for the specified replication instance class. For example to specify
--   the instance class dms.c4.large, set this parameter to
--   <tt>"dms.c4.large"</tt>.
--   
--   For more information on the settings and capacities for the available
--   replication instance classes, see <a>Selecting the right DMS
--   replication instance for your migration</a>.
orderableReplicationInstance_replicationInstanceClass :: Lens' OrderableReplicationInstance (Maybe Text)

-- | The default amount of storage (in gigabytes) that is allocated for the
--   replication instance.
orderableReplicationInstance_defaultAllocatedStorage :: Lens' OrderableReplicationInstance (Maybe Int)

-- | The type of storage used by the replication instance.
orderableReplicationInstance_storageType :: Lens' OrderableReplicationInstance (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.DMS.Types.OrderableReplicationInstance.OrderableReplicationInstance
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.DMS.Types.OrderableReplicationInstance.OrderableReplicationInstance
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.DMS.Types.OrderableReplicationInstance.OrderableReplicationInstance
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.DMS.Types.OrderableReplicationInstance.OrderableReplicationInstance

module Network.AWS.DMS.Types.ReplicationInstanceTaskLog

-- | Contains metadata for a replication instance task log.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newReplicationInstanceTaskLog</a> smart constructor.
data ReplicationInstanceTaskLog
ReplicationInstanceTaskLog' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Integer -> ReplicationInstanceTaskLog

-- | The name of the replication task.
[$sel:replicationTaskName:ReplicationInstanceTaskLog'] :: ReplicationInstanceTaskLog -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the replication task.

--   fields omitted.

--   the replication task.
--   
--   <a>$sel:replicationTaskArn:ReplicationInstanceTaskLog'</a>,
--   <a>replicationInstanceTaskLog_replicationTaskArn</a> - The Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN) of the replication task.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:replicationInstanceTaskLogSize:ReplicationInstanceTaskLog'</a>,
--   <a>replicationInstanceTaskLog_replicationInstanceTaskLogSize</a> - The
--   size, in bytes, of the replication task log.
newReplicationInstanceTaskLog :: ReplicationInstanceTaskLog

-- | The name of the replication task.
replicationInstanceTaskLog_replicationTaskName :: Lens' ReplicationInstanceTaskLog (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the replication task.

module Network.AWS.DMS.Types.ReplicationPendingModifiedValues

-- | Provides information about the values of pending modifications to a
--   replication instance. This data type is an object of the
--   <a>ReplicationInstance</a> user-defined data type.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newReplicationPendingModifiedValues</a> smart
--   constructor.
data ReplicationPendingModifiedValues
ReplicationPendingModifiedValues' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> ReplicationPendingModifiedValues

-- | The engine version number of the replication instance.
[$sel:engineVersion:ReplicationPendingModifiedValues'] :: ReplicationPendingModifiedValues -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies whether the replication instance is a Multi-AZ deployment.
--   You can't set the <tt>AvailabilityZone</tt> parameter if the Multi-AZ
--   parameter is set to <tt>true</tt>.
[$sel:multiAZ:ReplicationPendingModifiedValues'] :: ReplicationPendingModifiedValues -> Maybe Bool

-- | The amount of storage (in gigabytes) that is allocated for the
--   replication instance.
[$sel:allocatedStorage:ReplicationPendingModifiedValues'] :: ReplicationPendingModifiedValues -> Maybe Int

-- | The compute and memory capacity of the replication instance as defined
--   for the specified replication instance class.
--   
--   For more information on the settings and capacities for the available
--   replication instance classes, see <a>Selecting the right DMS
--   replication instance for your migration</a>.
[$sel:replicationInstanceClass:ReplicationPendingModifiedValues'] :: ReplicationPendingModifiedValues -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ReplicationPendingModifiedValues</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   version number of the replication instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:multiAZ:ReplicationPendingModifiedValues'</a>,
--   <a>replicationPendingModifiedValues_multiAZ</a> - Specifies whether
--   the replication instance is a Multi-AZ deployment. You can't set the
--   <tt>AvailabilityZone</tt> parameter if the Multi-AZ parameter is set
--   to <tt>true</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:allocatedStorage:ReplicationPendingModifiedValues'</a>,
--   <a>replicationPendingModifiedValues_allocatedStorage</a> - The amount
--   of storage (in gigabytes) that is allocated for the replication
--   instance.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:replicationInstanceClass:ReplicationPendingModifiedValues'</a>,
--   <a>replicationPendingModifiedValues_replicationInstanceClass</a> - The
--   compute and memory capacity of the replication instance as defined for

module Network.AWS.DMS.Types.ReplicationTaskAssessmentRun

-- | Provides information that describes a premigration assessment run that
--   you have started using the <tt>StartReplicationTaskAssessmentRun</tt>
--   operation.
--   
--   Some of the information appears based on other operations that can
--   return the <tt>ReplicationTaskAssessmentRun</tt> object.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newReplicationTaskAssessmentRun</a> smart constructor.
data ReplicationTaskAssessmentRun
ReplicationTaskAssessmentRun' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe ReplicationTaskAssessmentRunProgress -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> ReplicationTaskAssessmentRun

-- | Assessment run status.
--   
--   This status can have one of the following values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>"cancelling"</tt> â€“ The assessment run was canceled by the
--   <tt>CancelReplicationTaskAssessmentRun</tt> operation.</li>
--   <li><tt>"deleting"</tt> â€“ The assessment run was deleted by the
--   <tt>DeleteReplicationTaskAssessmentRun</tt> operation.</li>
--   <li><tt>"failed"</tt> â€“ At least one individual assessment completed
--   with a <tt>failed</tt> status.</li>
--   <li><tt>"error-provisioning"</tt> â€“ An internal error occurred while
--   resources were provisioned (during <tt>provisioning</tt> status).</li>
--   <li><tt>"error-executing"</tt> â€“ An internal error occurred while
--   individual assessments ran (during <tt>running</tt> status).</li>
--   <li><tt>"invalid state"</tt> â€“ The assessment run is in an unknown
--   state.</li>
--   <li><tt>"passed"</tt> â€“ All individual assessments have completed, and
--   none has a <tt>failed</tt> status.</li>
--   <li><tt>"provisioning"</tt> â€“ Resources required to run individual
--   assessments are being provisioned.</li>
--   <li><tt>"running"</tt> â€“ Individual assessments are being run.</li>
--   <li><tt>"starting"</tt> â€“ The assessment run is starting, but
--   resources are not yet being provisioned for individual
--   assessments.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:status:ReplicationTaskAssessmentRun'] :: ReplicationTaskAssessmentRun -> Maybe Text

-- | ARN of the service role used to start the assessment run using the
--   <tt>StartReplicationTaskAssessmentRun</tt> operation. The role must
--   allow the <tt>iam:PassRole</tt> action.
[$sel:serviceAccessRoleArn:ReplicationTaskAssessmentRun'] :: ReplicationTaskAssessmentRun -> Maybe Text

-- | Date on which the assessment run was created using the
--   <tt>StartReplicationTaskAssessmentRun</tt> operation.
[$sel:replicationTaskAssessmentRunCreationDate:ReplicationTaskAssessmentRun'] :: ReplicationTaskAssessmentRun -> Maybe POSIX

-- | Indication of the completion progress for the individual assessments
--   specified to run.
[$sel:assessmentProgress:ReplicationTaskAssessmentRun'] :: ReplicationTaskAssessmentRun -> Maybe ReplicationTaskAssessmentRunProgress

-- | ARN of the KMS encryption key used to encrypt the assessment run
--   results.
[$sel:resultKmsKeyArn:ReplicationTaskAssessmentRun'] :: ReplicationTaskAssessmentRun -> Maybe Text

-- | ARN of the migration task associated with this premigration assessment
--   run.
[$sel:replicationTaskArn:ReplicationTaskAssessmentRun'] :: ReplicationTaskAssessmentRun -> Maybe Text

-- | Amazon S3 bucket where DMS stores the results of this assessment run.
[$sel:resultLocationBucket:ReplicationTaskAssessmentRun'] :: ReplicationTaskAssessmentRun -> Maybe Text

-- | Folder in an Amazon S3 bucket where DMS stores the results of this
--   assessment run.
[$sel:resultLocationFolder:ReplicationTaskAssessmentRun'] :: ReplicationTaskAssessmentRun -> Maybe Text

-- | Encryption mode used to encrypt the assessment run results.
[$sel:resultEncryptionMode:ReplicationTaskAssessmentRun'] :: ReplicationTaskAssessmentRun -> Maybe Text

-- | Unique name of the assessment run.
[$sel:assessmentRunName:ReplicationTaskAssessmentRun'] :: ReplicationTaskAssessmentRun -> Maybe Text

-- | Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of this assessment run.
[$sel:replicationTaskAssessmentRunArn:ReplicationTaskAssessmentRun'] :: ReplicationTaskAssessmentRun -> Maybe Text

-- | Last message generated by an individual assessment failure.
[$sel:lastFailureMessage:ReplicationTaskAssessmentRun'] :: ReplicationTaskAssessmentRun -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ReplicationTaskAssessmentRun</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:ReplicationTaskAssessmentRun'</a>,
--   <a>replicationTaskAssessmentRun_status</a> - Assessment run status.
--   
--   This status can have one of the following values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>"cancelling"</tt> â€“ The assessment run was canceled by the
--   <tt>CancelReplicationTaskAssessmentRun</tt> operation.</li>
--   <li><tt>"deleting"</tt> â€“ The assessment run was deleted by the
--   <tt>DeleteReplicationTaskAssessmentRun</tt> operation.</li>
--   <li><tt>"failed"</tt> â€“ At least one individual assessment completed
--   with a <tt>failed</tt> status.</li>
--   <li><tt>"error-provisioning"</tt> â€“ An internal error occurred while
--   resources were provisioned (during <tt>provisioning</tt> status).</li>
--   <li><tt>"error-executing"</tt> â€“ An internal error occurred while
--   individual assessments ran (during <tt>running</tt> status).</li>
--   <li><tt>"invalid state"</tt> â€“ The assessment run is in an unknown
--   state.</li>
--   <li><tt>"passed"</tt> â€“ All individual assessments have completed, and
--   none has a <tt>failed</tt> status.</li>
--   <li><tt>"provisioning"</tt> â€“ Resources required to run individual
--   assessments are being provisioned.</li>
--   <li><tt>"running"</tt> â€“ Individual assessments are being run.</li>
--   <li><tt>"starting"</tt> â€“ The assessment run is starting, but
--   resources are not yet being provisioned for individual
--   assessments.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:serviceAccessRoleArn:ReplicationTaskAssessmentRun'</a>,
--   <a>replicationTaskAssessmentRun_serviceAccessRoleArn</a> - ARN of the

--   <tt>StartReplicationTaskAssessmentRun</tt> operation. The role must
--   allow the <tt>iam:PassRole</tt> action.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:replicationTaskAssessmentRunCreationDate:ReplicationTaskAssessmentRun'</a>,
--   <a>replicationTaskAssessmentRun_replicationTaskAssessmentRunCreationDate</a>
--   - Date on which the assessment run was created using the
--   <tt>StartReplicationTaskAssessmentRun</tt> operation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:assessmentProgress:ReplicationTaskAssessmentRun'</a>,

--   the completion progress for the individual assessments specified to
--   run.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resultKmsKeyArn:ReplicationTaskAssessmentRun'</a>,
--   <a>replicationTaskAssessmentRun_resultKmsKeyArn</a> - ARN of the KMS
--   encryption key used to encrypt the assessment run results.
--   
--   <a>$sel:replicationTaskArn:ReplicationTaskAssessmentRun'</a>,
--   <a>replicationTaskAssessmentRun_replicationTaskArn</a> - ARN of the
--   migration task associated with this premigration assessment run.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resultLocationBucket:ReplicationTaskAssessmentRun'</a>,
--   <a>replicationTaskAssessmentRun_resultLocationBucket</a> - Amazon S3
--   bucket where DMS stores the results of this assessment run.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resultLocationFolder:ReplicationTaskAssessmentRun'</a>,
--   <a>replicationTaskAssessmentRun_resultLocationFolder</a> - Folder in
--   an Amazon S3 bucket where DMS stores the results of this assessment
--   run.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resultEncryptionMode:ReplicationTaskAssessmentRun'</a>,
--   <a>replicationTaskAssessmentRun_resultEncryptionMode</a> - Encryption
--   mode used to encrypt the assessment run results.
--   
--   <a>$sel:assessmentRunName:ReplicationTaskAssessmentRun'</a>,
--   <a>replicationTaskAssessmentRun_assessmentRunName</a> - Unique name of
--   the assessment run.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:replicationTaskAssessmentRunArn:ReplicationTaskAssessmentRun'</a>,
--   <a>replicationTaskAssessmentRun_replicationTaskAssessmentRunArn</a> -
--   Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of this assessment run.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastFailureMessage:ReplicationTaskAssessmentRun'</a>,
--   <a>replicationTaskAssessmentRun_lastFailureMessage</a> - Last message
--   generated by an individual assessment failure.
newReplicationTaskAssessmentRun :: ReplicationTaskAssessmentRun

-- | Assessment run status.
--   
--   This status can have one of the following values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>"cancelling"</tt> â€“ The assessment run was canceled by the
--   <tt>CancelReplicationTaskAssessmentRun</tt> operation.</li>
--   <li><tt>"deleting"</tt> â€“ The assessment run was deleted by the
--   <tt>DeleteReplicationTaskAssessmentRun</tt> operation.</li>

--   individual assessments ran (during <tt>running</tt> status).</li>
--   <li><tt>"invalid state"</tt> â€“ The assessment run is in an unknown
--   state.</li>
--   <li><tt>"passed"</tt> â€“ All individual assessments have completed, and
--   none has a <tt>failed</tt> status.</li>
--   <li><tt>"provisioning"</tt> â€“ Resources required to run individual
--   assessments are being provisioned.</li>
--   <li><tt>"running"</tt> â€“ Individual assessments are being run.</li>
--   <li><tt>"starting"</tt> â€“ The assessment run is starting, but
--   resources are not yet being provisioned for individual
--   assessments.</li>
--   </ul>
replicationTaskAssessmentRun_status :: Lens' ReplicationTaskAssessmentRun (Maybe Text)

-- | ARN of the service role used to start the assessment run using the
--   <tt>StartReplicationTaskAssessmentRun</tt> operation. The role must

--   <tt>StartReplicationTaskAssessmentRun</tt> operation.

-- | ARN of the migration task associated with this premigration assessment
--   run.
replicationTaskAssessmentRun_replicationTaskArn :: Lens' ReplicationTaskAssessmentRun (Maybe Text)

-- | Amazon S3 bucket where DMS stores the results of this assessment run.
replicationTaskAssessmentRun_resultLocationBucket :: Lens' ReplicationTaskAssessmentRun (Maybe Text)

-- | Folder in an Amazon S3 bucket where DMS stores the results of this
--   assessment run.
replicationTaskAssessmentRun_resultLocationFolder :: Lens' ReplicationTaskAssessmentRun (Maybe Text)

-- | Encryption mode used to encrypt the assessment run results.
replicationTaskAssessmentRun_resultEncryptionMode :: Lens' ReplicationTaskAssessmentRun (Maybe Text)

-- | Unique name of the assessment run.
replicationTaskAssessmentRun_assessmentRunName :: Lens' ReplicationTaskAssessmentRun (Maybe Text)

-- | Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of this assessment run.
replicationTaskAssessmentRun_replicationTaskAssessmentRunArn :: Lens' ReplicationTaskAssessmentRun (Maybe Text)

-- | Last message generated by an individual assessment failure.
replicationTaskAssessmentRun_lastFailureMessage :: Lens' ReplicationTaskAssessmentRun (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.DMS.Types.ReplicationTaskAssessmentRun.ReplicationTaskAssessmentRun
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.DMS.Types.ReplicationTaskAssessmentRun.ReplicationTaskAssessmentRun
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.DMS.Types.ReplicationTaskAssessmentRun.ReplicationTaskAssessmentRun
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.DMS.Types.ReplicationTaskAssessmentRun.ReplicationTaskAssessmentRun
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.DMS.Types.ReplicationTaskAssessmentRun.ReplicationTaskAssessmentRun
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.DMS.Types.ReplicationTaskAssessmentRun.ReplicationTaskAssessmentRun
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.DMS.Types.ReplicationTaskAssessmentRun.ReplicationTaskAssessmentRun


module Network.AWS.DMS.Types.ReplicationTaskIndividualAssessment

-- | Provides information that describes an individual assessment from a
--   premigration assessment run.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newReplicationTaskIndividualAssessment</a> smart
--   constructor.
data ReplicationTaskIndividualAssessment
ReplicationTaskIndividualAssessment' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> ReplicationTaskIndividualAssessment
