--   
--   This status can have one of the following values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>"cancelled"</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>"error"</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>"failed"</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>"passed"</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>"pending"</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>"running"</pre></li>
--   </ul>

[$sel:replicationTaskIndividualAssessmentArn:ReplicationTaskIndividualAssessment'] :: ReplicationTaskIndividualAssessment -> Maybe Text

-- | ARN of the premigration assessment run that is created to run this
--   individual assessment.

module Network.AWS.DMS.Types.ReplicationTaskStats

-- | In response to a request by the <tt>DescribeReplicationTasks</tt>
--   operation, this object provides a collection of statistics about a
--   replication task.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newReplicationTaskStats</a> smart constructor.
data ReplicationTaskStats
ReplicationTaskStats' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Int -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Int -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe POSIX -> ReplicationTaskStats

-- | The date the replication task was stopped.
[$sel:stopDate:ReplicationTaskStats'] :: ReplicationTaskStats -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The percent complete for the full load migration task.
[$sel:fullLoadProgressPercent:ReplicationTaskStats'] :: ReplicationTaskStats -> Maybe Int

-- | The date the replication task full load was started.
[$sel:fullLoadStartDate:ReplicationTaskStats'] :: ReplicationTaskStats -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The elapsed time of the task, in milliseconds.
[$sel:elapsedTimeMillis:ReplicationTaskStats'] :: ReplicationTaskStats -> Maybe Integer

-- | The date the replication task was started either with a fresh start or
--   a resume. For more information, see <a>StartReplicationTaskType</a>.
[$sel:startDate:ReplicationTaskStats'] :: ReplicationTaskStats -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The number of errors that have occurred during this task.
[$sel:tablesErrored:ReplicationTaskStats'] :: ReplicationTaskStats -> Maybe Int

-- | The date the replication task full load was completed.
[$sel:fullLoadFinishDate:ReplicationTaskStats'] :: ReplicationTaskStats -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The number of tables loaded for this task.
[$sel:tablesLoaded:ReplicationTaskStats'] :: ReplicationTaskStats -> Maybe Int

-- | The number of tables queued for this task.
[$sel:tablesQueued:ReplicationTaskStats'] :: ReplicationTaskStats -> Maybe Int

-- | The number of tables currently loading for this task.
[$sel:tablesLoading:ReplicationTaskStats'] :: ReplicationTaskStats -> Maybe Int

-- | The date the replication task was started either with a fresh start or
--   a target reload.
[$sel:freshStartDate:ReplicationTaskStats'] :: ReplicationTaskStats -> Maybe POSIX

-- | Create a value of <a>ReplicationTaskStats</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:stopDate:ReplicationTaskStats'</a>,
--   <a>replicationTaskStats_stopDate</a> - The date the replication task
--   was stopped.
--   
--   <a>$sel:fullLoadProgressPercent:ReplicationTaskStats'</a>,
--   <a>replicationTaskStats_fullLoadProgressPercent</a> - The percent
--   complete for the full load migration task.
--   
--   <a>$sel:fullLoadStartDate:ReplicationTaskStats'</a>,
--   <a>replicationTaskStats_fullLoadStartDate</a> - The date the
--   replication task full load was started.
--   
--   <a>$sel:elapsedTimeMillis:ReplicationTaskStats'</a>,
--   <a>replicationTaskStats_elapsedTimeMillis</a> - The elapsed time of
--   the task, in milliseconds.
--   
--   <a>$sel:startDate:ReplicationTaskStats'</a>,
--   <a>replicationTaskStats_startDate</a> - The date the replication task
--   was started either with a fresh start or a resume. For more
--   information, see <a>StartReplicationTaskType</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tablesErrored:ReplicationTaskStats'</a>,
--   <a>replicationTaskStats_tablesErrored</a> - The number of errors that
--   have occurred during this task.
--   
--   <a>$sel:fullLoadFinishDate:ReplicationTaskStats'</a>,
--   <a>replicationTaskStats_fullLoadFinishDate</a> - The date the
--   replication task full load was completed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tablesLoaded:ReplicationTaskStats'</a>,
--   <a>replicationTaskStats_tablesLoaded</a> - The number of tables loaded
--   for this task.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tablesQueued:ReplicationTaskStats'</a>,
--   <a>replicationTaskStats_tablesQueued</a> - The number of tables queued
--   for this task.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tablesLoading:ReplicationTaskStats'</a>,
--   <a>replicationTaskStats_tablesLoading</a> - The number of tables
--   currently loading for this task.
--   
--   <a>$sel:freshStartDate:ReplicationTaskStats'</a>,
--   <a>replicationTaskStats_freshStartDate</a> - The date the replication
--   task was started either with a fresh start or a target reload.
newReplicationTaskStats :: ReplicationTaskStats

-- | The date the replication task was stopped.
replicationTaskStats_stopDate :: Lens' ReplicationTaskStats (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The percent complete for the full load migration task.

replicationTaskStats_fullLoadStartDate :: Lens' ReplicationTaskStats (Maybe UTCTime)

replicationTaskStats_elapsedTimeMillis :: Lens' ReplicationTaskStats (Maybe Integer)

--   a resume. For more information, see <a>StartReplicationTaskType</a>.
replicationTaskStats_startDate :: Lens' ReplicationTaskStats (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The number of errors that have occurred during this task.
replicationTaskStats_tablesErrored :: Lens' ReplicationTaskStats (Maybe Int)

-- | The date the replication task full load was completed.
replicationTaskStats_fullLoadFinishDate :: Lens' ReplicationTaskStats (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The number of tables loaded for this task.
replicationTaskStats_tablesLoaded :: Lens' ReplicationTaskStats (Maybe Int)

-- | The number of tables queued for this task.
replicationTaskStats_tablesQueued :: Lens' ReplicationTaskStats (Maybe Int)

-- | The number of tables currently loading for this task.
replicationTaskStats_tablesLoading :: Lens' ReplicationTaskStats (Maybe Int)

--   a target reload.

module Network.AWS.DMS.Types.ReplicationTask

-- | Provides information that describes a replication task created by the
--   <tt>CreateReplicationTask</tt> operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newReplicationTask</a> smart constructor.
data ReplicationTask
ReplicationTask' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe MigrationTypeValue -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ReplicationTaskStats -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> ReplicationTask

-- | The settings for the replication task.
[$sel:replicationTaskSettings:ReplicationTask'] :: ReplicationTask -> Maybe Text

-- | The status of the replication task. This response parameter can return
--   one of the following values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>"moving"</tt> â€“ The task is being moved in response to running
--   the <a>MoveReplicationTask</a> operation.</li>
--   <li><tt>"creating"</tt> â€“ The task is being created in response to
--   running the <a>CreateReplicationTask</a> operation.</li>
--   <li><tt>"deleting"</tt> â€“ The task is being deleted in response to
--   running the <a>DeleteReplicationTask</a> operation.</li>
--   <li><tt>"failed"</tt> â€“ The task failed to successfully complete the
--   database migration in response to running the
--   <a>StartReplicationTask</a> operation.</li>
--   <li><tt>"failed-move"</tt> â€“ The task failed to move in response to
--   running the <a>MoveReplicationTask</a> operation.</li>
--   <li><tt>"modifying"</tt> â€“ The task definition is being modified in
--   response to running the <a>ModifyReplicationTask</a> operation.</li>
--   <li><tt>"ready"</tt> â€“ The task is in a <tt>ready</tt> state where it
--   can respond to other task operations, such as
--   <a>StartReplicationTask</a> or <a>DeleteReplicationTask</a> .</li>
--   <li><tt>"running"</tt> â€“ The task is performing a database migration
--   in response to running the <a>StartReplicationTask</a> operation.</li>
--   <li><tt>"starting"</tt> â€“ The task is preparing to perform a database
--   migration in response to running the <a>StartReplicationTask</a>
--   operation.</li>
--   <li><tt>"stopped"</tt> â€“ The task has stopped in response to running
--   the <a>StopReplicationTask</a> operation.</li>
--   <li><tt>"stopping"</tt> â€“ The task is preparing to stop in response to
--   running the <a>StopReplicationTask</a> operation.</li>
--   <li><tt>"testing"</tt> â€“ The database migration specified for this
--   task is being tested in response to running either the
--   <a>StartReplicationTaskAssessmentRun</a> or the
--   <a>StartReplicationTaskAssessment</a>
--   operation.<a>StartReplicationTaskAssessmentRun</a> is an improved
--   premigration task assessment operation. The
--   <a>StartReplicationTaskAssessment</a> operation assesses data type
--   compatibility only between the source and target database of a given
--   migration task. In contrast, <a>StartReplicationTaskAssessmentRun</a>
--   enables you to specify a variety of premigration task assessments in
--   addition to data type compatibility. These assessments include ones
--   for the validity of primary key definitions and likely issues with
--   database migration performance, among others.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:status:ReplicationTask'] :: ReplicationTask -> Maybe Text

-- | The reason the replication task was stopped. This response parameter
--   can return one of the following values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>"STOP_REASON_FULL_LOAD_COMPLETED"</tt> â€“ Full-load migration
--   completed.</li>
--   <li><tt>"STOP_REASON_CACHED_CHANGES_APPLIED"</tt> â€“ Change data
--   capture (CDC) load completed.</li>
--   <li><tt>"STOP_REASON_CACHED_CHANGES_NOT_APPLIED"</tt> â€“ In a full-load
--   and CDC migration, the full load stopped as specified before starting
--   the CDC migration.</li>
--   <li><tt>"STOP_REASON_SERVER_TIME"</tt> â€“ The migration stopped at the
--   specified server time.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:stopReason:ReplicationTask'] :: ReplicationTask -> Maybe Text

-- | The ARN that uniquely identifies the endpoint.
[$sel:targetEndpointArn:ReplicationTask'] :: ReplicationTask -> Maybe Text

-- | The user-assigned replication task identifier or name.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Must contain 1-255 alphanumeric characters or hyphens.</li>
--   <li>First character must be a letter.</li>
--   <li>Cannot end with a hyphen or contain two consecutive hyphens.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:replicationTaskIdentifier:ReplicationTask'] :: ReplicationTask -> Maybe Text

-- | Indicates when you want a change data capture (CDC) operation to
--   start. Use either <tt>CdcStartPosition</tt> or <tt>CdcStartTime</tt>
--   to specify when you want the CDC operation to start. Specifying both
--   values results in an error.
--   
--   The value can be in date, checkpoint, or LSN/SCN format.
--   
--   Date Example: --cdc-start-position â€œ2018-03-08T12:12:12â€
--   
--   Checkpoint Example: --cdc-start-position
--   "checkpoint:V1mysql-bin-changelog.157832:1975:-1:2002:677883278264080:mysql-bin-changelog.157832:187600#93"
--   
--   LSN Example: --cdc-start-position â€œmysql-bin-changelog.000024:373â€
[$sel:cdcStartPosition:ReplicationTask'] :: ReplicationTask -> Maybe Text

-- | The date the replication task is scheduled to start.
[$sel:replicationTaskStartDate:ReplicationTask'] :: ReplicationTask -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies the endpoint.
[$sel:sourceEndpointArn:ReplicationTask'] :: ReplicationTask -> Maybe Text

-- | Indicates the last checkpoint that occurred during a change data
--   capture (CDC) operation. You can provide this value to the
--   <tt>CdcStartPosition</tt> parameter to start a CDC operation that
--   begins at that checkpoint.
[$sel:recoveryCheckpoint:ReplicationTask'] :: ReplicationTask -> Maybe Text

-- | Table mappings specified in the task.
[$sel:tableMappings:ReplicationTask'] :: ReplicationTask -> Maybe Text

-- | The ARN of the replication instance to which this task is moved in
--   response to running the <a>MoveReplicationTask</a> operation.
--   Otherwise, this response parameter isn't a member of the
--   <tt>ReplicationTask</tt> object.
[$sel:targetReplicationInstanceArn:ReplicationTask'] :: ReplicationTask -> Maybe Text

-- | The date the replication task was created.
[$sel:replicationTaskCreationDate:ReplicationTask'] :: ReplicationTask -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The type of migration.
[$sel:migrationType:ReplicationTask'] :: ReplicationTask -> Maybe MigrationTypeValue

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the replication task.
[$sel:replicationTaskArn:ReplicationTask'] :: ReplicationTask -> Maybe Text

-- | Supplemental information that the task requires to migrate the data
--   for certain source and target endpoints. For more information, see
--   <a>Specifying Supplemental Data for Task Settings</a> in the
--   <i>Database Migration Service User Guide.</i>
[$sel:taskData:ReplicationTask'] :: ReplicationTask -> Maybe Text

-- | Indicates when you want a change data capture (CDC) operation to stop.
--   The value can be either server time or commit time.
--   
--   Server time example: --cdc-stop-position
--   â€œserver_time:2018-02-09T12:12:12â€
--   
--   Commit time example: --cdc-stop-position â€œcommit_time:
--   2018-02-09T12:12:12 â€œ
[$sel:cdcStopPosition:ReplicationTask'] :: ReplicationTask -> Maybe Text

-- | The statistics for the task, including elapsed time, tables loaded,
--   and table errors.
[$sel:replicationTaskStats:ReplicationTask'] :: ReplicationTask -> Maybe ReplicationTaskStats

-- | The ARN of the replication instance.
[$sel:replicationInstanceArn:ReplicationTask'] :: ReplicationTask -> Maybe Text

-- | The last error (failure) message generated for the replication task.
[$sel:lastFailureMessage:ReplicationTask'] :: ReplicationTask -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ReplicationTask</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:replicationTaskSettings:ReplicationTask'</a>,
--   <a>replicationTask_replicationTaskSettings</a> - The settings for the
--   replication task.
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:ReplicationTask'</a>, <a>replicationTask_status</a> -
--   The status of the replication task. This response parameter can return
--   one of the following values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>"moving"</tt> â€“ The task is being moved in response to running
--   the <a>MoveReplicationTask</a> operation.</li>
--   <li><tt>"creating"</tt> â€“ The task is being created in response to
--   running the <a>CreateReplicationTask</a> operation.</li>
--   <li><tt>"deleting"</tt> â€“ The task is being deleted in response to
--   running the <a>DeleteReplicationTask</a> operation.</li>
--   <li><tt>"failed"</tt> â€“ The task failed to successfully complete the
--   database migration in response to running the
--   <a>StartReplicationTask</a> operation.</li>
--   <li><tt>"failed-move"</tt> â€“ The task failed to move in response to
--   running the <a>MoveReplicationTask</a> operation.</li>
--   <li><tt>"modifying"</tt> â€“ The task definition is being modified in
--   response to running the <a>ModifyReplicationTask</a> operation.</li>
--   <li><tt>"ready"</tt> â€“ The task is in a <tt>ready</tt> state where it
--   can respond to other task operations, such as
--   <a>StartReplicationTask</a> or <a>DeleteReplicationTask</a> .</li>
--   <li><tt>"running"</tt> â€“ The task is performing a database migration
--   in response to running the <a>StartReplicationTask</a> operation.</li>
--   <li><tt>"starting"</tt> â€“ The task is preparing to perform a database
--   migration in response to running the <a>StartReplicationTask</a>
--   operation.</li>
--   <li><tt>"stopped"</tt> â€“ The task has stopped in response to running
--   the <a>StopReplicationTask</a> operation.</li>
--   <li><tt>"stopping"</tt> â€“ The task is preparing to stop in response to
--   running the <a>StopReplicationTask</a> operation.</li>
--   <li><tt>"testing"</tt> â€“ The database migration specified for this
--   task is being tested in response to running either the
--   <a>StartReplicationTaskAssessmentRun</a> or the
--   <a>StartReplicationTaskAssessment</a>
--   operation.<a>StartReplicationTaskAssessmentRun</a> is an improved
--   premigration task assessment operation. The
--   <a>StartReplicationTaskAssessment</a> operation assesses data type
--   compatibility only between the source and target database of a given
--   migration task. In contrast, <a>StartReplicationTaskAssessmentRun</a>
--   enables you to specify a variety of premigration task assessments in
--   addition to data type compatibility. These assessments include ones
--   for the validity of primary key definitions and likely issues with
--   database migration performance, among others.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:stopReason:ReplicationTask'</a>,
--   <a>replicationTask_stopReason</a> - The reason the replication task
--   was stopped. This response parameter can return one of the following
--   values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>"STOP_REASON_FULL_LOAD_COMPLETED"</tt> â€“ Full-load migration
--   completed.</li>
--   <li><tt>"STOP_REASON_CACHED_CHANGES_APPLIED"</tt> â€“ Change data
--   capture (CDC) load completed.</li>
--   <li><tt>"STOP_REASON_CACHED_CHANGES_NOT_APPLIED"</tt> â€“ In a full-load
--   and CDC migration, the full load stopped as specified before starting
--   the CDC migration.</li>
--   <li><tt>"STOP_REASON_SERVER_TIME"</tt> â€“ The migration stopped at the
--   specified server time.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:targetEndpointArn:ReplicationTask'</a>,
--   <a>replicationTask_targetEndpointArn</a> - The ARN that uniquely
--   identifies the endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:replicationTaskIdentifier:ReplicationTask'</a>,
--   <a>replicationTask_replicationTaskIdentifier</a> - The user-assigned
--   replication task identifier or name.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Must contain 1-255 alphanumeric characters or hyphens.</li>
--   <li>First character must be a letter.</li>
--   <li>Cannot end with a hyphen or contain two consecutive hyphens.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:cdcStartPosition:ReplicationTask'</a>,
--   <a>replicationTask_cdcStartPosition</a> - Indicates when you want a
--   change data capture (CDC) operation to start. Use either
--   <tt>CdcStartPosition</tt> or <tt>CdcStartTime</tt> to specify when you
--   want the CDC operation to start. Specifying both values results in an
--   error.
--   
--   The value can be in date, checkpoint, or LSN/SCN format.
--   
--   Date Example: --cdc-start-position â€œ2018-03-08T12:12:12â€
--   
--   Checkpoint Example: --cdc-start-position
--   "checkpoint:V1mysql-bin-changelog.157832:1975:-1:2002:677883278264080:mysql-bin-changelog.157832:187600#93"
--   
--   LSN Example: --cdc-start-position â€œmysql-bin-changelog.000024:373â€
--   
--   <a>$sel:replicationTaskStartDate:ReplicationTask'</a>,
--   <a>replicationTask_replicationTaskStartDate</a> - The date the
--   replication task is scheduled to start.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sourceEndpointArn:ReplicationTask'</a>,
--   <a>replicationTask_sourceEndpointArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name
--   (ARN) that uniquely identifies the endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:recoveryCheckpoint:ReplicationTask'</a>,
--   <a>replicationTask_recoveryCheckpoint</a> - Indicates the last
--   checkpoint that occurred during a change data capture (CDC) operation.
--   You can provide this value to the <tt>CdcStartPosition</tt> parameter
--   to start a CDC operation that begins at that checkpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tableMappings:ReplicationTask'</a>,
--   <a>replicationTask_tableMappings</a> - Table mappings specified in the
--   task.
--   
--   <a>$sel:targetReplicationInstanceArn:ReplicationTask'</a>,
--   <a>replicationTask_targetReplicationInstanceArn</a> - The ARN of the
--   replication instance to which this task is moved in response to
--   running the <a>MoveReplicationTask</a> operation. Otherwise, this
--   response parameter isn't a member of the <tt>ReplicationTask</tt>
--   object.
--   
--   <a>$sel:replicationTaskCreationDate:ReplicationTask'</a>,
--   <a>replicationTask_replicationTaskCreationDate</a> - The date the
--   replication task was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:migrationType:ReplicationTask'</a>,
--   <a>replicationTask_migrationType</a> - The type of migration.
--   
--   <a>$sel:replicationTaskArn:ReplicationTask'</a>,
--   <a>replicationTask_replicationTaskArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name
--   (ARN) of the replication task.
--   
--   <a>$sel:taskData:ReplicationTask'</a>, <a>replicationTask_taskData</a>
--   - Supplemental information that the task requires to migrate the data
--   for certain source and target endpoints. For more information, see
--   <a>Specifying Supplemental Data for Task Settings</a> in the
--   <i>Database Migration Service User Guide.</i>
--   
--   <a>$sel:cdcStopPosition:ReplicationTask'</a>,
--   <a>replicationTask_cdcStopPosition</a> - Indicates when you want a
--   change data capture (CDC) operation to stop. The value can be either
--   server time or commit time.
--   
--   Server time example: --cdc-stop-position
--   â€œserver_time:2018-02-09T12:12:12â€
--   
--   Commit time example: --cdc-stop-position â€œcommit_time:
--   2018-02-09T12:12:12 â€œ
--   
--   <a>$sel:replicationTaskStats:ReplicationTask'</a>,
--   <a>replicationTask_replicationTaskStats</a> - The statistics for the
--   task, including elapsed time, tables loaded, and table errors.
--   
--   <a>$sel:replicationInstanceArn:ReplicationTask'</a>,
--   <a>replicationTask_replicationInstanceArn</a> - The ARN of the
--   replication instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastFailureMessage:ReplicationTask'</a>,
--   <a>replicationTask_lastFailureMessage</a> - The last error (failure)
--   message generated for the replication task.
newReplicationTask :: ReplicationTask

-- | The settings for the replication task.
replicationTask_replicationTaskSettings :: Lens' ReplicationTask (Maybe Text)

-- | The status of the replication task. This response parameter can return
--   one of the following values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>"moving"</tt> â€“ The task is being moved in response to running
--   the <a>MoveReplicationTask</a> operation.</li>
--   <li><tt>"creating"</tt> â€“ The task is being created in response to
--   running the <a>CreateReplicationTask</a> operation.</li>
--   <li><tt>"deleting"</tt> â€“ The task is being deleted in response to
--   running the <a>DeleteReplicationTask</a> operation.</li>
--   <li><tt>"failed"</tt> â€“ The task failed to successfully complete the
--   database migration in response to running the
--   <a>StartReplicationTask</a> operation.</li>
--   <li><tt>"failed-move"</tt> â€“ The task failed to move in response to
--   running the <a>MoveReplicationTask</a> operation.</li>
--   <li><tt>"modifying"</tt> â€“ The task definition is being modified in
--   response to running the <a>ModifyReplicationTask</a> operation.</li>
--   <li><tt>"ready"</tt> â€“ The task is in a <tt>ready</tt> state where it
--   can respond to other task operations, such as
--   <a>StartReplicationTask</a> or <a>DeleteReplicationTask</a> .</li>
--   <li><tt>"running"</tt> â€“ The task is performing a database migration
--   in response to running the <a>StartReplicationTask</a> operation.</li>
--   <li><tt>"starting"</tt> â€“ The task is preparing to perform a database
--   migration in response to running the <a>StartReplicationTask</a>
--   operation.</li>
--   <li><tt>"stopped"</tt> â€“ The task has stopped in response to running
--   the <a>StopReplicationTask</a> operation.</li>
--   <li><tt>"stopping"</tt> â€“ The task is preparing to stop in response to
--   running the <a>StopReplicationTask</a> operation.</li>
--   <li><tt>"testing"</tt> â€“ The database migration specified for this
--   task is being tested in response to running either the
--   <a>StartReplicationTaskAssessmentRun</a> or the
--   <a>StartReplicationTaskAssessment</a>
--   operation.<a>StartReplicationTaskAssessmentRun</a> is an improved
--   premigration task assessment operation. The
--   <a>StartReplicationTaskAssessment</a> operation assesses data type
--   compatibility only between the source and target database of a given
--   migration task. In contrast, <a>StartReplicationTaskAssessmentRun</a>
--   enables you to specify a variety of premigration task assessments in
--   addition to data type compatibility. These assessments include ones
--   for the validity of primary key definitions and likely issues with
--   database migration performance, among others.</li>
--   </ul>
replicationTask_status :: Lens' ReplicationTask (Maybe Text)

-- | The reason the replication task was stopped. This response parameter
--   can return one of the following values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>"STOP_REASON_FULL_LOAD_COMPLETED"</tt> â€“ Full-load migration
--   completed.</li>
--   <li><tt>"STOP_REASON_CACHED_CHANGES_APPLIED"</tt> â€“ Change data
--   capture (CDC) load completed.</li>
--   <li><tt>"STOP_REASON_CACHED_CHANGES_NOT_APPLIED"</tt> â€“ In a full-load
--   and CDC migration, the full load stopped as specified before starting
--   the CDC migration.</li>
--   <li><tt>"STOP_REASON_SERVER_TIME"</tt> â€“ The migration stopped at the
--   specified server time.</li>
--   </ul>
replicationTask_stopReason :: Lens' ReplicationTask (Maybe Text)

-- | The ARN that uniquely identifies the endpoint.
replicationTask_targetEndpointArn :: Lens' ReplicationTask (Maybe Text)

-- | The user-assigned replication task identifier or name.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Must contain 1-255 alphanumeric characters or hyphens.</li>
--   <li>First character must be a letter.</li>
--   <li>Cannot end with a hyphen or contain two consecutive hyphens.</li>
--   </ul>
replicationTask_replicationTaskIdentifier :: Lens' ReplicationTask (Maybe Text)

-- | Indicates when you want a change data capture (CDC) operation to
--   start. Use either <tt>CdcStartPosition</tt> or <tt>CdcStartTime</tt>
--   to specify when you want the CDC operation to start. Specifying both
--   values results in an error.
--   
--   The value can be in date, checkpoint, or LSN/SCN format.
--   
--   Date Example: --cdc-start-position â€œ2018-03-08T12:12:12â€
--   
--   Checkpoint Example: --cdc-start-position
--   "checkpoint:V1mysql-bin-changelog.157832:1975:-1:2002:677883278264080:mysql-bin-changelog.157832:187600#93"
--   
--   LSN Example: --cdc-start-position â€œmysql-bin-changelog.000024:373â€
replicationTask_cdcStartPosition :: Lens' ReplicationTask (Maybe Text)

-- | The date the replication task is scheduled to start.
replicationTask_replicationTaskStartDate :: Lens' ReplicationTask (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies the endpoint.
replicationTask_sourceEndpointArn :: Lens' ReplicationTask (Maybe Text)

-- | Indicates the last checkpoint that occurred during a change data
--   capture (CDC) operation. You can provide this value to the
--   <tt>CdcStartPosition</tt> parameter to start a CDC operation that
--   begins at that checkpoint.
replicationTask_recoveryCheckpoint :: Lens' ReplicationTask (Maybe Text)

-- | Table mappings specified in the task.
replicationTask_tableMappings :: Lens' ReplicationTask (Maybe Text)

-- | The ARN of the replication instance to which this task is moved in
--   response to running the <a>MoveReplicationTask</a> operation.
--   Otherwise, this response parameter isn't a member of the
--   <tt>ReplicationTask</tt> object.
replicationTask_targetReplicationInstanceArn :: Lens' ReplicationTask (Maybe Text)

-- | The date the replication task was created.
replicationTask_replicationTaskCreationDate :: Lens' ReplicationTask (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The type of migration.
replicationTask_migrationType :: Lens' ReplicationTask (Maybe MigrationTypeValue)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the replication task.
replicationTask_replicationTaskArn :: Lens' ReplicationTask (Maybe Text)

-- | Supplemental information that the task requires to migrate the data
--   for certain source and target endpoints. For more information, see
--   <a>Specifying Supplemental Data for Task Settings</a> in the
--   <i>Database Migration Service User Guide.</i>
replicationTask_taskData :: Lens' ReplicationTask (Maybe Text)

-- | Indicates when you want a change data capture (CDC) operation to stop.
--   The value can be either server time or commit time.
--   
--   Server time example: --cdc-stop-position
--   â€œserver_time:2018-02-09T12:12:12â€
--   
--   Commit time example: --cdc-stop-position â€œcommit_time:
--   2018-02-09T12:12:12 â€œ
replicationTask_cdcStopPosition :: Lens' ReplicationTask (Maybe Text)

-- | The statistics for the task, including elapsed time, tables loaded,
--   and table errors.
replicationTask_replicationTaskStats :: Lens' ReplicationTask (Maybe ReplicationTaskStats)

-- | The ARN of the replication instance.
replicationTask_replicationInstanceArn :: Lens' ReplicationTask (Maybe Text)

-- | The last error (failure) message generated for the replication task.
replicationTask_lastFailureMessage :: Lens' ReplicationTask (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.DMS.Types.ReplicationTask.ReplicationTask
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.DMS.Types.ReplicationTask.ReplicationTask
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.DMS.Types.ReplicationTask.ReplicationTask
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.DMS.Types.ReplicationTask.ReplicationTask
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.DMS.Types.ReplicationTask.ReplicationTask
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.DMS.Types.ReplicationTask.ReplicationTask
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.DMS.Types.ReplicationTask.ReplicationTask


module Network.AWS.DMS.Types.ResourcePendingMaintenanceActions

-- | Identifies an DMS resource and any pending actions for it.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newResourcePendingMaintenanceActions</a> smart
--   constructor.
data ResourcePendingMaintenanceActions
ResourcePendingMaintenanceActions' :: Maybe [PendingMaintenanceAction] -> Maybe Text -> ResourcePendingMaintenanceActions

-- | Detailed information about the pending maintenance action.
[$sel:pendingMaintenanceActionDetails:ResourcePendingMaintenanceActions'] :: ResourcePendingMaintenanceActions -> Maybe [PendingMaintenanceAction]

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the DMS resource that the pending
--   maintenance action applies to. For information about creating an ARN,
--   see <a>Constructing an Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for DMS</a> in the
--   DMS documentation.
[$sel:resourceIdentifier:ResourcePendingMaintenanceActions'] :: ResourcePendingMaintenanceActions -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ResourcePendingMaintenanceActions</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:pendingMaintenanceActionDetails:ResourcePendingMaintenanceActions'</a>,
--   <a>resourcePendingMaintenanceActions_pendingMaintenanceActionDetails</a>
--   - Detailed information about the pending maintenance action.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceIdentifier:ResourcePendingMaintenanceActions'</a>,
--   <a>resourcePendingMaintenanceActions_resourceIdentifier</a> - The
--   Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the DMS resource that the pending
--   maintenance action applies to. For information about creating an ARN,
--   see <a>Constructing an Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for DMS</a> in the
--   DMS documentation.
newResourcePendingMaintenanceActions :: ResourcePendingMaintenanceActions

-- | Detailed information about the pending maintenance action.
resourcePendingMaintenanceActions_pendingMaintenanceActionDetails :: Lens' ResourcePendingMaintenanceActions (Maybe [PendingMaintenanceAction])

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the DMS resource that the pending
--   maintenance action applies to. For information about creating an ARN,
--   see <a>Constructing an Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for DMS</a> in the
--   DMS documentation.
resourcePendingMaintenanceActions_resourceIdentifier :: Lens' ResourcePendingMaintenanceActions (Maybe Text)
