module Network.AWS.DMS.Types.MicrosoftSQLServerSettings

-- | Provides information that defines a Microsoft SQL Server endpoint.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMicrosoftSQLServerSettings</a> smart constructor.
data MicrosoftSQLServerSettings
MicrosoftSQLServerSettings' :: Maybe Int -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe SafeguardPolicy -> Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> MicrosoftSQLServerSettings

-- | The maximum size of the packets (in bytes) used to transfer data using
--   BCP.
[$sel:bcpPacketSize:MicrosoftSQLServerSettings'] :: MicrosoftSQLServerSettings -> Maybe Int

-- | Use this to attribute to transfer data for full-load operations using
--   BCP. When the target table contains an identity column that does not
--   exist in the source table, you must disable the use BCP for loading
--   table option.
[$sel:useBcpFullLoad:MicrosoftSQLServerSettings'] :: MicrosoftSQLServerSettings -> Maybe Bool

-- | Fully qualified domain name of the endpoint.
[$sel:serverName:MicrosoftSQLServerSettings'] :: MicrosoftSQLServerSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | Cleans and recreates table metadata information on the replication
--   instance when a mismatch occurs. An example is a situation where
--   running an alter DDL statement on a table might result in different
--   information about the table cached in the replication instance.
[$sel:querySingleAlwaysOnNode:MicrosoftSQLServerSettings'] :: MicrosoftSQLServerSettings -> Maybe Bool

-- | The full Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role that specifies DMS
--   as the trusted entity and grants the required permissions to access
--   the value in <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt>. The role must allow the
--   <tt>iam:PassRole</tt> action. <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> has the
--   value of the Amazon Web Services Secrets Manager secret that allows
--   access to the SQL Server endpoint.
--   
--   You can specify one of two sets of values for these permissions. You
--   can specify the values for this setting and
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecretId</tt>. Or you can specify clear-text values
--   for <tt>UserName</tt>, <tt>Password</tt>, <tt>ServerName</tt>, and
--   <tt>Port</tt>. You can't specify both. For more information on
--   creating this <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> and the
--   <tt>SecretsManagerAccessRoleArn</tt> and
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecretId</tt> required to access it, see <a>Using
--   secrets to access Database Migration Service resources</a> in the
--   <i>Database Migration Service User Guide</i>.
[$sel:secretsManagerAccessRoleArn:MicrosoftSQLServerSettings'] :: MicrosoftSQLServerSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | Endpoint connection user name.
[$sel:username:MicrosoftSQLServerSettings'] :: MicrosoftSQLServerSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | Use this attribute to minimize the need to access the backup log and
--   enable DMS to prevent truncation using one of the following two
--   methods.
--   
--   <i>Start transactions in the database:</i> This is the default method.
--   When this method is used, DMS prevents TLOG truncation by mimicking a
--   transaction in the database. As long as such a transaction is open,
--   changes that appear after the transaction started aren't truncated. If
--   you need Microsoft Replication to be enabled in your database, then
--   you must choose this method.
--   
--   <i>Exclusively use sp_repldone within a single task</i>: When this
--   method is used, DMS reads the changes and then uses sp_repldone to
--   mark the TLOG transactions as ready for truncation. Although this
--   method doesn't involve any transactional activities, it can only be
--   used when Microsoft Replication isn't running. Also, when using this
--   method, only one DMS task can access the database at any given time.
--   Therefore, if you need to run parallel DMS tasks against the same
--   database, use the default method.
[$sel:safeguardPolicy:MicrosoftSQLServerSettings'] :: MicrosoftSQLServerSettings -> Maybe SafeguardPolicy

-- | Endpoint connection password.
[$sel:password:MicrosoftSQLServerSettings'] :: MicrosoftSQLServerSettings -> Maybe (Sensitive Text)

-- | Database name for the endpoint.
[$sel:databaseName:MicrosoftSQLServerSettings'] :: MicrosoftSQLServerSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | The full ARN, partial ARN, or friendly name of the
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> that contains the SQL Server endpoint
--   connection details.
[$sel:secretsManagerSecretId:MicrosoftSQLServerSettings'] :: MicrosoftSQLServerSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | When this attribute is set to <tt>Y</tt>, DMS only reads changes from
--   transaction log backups and doesn't read from the active transaction
--   log file during ongoing replication. Setting this parameter to
--   <tt>Y</tt> enables you to control active transaction log file growth
--   during full load and ongoing replication tasks. However, it can add
--   some source latency to ongoing replication.
[$sel:readBackupOnly:MicrosoftSQLServerSettings'] :: MicrosoftSQLServerSettings -> Maybe Bool

-- | When this attribute is set to <tt>Y</tt>, DMS processes third-party
--   transaction log backups if they are created in native format.
[$sel:useThirdPartyBackupDevice:MicrosoftSQLServerSettings'] :: MicrosoftSQLServerSettings -> Maybe Bool

-- | Specifies a file group for the DMS internal tables. When the
--   replication task starts, all the internal DMS control tables (awsdms_
--   apply_exception, awsdms_apply, awsdms_changes) are created for the
--   specified file group.
[$sel:controlTablesFileGroup:MicrosoftSQLServerSettings'] :: MicrosoftSQLServerSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | Endpoint TCP port.
[$sel:port:MicrosoftSQLServerSettings'] :: MicrosoftSQLServerSettings -> Maybe Int

-- | Create a value of <a>MicrosoftSQLServerSettings</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:bcpPacketSize:MicrosoftSQLServerSettings'</a>,
--   <a>microsoftSQLServerSettings_bcpPacketSize</a> - The maximum size of
--   the packets (in bytes) used to transfer data using BCP.
--   
--   <a>$sel:useBcpFullLoad:MicrosoftSQLServerSettings'</a>,
--   <a>microsoftSQLServerSettings_useBcpFullLoad</a> - Use this to
--   attribute to transfer data for full-load operations using BCP. When
--   the target table contains an identity column that does not exist in
--   the source table, you must disable the use BCP for loading table
--   option.
--   
--   <a>$sel:serverName:MicrosoftSQLServerSettings'</a>,
--   <a>microsoftSQLServerSettings_serverName</a> - Fully qualified domain
--   name of the endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:querySingleAlwaysOnNode:MicrosoftSQLServerSettings'</a>,
--   <a>microsoftSQLServerSettings_querySingleAlwaysOnNode</a> - Cleans and
--   recreates table metadata information on the replication instance when
--   a mismatch occurs. An example is a situation where running an alter
--   DDL statement on a table might result in different information about
--   the table cached in the replication instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:secretsManagerAccessRoleArn:MicrosoftSQLServerSettings'</a>,
--   <a>microsoftSQLServerSettings_secretsManagerAccessRoleArn</a> - The
--   full Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role that specifies DMS as
--   the trusted entity and grants the required permissions to access the
--   value in <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt>. The role must allow the
--   <tt>iam:PassRole</tt> action. <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> has the
--   value of the Amazon Web Services Secrets Manager secret that allows
--   access to the SQL Server endpoint.
--   
--   You can specify one of two sets of values for these permissions. You
--   can specify the values for this setting and
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecretId</tt>. Or you can specify clear-text values
--   for <tt>UserName</tt>, <tt>Password</tt>, <tt>ServerName</tt>, and
--   <tt>Port</tt>. You can't specify both. For more information on
--   creating this <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> and the
--   <tt>SecretsManagerAccessRoleArn</tt> and
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecretId</tt> required to access it, see <a>Using
--   secrets to access Database Migration Service resources</a> in the
--   <i>Database Migration Service User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:username:MicrosoftSQLServerSettings'</a>,
--   <a>microsoftSQLServerSettings_username</a> - Endpoint connection user
--   name.
--   
--   <a>$sel:safeguardPolicy:MicrosoftSQLServerSettings'</a>,
--   <a>microsoftSQLServerSettings_safeguardPolicy</a> - Use this attribute
--   to minimize the need to access the backup log and enable DMS to
--   prevent truncation using one of the following two methods.
--   
--   <i>Start transactions in the database:</i> This is the default method.
--   When this method is used, DMS prevents TLOG truncation by mimicking a
--   transaction in the database. As long as such a transaction is open,
--   changes that appear after the transaction started aren't truncated. If
--   you need Microsoft Replication to be enabled in your database, then
--   you must choose this method.
--   
--   <i>Exclusively use sp_repldone within a single task</i>: When this
--   method is used, DMS reads the changes and then uses sp_repldone to
--   mark the TLOG transactions as ready for truncation. Although this
--   method doesn't involve any transactional activities, it can only be
--   used when Microsoft Replication isn't running. Also, when using this
--   method, only one DMS task can access the database at any given time.
--   Therefore, if you need to run parallel DMS tasks against the same
--   database, use the default method.
--   
--   <a>$sel:password:MicrosoftSQLServerSettings'</a>,
--   <a>microsoftSQLServerSettings_password</a> - Endpoint connection
--   password.
--   
--   <a>$sel:databaseName:MicrosoftSQLServerSettings'</a>,
--   <a>microsoftSQLServerSettings_databaseName</a> - Database name for the
--   endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:secretsManagerSecretId:MicrosoftSQLServerSettings'</a>,
--   <a>microsoftSQLServerSettings_secretsManagerSecretId</a> - The full
--   ARN, partial ARN, or friendly name of the
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> that contains the SQL Server endpoint
--   connection details.
--   
--   <a>$sel:readBackupOnly:MicrosoftSQLServerSettings'</a>,
--   <a>microsoftSQLServerSettings_readBackupOnly</a> - When this attribute
--   is set to <tt>Y</tt>, DMS only reads changes from transaction log
--   backups and doesn't read from the active transaction log file during
--   ongoing replication. Setting this parameter to <tt>Y</tt> enables you
--   to control active transaction log file growth during full load and
--   ongoing replication tasks. However, it can add some source latency to
--   ongoing replication.
--   
--   <a>$sel:useThirdPartyBackupDevice:MicrosoftSQLServerSettings'</a>,
--   <a>microsoftSQLServerSettings_useThirdPartyBackupDevice</a> - When
--   this attribute is set to <tt>Y</tt>, DMS processes third-party
--   transaction log backups if they are created in native format.
--   
--   <a>$sel:controlTablesFileGroup:MicrosoftSQLServerSettings'</a>,
--   <a>microsoftSQLServerSettings_controlTablesFileGroup</a> - Specifies a
--   file group for the DMS internal tables. When the replication task
--   starts, all the internal DMS control tables (awsdms_ apply_exception,
--   awsdms_apply, awsdms_changes) are created for the specified file
--   group.
--   
--   <a>$sel:port:MicrosoftSQLServerSettings'</a>,
--   <a>microsoftSQLServerSettings_port</a> - Endpoint TCP port.
newMicrosoftSQLServerSettings :: MicrosoftSQLServerSettings

-- | The maximum size of the packets (in bytes) used to transfer data using
--   BCP.
microsoftSQLServerSettings_bcpPacketSize :: Lens' MicrosoftSQLServerSettings (Maybe Int)

-- | Use this to attribute to transfer data for full-load operations using
--   BCP. When the target table contains an identity column that does not
--   exist in the source table, you must disable the use BCP for loading
--   table option.
microsoftSQLServerSettings_useBcpFullLoad :: Lens' MicrosoftSQLServerSettings (Maybe Bool)

-- | Fully qualified domain name of the endpoint.
microsoftSQLServerSettings_serverName :: Lens' MicrosoftSQLServerSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | Cleans and recreates table metadata information on the replication
--   instance when a mismatch occurs. An example is a situation where
--   running an alter DDL statement on a table might result in different
--   information about the table cached in the replication instance.
microsoftSQLServerSettings_querySingleAlwaysOnNode :: Lens' MicrosoftSQLServerSettings (Maybe Bool)

-- | The full Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role that specifies DMS
--   as the trusted entity and grants the required permissions to access
--   the value in <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt>. The role must allow the
--   <tt>iam:PassRole</tt> action. <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> has the
--   value of the Amazon Web Services Secrets Manager secret that allows
--   access to the SQL Server endpoint.
--   
--   You can specify one of two sets of values for these permissions. You
--   can specify the values for this setting and
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecretId</tt>. Or you can specify clear-text values
--   for <tt>UserName</tt>, <tt>Password</tt>, <tt>ServerName</tt>, and
--   <tt>Port</tt>. You can't specify both. For more information on
--   creating this <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> and the
--   <tt>SecretsManagerAccessRoleArn</tt> and
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecretId</tt> required to access it, see <a>Using
--   secrets to access Database Migration Service resources</a> in the
--   <i>Database Migration Service User Guide</i>.
microsoftSQLServerSettings_secretsManagerAccessRoleArn :: Lens' MicrosoftSQLServerSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | Endpoint connection user name.
microsoftSQLServerSettings_username :: Lens' MicrosoftSQLServerSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | Use this attribute to minimize the need to access the backup log and
--   enable DMS to prevent truncation using one of the following two
--   methods.
--   
--   <i>Start transactions in the database:</i> This is the default method.
--   When this method is used, DMS prevents TLOG truncation by mimicking a
--   transaction in the database. As long as such a transaction is open,
--   changes that appear after the transaction started aren't truncated. If
--   you need Microsoft Replication to be enabled in your database, then
--   you must choose this method.
--   
--   <i>Exclusively use sp_repldone within a single task</i>: When this
--   method is used, DMS reads the changes and then uses sp_repldone to
--   mark the TLOG transactions as ready for truncation. Although this
--   method doesn't involve any transactional activities, it can only be
--   used when Microsoft Replication isn't running. Also, when using this
--   method, only one DMS task can access the database at any given time.
--   Therefore, if you need to run parallel DMS tasks against the same
--   database, use the default method.
microsoftSQLServerSettings_safeguardPolicy :: Lens' MicrosoftSQLServerSettings (Maybe SafeguardPolicy)

-- | Endpoint connection password.
microsoftSQLServerSettings_password :: Lens' MicrosoftSQLServerSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | Database name for the endpoint.
microsoftSQLServerSettings_databaseName :: Lens' MicrosoftSQLServerSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | The full ARN, partial ARN, or friendly name of the
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> that contains the SQL Server endpoint
--   connection details.
microsoftSQLServerSettings_secretsManagerSecretId :: Lens' MicrosoftSQLServerSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | When this attribute is set to <tt>Y</tt>, DMS only reads changes from
--   transaction log backups and doesn't read from the active transaction
--   log file during ongoing replication. Setting this parameter to
--   <tt>Y</tt> enables you to control active transaction log file growth
--   during full load and ongoing replication tasks. However, it can add
--   some source latency to ongoing replication.
microsoftSQLServerSettings_readBackupOnly :: Lens' MicrosoftSQLServerSettings (Maybe Bool)

-- | When this attribute is set to <tt>Y</tt>, DMS processes third-party
--   transaction log backups if they are created in native format.
microsoftSQLServerSettings_useThirdPartyBackupDevice :: Lens' MicrosoftSQLServerSettings (Maybe Bool)

-- | Specifies a file group for the DMS internal tables. When the
--   replication task starts, all the internal DMS control tables (awsdms_
--   apply_exception, awsdms_apply, awsdms_changes) are created for the
--   specified file group.
microsoftSQLServerSettings_controlTablesFileGroup :: Lens' MicrosoftSQLServerSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | Endpoint TCP port.
microsoftSQLServerSettings_port :: Lens' MicrosoftSQLServerSettings (Maybe Int)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.DMS.Types.MicrosoftSQLServerSettings.MicrosoftSQLServerSettings

instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.DMS.Types.SourceType.SourceType
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.DMS.Types.SourceType.SourceType


module Network.AWS.DMS.Types.Event

-- | Describes an identifiable significant activity that affects a
--   replication instance or task. This object can provide the message, the
--   available event categories, the date and source of the event, and the
--   DMS resource type.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEvent</a> smart constructor.
data Event
Event' :: Maybe SourceType -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> Event

-- | The type of DMS resource that generates events.
--   
--   Valid values: replication-instance | endpoint | replication-task
[$sel:sourceType:Event'] :: Event -> Maybe SourceType

-- | The identifier of an event source.
[$sel:sourceIdentifier:Event'] :: Event -> Maybe Text

-- | The date of the event.
[$sel:date:Event'] :: Event -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The event categories available for the specified source type.
[$sel:eventCategories:Event'] :: Event -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The event message.
[$sel:message:Event'] :: Event -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Event</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:sourceType:Event'</a>, <a>event_sourceType</a> - The type of
--   DMS resource that generates events.
--   
--   Valid values: replication-instance | endpoint | replication-task
--   
--   <a>$sel:sourceIdentifier:Event'</a>, <a>event_sourceIdentifier</a> -
--   The identifier of an event source.
--   
--   <a>$sel:date:Event'</a>, <a>event_date</a> - The date of the event.
--   
--   <a>$sel:eventCategories:Event'</a>, <a>event_eventCategories</a> - The
--   event categories available for the specified source type.
--   
--   <a>$sel:message:Event'</a>, <a>event_message</a> - The event message.
newEvent :: Event

-- | The type of DMS resource that generates events.
--   
--   Valid values: replication-instance | endpoint | replication-task
event_sourceType :: Lens' Event (Maybe SourceType)

-- | The identifier of an event source.
event_sourceIdentifier :: Lens' Event (Maybe Text)

-- | The date of the event.
event_date :: Lens' Event (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The event categories available for the specified source type.
event_eventCategories :: Lens' Event (Maybe [Text])

-- | The event message.
event_message :: Lens' Event (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.DMS.Types.Event.Event
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.DMS.Types.Event.Event
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.DMS.Types.Event.Event
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.DMS.Types.Event.Event
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.DMS.Types.Event.Event
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.DMS.Types.Event.Event
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.DMS.Types.Event.Event


module Network.AWS.DMS.Types.SslSecurityProtocolValue

SslSecurityProtocolValue' :: Text -> SslSecurityProtocolValue
[fromSslSecurityProtocolValue] :: SslSecurityProtocolValue -> Text
pattern SslSecurityProtocolValue_Plaintext :: SslSecurityProtocolValue
pattern SslSecurityProtocolValue_Ssl_encryption :: SslSecurityProtocolValue

module Network.AWS.DMS.Types.RedisSettings

-- | Provides information that defines a Redis target endpoint.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRedisSettings</a> smart constructor.
data RedisSettings
RedisSettings' :: Maybe SslSecurityProtocolValue -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> Maybe RedisAuthTypeValue -> Text -> Int -> RedisSettings

-- | The connection to a Redis target endpoint using Transport Layer
--   Security (TLS). Valid values include <tt>plaintext</tt> and
--   <tt>ssl-encryption</tt>. The default is <tt>ssl-encryption</tt>. The
--   <tt>ssl-encryption</tt> option makes an encrypted connection.
--   Optionally, you can identify an Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for an SSL
--   certificate authority (CA) using the <tt>SslCaCertificateArn
--   </tt>setting. If an ARN isn't given for a CA, DMS uses the Amazon root
--   CA.
--   
--   The <tt>plaintext</tt> option doesn't provide Transport Layer Security
--   (TLS) encryption for traffic between endpoint and database.
[$sel:sslSecurityProtocol:RedisSettings'] :: RedisSettings -> Maybe SslSecurityProtocolValue

-- | The user name provided with the <tt>auth-role</tt> option of the
--   <tt>AuthType</tt> setting for a Redis target endpoint.
[$sel:authUserName:RedisSettings'] :: RedisSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the certificate authority (CA) that
--   DMS uses to connect to your Redis target endpoint.
[$sel:sslCaCertificateArn:RedisSettings'] :: RedisSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | The password provided with the <tt>auth-role</tt> and
--   <tt>auth-token</tt> options of the <tt>AuthType</tt> setting for a
--   Redis target endpoint.
[$sel:authPassword:RedisSettings'] :: RedisSettings -> Maybe (Sensitive Text)

-- | The type of authentication to perform when connecting to a Redis
--   target. Options include <tt>none</tt>, <tt>auth-token</tt>, and
--   <tt>auth-role</tt>. The <tt>auth-token</tt> option requires an
--   <tt>AuthPassword</tt> value to be provided. The <tt>auth-role</tt>
--   option requires <tt>AuthUserName</tt> and <tt>AuthPassword</tt> values
--   to be provided.
[$sel:authType:RedisSettings'] :: RedisSettings -> Maybe RedisAuthTypeValue

-- | Fully qualified domain name of the endpoint.
[$sel:serverName:RedisSettings'] :: RedisSettings -> Text

-- | Transmission Control Protocol (TCP) port for the endpoint.
[$sel:port:RedisSettings'] :: RedisSettings -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>RedisSettings</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:sslSecurityProtocol:RedisSettings'</a>,
--   <a>redisSettings_sslSecurityProtocol</a> - The connection to a Redis
--   target endpoint using Transport Layer Security (TLS). Valid values
--   include <tt>plaintext</tt> and <tt>ssl-encryption</tt>. The default is
--   <tt>ssl-encryption</tt>. The <tt>ssl-encryption</tt> option makes an
--   encrypted connection. Optionally, you can identify an Amazon Resource
--   Name (ARN) for an SSL certificate authority (CA) using the
--   <tt>SslCaCertificateArn </tt>setting. If an ARN isn't given for a CA,
--   DMS uses the Amazon root CA.
--   
--   The <tt>plaintext</tt> option doesn't provide Transport Layer Security
--   (TLS) encryption for traffic between endpoint and database.
--   
--   <a>$sel:authUserName:RedisSettings'</a>,
--   <a>redisSettings_authUserName</a> - The user name provided with the
--   <tt>auth-role</tt> option of the <tt>AuthType</tt> setting for a Redis
--   target endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sslCaCertificateArn:RedisSettings'</a>,
--   <a>redisSettings_sslCaCertificateArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name
--   (ARN) for the certificate authority (CA) that DMS uses to connect to
--   your Redis target endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:authPassword:RedisSettings'</a>,
--   <a>redisSettings_authPassword</a> - The password provided with the
--   <tt>auth-role</tt> and <tt>auth-token</tt> options of the
--   <tt>AuthType</tt> setting for a Redis target endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:authType:RedisSettings'</a>, <a>redisSettings_authType</a> -
--   The type of authentication to perform when connecting to a Redis
--   target. Options include <tt>none</tt>, <tt>auth-token</tt>, and
--   <tt>auth-role</tt>. The <tt>auth-token</tt> option requires an
--   <tt>AuthPassword</tt> value to be provided. The <tt>auth-role</tt>
--   option requires <tt>AuthUserName</tt> and <tt>AuthPassword</tt> values
--   to be provided.
--   
--   <a>$sel:serverName:RedisSettings'</a>, <a>redisSettings_serverName</a>
--   - Fully qualified domain name of the endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:port:RedisSettings'</a>, <a>redisSettings_port</a> -
--   Transmission Control Protocol (TCP) port for the endpoint.
newRedisSettings :: Text -> Int -> RedisSettings

-- | The connection to a Redis target endpoint using Transport Layer
--   Security (TLS). Valid values include <tt>plaintext</tt> and
--   <tt>ssl-encryption</tt>. The default is <tt>ssl-encryption</tt>. The
--   <tt>ssl-encryption</tt> option makes an encrypted connection.
--   Optionally, you can identify an Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for an SSL
--   certificate authority (CA) using the <tt>SslCaCertificateArn
--   </tt>setting. If an ARN isn't given for a CA, DMS uses the Amazon root
--   CA.
--   
--   The <tt>plaintext</tt> option doesn't provide Transport Layer Security
--   (TLS) encryption for traffic between endpoint and database.
redisSettings_sslSecurityProtocol :: Lens' RedisSettings (Maybe SslSecurityProtocolValue)

-- | The user name provided with the <tt>auth-role</tt> option of the
--   <tt>AuthType</tt> setting for a Redis target endpoint.
redisSettings_authUserName :: Lens' RedisSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the certificate authority (CA) that
--   DMS uses to connect to your Redis target endpoint.
redisSettings_sslCaCertificateArn :: Lens' RedisSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | The password provided with the <tt>auth-role</tt> and
--   <tt>auth-token</tt> options of the <tt>AuthType</tt> setting for a
--   Redis target endpoint.
redisSettings_authPassword :: Lens' RedisSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | The type of authentication to perform when connecting to a Redis
--   target. Options include <tt>none</tt>, <tt>auth-token</tt>, and
--   <tt>auth-role</tt>. The <tt>auth-token</tt> option requires an
--   <tt>AuthPassword</tt> value to be provided. The <tt>auth-role</tt>
--   option requires <tt>AuthUserName</tt> and <tt>AuthPassword</tt> values
--   to be provided.
redisSettings_authType :: Lens' RedisSettings (Maybe RedisAuthTypeValue)

-- | Fully qualified domain name of the endpoint.
redisSettings_serverName :: Lens' RedisSettings Text

-- | Transmission Control Protocol (TCP) port for the endpoint.
redisSettings_port :: Lens' RedisSettings Int
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.DMS.Types.RedisSettings.RedisSettings
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.DMS.Types.RedisSettings.RedisSettings
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.DMS.Types.RedisSettings.RedisSettings
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.DMS.Types.RedisSettings.RedisSettings
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.DMS.Types.RedisSettings.RedisSettings
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.DMS.Types.RedisSettings.RedisSettings
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.DMS.Types.RedisSettings.RedisSettings


module Network.AWS.DMS.Types.StartReplicationTaskTypeValue
newtype StartReplicationTaskTypeValue
StartReplicationTaskTypeValue' :: Text -> StartReplicationTaskTypeValue

pattern StartReplicationTaskTypeValue_Reload_target :: StartReplicationTaskTypeValue

module Network.AWS.DMS.Types.Subnet

-- | In response to a request by the
--   <tt>DescribeReplicationSubnetGroups</tt> operation, this object
--   identifies a subnet by its given Availability Zone, subnet identifier,
--   and status.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSubnet</a> smart constructor.
data Subnet
Subnet' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe AvailabilityZone -> Subnet

-- | The status of the subnet.
[$sel:subnetStatus:Subnet'] :: Subnet -> Maybe Text

-- | The subnet identifier.
[$sel:subnetIdentifier:Subnet'] :: Subnet -> Maybe Text

-- | The Availability Zone of the subnet.
[$sel:subnetAvailabilityZone:Subnet'] :: Subnet -> Maybe AvailabilityZone

-- | Create a value of <a>Subnet</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--

--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:subnetStatus:Subnet'</a>, <a>subnet_subnetStatus</a> - The
--   status of the subnet.
--   
--   <a>$sel:subnetIdentifier:Subnet'</a>, <a>subnet_subnetIdentifier</a> -
--   The subnet identifier.
--   
--   <a>$sel:subnetAvailabilityZone:Subnet'</a>,
--   <a>subnet_subnetAvailabilityZone</a> - The Availability Zone of the
--   subnet.
newSubnet :: Subnet

-- | The status of the subnet.
subnet_subnetStatus :: Lens' Subnet (Maybe Text)

-- | The subnet identifier.
subnet_subnetIdentifier :: Lens' Subnet (Maybe Text)

-- | The Availability Zone of the subnet.
subnet_subnetAvailabilityZone :: Lens' Subnet (Maybe AvailabilityZone)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.DMS.Types.Subnet.Subnet

module Network.AWS.DMS.Types.ReplicationSubnetGroup

-- | Describes a subnet group in response to a request by the
--   <tt>DescribeReplicationSubnetGroups</tt> operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newReplicationSubnetGroup</a> smart constructor.
data ReplicationSubnetGroup
ReplicationSubnetGroup' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe [Subnet] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> ReplicationSubnetGroup

-- | The ID of the VPC.
[$sel:vpcId:ReplicationSubnetGroup'] :: ReplicationSubnetGroup -> Maybe Text

-- | The subnets that are in the subnet group.
[$sel:subnets:ReplicationSubnetGroup'] :: ReplicationSubnetGroup -> Maybe [Subnet]

-- | The identifier of the replication instance subnet group.

-- | The status of the subnet group.
[$sel:subnetGroupStatus:ReplicationSubnetGroup'] :: ReplicationSubnetGroup -> Maybe Text

--   fields omitted.

--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional

--   <a>$sel:subnets:ReplicationSubnetGroup'</a>,
--   <a>replicationSubnetGroup_subnets</a> - The subnets that are in the
--   subnet group.
--   
--   <a>$sel:replicationSubnetGroupIdentifier:ReplicationSubnetGroup'</a>,
--   <a>replicationSubnetGroup_replicationSubnetGroupIdentifier</a> - The
--   identifier of the replication instance subnet group.
--   
--   <a>$sel:subnetGroupStatus:ReplicationSubnetGroup'</a>,
--   <a>replicationSubnetGroup_subnetGroupStatus</a> - The status of the
--   subnet group.
--   
--   <a>$sel:replicationSubnetGroupDescription:ReplicationSubnetGroup'</a>,
--   <a>replicationSubnetGroup_replicationSubnetGroupDescription</a> - A
--   description for the replication subnet group.
newReplicationSubnetGroup :: ReplicationSubnetGroup

module Network.AWS.DMS.Types.SupportedEndpointType

-- | Provides information about types of supported endpoints in response to
--   a request by the <tt>DescribeEndpointTypes</tt> operation. This
--   information includes the type of endpoint, the database engine name,
--   and whether change data capture (CDC) is supported.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSupportedEndpointType</a> smart constructor.
data SupportedEndpointType
SupportedEndpointType' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe ReplicationEndpointTypeValue -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> SupportedEndpointType

-- | The expanded name for the engine name. For example, if the
--   <tt>EngineName</tt> parameter is "aurora," this value would be "Amazon
--   Aurora MySQL."
[$sel:engineDisplayName:SupportedEndpointType'] :: SupportedEndpointType -> Maybe Text

-- | The type of endpoint. Valid values are <tt>source</tt> and
--   <tt>target</tt>.
[$sel:endpointType:SupportedEndpointType'] :: SupportedEndpointType -> Maybe ReplicationEndpointTypeValue

-- | The database engine name. Valid values, depending on the EndpointType,
--   include <tt>"mysql"</tt>, <tt>"oracle"</tt>, <tt>"postgres"</tt>,
--   <tt>"mariadb"</tt>, <tt>"aurora"</tt>, <tt>"aurora-postgresql"</tt>,
--   <tt>"redshift"</tt>, <tt>"s3"</tt>, <tt>"db2"</tt>,
--   <tt>"azuredb"</tt>, <tt>"sybase"</tt>, <tt>"dynamodb"</tt>,
--   <tt>"mongodb"</tt>, <tt>"kinesis"</tt>, <tt>"kafka"</tt>,
--   <tt>"elasticsearch"</tt>, <tt>"documentdb"</tt>, <tt>"sqlserver"</tt>,
--   and <tt>"neptune"</tt>.
[$sel:engineName:SupportedEndpointType'] :: SupportedEndpointType -> Maybe Text

-- | The earliest DMS engine version that supports this endpoint engine.
--   Note that endpoint engines released with DMS versions earlier than
--   3.1.1 do not return a value for this parameter.
[$sel:replicationInstanceEngineMinimumVersion:SupportedEndpointType'] :: SupportedEndpointType -> Maybe Text

-- | Indicates if change data capture (CDC) is supported.
[$sel:supportsCDC:SupportedEndpointType'] :: SupportedEndpointType -> Maybe Bool

-- | Create a value of <a>SupportedEndpointType</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:engineDisplayName:SupportedEndpointType'</a>,
--   <a>supportedEndpointType_engineDisplayName</a> - The expanded name for
--   the engine name. For example, if the <tt>EngineName</tt> parameter is
--   "aurora," this value would be "Amazon Aurora MySQL."
--   
--   <a>$sel:endpointType:SupportedEndpointType'</a>,
--   <a>supportedEndpointType_endpointType</a> - The type of endpoint.
--   Valid values are <tt>source</tt> and <tt>target</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:engineName:SupportedEndpointType'</a>,
--   <a>supportedEndpointType_engineName</a> - The database engine name.
--   Valid values, depending on the EndpointType, include <tt>"mysql"</tt>,
--   <tt>"oracle"</tt>, <tt>"postgres"</tt>, <tt>"mariadb"</tt>,
--   <tt>"aurora"</tt>, <tt>"aurora-postgresql"</tt>, <tt>"redshift"</tt>,
--   <tt>"s3"</tt>, <tt>"db2"</tt>, <tt>"azuredb"</tt>, <tt>"sybase"</tt>,
--   <tt>"dynamodb"</tt>, <tt>"mongodb"</tt>, <tt>"kinesis"</tt>,
--   <tt>"kafka"</tt>, <tt>"elasticsearch"</tt>, <tt>"documentdb"</tt>,
--   <tt>"sqlserver"</tt>, and <tt>"neptune"</tt>.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:replicationInstanceEngineMinimumVersion:SupportedEndpointType'</a>,
--   <a>supportedEndpointType_replicationInstanceEngineMinimumVersion</a> -
--   The earliest DMS engine version that supports this endpoint engine.
--   Note that endpoint engines released with DMS versions earlier than
--   3.1.1 do not return a value for this parameter.
--   
--   <a>$sel:supportsCDC:SupportedEndpointType'</a>,
--   <a>supportedEndpointType_supportsCDC</a> - Indicates if change data
--   capture (CDC) is supported.
newSupportedEndpointType :: SupportedEndpointType

-- | The expanded name for the engine name. For example, if the
--   <tt>EngineName</tt> parameter is "aurora," this value would be "Amazon
--   Aurora MySQL."
supportedEndpointType_engineDisplayName :: Lens' SupportedEndpointType (Maybe Text)

-- | The type of endpoint. Valid values are <tt>source</tt> and
--   <tt>target</tt>.
supportedEndpointType_endpointType :: Lens' SupportedEndpointType (Maybe ReplicationEndpointTypeValue)

-- | The database engine name. Valid values, depending on the EndpointType,
--   include <tt>"mysql"</tt>, <tt>"oracle"</tt>, <tt>"postgres"</tt>,
--   <tt>"mariadb"</tt>, <tt>"aurora"</tt>, <tt>"aurora-postgresql"</tt>,
--   <tt>"redshift"</tt>, <tt>"s3"</tt>, <tt>"db2"</tt>,
--   <tt>"azuredb"</tt>, <tt>"sybase"</tt>, <tt>"dynamodb"</tt>,
--   <tt>"mongodb"</tt>, <tt>"kinesis"</tt>, <tt>"kafka"</tt>,
--   <tt>"elasticsearch"</tt>, <tt>"documentdb"</tt>, <tt>"sqlserver"</tt>,
--   and <tt>"neptune"</tt>.
supportedEndpointType_engineName :: Lens' SupportedEndpointType (Maybe Text)

-- | The earliest DMS engine version that supports this endpoint engine.
--   Note that endpoint engines released with DMS versions earlier than
--   3.1.1 do not return a value for this parameter.
supportedEndpointType_replicationInstanceEngineMinimumVersion :: Lens' SupportedEndpointType (Maybe Text)

-- | Indicates if change data capture (CDC) is supported.
supportedEndpointType_supportsCDC :: Lens' SupportedEndpointType (Maybe Bool)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.DMS.Types.SupportedEndpointType.SupportedEndpointType
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.DMS.Types.SupportedEndpointType.SupportedEndpointType
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.DMS.Types.SupportedEndpointType.SupportedEndpointType
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.DMS.Types.SupportedEndpointType.SupportedEndpointType
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.DMS.Types.SupportedEndpointType.SupportedEndpointType
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.DMS.Types.SupportedEndpointType.SupportedEndpointType
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.DMS.Types.SupportedEndpointType.SupportedEndpointType


module Network.AWS.DMS.Types.SybaseSettings

-- | Provides information that defines a SAP ASE endpoint.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSybaseSettings</a> smart constructor.
data SybaseSettings
SybaseSettings' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> SybaseSettings

-- | Fully qualified domain name of the endpoint.
[$sel:serverName:SybaseSettings'] :: SybaseSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | The full Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role that specifies DMS
--   as the trusted entity and grants the required permissions to access
--   the value in <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt>. The role must allow the
--   <tt>iam:PassRole</tt> action. <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> has the
--   value of the Amazon Web Services Secrets Manager secret that allows
--   access to the SAP ASE endpoint.
--   
--   You can specify one of two sets of values for these permissions. You
--   can specify the values for this setting and
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecretId</tt>. Or you can specify clear-text values
--   for <tt>UserName</tt>, <tt>Password</tt>, <tt>ServerName</tt>, and
--   <tt>Port</tt>. You can't specify both. For more information on
--   creating this <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> and the
--   <tt>SecretsManagerAccessRoleArn</tt> and
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecretId</tt> required to access it, see <a>Using
--   secrets to access Database Migration Service resources</a> in the
--   <i>Database Migration Service User Guide</i>.
[$sel:secretsManagerAccessRoleArn:SybaseSettings'] :: SybaseSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | Endpoint connection user name.
[$sel:username:SybaseSettings'] :: SybaseSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | Endpoint connection password.
[$sel:password:SybaseSettings'] :: SybaseSettings -> Maybe (Sensitive Text)

-- | Database name for the endpoint.
[$sel:databaseName:SybaseSettings'] :: SybaseSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | The full ARN, partial ARN, or friendly name of the
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> that contains the SAP SAE endpoint
--   connection details.
[$sel:secretsManagerSecretId:SybaseSettings'] :: SybaseSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | Endpoint TCP port.
[$sel:port:SybaseSettings'] :: SybaseSettings -> Maybe Int

-- | Create a value of <a>SybaseSettings</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:serverName:SybaseSettings'</a>,
--   <a>sybaseSettings_serverName</a> - Fully qualified domain name of the
--   endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:secretsManagerAccessRoleArn:SybaseSettings'</a>,
--   <a>sybaseSettings_secretsManagerAccessRoleArn</a> - The full Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role that specifies DMS as the trusted
--   entity and grants the required permissions to access the value in
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt>. The role must allow the
--   <tt>iam:PassRole</tt> action. <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> has the
--   value of the Amazon Web Services Secrets Manager secret that allows
--   access to the SAP ASE endpoint.
--   
--   You can specify one of two sets of values for these permissions. You
--   can specify the values for this setting and
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecretId</tt>. Or you can specify clear-text values
--   for <tt>UserName</tt>, <tt>Password</tt>, <tt>ServerName</tt>, and
--   <tt>Port</tt>. You can't specify both. For more information on
--   creating this <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> and the
--   <tt>SecretsManagerAccessRoleArn</tt> and
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecretId</tt> required to access it, see <a>Using
--   secrets to access Database Migration Service resources</a> in the
--   <i>Database Migration Service User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:username:SybaseSettings'</a>, <a>sybaseSettings_username</a> -
--   Endpoint connection user name.
--   
--   <a>$sel:password:SybaseSettings'</a>, <a>sybaseSettings_password</a> -
--   Endpoint connection password.
--   
--   <a>$sel:databaseName:SybaseSettings'</a>,
--   <a>sybaseSettings_databaseName</a> - Database name for the endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:secretsManagerSecretId:SybaseSettings'</a>,
--   <a>sybaseSettings_secretsManagerSecretId</a> - The full ARN, partial
--   ARN, or friendly name of the <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> that
--   contains the SAP SAE endpoint connection details.
--   
--   <a>$sel:port:SybaseSettings'</a>, <a>sybaseSettings_port</a> -
--   Endpoint TCP port.
newSybaseSettings :: SybaseSettings

-- | Fully qualified domain name of the endpoint.
sybaseSettings_serverName :: Lens' SybaseSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | The full Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role that specifies DMS
--   as the trusted entity and grants the required permissions to access
--   the value in <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt>. The role must allow the
--   <tt>iam:PassRole</tt> action. <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> has the
--   value of the Amazon Web Services Secrets Manager secret that allows
--   access to the SAP ASE endpoint.
--   
--   You can specify one of two sets of values for these permissions. You
--   can specify the values for this setting and
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecretId</tt>. Or you can specify clear-text values
--   for <tt>UserName</tt>, <tt>Password</tt>, <tt>ServerName</tt>, and
--   <tt>Port</tt>. You can't specify both. For more information on
--   creating this <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> and the
--   <tt>SecretsManagerAccessRoleArn</tt> and
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecretId</tt> required to access it, see <a>Using
--   secrets to access Database Migration Service resources</a> in the
--   <i>Database Migration Service User Guide</i>.
sybaseSettings_secretsManagerAccessRoleArn :: Lens' SybaseSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | Endpoint connection user name.
sybaseSettings_username :: Lens' SybaseSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | Endpoint connection password.
sybaseSettings_password :: Lens' SybaseSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | Database name for the endpoint.
sybaseSettings_databaseName :: Lens' SybaseSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | The full ARN, partial ARN, or friendly name of the
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> that contains the SAP SAE endpoint
--   connection details.
sybaseSettings_secretsManagerSecretId :: Lens' SybaseSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | Endpoint TCP port.
sybaseSettings_port :: Lens' SybaseSettings (Maybe Int)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.DMS.Types.SybaseSettings.SybaseSettings
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.DMS.Types.SybaseSettings.SybaseSettings
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.DMS.Types.SybaseSettings.SybaseSettings
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.DMS.Types.SybaseSettings.SybaseSettings

instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.DMS.Types.SybaseSettings.SybaseSettings


module Network.AWS.DMS.Types.TableStatistics

-- | Provides a collection of table statistics in response to a request by
--   the <tt>DescribeTableStatistics</tt> operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTableStatistics</a> smart constructor.
data TableStatistics
TableStatistics' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> TableStatistics

-- | The validation state of the table.
--   
--   This parameter can have the following values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Not enabled â€“ Validation isn't enabled for the table in the
--   migration task.</li>
--   <li>Pending records â€“ Some records in the table are waiting for
--   validation.</li>
--   <li>Mismatched records â€“ Some records in the table don't match between
--   the source and target.</li>
--   <li>Suspended records â€“ Some records in the table couldn't be
--   validated.</li>
--   <li>No primary key â€“The table couldn't be validated because it has no
--   primary key.</li>
--   <li>Table error â€“ The table wasn't validated because it's in an error
--   state and some data wasn't migrated.</li>
--   <li>Validated â€“ All rows in the table are validated. If the table is
--   updated, the status can change from Validated.</li>
--   <li>Error â€“ The table couldn't be validated because of an unexpected
--   error.</li>
--   <li>Pending validation â€“ The table is waiting validation.</li>
--   <li>Preparing table â€“ Preparing the table enabled in the migration
--   task for validation.</li>
--   <li>Pending revalidation â€“ All rows in the table are pending
--   validation after the table was updated.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:validationState:TableStatistics'] :: TableStatistics -> Maybe Text

-- | The number of rows added during the full load operation.
[$sel:fullLoadRows:TableStatistics'] :: TableStatistics -> Maybe Integer

-- | The number of insert actions performed on a table.
[$sel:inserts:TableStatistics'] :: TableStatistics -> Maybe Integer

-- | The time when the full load operation completed.
[$sel:fullLoadEndTime:TableStatistics'] :: TableStatistics -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The number of rows that failed conditional checks during the full load
--   operation (valid only for migrations where DynamoDB is the target).
[$sel:fullLoadCondtnlChkFailedRows:TableStatistics'] :: TableStatistics -> Maybe Integer

-- | A value that indicates if the table was reloaded (<tt>true</tt>) or
--   loaded as part of a new full load operation (<tt>false</tt>).
[$sel:fullLoadReloaded:TableStatistics'] :: TableStatistics -> Maybe Bool

-- | The number of records that failed validation.
[$sel:validationFailedRecords:TableStatistics'] :: TableStatistics -> Maybe Integer

-- | The number of records that couldn't be validated.
[$sel:validationSuspendedRecords:TableStatistics'] :: TableStatistics -> Maybe Integer

-- | The schema name.
[$sel:schemaName:TableStatistics'] :: TableStatistics -> Maybe Text

-- | Additional details about the state of validation.
[$sel:validationStateDetails:TableStatistics'] :: TableStatistics -> Maybe Text

-- | The state of the tables described.
--   
--   Valid states: Table does not exist | Before load | Full load | Table
--   completed | Table cancelled | Table error | Table all | Table updates
--   | Table is being reloaded
[$sel:tableState:TableStatistics'] :: TableStatistics -> Maybe Text

-- | The number of rows that failed to load during the full load operation
--   (valid only for migrations where DynamoDB is the target).
[$sel:fullLoadErrorRows:TableStatistics'] :: TableStatistics -> Maybe Integer

-- | The data definition language (DDL) used to build and modify the
--   structure of your tables.
[$sel:ddls:TableStatistics'] :: TableStatistics -> Maybe Integer

-- | The number of delete actions performed on a table.
[$sel:deletes:TableStatistics'] :: TableStatistics -> Maybe Integer

-- | The number of update actions performed on a table.
[$sel:updates:TableStatistics'] :: TableStatistics -> Maybe Integer

-- | The number of records that have yet to be validated.
[$sel:validationPendingRecords:TableStatistics'] :: TableStatistics -> Maybe Integer

-- | The time when the full load operation started.
[$sel:fullLoadStartTime:TableStatistics'] :: TableStatistics -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The last time a table was updated.
[$sel:lastUpdateTime:TableStatistics'] :: TableStatistics -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The name of the table.
[$sel:tableName:TableStatistics'] :: TableStatistics -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>TableStatistics</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:validationState:TableStatistics'</a>,
--   <a>tableStatistics_validationState</a> - The validation state of the
--   table.
--   
--   This parameter can have the following values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Not enabled â€“ Validation isn't enabled for the table in the
--   migration task.</li>
--   <li>Pending records â€“ Some records in the table are waiting for
--   validation.</li>
--   <li>Mismatched records â€“ Some records in the table don't match between
--   the source and target.</li>
--   <li>Suspended records â€“ Some records in the table couldn't be
--   validated.</li>
--   <li>No primary key â€“The table couldn't be validated because it has no
--   primary key.</li>
--   <li>Table error â€“ The table wasn't validated because it's in an error
--   state and some data wasn't migrated.</li>
--   <li>Validated â€“ All rows in the table are validated. If the table is
--   updated, the status can change from Validated.</li>
--   <li>Error â€“ The table couldn't be validated because of an unexpected
--   error.</li>
--   <li>Pending validation â€“ The table is waiting validation.</li>
--   <li>Preparing table â€“ Preparing the table enabled in the migration
--   task for validation.</li>
--   <li>Pending revalidation â€“ All rows in the table are pending
--   validation after the table was updated.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:fullLoadRows:TableStatistics'</a>,
--   <a>tableStatistics_fullLoadRows</a> - The number of rows added during
--   the full load operation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:inserts:TableStatistics'</a>, <a>tableStatistics_inserts</a> -
--   The number of insert actions performed on a table.
--   
--   <a>$sel:fullLoadEndTime:TableStatistics'</a>,
--   <a>tableStatistics_fullLoadEndTime</a> - The time when the full load
--   operation completed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:fullLoadCondtnlChkFailedRows:TableStatistics'</a>,
--   <a>tableStatistics_fullLoadCondtnlChkFailedRows</a> - The number of
--   rows that failed conditional checks during the full load operation
--   (valid only for migrations where DynamoDB is the target).
--   
--   <a>$sel:fullLoadReloaded:TableStatistics'</a>,
--   <a>tableStatistics_fullLoadReloaded</a> - A value that indicates if
--   the table was reloaded (<tt>true</tt>) or loaded as part of a new full
--   load operation (<tt>false</tt>).
--   
--   <a>$sel:validationFailedRecords:TableStatistics'</a>,
--   <a>tableStatistics_validationFailedRecords</a> - The number of records
--   that failed validation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:validationSuspendedRecords:TableStatistics'</a>,
--   <a>tableStatistics_validationSuspendedRecords</a> - The number of
--   records that couldn't be validated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:schemaName:TableStatistics'</a>,
--   <a>tableStatistics_schemaName</a> - The schema name.
--   
--   <a>$sel:validationStateDetails:TableStatistics'</a>,
--   <a>tableStatistics_validationStateDetails</a> - Additional details
--   about the state of validation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tableState:TableStatistics'</a>,
--   <a>tableStatistics_tableState</a> - The state of the tables described.
--   
--   Valid states: Table does not exist | Before load | Full load | Table
--   completed | Table cancelled | Table error | Table all | Table updates
--   | Table is being reloaded
--   
--   <a>$sel:fullLoadErrorRows:TableStatistics'</a>,
--   <a>tableStatistics_fullLoadErrorRows</a> - The number of rows that
--   failed to load during the full load operation (valid only for
--   migrations where DynamoDB is the target).
--   
--   <a>$sel:ddls:TableStatistics'</a>, <a>tableStatistics_ddls</a> - The
--   data definition language (DDL) used to build and modify the structure
--   of your tables.
--   
--   <a>$sel:deletes:TableStatistics'</a>, <a>tableStatistics_deletes</a> -
--   The number of delete actions performed on a table.
--   
--   <a>$sel:updates:TableStatistics'</a>, <a>tableStatistics_updates</a> -
--   The number of update actions performed on a table.
--   
--   <a>$sel:validationPendingRecords:TableStatistics'</a>,
--   <a>tableStatistics_validationPendingRecords</a> - The number of
--   records that have yet to be validated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:fullLoadStartTime:TableStatistics'</a>,
--   <a>tableStatistics_fullLoadStartTime</a> - The time when the full load
--   operation started.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastUpdateTime:TableStatistics'</a>,
--   <a>tableStatistics_lastUpdateTime</a> - The last time a table was
--   updated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tableName:TableStatistics'</a>,
--   <a>tableStatistics_tableName</a> - The name of the table.
newTableStatistics :: TableStatistics

-- | The validation state of the table.
--   
--   This parameter can have the following values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Not enabled â€“ Validation isn't enabled for the table in the
--   migration task.</li>
--   <li>Pending records â€“ Some records in the table are waiting for
--   validation.</li>
--   <li>Mismatched records â€“ Some records in the table don't match between
--   the source and target.</li>
--   <li>Suspended records â€“ Some records in the table couldn't be
--   validated.</li>
--   <li>No primary key â€“The table couldn't be validated because it has no
--   primary key.</li>
--   <li>Table error â€“ The table wasn't validated because it's in an error
--   state and some data wasn't migrated.</li>
--   <li>Validated â€“ All rows in the table are validated. If the table is
--   updated, the status can change from Validated.</li>
--   <li>Error â€“ The table couldn't be validated because of an unexpected
--   error.</li>
--   <li>Pending validation â€“ The table is waiting validation.</li>
--   <li>Preparing table â€“ Preparing the table enabled in the migration
--   task for validation.</li>
--   <li>Pending revalidation â€“ All rows in the table are pending
--   validation after the table was updated.</li>
--   </ul>
tableStatistics_validationState :: Lens' TableStatistics (Maybe Text)

-- | The number of rows added during the full load operation.
tableStatistics_fullLoadRows :: Lens' TableStatistics (Maybe Integer)

-- | The number of insert actions performed on a table.
tableStatistics_inserts :: Lens' TableStatistics (Maybe Integer)

-- | The time when the full load operation completed.
tableStatistics_fullLoadEndTime :: Lens' TableStatistics (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The number of rows that failed conditional checks during the full load
--   operation (valid only for migrations where DynamoDB is the target).
tableStatistics_fullLoadCondtnlChkFailedRows :: Lens' TableStatistics (Maybe Integer)

-- | A value that indicates if the table was reloaded (<tt>true</tt>) or
--   loaded as part of a new full load operation (<tt>false</tt>).
tableStatistics_fullLoadReloaded :: Lens' TableStatistics (Maybe Bool)

-- | The number of records that failed validation.
tableStatistics_validationFailedRecords :: Lens' TableStatistics (Maybe Integer)

-- | The number of records that couldn't be validated.
tableStatistics_validationSuspendedRecords :: Lens' TableStatistics (Maybe Integer)

-- | The schema name.
tableStatistics_schemaName :: Lens' TableStatistics (Maybe Text)

-- | Additional details about the state of validation.
tableStatistics_validationStateDetails :: Lens' TableStatistics (Maybe Text)

-- | The state of the tables described.
--   
--   Valid states: Table does not exist | Before load | Full load | Table
--   completed | Table cancelled | Table error | Table all | Table updates
--   | Table is being reloaded
tableStatistics_tableState :: Lens' TableStatistics (Maybe Text)

-- | The number of rows that failed to load during the full load operation
--   (valid only for migrations where DynamoDB is the target).
tableStatistics_fullLoadErrorRows :: Lens' TableStatistics (Maybe Integer)

-- | The data definition language (DDL) used to build and modify the
--   structure of your tables.
tableStatistics_ddls :: Lens' TableStatistics (Maybe Integer)

-- | The number of delete actions performed on a table.
tableStatistics_deletes :: Lens' TableStatistics (Maybe Integer)

-- | The number of update actions performed on a table.
tableStatistics_updates :: Lens' TableStatistics (Maybe Integer)

-- | The number of records that have yet to be validated.
tableStatistics_validationPendingRecords :: Lens' TableStatistics (Maybe Integer)

-- | The time when the full load operation started.
tableStatistics_fullLoadStartTime :: Lens' TableStatistics (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The last time a table was updated.
tableStatistics_lastUpdateTime :: Lens' TableStatistics (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The name of the table.
tableStatistics_tableName :: Lens' TableStatistics (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.DMS.Types.TableStatistics.TableStatistics
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.DMS.Types.TableStatistics.TableStatistics
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.DMS.Types.TableStatistics.TableStatistics
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.DMS.Types.TableStatistics.TableStatistics
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.DMS.Types.TableStatistics.TableStatistics
