module Network.AWS.DMS.Types.TableToReload

-- | Provides the name of the schema and table to be reloaded.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTableToReload</a> smart constructor.
data TableToReload
TableToReload' :: Text -> Text -> TableToReload

-- | The schema name of the table to be reloaded.
[$sel:schemaName:TableToReload'] :: TableToReload -> Text

-- | The table name of the table to be reloaded.
[$sel:tableName:TableToReload'] :: TableToReload -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>TableToReload</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:schemaName:TableToReload'</a>, <a>tableToReload_schemaName</a>
--   - The schema name of the table to be reloaded.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tableName:TableToReload'</a>, <a>tableToReload_tableName</a> -
--   The table name of the table to be reloaded.
newTableToReload :: Text -> Text -> TableToReload

-- | The schema name of the table to be reloaded.
tableToReload_schemaName :: Lens' TableToReload Text

-- | The table name of the table to be reloaded.
tableToReload_tableName :: Lens' TableToReload Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.DMS.Types.TableToReload.TableToReload
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.DMS.Types.TableToReload.TableToReload
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.DMS.Types.TableToReload.TableToReload
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.DMS.Types.TableToReload.TableToReload
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.DMS.Types.TableToReload.TableToReload
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.DMS.Types.TableToReload.TableToReload
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.DMS.Types.TableToReload.TableToReload


module Network.AWS.DMS.Types.Tag

-- | A user-defined key-value pair that describes metadata added to an DMS
--   resource and that is used by operations such as the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>AddTagsToResource</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>ListTagsForResource</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>RemoveTagsFromResource</pre></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTag</a> smart constructor.
data Tag
Tag' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Tag

-- | A value is the optional value of the tag. The string value can be
--   1-256 Unicode characters in length and can't be prefixed with "aws:"
--   or "dms:". The string can only contain only the set of Unicode
--   letters, digits, white-space, '_', '.', '/', '=', '+', '-' (Java
--   regular expressions: "^([\\p{L}\\p{Z}\\p{N}_.:/=+\\-]*)$").
[$sel:value:Tag'] :: Tag -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) string that uniquely identifies the
--   resource for which the tag is created.
[$sel:resourceArn:Tag'] :: Tag -> Maybe Text

-- | A key is the required name of the tag. The string value can be 1-128
--   Unicode characters in length and can't be prefixed with "aws:" or
--   "dms:". The string can only contain only the set of Unicode letters,
--   digits, white-space, '_', '.', '/', '=', '+', '-' (Java regular
--   expressions: "^([\\p{L}\\p{Z}\\p{N}_.:/=+\\-]*)$").
[$sel:key:Tag'] :: Tag -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Tag</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:Tag'</a>, <a>tag_value</a> - A value is the optional
--   value of the tag. The string value can be 1-256 Unicode characters in
--   length and can't be prefixed with "aws:" or "dms:". The string can
--   only contain only the set of Unicode letters, digits, white-space,
--   '_', '.', '/', '=', '+', '-' (Java regular expressions:
--   "^([\\p{L}\\p{Z}\\p{N}_.:/=+\\-]*)$").
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceArn:Tag'</a>, <a>tag_resourceArn</a> - The Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN) string that uniquely identifies the resource for
--   which the tag is created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:key:Tag'</a>, <a>tag_key</a> - A key is the required name of
--   the tag. The string value can be 1-128 Unicode characters in length
--   and can't be prefixed with "aws:" or "dms:". The string can only
--   contain only the set of Unicode letters, digits, white-space, '_',
--   '.', '/', '=', '+', '-' (Java regular expressions:
--   "^([\\p{L}\\p{Z}\\p{N}_.:/=+\\-]*)$").
newTag :: Tag

-- | A value is the optional value of the tag. The string value can be
--   1-256 Unicode characters in length and can't be prefixed with "aws:"
--   or "dms:". The string can only contain only the set of Unicode
--   letters, digits, white-space, '_', '.', '/', '=', '+', '-' (Java
--   regular expressions: "^([\\p{L}\\p{Z}\\p{N}_.:/=+\\-]*)$").
tag_value :: Lens' Tag (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) string that uniquely identifies the
--   resource for which the tag is created.
tag_resourceArn :: Lens' Tag (Maybe Text)

-- | A key is the required name of the tag. The string value can be 1-128
--   Unicode characters in length and can't be prefixed with "aws:" or
--   "dms:". The string can only contain only the set of Unicode letters,
--   digits, white-space, '_', '.', '/', '=', '+', '-' (Java regular
--   expressions: "^([\\p{L}\\p{Z}\\p{N}_.:/=+\\-]*)$").
tag_key :: Lens' Tag (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.DMS.Types.Tag.Tag
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.DMS.Types.Tag.Tag
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.DMS.Types.Tag.Tag
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.DMS.Types.Tag.Tag
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.DMS.Types.Tag.Tag
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.DMS.Types.Tag.Tag
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.DMS.Types.Tag.Tag
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.DMS.Types.Tag.Tag


module Network.AWS.DMS.Types.TargetDbType
newtype TargetDbType
TargetDbType' :: Text -> TargetDbType
[fromTargetDbType] :: TargetDbType -> Text
pattern TargetDbType_Multiple_databases :: TargetDbType
pattern TargetDbType_Specific_database :: TargetDbType
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.ToXML Network.AWS.DMS.Types.TargetDbType.TargetDbType
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.DMS.Types.TargetDbType.TargetDbType
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSONKey Network.AWS.DMS.Types.TargetDbType.TargetDbType
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.DMS.Types.TargetDbType.TargetDbType
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSONKey Network.AWS.DMS.Types.TargetDbType.TargetDbType
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.DMS.Types.TargetDbType.TargetDbType
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.DMS.Types.TargetDbType.TargetDbType
instance Network.AWS.Data.Headers.ToHeader Network.AWS.DMS.Types.TargetDbType.TargetDbType
instance Network.AWS.Data.Log.ToLog Network.AWS.DMS.Types.TargetDbType.TargetDbType
instance Network.AWS.Data.ByteString.ToByteString Network.AWS.DMS.Types.TargetDbType.TargetDbType
instance Network.AWS.Data.Text.ToText Network.AWS.DMS.Types.TargetDbType.TargetDbType
instance Network.AWS.Data.Text.FromText Network.AWS.DMS.Types.TargetDbType.TargetDbType
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.DMS.Types.TargetDbType.TargetDbType
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.DMS.Types.TargetDbType.TargetDbType
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.DMS.Types.TargetDbType.TargetDbType
instance GHC.Classes.Ord Network.AWS.DMS.Types.TargetDbType.TargetDbType
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.DMS.Types.TargetDbType.TargetDbType
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.DMS.Types.TargetDbType.TargetDbType
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.DMS.Types.TargetDbType.TargetDbType


module Network.AWS.DMS.Types.MySQLSettings

-- | Provides information that defines a MySQL endpoint.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMySQLSettings</a> smart constructor.
data MySQLSettings
MySQLSettings' :: Maybe Int -> Maybe TargetDbType -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> MySQLSettings

-- | Specifies the maximum size (in KB) of any .csv file used to transfer
--   data to a MySQL-compatible database.
--   
--   Example: <tt>maxFileSize=512</tt>
[$sel:maxFileSize:MySQLSettings'] :: MySQLSettings -> Maybe Int

-- | Specifies where to migrate source tables on the target, either to a
--   single database or multiple databases.
--   
--   Example: <tt>targetDbType=MULTIPLE_DATABASES</tt>
[$sel:targetDbType:MySQLSettings'] :: MySQLSettings -> Maybe TargetDbType

-- | Fully qualified domain name of the endpoint.
[$sel:serverName:MySQLSettings'] :: MySQLSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | Adjusts the behavior of DMS when migrating from an SQL Server source
--   database that is hosted as part of an Always On availability group
--   cluster. If you need DMS to poll all the nodes in the Always On
--   cluster for transaction backups, set this attribute to <tt>false</tt>.
[$sel:cleanSourceMetadataOnMismatch:MySQLSettings'] :: MySQLSettings -> Maybe Bool

-- | Improves performance when loading data into the MySQL-compatible
--   target database. Specifies how many threads to use to load the data
--   into the MySQL-compatible target database. Setting a large number of
--   threads can have an adverse effect on database performance, because a
--   separate connection is required for each thread.
--   
--   Example: <tt>parallelLoadThreads=1</tt>
[$sel:parallelLoadThreads:MySQLSettings'] :: MySQLSettings -> Maybe Int

-- | The full Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role that specifies DMS
--   as the trusted entity and grants the required permissions to access
--   the value in <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt>. The role must allow the
--   <tt>iam:PassRole</tt> action. <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> has the
--   value of the Amazon Web Services Secrets Manager secret that allows
--   access to the MySQL endpoint.
--   
--   You can specify one of two sets of values for these permissions. You
--   can specify the values for this setting and
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecretId</tt>. Or you can specify clear-text values
--   for <tt>UserName</tt>, <tt>Password</tt>, <tt>ServerName</tt>, and
--   <tt>Port</tt>. You can't specify both. For more information on
--   creating this <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> and the
--   <tt>SecretsManagerAccessRoleArn</tt> and
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecretId</tt> required to access it, see <a>Using
--   secrets to access Database Migration Service resources</a> in the
--   <i>Database Migration Service User Guide</i>.
[$sel:secretsManagerAccessRoleArn:MySQLSettings'] :: MySQLSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | Endpoint connection user name.
[$sel:username:MySQLSettings'] :: MySQLSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | Endpoint connection password.
[$sel:password:MySQLSettings'] :: MySQLSettings -> Maybe (Sensitive Text)

-- | Specifies how often to check the binary log for new changes/events
--   when the database is idle.
--   
--   Example: <tt>eventsPollInterval=5;</tt>
--   
--   In the example, DMS checks for changes in the binary logs every five
--   seconds.
[$sel:eventsPollInterval:MySQLSettings'] :: MySQLSettings -> Maybe Int

-- | Database name for the endpoint. For a MySQL source or target endpoint,
--   don't explicitly specify the database using the <tt>DatabaseName</tt>
--   request parameter on either the <tt>CreateEndpoint</tt> or
--   <tt>ModifyEndpoint</tt> API call. Specifying <tt>DatabaseName</tt>
--   when you create or modify a MySQL endpoint replicates all the task
--   tables to this single database. For MySQL endpoints, you specify the
--   database only when you specify the schema in the table-mapping rules
--   of the DMS task.
[$sel:databaseName:MySQLSettings'] :: MySQLSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies a script to run immediately after DMS connects to the
--   endpoint. The migration task continues running regardless if the SQL
--   statement succeeds or fails.
--   
--   For this parameter, provide the code of the script itself, not the
--   name of a file containing the script.
[$sel:afterConnectScript:MySQLSettings'] :: MySQLSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | The full ARN, partial ARN, or friendly name of the
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> that contains the MySQL endpoint
--   connection details.
[$sel:secretsManagerSecretId:MySQLSettings'] :: MySQLSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies the time zone for the source MySQL database.
--   
--   Example: <tt>serverTimezone=US/Pacific;</tt>
--   
--   Note: Do not enclose time zones in single quotes.
[$sel:serverTimezone:MySQLSettings'] :: MySQLSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | Endpoint TCP port.
[$sel:port:MySQLSettings'] :: MySQLSettings -> Maybe Int

-- | Create a value of <a>MySQLSettings</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxFileSize:MySQLSettings'</a>,
--   <a>mySQLSettings_maxFileSize</a> - Specifies the maximum size (in KB)
--   of any .csv file used to transfer data to a MySQL-compatible database.
--   
--   Example: <tt>maxFileSize=512</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:targetDbType:MySQLSettings'</a>,
--   <a>mySQLSettings_targetDbType</a> - Specifies where to migrate source
--   tables on the target, either to a single database or multiple
--   databases.
--   
--   Example: <tt>targetDbType=MULTIPLE_DATABASES</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:serverName:MySQLSettings'</a>, <a>mySQLSettings_serverName</a>
--   - Fully qualified domain name of the endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:cleanSourceMetadataOnMismatch:MySQLSettings'</a>,
--   <a>mySQLSettings_cleanSourceMetadataOnMismatch</a> - Adjusts the
--   behavior of DMS when migrating from an SQL Server source database that
--   is hosted as part of an Always On availability group cluster. If you
--   need DMS to poll all the nodes in the Always On cluster for
--   transaction backups, set this attribute to <tt>false</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:parallelLoadThreads:MySQLSettings'</a>,
--   <a>mySQLSettings_parallelLoadThreads</a> - Improves performance when
--   loading data into the MySQL-compatible target database. Specifies how
--   many threads to use to load the data into the MySQL-compatible target
--   database. Setting a large number of threads can have an adverse effect
--   on database performance, because a separate connection is required for
--   each thread.
--   
--   Example: <tt>parallelLoadThreads=1</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:secretsManagerAccessRoleArn:MySQLSettings'</a>,
--   <a>mySQLSettings_secretsManagerAccessRoleArn</a> - The full Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role that specifies DMS as the trusted
--   entity and grants the required permissions to access the value in
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt>. The role must allow the
--   <tt>iam:PassRole</tt> action. <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> has the
--   value of the Amazon Web Services Secrets Manager secret that allows
--   access to the MySQL endpoint.
--   
--   You can specify one of two sets of values for these permissions. You
--   can specify the values for this setting and
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecretId</tt>. Or you can specify clear-text values
--   for <tt>UserName</tt>, <tt>Password</tt>, <tt>ServerName</tt>, and
--   <tt>Port</tt>. You can't specify both. For more information on
--   creating this <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> and the
--   <tt>SecretsManagerAccessRoleArn</tt> and
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecretId</tt> required to access it, see <a>Using
--   secrets to access Database Migration Service resources</a> in the
--   <i>Database Migration Service User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:username:MySQLSettings'</a>, <a>mySQLSettings_username</a> -
--   Endpoint connection user name.
--   
--   <a>$sel:password:MySQLSettings'</a>, <a>mySQLSettings_password</a> -
--   Endpoint connection password.
--   
--   <a>$sel:eventsPollInterval:MySQLSettings'</a>,
--   <a>mySQLSettings_eventsPollInterval</a> - Specifies how often to check
--   the binary log for new changes/events when the database is idle.
--   
--   Example: <tt>eventsPollInterval=5;</tt>
--   
--   In the example, DMS checks for changes in the binary logs every five
--   seconds.
--   
--   <a>$sel:databaseName:MySQLSettings'</a>,
--   <a>mySQLSettings_databaseName</a> - Database name for the endpoint.
--   For a MySQL source or target endpoint, don't explicitly specify the
--   database using the <tt>DatabaseName</tt> request parameter on either
--   the <tt>CreateEndpoint</tt> or <tt>ModifyEndpoint</tt> API call.
--   Specifying <tt>DatabaseName</tt> when you create or modify a MySQL
--   endpoint replicates all the task tables to this single database. For
--   MySQL endpoints, you specify the database only when you specify the
--   schema in the table-mapping rules of the DMS task.
--   
--   <a>$sel:afterConnectScript:MySQLSettings'</a>,
--   <a>mySQLSettings_afterConnectScript</a> - Specifies a script to run
--   immediately after DMS connects to the endpoint. The migration task
--   continues running regardless if the SQL statement succeeds or fails.
--   
--   For this parameter, provide the code of the script itself, not the
--   name of a file containing the script.
--   
--   <a>$sel:secretsManagerSecretId:MySQLSettings'</a>,
--   <a>mySQLSettings_secretsManagerSecretId</a> - The full ARN, partial
--   ARN, or friendly name of the <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> that
--   contains the MySQL endpoint connection details.
--   
--   <a>$sel:serverTimezone:MySQLSettings'</a>,
--   <a>mySQLSettings_serverTimezone</a> - Specifies the time zone for the
--   source MySQL database.
--   
--   Example: <tt>serverTimezone=US/Pacific;</tt>
--   
--   Note: Do not enclose time zones in single quotes.
--   
--   <a>$sel:port:MySQLSettings'</a>, <a>mySQLSettings_port</a> - Endpoint
--   TCP port.
newMySQLSettings :: MySQLSettings

-- | Specifies the maximum size (in KB) of any .csv file used to transfer
--   data to a MySQL-compatible database.
--   
--   Example: <tt>maxFileSize=512</tt>
mySQLSettings_maxFileSize :: Lens' MySQLSettings (Maybe Int)

-- | Specifies where to migrate source tables on the target, either to a
--   single database or multiple databases.
--   
--   Example: <tt>targetDbType=MULTIPLE_DATABASES</tt>
mySQLSettings_targetDbType :: Lens' MySQLSettings (Maybe TargetDbType)

-- | Fully qualified domain name of the endpoint.
mySQLSettings_serverName :: Lens' MySQLSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | Adjusts the behavior of DMS when migrating from an SQL Server source
--   database that is hosted as part of an Always On availability group
--   cluster. If you need DMS to poll all the nodes in the Always On
--   cluster for transaction backups, set this attribute to <tt>false</tt>.
mySQLSettings_cleanSourceMetadataOnMismatch :: Lens' MySQLSettings (Maybe Bool)

-- | Improves performance when loading data into the MySQL-compatible
--   target database. Specifies how many threads to use to load the data
--   into the MySQL-compatible target database. Setting a large number of
--   threads can have an adverse effect on database performance, because a
--   separate connection is required for each thread.
--   
--   Example: <tt>parallelLoadThreads=1</tt>
mySQLSettings_parallelLoadThreads :: Lens' MySQLSettings (Maybe Int)

-- | The full Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role that specifies DMS
--   as the trusted entity and grants the required permissions to access
--   the value in <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt>. The role must allow the
--   <tt>iam:PassRole</tt> action. <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> has the
--   value of the Amazon Web Services Secrets Manager secret that allows
--   access to the MySQL endpoint.
--   
--   You can specify one of two sets of values for these permissions. You
--   can specify the values for this setting and
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecretId</tt>. Or you can specify clear-text values
--   for <tt>UserName</tt>, <tt>Password</tt>, <tt>ServerName</tt>, and
--   <tt>Port</tt>. You can't specify both. For more information on
--   creating this <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> and the
--   <tt>SecretsManagerAccessRoleArn</tt> and
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecretId</tt> required to access it, see <a>Using
--   secrets to access Database Migration Service resources</a> in the
--   <i>Database Migration Service User Guide</i>.
mySQLSettings_secretsManagerAccessRoleArn :: Lens' MySQLSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | Endpoint connection user name.
mySQLSettings_username :: Lens' MySQLSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | Endpoint connection password.
mySQLSettings_password :: Lens' MySQLSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies how often to check the binary log for new changes/events
--   when the database is idle.
--   
--   Example: <tt>eventsPollInterval=5;</tt>
--   
--   In the example, DMS checks for changes in the binary logs every five
--   seconds.
mySQLSettings_eventsPollInterval :: Lens' MySQLSettings (Maybe Int)

-- | Database name for the endpoint. For a MySQL source or target endpoint,
--   don't explicitly specify the database using the <tt>DatabaseName</tt>
--   request parameter on either the <tt>CreateEndpoint</tt> or
--   <tt>ModifyEndpoint</tt> API call. Specifying <tt>DatabaseName</tt>
--   when you create or modify a MySQL endpoint replicates all the task
--   tables to this single database. For MySQL endpoints, you specify the
--   database only when you specify the schema in the table-mapping rules
--   of the DMS task.
mySQLSettings_databaseName :: Lens' MySQLSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies a script to run immediately after DMS connects to the
--   endpoint. The migration task continues running regardless if the SQL
--   statement succeeds or fails.
--   
--   For this parameter, provide the code of the script itself, not the
--   name of a file containing the script.
mySQLSettings_afterConnectScript :: Lens' MySQLSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | The full ARN, partial ARN, or friendly name of the
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> that contains the MySQL endpoint
--   connection details.
mySQLSettings_secretsManagerSecretId :: Lens' MySQLSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the time zone for the source MySQL database.
--   
--   Example: <tt>serverTimezone=US/Pacific;</tt>
--   
--   Note: Do not enclose time zones in single quotes.
mySQLSettings_serverTimezone :: Lens' MySQLSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | Endpoint TCP port.
mySQLSettings_port :: Lens' MySQLSettings (Maybe Int)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.DMS.Types.MySQLSettings.MySQLSettings
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.DMS.Types.MySQLSettings.MySQLSettings
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.DMS.Types.MySQLSettings.MySQLSettings
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.DMS.Types.MySQLSettings.MySQLSettings
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.DMS.Types.MySQLSettings.MySQLSettings
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.DMS.Types.MySQLSettings.MySQLSettings
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.DMS.Types.MySQLSettings.MySQLSettings


module Network.AWS.DMS.Types.Endpoint

-- | Describes an endpoint of a database instance in response to operations
--   such as the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>CreateEndpoint</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>DescribeEndpoint</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>ModifyEndpoint</pre></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEndpoint</a> smart constructor.
data Endpoint
Endpoint' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe DmsTransferSettings -> Maybe MySQLSettings -> Maybe Text -> Maybe MicrosoftSQLServerSettings -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe DocDbSettings -> Maybe Text -> Maybe PostgreSQLSettings -> Maybe Text -> Maybe KafkaSettings -> Maybe OracleSettings -> Maybe ReplicationEndpointTypeValue -> Maybe RedshiftSettings -> Maybe ElasticsearchSettings -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe RedisSettings -> Maybe NeptuneSettings -> Maybe IBMDb2Settings -> Maybe Text -> Maybe MongoDbSettings -> Maybe DmsSslModeValue -> Maybe SybaseSettings -> Maybe Text -> Maybe S3Settings -> Maybe KinesisSettings -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe DynamoDbSettings -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Endpoint

-- | The status of the endpoint.
[$sel:status:Endpoint'] :: Endpoint -> Maybe Text

-- | The settings in JSON format for the DMS transfer type of source
--   endpoint.
--   
--   Possible settings include the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>ServiceAccessRoleArn</tt> - - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN)
--   used by the service access IAM role. The role must allow the
--   <tt>iam:PassRole</tt> action.</li>
--   <li><tt>BucketName</tt> - The name of the S3 bucket to use.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   Shorthand syntax for these settings is as follows:
--   <tt>ServiceAccessRoleArn=string,BucketName=string,</tt>
--   
--   JSON syntax for these settings is as follows: <tt>{
--   "ServiceAccessRoleArn": "string", "BucketName": "string"} </tt>
[$sel:dmsTransferSettings:Endpoint'] :: Endpoint -> Maybe DmsTransferSettings

-- | The settings for the MySQL source and target endpoint. For more
--   information, see the <tt>MySQLSettings</tt> structure.
[$sel:mySQLSettings:Endpoint'] :: Endpoint -> Maybe MySQLSettings

-- | The name of the server at the endpoint.
[$sel:serverName:Endpoint'] :: Endpoint -> Maybe Text

-- | The settings for the Microsoft SQL Server source and target endpoint.
--   For more information, see the <tt>MicrosoftSQLServerSettings</tt>
--   structure.
[$sel:microsoftSQLServerSettings:Endpoint'] :: Endpoint -> Maybe MicrosoftSQLServerSettings

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) used for SSL connection to the
--   endpoint.
[$sel:certificateArn:Endpoint'] :: Endpoint -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) used by the service to access the IAM
--   role. The role must allow the <tt>iam:PassRole</tt> action.
[$sel:serviceAccessRoleArn:Endpoint'] :: Endpoint -> Maybe Text
[$sel:docDbSettings:Endpoint'] :: Endpoint -> Maybe DocDbSettings

-- | The expanded name for the engine name. For example, if the
--   <tt>EngineName</tt> parameter is "aurora," this value would be "Amazon
--   Aurora MySQL."
[$sel:engineDisplayName:Endpoint'] :: Endpoint -> Maybe Text

-- | The settings for the PostgreSQL source and target endpoint. For more
--   information, see the <tt>PostgreSQLSettings</tt> structure.
[$sel:postgreSQLSettings:Endpoint'] :: Endpoint -> Maybe PostgreSQLSettings

-- | Additional connection attributes used to connect to the endpoint.
[$sel:extraConnectionAttributes:Endpoint'] :: Endpoint -> Maybe Text

-- | The settings for the Apache Kafka target endpoint. For more
--   information, see the <tt>KafkaSettings</tt> structure.
[$sel:kafkaSettings:Endpoint'] :: Endpoint -> Maybe KafkaSettings

-- | The settings for the Oracle source and target endpoint. For more
--   information, see the <tt>OracleSettings</tt> structure.
[$sel:oracleSettings:Endpoint'] :: Endpoint -> Maybe OracleSettings

-- | The type of endpoint. Valid values are <tt>source</tt> and
--   <tt>target</tt>.
[$sel:endpointType:Endpoint'] :: Endpoint -> Maybe ReplicationEndpointTypeValue

-- | Settings for the Amazon Redshift endpoint.
[$sel:redshiftSettings:Endpoint'] :: Endpoint -> Maybe RedshiftSettings

-- | The settings for the Elasticsearch source endpoint. For more
--   information, see the <tt>ElasticsearchSettings</tt> structure.
[$sel:elasticsearchSettings:Endpoint'] :: Endpoint -> Maybe ElasticsearchSettings

-- | The user name used to connect to the endpoint.
[$sel:username:Endpoint'] :: Endpoint -> Maybe Text

-- | The external table definition.
[$sel:externalTableDefinition:Endpoint'] :: Endpoint -> Maybe Text

-- | The database engine name. Valid values, depending on the EndpointType,
--   include <tt>"mysql"</tt>, <tt>"oracle"</tt>, <tt>"postgres"</tt>,
--   <tt>"mariadb"</tt>, <tt>"aurora"</tt>, <tt>"aurora-postgresql"</tt>,
--   <tt>"redshift"</tt>, <tt>"s3"</tt>, <tt>"db2"</tt>,
--   <tt>"azuredb"</tt>, <tt>"sybase"</tt>, <tt>"dynamodb"</tt>,
--   <tt>"mongodb"</tt>, <tt>"kinesis"</tt>, <tt>"kafka"</tt>,
--   <tt>"elasticsearch"</tt>, <tt>"documentdb"</tt>, <tt>"sqlserver"</tt>,
--   and <tt>"neptune"</tt>.
[$sel:engineName:Endpoint'] :: Endpoint -> Maybe Text

-- | The settings for the Redis target endpoint. For more information, see
--   the <tt>RedisSettings</tt> structure.
[$sel:redisSettings:Endpoint'] :: Endpoint -> Maybe RedisSettings

-- | The settings for the Amazon Neptune target endpoint. For more
--   information, see the <tt>NeptuneSettings</tt> structure.
[$sel:neptuneSettings:Endpoint'] :: Endpoint -> Maybe NeptuneSettings

-- | The settings for the IBM Db2 LUW source endpoint. For more
--   information, see the <tt>IBMDb2Settings</tt> structure.
[$sel:iBMDb2Settings:Endpoint'] :: Endpoint -> Maybe IBMDb2Settings

-- | An KMS key identifier that is used to encrypt the connection
--   parameters for the endpoint.
--   
--   If you don't specify a value for the <tt>KmsKeyId</tt> parameter, then
--   DMS uses your default encryption key.
--   
--   KMS creates the default encryption key for your Amazon Web Services
--   account. Your Amazon Web Services account has a different default
--   encryption key for each Amazon Web Services Region.
[$sel:kmsKeyId:Endpoint'] :: Endpoint -> Maybe Text

-- | The settings for the MongoDB source endpoint. For more information,
--   see the <tt>MongoDbSettings</tt> structure.
[$sel:mongoDbSettings:Endpoint'] :: Endpoint -> Maybe MongoDbSettings

-- | The SSL mode used to connect to the endpoint. The default value is
--   <tt>none</tt>.
[$sel:sslMode:Endpoint'] :: Endpoint -> Maybe DmsSslModeValue

-- | The settings for the SAP ASE source and target endpoint. For more
--   information, see the <tt>SybaseSettings</tt> structure.
[$sel:sybaseSettings:Endpoint'] :: Endpoint -> Maybe SybaseSettings

-- | The name of the database at the endpoint.
[$sel:databaseName:Endpoint'] :: Endpoint -> Maybe Text

-- | The settings for the S3 target endpoint. For more information, see the
--   <tt>S3Settings</tt> structure.
[$sel:s3Settings:Endpoint'] :: Endpoint -> Maybe S3Settings

-- | The settings for the Amazon Kinesis target endpoint. For more
--   information, see the <tt>KinesisSettings</tt> structure.
[$sel:kinesisSettings:Endpoint'] :: Endpoint -> Maybe KinesisSettings

-- | The database endpoint identifier. Identifiers must begin with a letter
--   and must contain only ASCII letters, digits, and hyphens. They can't
--   end with a hyphen or contain two consecutive hyphens.
[$sel:endpointIdentifier:Endpoint'] :: Endpoint -> Maybe Text

-- | Value returned by a call to CreateEndpoint that can be used for
--   cross-account validation. Use it on a subsequent call to
--   CreateEndpoint to create the endpoint with a cross-account.
[$sel:externalId:Endpoint'] :: Endpoint -> Maybe Text

-- | The settings for the DynamoDB target endpoint. For more information,
--   see the <tt>DynamoDBSettings</tt> structure.
[$sel:dynamoDbSettings:Endpoint'] :: Endpoint -> Maybe DynamoDbSettings

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) string that uniquely identifies the
--   endpoint.
[$sel:endpointArn:Endpoint'] :: Endpoint -> Maybe Text

-- | The port value used to access the endpoint.
[$sel:port:Endpoint'] :: Endpoint -> Maybe Int

-- | Create a value of <a>Endpoint</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:Endpoint'</a>, <a>endpoint_status</a> - The status of
--   the endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dmsTransferSettings:Endpoint'</a>,
--   <a>endpoint_dmsTransferSettings</a> - The settings in JSON format for
--   the DMS transfer type of source endpoint.
--   
--   Possible settings include the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>ServiceAccessRoleArn</tt> - - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN)
--   used by the service access IAM role. The role must allow the
--   <tt>iam:PassRole</tt> action.</li>
--   <li><tt>BucketName</tt> - The name of the S3 bucket to use.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   Shorthand syntax for these settings is as follows:
--   <tt>ServiceAccessRoleArn=string,BucketName=string,</tt>
--   
--   JSON syntax for these settings is as follows: <tt>{
--   "ServiceAccessRoleArn": "string", "BucketName": "string"} </tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:mySQLSettings:Endpoint'</a>, <a>endpoint_mySQLSettings</a> -
--   The settings for the MySQL source and target endpoint. For more
--   information, see the <tt>MySQLSettings</tt> structure.
--   
--   <a>$sel:serverName:Endpoint'</a>, <a>endpoint_serverName</a> - The
--   name of the server at the endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:microsoftSQLServerSettings:Endpoint'</a>,
--   <a>endpoint_microsoftSQLServerSettings</a> - The settings for the
--   Microsoft SQL Server source and target endpoint. For more information,
--   see the <tt>MicrosoftSQLServerSettings</tt> structure.
--   
--   <a>$sel:certificateArn:Endpoint'</a>, <a>endpoint_certificateArn</a> -
--   The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) used for SSL connection to the
--   endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:serviceAccessRoleArn:Endpoint'</a>,
--   <a>endpoint_serviceAccessRoleArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN)
--   used by the service to access the IAM role. The role must allow the
--   <tt>iam:PassRole</tt> action.
--   
--   <a>$sel:docDbSettings:Endpoint'</a>, <a>endpoint_docDbSettings</a> -
--   Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:engineDisplayName:Endpoint'</a>,
--   <a>endpoint_engineDisplayName</a> - The expanded name for the engine
--   name. For example, if the <tt>EngineName</tt> parameter is "aurora,"
--   this value would be "Amazon Aurora MySQL."
--   
--   <a>$sel:postgreSQLSettings:Endpoint'</a>,
--   <a>endpoint_postgreSQLSettings</a> - The settings for the PostgreSQL
--   source and target endpoint. For more information, see the
--   <tt>PostgreSQLSettings</tt> structure.
--   
--   <a>$sel:extraConnectionAttributes:Endpoint'</a>,
--   <a>endpoint_extraConnectionAttributes</a> - Additional connection
--   attributes used to connect to the endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:kafkaSettings:Endpoint'</a>, <a>endpoint_kafkaSettings</a> -
--   The settings for the Apache Kafka target endpoint. For more
--   information, see the <tt>KafkaSettings</tt> structure.
--   
--   <a>$sel:oracleSettings:Endpoint'</a>, <a>endpoint_oracleSettings</a> -
--   The settings for the Oracle source and target endpoint. For more
--   information, see the <tt>OracleSettings</tt> structure.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endpointType:Endpoint'</a>, <a>endpoint_endpointType</a> - The
--   type of endpoint. Valid values are <tt>source</tt> and
--   <tt>target</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:redshiftSettings:Endpoint'</a>,
--   <a>endpoint_redshiftSettings</a> - Settings for the Amazon Redshift
--   endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:elasticsearchSettings:Endpoint'</a>,
--   <a>endpoint_elasticsearchSettings</a> - The settings for the
--   Elasticsearch source endpoint. For more information, see the
--   <tt>ElasticsearchSettings</tt> structure.
--   
--   <a>$sel:username:Endpoint'</a>, <a>endpoint_username</a> - The user
--   name used to connect to the endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:externalTableDefinition:Endpoint'</a>,
--   <a>endpoint_externalTableDefinition</a> - The external table
--   definition.
--   
--   <a>$sel:engineName:Endpoint'</a>, <a>endpoint_engineName</a> - The
--   database engine name. Valid values, depending on the EndpointType,
--   include <tt>"mysql"</tt>, <tt>"oracle"</tt>, <tt>"postgres"</tt>,
--   <tt>"mariadb"</tt>, <tt>"aurora"</tt>, <tt>"aurora-postgresql"</tt>,
--   <tt>"redshift"</tt>, <tt>"s3"</tt>, <tt>"db2"</tt>,
--   <tt>"azuredb"</tt>, <tt>"sybase"</tt>, <tt>"dynamodb"</tt>,
--   <tt>"mongodb"</tt>, <tt>"kinesis"</tt>, <tt>"kafka"</tt>,
--   <tt>"elasticsearch"</tt>, <tt>"documentdb"</tt>, <tt>"sqlserver"</tt>,
--   and <tt>"neptune"</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:redisSettings:Endpoint'</a>, <a>endpoint_redisSettings</a> -
--   The settings for the Redis target endpoint. For more information, see
--   the <tt>RedisSettings</tt> structure.
--   
--   <a>$sel:neptuneSettings:Endpoint'</a>, <a>endpoint_neptuneSettings</a>
--   - The settings for the Amazon Neptune target endpoint. For more
--   information, see the <tt>NeptuneSettings</tt> structure.
--   
--   <a>$sel:iBMDb2Settings:Endpoint'</a>, <a>endpoint_iBMDb2Settings</a> -
--   The settings for the IBM Db2 LUW source endpoint. For more
--   information, see the <tt>IBMDb2Settings</tt> structure.
--   
--   <a>$sel:kmsKeyId:Endpoint'</a>, <a>endpoint_kmsKeyId</a> - An KMS key
--   identifier that is used to encrypt the connection parameters for the
--   endpoint.
--   
--   If you don't specify a value for the <tt>KmsKeyId</tt> parameter, then
--   DMS uses your default encryption key.
--   
--   KMS creates the default encryption key for your Amazon Web Services
--   account. Your Amazon Web Services account has a different default
--   encryption key for each Amazon Web Services Region.
--   
--   <a>$sel:mongoDbSettings:Endpoint'</a>, <a>endpoint_mongoDbSettings</a>
--   - The settings for the MongoDB source endpoint. For more information,
--   see the <tt>MongoDbSettings</tt> structure.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sslMode:Endpoint'</a>, <a>endpoint_sslMode</a> - The SSL mode
--   used to connect to the endpoint. The default value is <tt>none</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sybaseSettings:Endpoint'</a>, <a>endpoint_sybaseSettings</a> -
--   The settings for the SAP ASE source and target endpoint. For more
--   information, see the <tt>SybaseSettings</tt> structure.
--   
--   <a>$sel:databaseName:Endpoint'</a>, <a>endpoint_databaseName</a> - The
--   name of the database at the endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:s3Settings:Endpoint'</a>, <a>endpoint_s3Settings</a> - The
--   settings for the S3 target endpoint. For more information, see the
--   <tt>S3Settings</tt> structure.
--   
--   <a>$sel:kinesisSettings:Endpoint'</a>, <a>endpoint_kinesisSettings</a>
--   - The settings for the Amazon Kinesis target endpoint. For more
--   information, see the <tt>KinesisSettings</tt> structure.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endpointIdentifier:Endpoint'</a>,
--   <a>endpoint_endpointIdentifier</a> - The database endpoint identifier.
--   Identifiers must begin with a letter and must contain only ASCII
--   letters, digits, and hyphens. They can't end with a hyphen or contain
--   two consecutive hyphens.
--   
--   <a>$sel:externalId:Endpoint'</a>, <a>endpoint_externalId</a> - Value
--   returned by a call to CreateEndpoint that can be used for
--   cross-account validation. Use it on a subsequent call to
--   CreateEndpoint to create the endpoint with a cross-account.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dynamoDbSettings:Endpoint'</a>,
--   <a>endpoint_dynamoDbSettings</a> - The settings for the DynamoDB
--   target endpoint. For more information, see the
--   <tt>DynamoDBSettings</tt> structure.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endpointArn:Endpoint'</a>, <a>endpoint_endpointArn</a> - The
--   Amazon Resource Name (ARN) string that uniquely identifies the
--   endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:port:Endpoint'</a>, <a>endpoint_port</a> - The port value used
--   to access the endpoint.
newEndpoint :: Endpoint

-- | The status of the endpoint.
endpoint_status :: Lens' Endpoint (Maybe Text)

-- | The settings in JSON format for the DMS transfer type of source
--   endpoint.
--   
--   Possible settings include the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>ServiceAccessRoleArn</tt> - - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN)
--   used by the service access IAM role. The role must allow the
--   <tt>iam:PassRole</tt> action.</li>
--   <li><tt>BucketName</tt> - The name of the S3 bucket to use.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   Shorthand syntax for these settings is as follows:
--   <tt>ServiceAccessRoleArn=string,BucketName=string,</tt>
--   
--   JSON syntax for these settings is as follows: <tt>{
--   "ServiceAccessRoleArn": "string", "BucketName": "string"} </tt>
endpoint_dmsTransferSettings :: Lens' Endpoint (Maybe DmsTransferSettings)

-- | The settings for the MySQL source and target endpoint. For more
--   information, see the <tt>MySQLSettings</tt> structure.
endpoint_mySQLSettings :: Lens' Endpoint (Maybe MySQLSettings)

-- | The name of the server at the endpoint.
endpoint_serverName :: Lens' Endpoint (Maybe Text)

-- | The settings for the Microsoft SQL Server source and target endpoint.
--   For more information, see the <tt>MicrosoftSQLServerSettings</tt>
--   structure.
endpoint_microsoftSQLServerSettings :: Lens' Endpoint (Maybe MicrosoftSQLServerSettings)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) used for SSL connection to the
--   endpoint.
endpoint_certificateArn :: Lens' Endpoint (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) used by the service to access the IAM
--   role. The role must allow the <tt>iam:PassRole</tt> action.
endpoint_serviceAccessRoleArn :: Lens' Endpoint (Maybe Text)

-- | Undocumented member.
endpoint_docDbSettings :: Lens' Endpoint (Maybe DocDbSettings)

-- | The expanded name for the engine name. For example, if the
--   <tt>EngineName</tt> parameter is "aurora," this value would be "Amazon
--   Aurora MySQL."
endpoint_engineDisplayName :: Lens' Endpoint (Maybe Text)

-- | The settings for the PostgreSQL source and target endpoint. For more
--   information, see the <tt>PostgreSQLSettings</tt> structure.
endpoint_postgreSQLSettings :: Lens' Endpoint (Maybe PostgreSQLSettings)

-- | Additional connection attributes used to connect to the endpoint.
endpoint_extraConnectionAttributes :: Lens' Endpoint (Maybe Text)

-- | The settings for the Apache Kafka target endpoint. For more
--   information, see the <tt>KafkaSettings</tt> structure.
endpoint_kafkaSettings :: Lens' Endpoint (Maybe KafkaSettings)

-- | The settings for the Oracle source and target endpoint. For more
--   information, see the <tt>OracleSettings</tt> structure.
endpoint_oracleSettings :: Lens' Endpoint (Maybe OracleSettings)

-- | The type of endpoint. Valid values are <tt>source</tt> and
--   <tt>target</tt>.
endpoint_endpointType :: Lens' Endpoint (Maybe ReplicationEndpointTypeValue)

-- | Settings for the Amazon Redshift endpoint.
endpoint_redshiftSettings :: Lens' Endpoint (Maybe RedshiftSettings)

-- | The settings for the Elasticsearch source endpoint. For more
--   information, see the <tt>ElasticsearchSettings</tt> structure.
endpoint_elasticsearchSettings :: Lens' Endpoint (Maybe ElasticsearchSettings)

-- | The user name used to connect to the endpoint.
endpoint_username :: Lens' Endpoint (Maybe Text)

-- | The external table definition.
endpoint_externalTableDefinition :: Lens' Endpoint (Maybe Text)

-- | The database engine name. Valid values, depending on the EndpointType,
--   include <tt>"mysql"</tt>, <tt>"oracle"</tt>, <tt>"postgres"</tt>,
--   <tt>"mariadb"</tt>, <tt>"aurora"</tt>, <tt>"aurora-postgresql"</tt>,
--   <tt>"redshift"</tt>, <tt>"s3"</tt>, <tt>"db2"</tt>,
--   <tt>"azuredb"</tt>, <tt>"sybase"</tt>, <tt>"dynamodb"</tt>,
--   <tt>"mongodb"</tt>, <tt>"kinesis"</tt>, <tt>"kafka"</tt>,
--   <tt>"elasticsearch"</tt>, <tt>"documentdb"</tt>, <tt>"sqlserver"</tt>,
--   and <tt>"neptune"</tt>.
endpoint_engineName :: Lens' Endpoint (Maybe Text)

-- | The settings for the Redis target endpoint. For more information, see
--   the <tt>RedisSettings</tt> structure.
endpoint_redisSettings :: Lens' Endpoint (Maybe RedisSettings)

-- | The settings for the Amazon Neptune target endpoint. For more
--   information, see the <tt>NeptuneSettings</tt> structure.
endpoint_neptuneSettings :: Lens' Endpoint (Maybe NeptuneSettings)

-- | The settings for the IBM Db2 LUW source endpoint. For more
--   information, see the <tt>IBMDb2Settings</tt> structure.
endpoint_iBMDb2Settings :: Lens' Endpoint (Maybe IBMDb2Settings)

-- | An KMS key identifier that is used to encrypt the connection
--   parameters for the endpoint.
--   
--   If you don't specify a value for the <tt>KmsKeyId</tt> parameter, then
--   DMS uses your default encryption key.
--   
--   KMS creates the default encryption key for your Amazon Web Services
--   account. Your Amazon Web Services account has a different default
--   encryption key for each Amazon Web Services Region.
endpoint_kmsKeyId :: Lens' Endpoint (Maybe Text)

-- | The settings for the MongoDB source endpoint. For more information,
--   see the <tt>MongoDbSettings</tt> structure.
endpoint_mongoDbSettings :: Lens' Endpoint (Maybe MongoDbSettings)

-- | The SSL mode used to connect to the endpoint. The default value is
--   <tt>none</tt>.
endpoint_sslMode :: Lens' Endpoint (Maybe DmsSslModeValue)

-- | The settings for the SAP ASE source and target endpoint. For more
--   information, see the <tt>SybaseSettings</tt> structure.
endpoint_sybaseSettings :: Lens' Endpoint (Maybe SybaseSettings)

-- | The name of the database at the endpoint.
endpoint_databaseName :: Lens' Endpoint (Maybe Text)

-- | The settings for the S3 target endpoint. For more information, see the
--   <tt>S3Settings</tt> structure.
endpoint_s3Settings :: Lens' Endpoint (Maybe S3Settings)

-- | The settings for the Amazon Kinesis target endpoint. For more
--   information, see the <tt>KinesisSettings</tt> structure.
endpoint_kinesisSettings :: Lens' Endpoint (Maybe KinesisSettings)

-- | The database endpoint identifier. Identifiers must begin with a letter
--   and must contain only ASCII letters, digits, and hyphens. They can't
--   end with a hyphen or contain two consecutive hyphens.
endpoint_endpointIdentifier :: Lens' Endpoint (Maybe Text)

-- | Value returned by a call to CreateEndpoint that can be used for
--   cross-account validation. Use it on a subsequent call to
--   CreateEndpoint to create the endpoint with a cross-account.
endpoint_externalId :: Lens' Endpoint (Maybe Text)

-- | The settings for the DynamoDB target endpoint. For more information,
--   see the <tt>DynamoDBSettings</tt> structure.
endpoint_dynamoDbSettings :: Lens' Endpoint (Maybe DynamoDbSettings)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) string that uniquely identifies the
--   endpoint.
endpoint_endpointArn :: Lens' Endpoint (Maybe Text)

-- | The port value used to access the endpoint.
endpoint_port :: Lens' Endpoint (Maybe Int)

instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.DMS.Types.Endpoint.Endpoint
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.DMS.Types.Endpoint.Endpoint
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.DMS.Types.Endpoint.Endpoint
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.DMS.Types.Endpoint.Endpoint
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.DMS.Types.Endpoint.Endpoint


module Network.AWS.DMS.Types.VpcSecurityGroupMembership

-- | Describes the status of a security group associated with the virtual
--   private cloud (VPC) hosting your replication and DB instances.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newVpcSecurityGroupMembership</a> smart constructor.
data VpcSecurityGroupMembership
VpcSecurityGroupMembership' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> VpcSecurityGroupMembership

-- | The status of the VPC security group.
[$sel:status:VpcSecurityGroupMembership'] :: VpcSecurityGroupMembership -> Maybe Text

-- | The VPC security group ID.
[$sel:vpcSecurityGroupId:VpcSecurityGroupMembership'] :: VpcSecurityGroupMembership -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>VpcSecurityGroupMembership</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:VpcSecurityGroupMembership'</a>,
--   <a>vpcSecurityGroupMembership_status</a> - The status of the VPC
--   security group.
--   
--   <a>$sel:vpcSecurityGroupId:VpcSecurityGroupMembership'</a>,
--   <a>vpcSecurityGroupMembership_vpcSecurityGroupId</a> - The VPC
--   security group ID.
newVpcSecurityGroupMembership :: VpcSecurityGroupMembership

-- | The status of the VPC security group.
vpcSecurityGroupMembership_status :: Lens' VpcSecurityGroupMembership (Maybe Text)

-- | The VPC security group ID.
vpcSecurityGroupMembership_vpcSecurityGroupId :: Lens' VpcSecurityGroupMembership (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.DMS.Types.VpcSecurityGroupMembership.VpcSecurityGroupMembership
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.DMS.Types.VpcSecurityGroupMembership.VpcSecurityGroupMembership
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.DMS.Types.VpcSecurityGroupMembership.VpcSecurityGroupMembership
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.DMS.Types.VpcSecurityGroupMembership.VpcSecurityGroupMembership
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.DMS.Types.VpcSecurityGroupMembership.VpcSecurityGroupMembership
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.DMS.Types.VpcSecurityGroupMembership.VpcSecurityGroupMembership
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.DMS.Types.VpcSecurityGroupMembership.VpcSecurityGroupMembership


module Network.AWS.DMS.Types.ReplicationInstance

-- | Provides information that defines a replication instance.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newReplicationInstance</a> smart constructor.
data ReplicationInstance
ReplicationInstance' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe ReplicationSubnetGroup -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [VpcSecurityGroupMembership] -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ReplicationPendingModifiedValues -> ReplicationInstance

-- | The engine version number of the replication instance.
--   
--   If an engine version number is not specified when a replication
--   instance is created, the default is the latest engine version
--   available.
--   
--   When modifying a major engine version of an instance, also set
--   <tt>AllowMajorVersionUpgrade</tt> to <tt>true</tt>.
[$sel:engineVersion:ReplicationInstance'] :: ReplicationInstance -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies the accessibility options for the replication instance. A
--   value of <tt>true</tt> represents an instance with a public IP
--   address. A value of <tt>false</tt> represents an instance with a
--   private IP address. The default value is <tt>true</tt>.
[$sel:publiclyAccessible:ReplicationInstance'] :: ReplicationInstance -> Maybe Bool

-- | Boolean value indicating if minor version upgrades will be
--   automatically applied to the instance.
[$sel:autoMinorVersionUpgrade:ReplicationInstance'] :: ReplicationInstance -> Maybe Bool

-- | One or more public IP addresses for the replication instance.
[$sel:replicationInstancePublicIpAddresses:ReplicationInstance'] :: ReplicationInstance -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The subnet group for the replication instance.
[$sel:replicationSubnetGroup:ReplicationInstance'] :: ReplicationInstance -> Maybe ReplicationSubnetGroup

-- | The time the replication instance was created.
[$sel:instanceCreateTime:ReplicationInstance'] :: ReplicationInstance -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The expiration date of the free replication instance that is part of
--   the Free DMS program.
[$sel:freeUntil:ReplicationInstance'] :: ReplicationInstance -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The status of the replication instance. The possible return values
--   include:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>"available"</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>"creating"</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>"deleted"</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>"deleting"</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>"failed"</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>"modifying"</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>"upgrading"</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>"rebooting"</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>"resetting-master-credentials"</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>"storage-full"</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>"incompatible-credentials"</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>"incompatible-network"</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>"maintenance"</pre></li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:replicationInstanceStatus:ReplicationInstance'] :: ReplicationInstance -> Maybe Text

-- | One or more private IP addresses for the replication instance.
[$sel:replicationInstancePrivateIpAddresses:ReplicationInstance'] :: ReplicationInstance -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The maintenance window times for the replication instance. Any pending
--   upgrades to the replication instance are performed during this time.
[$sel:preferredMaintenanceWindow:ReplicationInstance'] :: ReplicationInstance -> Maybe Text

-- | The private IP address of the replication instance.
[$sel:replicationInstancePrivateIpAddress:ReplicationInstance'] :: ReplicationInstance -> Maybe Text

-- | An KMS key identifier that is used to encrypt the data on the
--   replication instance.
--   
--   If you don't specify a value for the <tt>KmsKeyId</tt> parameter, then
--   DMS uses your default encryption key.
--   
--   KMS creates the default encryption key for your Amazon Web Services
--   account. Your Amazon Web Services account has a different default
--   encryption key for each Amazon Web Services Region.
[$sel:kmsKeyId:ReplicationInstance'] :: ReplicationInstance -> Maybe Text

-- | The Availability Zone for the instance.
[$sel:availabilityZone:ReplicationInstance'] :: ReplicationInstance -> Maybe Text

-- | The VPC security group for the instance.
[$sel:vpcSecurityGroups:ReplicationInstance'] :: ReplicationInstance -> Maybe [VpcSecurityGroupMembership]

-- | Specifies whether the replication instance is a Multi-AZ deployment.
--   You can't set the <tt>AvailabilityZone</tt> parameter if the Multi-AZ
--   parameter is set to <tt>true</tt>.
[$sel:multiAZ:ReplicationInstance'] :: ReplicationInstance -> Maybe Bool

-- | The Availability Zone of the standby replication instance in a
--   Multi-AZ deployment.
[$sel:secondaryAvailabilityZone:ReplicationInstance'] :: ReplicationInstance -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the replication instance.
[$sel:replicationInstanceArn:ReplicationInstance'] :: ReplicationInstance -> Maybe Text

-- | The amount of storage (in gigabytes) that is allocated for the
--   replication instance.
[$sel:allocatedStorage:ReplicationInstance'] :: ReplicationInstance -> Maybe Int

-- | The DNS name servers supported for the replication instance to access
--   your on-premise source or target database.
[$sel:dnsNameServers:ReplicationInstance'] :: ReplicationInstance -> Maybe Text

-- | The public IP address of the replication instance.
[$sel:replicationInstancePublicIpAddress:ReplicationInstance'] :: ReplicationInstance -> Maybe Text

-- | The compute and memory capacity of the replication instance as defined
--   for the specified replication instance class. It is a required
--   parameter, although a default value is pre-selected in the DMS
--   console.
--   
--   For more information on the settings and capacities for the available
--   replication instance classes, see <a>Selecting the right DMS
--   replication instance for your migration</a>.
[$sel:replicationInstanceClass:ReplicationInstance'] :: ReplicationInstance -> Maybe Text

-- | The replication instance identifier is a required parameter. This
--   parameter is stored as a lowercase string.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Must contain 1-63 alphanumeric characters or hyphens.</li>
--   <li>First character must be a letter.</li>
--   <li>Cannot end with a hyphen or contain two consecutive hyphens.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   Example: <tt>myrepinstance</tt>
[$sel:replicationInstanceIdentifier:ReplicationInstance'] :: ReplicationInstance -> Maybe Text

-- | The pending modification values.
[$sel:pendingModifiedValues:ReplicationInstance'] :: ReplicationInstance -> Maybe ReplicationPendingModifiedValues

-- | Create a value of <a>ReplicationInstance</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:engineVersion:ReplicationInstance'</a>,
--   <a>replicationInstance_engineVersion</a> - The engine version number
--   of the replication instance.
--   
--   If an engine version number is not specified when a replication
--   instance is created, the default is the latest engine version
--   available.
--   
--   When modifying a major engine version of an instance, also set
--   <tt>AllowMajorVersionUpgrade</tt> to <tt>true</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:publiclyAccessible:ReplicationInstance'</a>,
--   <a>replicationInstance_publiclyAccessible</a> - Specifies the
--   accessibility options for the replication instance. A value of
--   <tt>true</tt> represents an instance with a public IP address. A value
--   of <tt>false</tt> represents an instance with a private IP address.
--   The default value is <tt>true</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:autoMinorVersionUpgrade:ReplicationInstance'</a>,
--   <a>replicationInstance_autoMinorVersionUpgrade</a> - Boolean value
--   indicating if minor version upgrades will be automatically applied to
--   the instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:replicationInstancePublicIpAddresses:ReplicationInstance'</a>,
--   <a>replicationInstance_replicationInstancePublicIpAddresses</a> - One
--   or more public IP addresses for the replication instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:replicationSubnetGroup:ReplicationInstance'</a>,
--   <a>replicationInstance_replicationSubnetGroup</a> - The subnet group
--   for the replication instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:instanceCreateTime:ReplicationInstance'</a>,
--   <a>replicationInstance_instanceCreateTime</a> - The time the
--   replication instance was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:freeUntil:ReplicationInstance'</a>,
--   <a>replicationInstance_freeUntil</a> - The expiration date of the free
--   replication instance that is part of the Free DMS program.
--   
--   <a>$sel:replicationInstanceStatus:ReplicationInstance'</a>,
--   <a>replicationInstance_replicationInstanceStatus</a> - The status of
--   the replication instance. The possible return values include:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>"available"</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>"creating"</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>"deleted"</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>"deleting"</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>"failed"</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>"modifying"</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>"upgrading"</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>"rebooting"</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>"resetting-master-credentials"</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>"storage-full"</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>"incompatible-credentials"</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>"incompatible-network"</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>"maintenance"</pre></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:replicationInstancePrivateIpAddresses:ReplicationInstance'</a>,
--   <a>replicationInstance_replicationInstancePrivateIpAddresses</a> - One
--   or more private IP addresses for the replication instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:preferredMaintenanceWindow:ReplicationInstance'</a>,
--   <a>replicationInstance_preferredMaintenanceWindow</a> - The
--   maintenance window times for the replication instance. Any pending
--   upgrades to the replication instance are performed during this time.
--   
--   <a>$sel:replicationInstancePrivateIpAddress:ReplicationInstance'</a>,
--   <a>replicationInstance_replicationInstancePrivateIpAddress</a> - The
--   private IP address of the replication instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:kmsKeyId:ReplicationInstance'</a>,
--   <a>replicationInstance_kmsKeyId</a> - An KMS key identifier that is
--   used to encrypt the data on the replication instance.
--   
--   If you don't specify a value for the <tt>KmsKeyId</tt> parameter, then
--   DMS uses your default encryption key.
--   
--   KMS creates the default encryption key for your Amazon Web Services
--   account. Your Amazon Web Services account has a different default
--   encryption key for each Amazon Web Services Region.
--   
--   <a>$sel:availabilityZone:ReplicationInstance'</a>,
--   <a>replicationInstance_availabilityZone</a> - The Availability Zone
--   for the instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:vpcSecurityGroups:ReplicationInstance'</a>,
--   <a>replicationInstance_vpcSecurityGroups</a> - The VPC security group
--   for the instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:multiAZ:ReplicationInstance'</a>,
--   <a>replicationInstance_multiAZ</a> - Specifies whether the replication
--   instance is a Multi-AZ deployment. You can't set the
--   <tt>AvailabilityZone</tt> parameter if the Multi-AZ parameter is set
--   to <tt>true</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:secondaryAvailabilityZone:ReplicationInstance'</a>,
--   <a>replicationInstance_secondaryAvailabilityZone</a> - The
--   Availability Zone of the standby replication instance in a Multi-AZ
--   deployment.
--   
--   <a>$sel:replicationInstanceArn:ReplicationInstance'</a>,
--   <a>replicationInstance_replicationInstanceArn</a> - The Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN) of the replication instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:allocatedStorage:ReplicationInstance'</a>,
--   <a>replicationInstance_allocatedStorage</a> - The amount of storage
--   (in gigabytes) that is allocated for the replication instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dnsNameServers:ReplicationInstance'</a>,
--   <a>replicationInstance_dnsNameServers</a> - The DNS name servers
--   supported for the replication instance to access your on-premise
--   source or target database.
--   
--   <a>$sel:replicationInstancePublicIpAddress:ReplicationInstance'</a>,
--   <a>replicationInstance_replicationInstancePublicIpAddress</a> - The
--   public IP address of the replication instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:replicationInstanceClass:ReplicationInstance'</a>,
--   <a>replicationInstance_replicationInstanceClass</a> - The compute and
--   memory capacity of the replication instance as defined for the
--   specified replication instance class. It is a required parameter,
--   although a default value is pre-selected in the DMS console.
--   
--   For more information on the settings and capacities for the available
--   replication instance classes, see <a>Selecting the right DMS
--   replication instance for your migration</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:replicationInstanceIdentifier:ReplicationInstance'</a>,
--   <a>replicationInstance_replicationInstanceIdentifier</a> - The
--   replication instance identifier is a required parameter. This
--   parameter is stored as a lowercase string.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Must contain 1-63 alphanumeric characters or hyphens.</li>
--   <li>First character must be a letter.</li>
--   <li>Cannot end with a hyphen or contain two consecutive hyphens.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   Example: <tt>myrepinstance</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:pendingModifiedValues:ReplicationInstance'</a>,
--   <a>replicationInstance_pendingModifiedValues</a> - The pending
--   modification values.
newReplicationInstance :: ReplicationInstance

-- | The engine version number of the replication instance.
--   
--   If an engine version number is not specified when a replication
--   instance is created, the default is the latest engine version
--   available.
--   
--   When modifying a major engine version of an instance, also set
--   <tt>AllowMajorVersionUpgrade</tt> to <tt>true</tt>.
replicationInstance_engineVersion :: Lens' ReplicationInstance (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the accessibility options for the replication instance. A
--   value of <tt>true</tt> represents an instance with a public IP
--   address. A value of <tt>false</tt> represents an instance with a
--   private IP address. The default value is <tt>true</tt>.
replicationInstance_publiclyAccessible :: Lens' ReplicationInstance (Maybe Bool)

-- | Boolean value indicating if minor version upgrades will be
--   automatically applied to the instance.
replicationInstance_autoMinorVersionUpgrade :: Lens' ReplicationInstance (Maybe Bool)

-- | One or more public IP addresses for the replication instance.
replicationInstance_replicationInstancePublicIpAddresses :: Lens' ReplicationInstance (Maybe [Text])

-- | The subnet group for the replication instance.
replicationInstance_replicationSubnetGroup :: Lens' ReplicationInstance (Maybe ReplicationSubnetGroup)

-- | The time the replication instance was created.
replicationInstance_instanceCreateTime :: Lens' ReplicationInstance (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The expiration date of the free replication instance that is part of
--   the Free DMS program.
replicationInstance_freeUntil :: Lens' ReplicationInstance (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The status of the replication instance. The possible return values
--   include:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>"available"</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>"creating"</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>"deleted"</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>"deleting"</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>"failed"</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>"modifying"</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>"upgrading"</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>"rebooting"</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>"resetting-master-credentials"</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>"storage-full"</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>"incompatible-credentials"</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>"incompatible-network"</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>"maintenance"</pre></li>
--   </ul>
replicationInstance_replicationInstanceStatus :: Lens' ReplicationInstance (Maybe Text)

-- | One or more private IP addresses for the replication instance.
replicationInstance_replicationInstancePrivateIpAddresses :: Lens' ReplicationInstance (Maybe [Text])

-- | The maintenance window times for the replication instance. Any pending
--   upgrades to the replication instance are performed during this time.
replicationInstance_preferredMaintenanceWindow :: Lens' ReplicationInstance (Maybe Text)

-- | The private IP address of the replication instance.
replicationInstance_replicationInstancePrivateIpAddress :: Lens' ReplicationInstance (Maybe Text)

-- | An KMS key identifier that is used to encrypt the data on the
--   replication instance.
--   
--   If you don't specify a value for the <tt>KmsKeyId</tt> parameter, then
--   DMS uses your default encryption key.
--   
--   KMS creates the default encryption key for your Amazon Web Services
--   account. Your Amazon Web Services account has a different default
--   encryption key for each Amazon Web Services Region.
replicationInstance_kmsKeyId :: Lens' ReplicationInstance (Maybe Text)

-- | The Availability Zone for the instance.
replicationInstance_availabilityZone :: Lens' ReplicationInstance (Maybe Text)

-- | The VPC security group for the instance.
replicationInstance_vpcSecurityGroups :: Lens' ReplicationInstance (Maybe [VpcSecurityGroupMembership])

-- | Specifies whether the replication instance is a Multi-AZ deployment.
--   You can't set the <tt>AvailabilityZone</tt> parameter if the Multi-AZ
--   parameter is set to <tt>true</tt>.
replicationInstance_multiAZ :: Lens' ReplicationInstance (Maybe Bool)

-- | The Availability Zone of the standby replication instance in a
--   Multi-AZ deployment.
replicationInstance_secondaryAvailabilityZone :: Lens' ReplicationInstance (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the replication instance.
replicationInstance_replicationInstanceArn :: Lens' ReplicationInstance (Maybe Text)

-- | The amount of storage (in gigabytes) that is allocated for the
--   replication instance.
replicationInstance_allocatedStorage :: Lens' ReplicationInstance (Maybe Int)

-- | The DNS name servers supported for the replication instance to access
--   your on-premise source or target database.
replicationInstance_dnsNameServers :: Lens' ReplicationInstance (Maybe Text)

-- | The public IP address of the replication instance.
replicationInstance_replicationInstancePublicIpAddress :: Lens' ReplicationInstance (Maybe Text)

-- | The compute and memory capacity of the replication instance as defined
--   for the specified replication instance class. It is a required
--   parameter, although a default value is pre-selected in the DMS
--   console.
--   
--   For more information on the settings and capacities for the available
--   replication instance classes, see <a>Selecting the right DMS
--   replication instance for your migration</a>.
replicationInstance_replicationInstanceClass :: Lens' ReplicationInstance (Maybe Text)

-- | The replication instance identifier is a required parameter. This
--   parameter is stored as a lowercase string.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Must contain 1-63 alphanumeric characters or hyphens.</li>
--   <li>First character must be a letter.</li>
--   <li>Cannot end with a hyphen or contain two consecutive hyphens.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   Example: <tt>myrepinstance</tt>
replicationInstance_replicationInstanceIdentifier :: Lens' ReplicationInstance (Maybe Text)

-- | The pending modification values.
replicationInstance_pendingModifiedValues :: Lens' ReplicationInstance (Maybe ReplicationPendingModifiedValues)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.DMS.Types.ReplicationInstance.ReplicationInstance
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.DMS.Types.ReplicationInstance.ReplicationInstance
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.DMS.Types.ReplicationInstance.ReplicationInstance
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.DMS.Types.ReplicationInstance.ReplicationInstance
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.DMS.Types.ReplicationInstance.ReplicationInstance
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.DMS.Types.ReplicationInstance.ReplicationInstance
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.DMS.Types.ReplicationInstance.ReplicationInstance


module Network.AWS.DMS.Types

-- | API version <tt>2016-01-01</tt> of the Amazon Database Migration
--   Service SDK configuration.
defaultService :: Service

-- | The ciphertext references a key that doesn't exist or that the DMS
--   account doesn't have access to.
_KMSAccessDeniedFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The specified master key (CMK) isn't enabled.
_KMSDisabledFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | An Key Management Service (KMS) error is preventing access to KMS.
_KMSFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The subnet provided is invalid.
_InvalidSubnet :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | DMS cannot access the KMS key.
_KMSKeyNotAccessibleFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The replication subnet group does not cover enough Availability Zones
--   (AZs). Edit the replication subnet group and add more AZs.
_ReplicationSubnetGroupDoesNotCoverEnoughAZs :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | A specified Amazon S3 bucket, bucket folder, or other object can't be
--   found.
_S3ResourceNotFoundFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The resource is in a state that prevents it from being used for
--   database migration.
_InvalidResourceStateFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The certificate was not valid.
_InvalidCertificateFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | You are not authorized for the SNS subscription.
_SNSNoAuthorizationFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The resource you are attempting to create already exists.
_ResourceAlreadyExistsFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | There are not enough resources allocated to the database migration.
_InsufficientResourceCapacityFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Insufficient privileges are preventing access to an Amazon S3 object.
_S3AccessDeniedFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The SNS topic is invalid.
_SNSInvalidTopicFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The specified KMS entity or resource can't be found.
_KMSNotFoundFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | This request triggered KMS request throttling.
_KMSThrottlingFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The quota for this resource quota has been exceeded.
_ResourceQuotaExceededFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | An upgrade dependency is preventing the database migration.
_UpgradeDependencyFailureFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The resource could not be found.
_ResourceNotFoundFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The storage quota has been exceeded.
_StorageQuotaExceededFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | DMS was denied access to the endpoint. Check that the role is
--   correctly configured.
_AccessDeniedFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The specified subnet is already in use.
_SubnetAlreadyInUse :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The state of the specified KMS resource isn't valid for this request.
_KMSInvalidStateFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError
