-- | Describes a quota for an Amazon Web Services account, for example the
--   number of replication instances allowed.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAccountQuota</a> smart constructor.
data AccountQuota
AccountQuota' :: Maybe Integer -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Text -> AccountQuota

-- | The maximum allowed value for the quota.
[$sel:max:AccountQuota'] :: AccountQuota -> Maybe Integer

-- | The amount currently used toward the quota maximum.
[$sel:used:AccountQuota'] :: AccountQuota -> Maybe Integer

-- | The name of the DMS quota for this Amazon Web Services account.
[$sel:accountQuotaName:AccountQuota'] :: AccountQuota -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>AccountQuota</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:max:AccountQuota'</a>, <a>accountQuota_max</a> - The maximum
--   allowed value for the quota.
--   
--   <a>$sel:used:AccountQuota'</a>, <a>accountQuota_used</a> - The amount
--   currently used toward the quota maximum.
--   
--   <a>$sel:accountQuotaName:AccountQuota'</a>,
--   <a>accountQuota_accountQuotaName</a> - The name of the DMS quota for
--   this Amazon Web Services account.
newAccountQuota :: AccountQuota

-- | The maximum allowed value for the quota.
accountQuota_max :: Lens' AccountQuota (Maybe Integer)

-- | The amount currently used toward the quota maximum.
accountQuota_used :: Lens' AccountQuota (Maybe Integer)

-- | The name of the DMS quota for this Amazon Web Services account.
accountQuota_accountQuotaName :: Lens' AccountQuota (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of an Availability Zone for use during database migration.
--   <tt>AvailabilityZone</tt> is an optional parameter to the
--   <a>CreateReplicationInstance</a> operation, and itâ€™s value relates to
--   the Amazon Web Services Region of an endpoint. For example, the
--   availability zone of an endpoint in the us-east-1 region might be
--   us-east-1a, us-east-1b, us-east-1c, or us-east-1d.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAvailabilityZone</a> smart constructor.
data AvailabilityZone
AvailabilityZone' :: Maybe Text -> AvailabilityZone

-- | The name of the Availability Zone.
[$sel:name:AvailabilityZone'] :: AvailabilityZone -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>AvailabilityZone</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:AvailabilityZone'</a>, <a>availabilityZone_name</a> - The
--   name of the Availability Zone.
newAvailabilityZone :: AvailabilityZone

-- | The name of the Availability Zone.
availabilityZone_name :: Lens' AvailabilityZone (Maybe Text)

-- | The SSL certificate that can be used to encrypt connections between
--   the endpoints and the replication instance.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCertificate</a> smart constructor.
data Certificate
Certificate' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Base64 -> Maybe Int -> Maybe POSIX -> Certificate

-- | The owner of the certificate.
[$sel:certificateOwner:Certificate'] :: Certificate -> Maybe Text

-- | The signing algorithm for the certificate.
[$sel:signingAlgorithm:Certificate'] :: Certificate -> Maybe Text

-- | The beginning date that the certificate is valid.
[$sel:validFromDate:Certificate'] :: Certificate -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The contents of a <tt>.pem</tt> file, which contains an X.509
--   certificate.
[$sel:certificatePem:Certificate'] :: Certificate -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the certificate.
[$sel:certificateArn:Certificate'] :: Certificate -> Maybe Text

-- | The date that the certificate was created.
[$sel:certificateCreationDate:Certificate'] :: Certificate -> Maybe POSIX

-- | A customer-assigned name for the certificate. Identifiers must begin
--   with a letter and must contain only ASCII letters, digits, and
--   hyphens. They can't end with a hyphen or contain two consecutive
--   hyphens.
[$sel:certificateIdentifier:Certificate'] :: Certificate -> Maybe Text

-- | The location of an imported Oracle Wallet certificate for use with
--   SSL.
[$sel:certificateWallet:Certificate'] :: Certificate -> Maybe Base64

-- | The key length of the cryptographic algorithm being used.
[$sel:keyLength:Certificate'] :: Certificate -> Maybe Int

-- | The final date that the certificate is valid.
[$sel:validToDate:Certificate'] :: Certificate -> Maybe POSIX

-- | Create a value of <a>Certificate</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:certificateOwner:Certificate'</a>,
--   <a>certificate_certificateOwner</a> - The owner of the certificate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:signingAlgorithm:Certificate'</a>,
--   <a>certificate_signingAlgorithm</a> - The signing algorithm for the
--   certificate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:validFromDate:Certificate'</a>,
--   <a>certificate_validFromDate</a> - The beginning date that the
--   certificate is valid.
--   
--   <a>$sel:certificatePem:Certificate'</a>,
--   <a>certificate_certificatePem</a> - The contents of a <tt>.pem</tt>
--   file, which contains an X.509 certificate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:certificateArn:Certificate'</a>,
--   <a>certificate_certificateArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for
--   the certificate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:certificateCreationDate:Certificate'</a>,
--   <a>certificate_certificateCreationDate</a> - The date that the
--   certificate was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:certificateIdentifier:Certificate'</a>,
--   <a>certificate_certificateIdentifier</a> - A customer-assigned name
--   for the certificate. Identifiers must begin with a letter and must
--   contain only ASCII letters, digits, and hyphens. They can't end with a
--   hyphen or contain two consecutive hyphens.
--   
--   <a>$sel:certificateWallet:Certificate'</a>,
--   <a>certificate_certificateWallet</a> - The location of an imported
--   Oracle Wallet certificate for use with SSL.-- -- <i>Note:</i> This
--   <tt>Lens</tt> automatically encodes and decodes Base64 data. -- The
--   underlying isomorphism will encode to Base64 representation during --
--   serialisation, and decode from Base64 representation during
--   deserialisation. -- This <tt>Lens</tt> accepts and returns only raw
--   unencoded data.
--   
--   <a>$sel:keyLength:Certificate'</a>, <a>certificate_keyLength</a> - The
--   key length of the cryptographic algorithm being used.
--   
--   <a>$sel:validToDate:Certificate'</a>, <a>certificate_validToDate</a> -
--   The final date that the certificate is valid.
newCertificate :: Certificate

-- | The owner of the certificate.
certificate_certificateOwner :: Lens' Certificate (Maybe Text)

-- | The signing algorithm for the certificate.
certificate_signingAlgorithm :: Lens' Certificate (Maybe Text)

-- | The beginning date that the certificate is valid.
certificate_validFromDate :: Lens' Certificate (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The contents of a <tt>.pem</tt> file, which contains an X.509
--   certificate.
certificate_certificatePem :: Lens' Certificate (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the certificate.
certificate_certificateArn :: Lens' Certificate (Maybe Text)

-- | The date that the certificate was created.
certificate_certificateCreationDate :: Lens' Certificate (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | A customer-assigned name for the certificate. Identifiers must begin
--   with a letter and must contain only ASCII letters, digits, and
--   hyphens. They can't end with a hyphen or contain two consecutive
--   hyphens.
certificate_certificateIdentifier :: Lens' Certificate (Maybe Text)

-- | The location of an imported Oracle Wallet certificate for use with
--   SSL.-- -- <i>Note:</i> This <tt>Lens</tt> automatically encodes and
--   decodes Base64 data. -- The underlying isomorphism will encode to
--   Base64 representation during -- serialisation, and decode from Base64
--   representation during deserialisation. -- This <tt>Lens</tt> accepts
--   and returns only raw unencoded data.
certificate_certificateWallet :: Lens' Certificate (Maybe ByteString)

-- | The key length of the cryptographic algorithm being used.
certificate_keyLength :: Lens' Certificate (Maybe Int)

-- | The final date that the certificate is valid.
certificate_validToDate :: Lens' Certificate (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | Status of the connection between an endpoint and a replication
--   instance, including Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) and the last error
--   message issued.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newConnection</a> smart constructor.
data Connection
Connection' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Connection

-- | The connection status. This parameter can return one of the following
--   values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>"successful"</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>"testing"</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>"failed"</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>"deleting"</pre></li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:status:Connection'] :: Connection -> Maybe Text

-- | The ARN of the replication instance.
[$sel:replicationInstanceArn:Connection'] :: Connection -> Maybe Text

-- | The identifier of the endpoint. Identifiers must begin with a letter
--   and must contain only ASCII letters, digits, and hyphens. They can't
--   end with a hyphen or contain two consecutive hyphens.
[$sel:endpointIdentifier:Connection'] :: Connection -> Maybe Text

-- | The replication instance identifier. This parameter is stored as a
--   lowercase string.
[$sel:replicationInstanceIdentifier:Connection'] :: Connection -> Maybe Text

-- | The ARN string that uniquely identifies the endpoint.
[$sel:endpointArn:Connection'] :: Connection -> Maybe Text

-- | The error message when the connection last failed.
[$sel:lastFailureMessage:Connection'] :: Connection -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Connection</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:Connection'</a>, <a>connection_status</a> - The
--   connection status. This parameter can return one of the following
--   values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>"successful"</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>"testing"</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>"failed"</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>"deleting"</pre></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:replicationInstanceArn:Connection'</a>,
--   <a>connection_replicationInstanceArn</a> - The ARN of the replication
--   instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endpointIdentifier:Connection'</a>,
--   <a>connection_endpointIdentifier</a> - The identifier of the endpoint.
--   Identifiers must begin with a letter and must contain only ASCII
--   letters, digits, and hyphens. They can't end with a hyphen or contain
--   two consecutive hyphens.
--   
--   <a>$sel:replicationInstanceIdentifier:Connection'</a>,
--   <a>connection_replicationInstanceIdentifier</a> - The replication
--   instance identifier. This parameter is stored as a lowercase string.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endpointArn:Connection'</a>, <a>connection_endpointArn</a> -
--   The ARN string that uniquely identifies the endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastFailureMessage:Connection'</a>,
--   <a>connection_lastFailureMessage</a> - The error message when the
--   connection last failed.
newConnection :: Connection

-- | The connection status. This parameter can return one of the following
--   values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>"successful"</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>"testing"</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>"failed"</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>"deleting"</pre></li>
--   </ul>
connection_status :: Lens' Connection (Maybe Text)

-- | The ARN of the replication instance.
connection_replicationInstanceArn :: Lens' Connection (Maybe Text)

-- | The identifier of the endpoint. Identifiers must begin with a letter
--   and must contain only ASCII letters, digits, and hyphens. They can't
--   end with a hyphen or contain two consecutive hyphens.
connection_endpointIdentifier :: Lens' Connection (Maybe Text)

-- | The replication instance identifier. This parameter is stored as a
--   lowercase string.
connection_replicationInstanceIdentifier :: Lens' Connection (Maybe Text)

-- | The ARN string that uniquely identifies the endpoint.
connection_endpointArn :: Lens' Connection (Maybe Text)

-- | The error message when the connection last failed.
connection_lastFailureMessage :: Lens' Connection (Maybe Text)

-- | The settings in JSON format for the DMS Transfer type source endpoint.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDmsTransferSettings</a> smart constructor.
data DmsTransferSettings
DmsTransferSettings' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> DmsTransferSettings

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) used by the service access IAM role.
--   The role must allow the <tt>iam:PassRole</tt> action.
[$sel:serviceAccessRoleArn:DmsTransferSettings'] :: DmsTransferSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the S3 bucket to use.
[$sel:bucketName:DmsTransferSettings'] :: DmsTransferSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DmsTransferSettings</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:serviceAccessRoleArn:DmsTransferSettings'</a>,
--   <a>dmsTransferSettings_serviceAccessRoleArn</a> - The Amazon Resource
--   Name (ARN) used by the service access IAM role. The role must allow
--   the <tt>iam:PassRole</tt> action.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bucketName:DmsTransferSettings'</a>,
--   <a>dmsTransferSettings_bucketName</a> - The name of the S3 bucket to
--   use.
newDmsTransferSettings :: DmsTransferSettings

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) used by the service access IAM role.
--   The role must allow the <tt>iam:PassRole</tt> action.
dmsTransferSettings_serviceAccessRoleArn :: Lens' DmsTransferSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the S3 bucket to use.
dmsTransferSettings_bucketName :: Lens' DmsTransferSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | Provides information that defines a DocumentDB endpoint.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDocDbSettings</a> smart constructor.
data DocDbSettings
DocDbSettings' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> Maybe NestingLevelValue -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Int -> DocDbSettings

-- | The name of the server on the DocumentDB source endpoint.
[$sel:serverName:DocDbSettings'] :: DocDbSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | The full Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role that specifies DMS
--   as the trusted entity and grants the required permissions to access
--   the value in <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt>. The role must allow the
--   <tt>iam:PassRole</tt> action. <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> has the
--   value of the Amazon Web Services Secrets Manager secret that allows
--   access to the DocumentDB endpoint.
--   
--   You can specify one of two sets of values for these permissions. You
--   can specify the values for this setting and
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecretId</tt>. Or you can specify clear-text values
--   for <tt>UserName</tt>, <tt>Password</tt>, <tt>ServerName</tt>, and
--   <tt>Port</tt>. You can't specify both. For more information on
--   creating this <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> and the
--   <tt>SecretsManagerAccessRoleArn</tt> and
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecretId</tt> required to access it, see <a>Using
--   secrets to access Database Migration Service resources</a> in the
--   <i>Database Migration Service User Guide</i>.
[$sel:secretsManagerAccessRoleArn:DocDbSettings'] :: DocDbSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | The user name you use to access the DocumentDB source endpoint.
[$sel:username:DocDbSettings'] :: DocDbSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | The KMS key identifier that is used to encrypt the content on the
--   replication instance. If you don't specify a value for the
--   <tt>KmsKeyId</tt> parameter, then DMS uses your default encryption
--   key. KMS creates the default encryption key for your Amazon Web
--   Services account. Your Amazon Web Services account has a different
--   default encryption key for each Amazon Web Services Region.
[$sel:kmsKeyId:DocDbSettings'] :: DocDbSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | The password for the user account you use to access the DocumentDB
--   source endpoint.
[$sel:password:DocDbSettings'] :: DocDbSettings -> Maybe (Sensitive Text)

-- | Specifies either document or table mode.
--   
--   Default value is <tt>"none"</tt>. Specify <tt>"none"</tt> to use
--   document mode. Specify <tt>"one"</tt> to use table mode.
[$sel:nestingLevel:DocDbSettings'] :: DocDbSettings -> Maybe NestingLevelValue

-- | The database name on the DocumentDB source endpoint.
[$sel:databaseName:DocDbSettings'] :: DocDbSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | Indicates the number of documents to preview to determine the document
--   organization. Use this setting when <tt>NestingLevel</tt> is set to
--   <tt>"one"</tt>.
--   
--   Must be a positive value greater than <tt>0</tt>. Default value is
--   <tt>1000</tt>.
[$sel:docsToInvestigate:DocDbSettings'] :: DocDbSettings -> Maybe Int

-- | The full ARN, partial ARN, or friendly name of the
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> that contains the DocumentDB endpoint
--   connection details.
[$sel:secretsManagerSecretId:DocDbSettings'] :: DocDbSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies the document ID. Use this setting when <tt>NestingLevel</tt>
--   is set to <tt>"none"</tt>.
--   
--   Default value is <tt>"false"</tt>.
[$sel:extractDocId:DocDbSettings'] :: DocDbSettings -> Maybe Bool

-- | The port value for the DocumentDB source endpoint.
[$sel:port:DocDbSettings'] :: DocDbSettings -> Maybe Int

-- | Create a value of <a>DocDbSettings</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:serverName:DocDbSettings'</a>, <a>docDbSettings_serverName</a>
--   - The name of the server on the DocumentDB source endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:secretsManagerAccessRoleArn:DocDbSettings'</a>,
--   <a>docDbSettings_secretsManagerAccessRoleArn</a> - The full Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role that specifies DMS as the trusted
--   entity and grants the required permissions to access the value in
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt>. The role must allow the
--   <tt>iam:PassRole</tt> action. <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> has the
--   value of the Amazon Web Services Secrets Manager secret that allows
--   access to the DocumentDB endpoint.
--   
--   You can specify one of two sets of values for these permissions. You
--   can specify the values for this setting and
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecretId</tt>. Or you can specify clear-text values
--   for <tt>UserName</tt>, <tt>Password</tt>, <tt>ServerName</tt>, and
--   <tt>Port</tt>. You can't specify both. For more information on
--   creating this <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> and the
--   <tt>SecretsManagerAccessRoleArn</tt> and
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecretId</tt> required to access it, see <a>Using
--   secrets to access Database Migration Service resources</a> in the
--   <i>Database Migration Service User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:username:DocDbSettings'</a>, <a>docDbSettings_username</a> -
--   The user name you use to access the DocumentDB source endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:kmsKeyId:DocDbSettings'</a>, <a>docDbSettings_kmsKeyId</a> -
--   The KMS key identifier that is used to encrypt the content on the
--   replication instance. If you don't specify a value for the
--   <tt>KmsKeyId</tt> parameter, then DMS uses your default encryption
--   key. KMS creates the default encryption key for your Amazon Web
--   Services account. Your Amazon Web Services account has a different
--   default encryption key for each Amazon Web Services Region.
--   
--   <a>$sel:password:DocDbSettings'</a>, <a>docDbSettings_password</a> -
--   The password for the user account you use to access the DocumentDB
--   source endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:nestingLevel:DocDbSettings'</a>,
--   <a>docDbSettings_nestingLevel</a> - Specifies either document or table
--   mode.
--   
--   Default value is <tt>"none"</tt>. Specify <tt>"none"</tt> to use
--   document mode. Specify <tt>"one"</tt> to use table mode.
--   
--   <a>$sel:databaseName:DocDbSettings'</a>,
--   <a>docDbSettings_databaseName</a> - The database name on the
--   DocumentDB source endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:docsToInvestigate:DocDbSettings'</a>,
--   <a>docDbSettings_docsToInvestigate</a> - Indicates the number of
--   documents to preview to determine the document organization. Use this
--   setting when <tt>NestingLevel</tt> is set to <tt>"one"</tt>.
--   
--   Must be a positive value greater than <tt>0</tt>. Default value is
--   <tt>1000</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:secretsManagerSecretId:DocDbSettings'</a>,
--   <a>docDbSettings_secretsManagerSecretId</a> - The full ARN, partial
--   ARN, or friendly name of the <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> that
--   contains the DocumentDB endpoint connection details.
--   
--   <a>$sel:extractDocId:DocDbSettings'</a>,
--   <a>docDbSettings_extractDocId</a> - Specifies the document ID. Use
--   this setting when <tt>NestingLevel</tt> is set to <tt>"none"</tt>.
--   
--   Default value is <tt>"false"</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:port:DocDbSettings'</a>, <a>docDbSettings_port</a> - The port
--   value for the DocumentDB source endpoint.
newDocDbSettings :: DocDbSettings

-- | The name of the server on the DocumentDB source endpoint.
docDbSettings_serverName :: Lens' DocDbSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | The full Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role that specifies DMS
--   as the trusted entity and grants the required permissions to access
--   the value in <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt>. The role must allow the
--   <tt>iam:PassRole</tt> action. <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> has the
--   value of the Amazon Web Services Secrets Manager secret that allows
--   access to the DocumentDB endpoint.
--   
--   You can specify one of two sets of values for these permissions. You
--   can specify the values for this setting and
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecretId</tt>. Or you can specify clear-text values
--   for <tt>UserName</tt>, <tt>Password</tt>, <tt>ServerName</tt>, and
--   <tt>Port</tt>. You can't specify both. For more information on
--   creating this <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> and the
--   <tt>SecretsManagerAccessRoleArn</tt> and
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecretId</tt> required to access it, see <a>Using
--   secrets to access Database Migration Service resources</a> in the
--   <i>Database Migration Service User Guide</i>.
docDbSettings_secretsManagerAccessRoleArn :: Lens' DocDbSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | The user name you use to access the DocumentDB source endpoint.
docDbSettings_username :: Lens' DocDbSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | The KMS key identifier that is used to encrypt the content on the
--   replication instance. If you don't specify a value for the
--   <tt>KmsKeyId</tt> parameter, then DMS uses your default encryption
--   key. KMS creates the default encryption key for your Amazon Web
--   Services account. Your Amazon Web Services account has a different
--   default encryption key for each Amazon Web Services Region.
docDbSettings_kmsKeyId :: Lens' DocDbSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | The password for the user account you use to access the DocumentDB
--   source endpoint.
docDbSettings_password :: Lens' DocDbSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies either document or table mode.
--   
--   Default value is <tt>"none"</tt>. Specify <tt>"none"</tt> to use
--   document mode. Specify <tt>"one"</tt> to use table mode.
docDbSettings_nestingLevel :: Lens' DocDbSettings (Maybe NestingLevelValue)

-- | The database name on the DocumentDB source endpoint.
docDbSettings_databaseName :: Lens' DocDbSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | Indicates the number of documents to preview to determine the document
--   organization. Use this setting when <tt>NestingLevel</tt> is set to
--   <tt>"one"</tt>.
--   
--   Must be a positive value greater than <tt>0</tt>. Default value is
--   <tt>1000</tt>.
docDbSettings_docsToInvestigate :: Lens' DocDbSettings (Maybe Int)

-- | The full ARN, partial ARN, or friendly name of the
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> that contains the DocumentDB endpoint
--   connection details.
docDbSettings_secretsManagerSecretId :: Lens' DocDbSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the document ID. Use this setting when <tt>NestingLevel</tt>
--   is set to <tt>"none"</tt>.
--   
--   Default value is <tt>"false"</tt>.
docDbSettings_extractDocId :: Lens' DocDbSettings (Maybe Bool)

-- | The port value for the DocumentDB source endpoint.
docDbSettings_port :: Lens' DocDbSettings (Maybe Int)

--   Management (IAM) role used to define an Amazon DynamoDB target
--   endpoint.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDynamoDbSettings</a> smart constructor.
data DynamoDbSettings

--   role. The role must allow the <tt>iam:PassRole</tt> action.
[$sel:serviceAccessRoleArn:DynamoDbSettings'] :: DynamoDbSettings -> Text

newDynamoDbSettings :: Text -> DynamoDbSettings

-- | Provides information that defines an Elasticsearch endpoint.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newElasticsearchSettings</a> smart constructor.
data ElasticsearchSettings
ElasticsearchSettings' :: Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Text -> Text -> ElasticsearchSettings

-- | The maximum percentage of records that can fail to be written before a
--   full load operation stops.
--   
--   To avoid early failure, this counter is only effective after 1000
--   records are transferred. Elasticsearch also has the concept of error
--   monitoring during the last 10 minutes of an Observation Window. If
--   transfer of all records fail in the last 10 minutes, the full load
--   operation stops.
[$sel:fullLoadErrorPercentage:ElasticsearchSettings'] :: ElasticsearchSettings -> Maybe Int

-- | The maximum number of seconds for which DMS retries failed API
--   requests to the Elasticsearch cluster.
[$sel:errorRetryDuration:ElasticsearchSettings'] :: ElasticsearchSettings -> Maybe Int

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) used by the service to access the IAM
--   role. The role must allow the <tt>iam:PassRole</tt> action.
[$sel:serviceAccessRoleArn:ElasticsearchSettings'] :: ElasticsearchSettings -> Text

-- | The endpoint for the Elasticsearch cluster. DMS uses HTTPS if a
--   transport protocol (http/https) is not specified.
[$sel:endpointUri:ElasticsearchSettings'] :: ElasticsearchSettings -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ElasticsearchSettings</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:fullLoadErrorPercentage:ElasticsearchSettings'</a>,
--   <a>elasticsearchSettings_fullLoadErrorPercentage</a> - The maximum
--   percentage of records that can fail to be written before a full load
--   operation stops.
--   
--   To avoid early failure, this counter is only effective after 1000
--   records are transferred. Elasticsearch also has the concept of error
--   monitoring during the last 10 minutes of an Observation Window. If
--   transfer of all records fail in the last 10 minutes, the full load
--   operation stops.
--   
--   <a>$sel:errorRetryDuration:ElasticsearchSettings'</a>,
--   <a>elasticsearchSettings_errorRetryDuration</a> - The maximum number
--   of seconds for which DMS retries failed API requests to the
--   Elasticsearch cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:serviceAccessRoleArn:ElasticsearchSettings'</a>,
--   <a>elasticsearchSettings_serviceAccessRoleArn</a> - The Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN) used by the service to access the IAM role. The
--   role must allow the <tt>iam:PassRole</tt> action.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endpointUri:ElasticsearchSettings'</a>,
--   <a>elasticsearchSettings_endpointUri</a> - The endpoint for the
--   Elasticsearch cluster. DMS uses HTTPS if a transport protocol
--   (http/https) is not specified.
newElasticsearchSettings :: Text -> Text -> ElasticsearchSettings

-- | The maximum percentage of records that can fail to be written before a
--   full load operation stops.
--   
--   To avoid early failure, this counter is only effective after 1000
--   records are transferred. Elasticsearch also has the concept of error
--   monitoring during the last 10 minutes of an Observation Window. If
--   transfer of all records fail in the last 10 minutes, the full load
--   operation stops.
elasticsearchSettings_fullLoadErrorPercentage :: Lens' ElasticsearchSettings (Maybe Int)

-- | The maximum number of seconds for which DMS retries failed API
--   requests to the Elasticsearch cluster.
elasticsearchSettings_errorRetryDuration :: Lens' ElasticsearchSettings (Maybe Int)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) used by the service to access the IAM
--   role. The role must allow the <tt>iam:PassRole</tt> action.
elasticsearchSettings_serviceAccessRoleArn :: Lens' ElasticsearchSettings Text

-- | The endpoint for the Elasticsearch cluster. DMS uses HTTPS if a
--   transport protocol (http/https) is not specified.
elasticsearchSettings_endpointUri :: Lens' ElasticsearchSettings Text

-- | Describes an endpoint of a database instance in response to operations
--   such as the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>CreateEndpoint</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>DescribeEndpoint</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>ModifyEndpoint</pre></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEndpoint</a> smart constructor.
data Endpoint
Endpoint' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe DmsTransferSettings -> Maybe MySQLSettings -> Maybe Text -> Maybe MicrosoftSQLServerSettings -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe DocDbSettings -> Maybe Text -> Maybe PostgreSQLSettings -> Maybe Text -> Maybe KafkaSettings -> Maybe OracleSettings -> Maybe ReplicationEndpointTypeValue -> Maybe RedshiftSettings -> Maybe ElasticsearchSettings -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe RedisSettings -> Maybe NeptuneSettings -> Maybe IBMDb2Settings -> Maybe Text -> Maybe MongoDbSettings -> Maybe DmsSslModeValue -> Maybe SybaseSettings -> Maybe Text -> Maybe S3Settings -> Maybe KinesisSettings -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe DynamoDbSettings -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Endpoint

-- | The status of the endpoint.
[$sel:status:Endpoint'] :: Endpoint -> Maybe Text

-- | The settings in JSON format for the DMS transfer type of source
--   endpoint.
--   
--   Possible settings include the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>ServiceAccessRoleArn</tt> - - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN)
--   used by the service access IAM role. The role must allow the
--   <tt>iam:PassRole</tt> action.</li>
--   <li><tt>BucketName</tt> - The name of the S3 bucket to use.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   Shorthand syntax for these settings is as follows:
--   <tt>ServiceAccessRoleArn=string,BucketName=string,</tt>
--   
--   JSON syntax for these settings is as follows: <tt>{
--   "ServiceAccessRoleArn": "string", "BucketName": "string"} </tt>
[$sel:dmsTransferSettings:Endpoint'] :: Endpoint -> Maybe DmsTransferSettings

-- | The settings for the MySQL source and target endpoint. For more
--   information, see the <tt>MySQLSettings</tt> structure.
[$sel:mySQLSettings:Endpoint'] :: Endpoint -> Maybe MySQLSettings

-- | The name of the server at the endpoint.
[$sel:serverName:Endpoint'] :: Endpoint -> Maybe Text

-- | The settings for the Microsoft SQL Server source and target endpoint.
--   For more information, see the <tt>MicrosoftSQLServerSettings</tt>
--   structure.
[$sel:microsoftSQLServerSettings:Endpoint'] :: Endpoint -> Maybe MicrosoftSQLServerSettings

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) used for SSL connection to the
--   endpoint.
[$sel:certificateArn:Endpoint'] :: Endpoint -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) used by the service to access the IAM
--   role. The role must allow the <tt>iam:PassRole</tt> action.
[$sel:serviceAccessRoleArn:Endpoint'] :: Endpoint -> Maybe Text
[$sel:docDbSettings:Endpoint'] :: Endpoint -> Maybe DocDbSettings

-- | The expanded name for the engine name. For example, if the
--   <tt>EngineName</tt> parameter is "aurora," this value would be "Amazon
--   Aurora MySQL."
[$sel:engineDisplayName:Endpoint'] :: Endpoint -> Maybe Text

-- | The settings for the PostgreSQL source and target endpoint. For more
--   information, see the <tt>PostgreSQLSettings</tt> structure.
[$sel:postgreSQLSettings:Endpoint'] :: Endpoint -> Maybe PostgreSQLSettings

-- | Additional connection attributes used to connect to the endpoint.
[$sel:extraConnectionAttributes:Endpoint'] :: Endpoint -> Maybe Text

-- | The settings for the Apache Kafka target endpoint. For more
--   information, see the <tt>KafkaSettings</tt> structure.
[$sel:kafkaSettings:Endpoint'] :: Endpoint -> Maybe KafkaSettings

-- | The settings for the Oracle source and target endpoint. For more
--   information, see the <tt>OracleSettings</tt> structure.
[$sel:oracleSettings:Endpoint'] :: Endpoint -> Maybe OracleSettings

-- | The type of endpoint. Valid values are <tt>source</tt> and
--   <tt>target</tt>.
[$sel:endpointType:Endpoint'] :: Endpoint -> Maybe ReplicationEndpointTypeValue

-- | Settings for the Amazon Redshift endpoint.
[$sel:redshiftSettings:Endpoint'] :: Endpoint -> Maybe RedshiftSettings

-- | The settings for the Elasticsearch source endpoint. For more
--   information, see the <tt>ElasticsearchSettings</tt> structure.
[$sel:elasticsearchSettings:Endpoint'] :: Endpoint -> Maybe ElasticsearchSettings

-- | The user name used to connect to the endpoint.
[$sel:username:Endpoint'] :: Endpoint -> Maybe Text

-- | The external table definition.
[$sel:externalTableDefinition:Endpoint'] :: Endpoint -> Maybe Text

-- | The database engine name. Valid values, depending on the EndpointType,
--   include <tt>"mysql"</tt>, <tt>"oracle"</tt>, <tt>"postgres"</tt>,
--   <tt>"mariadb"</tt>, <tt>"aurora"</tt>, <tt>"aurora-postgresql"</tt>,
--   <tt>"redshift"</tt>, <tt>"s3"</tt>, <tt>"db2"</tt>,
--   <tt>"azuredb"</tt>, <tt>"sybase"</tt>, <tt>"dynamodb"</tt>,
--   <tt>"mongodb"</tt>, <tt>"kinesis"</tt>, <tt>"kafka"</tt>,
--   <tt>"elasticsearch"</tt>, <tt>"documentdb"</tt>, <tt>"sqlserver"</tt>,
--   and <tt>"neptune"</tt>.
[$sel:engineName:Endpoint'] :: Endpoint -> Maybe Text

-- | The settings for the Redis target endpoint. For more information, see
--   the <tt>RedisSettings</tt> structure.
[$sel:redisSettings:Endpoint'] :: Endpoint -> Maybe RedisSettings

-- | The settings for the Amazon Neptune target endpoint. For more
--   information, see the <tt>NeptuneSettings</tt> structure.
[$sel:neptuneSettings:Endpoint'] :: Endpoint -> Maybe NeptuneSettings

-- | The settings for the IBM Db2 LUW source endpoint. For more
--   information, see the <tt>IBMDb2Settings</tt> structure.
[$sel:iBMDb2Settings:Endpoint'] :: Endpoint -> Maybe IBMDb2Settings

-- | An KMS key identifier that is used to encrypt the connection
--   parameters for the endpoint.
--   
--   If you don't specify a value for the <tt>KmsKeyId</tt> parameter, then
--   DMS uses your default encryption key.
--   
--   KMS creates the default encryption key for your Amazon Web Services
--   account. Your Amazon Web Services account has a different default
--   encryption key for each Amazon Web Services Region.
[$sel:kmsKeyId:Endpoint'] :: Endpoint -> Maybe Text

-- | The settings for the MongoDB source endpoint. For more information,
--   see the <tt>MongoDbSettings</tt> structure.
[$sel:mongoDbSettings:Endpoint'] :: Endpoint -> Maybe MongoDbSettings

-- | The SSL mode used to connect to the endpoint. The default value is
--   <tt>none</tt>.
[$sel:sslMode:Endpoint'] :: Endpoint -> Maybe DmsSslModeValue

-- | The settings for the SAP ASE source and target endpoint. For more
--   information, see the <tt>SybaseSettings</tt> structure.
[$sel:sybaseSettings:Endpoint'] :: Endpoint -> Maybe SybaseSettings

-- | The name of the database at the endpoint.
[$sel:databaseName:Endpoint'] :: Endpoint -> Maybe Text

-- | The settings for the S3 target endpoint. For more information, see the
--   <tt>S3Settings</tt> structure.
[$sel:s3Settings:Endpoint'] :: Endpoint -> Maybe S3Settings

-- | The settings for the Amazon Kinesis target endpoint. For more
--   information, see the <tt>KinesisSettings</tt> structure.
[$sel:kinesisSettings:Endpoint'] :: Endpoint -> Maybe KinesisSettings

-- | The database endpoint identifier. Identifiers must begin with a letter
--   and must contain only ASCII letters, digits, and hyphens. They can't
--   end with a hyphen or contain two consecutive hyphens.
[$sel:endpointIdentifier:Endpoint'] :: Endpoint -> Maybe Text

-- | Value returned by a call to CreateEndpoint that can be used for
--   cross-account validation. Use it on a subsequent call to
--   CreateEndpoint to create the endpoint with a cross-account.
[$sel:externalId:Endpoint'] :: Endpoint -> Maybe Text

-- | The settings for the DynamoDB target endpoint. For more information,
--   see the <tt>DynamoDBSettings</tt> structure.
[$sel:dynamoDbSettings:Endpoint'] :: Endpoint -> Maybe DynamoDbSettings

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) string that uniquely identifies the
--   endpoint.
[$sel:endpointArn:Endpoint'] :: Endpoint -> Maybe Text

-- | The port value used to access the endpoint.
[$sel:port:Endpoint'] :: Endpoint -> Maybe Int

-- | Create a value of <a>Endpoint</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:Endpoint'</a>, <a>endpoint_status</a> - The status of
--   the endpoint.

--   <a>$sel:dmsTransferSettings:Endpoint'</a>,

--   information, see the <tt>KafkaSettings</tt> structure.

--   <a>$sel:oracleSettings:Endpoint'</a>, <a>endpoint_oracleSettings</a> -
--   The settings for the Oracle source and target endpoint. For more
--   information, see the <tt>OracleSettings</tt> structure.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endpointType:Endpoint'</a>, <a>endpoint_endpointType</a> - The
--   type of endpoint. Valid values are <tt>source</tt> and
--   <tt>target</tt>.

--   <a>$sel:redshiftSettings:Endpoint'</a>,
--   <a>endpoint_redshiftSettings</a> - Settings for the Amazon Redshift

--   
--   <a>$sel:elasticsearchSettings:Endpoint'</a>,

--   - The settings for the Amazon Neptune target endpoint. For more
--   information, see the <tt>NeptuneSettings</tt> structure.
--

--   The settings for the IBM Db2 LUW source endpoint. For more
--   information, see the <tt>IBMDb2Settings</tt> structure.

--   identifier that is used to encrypt the connection parameters for the
--   endpoint.
--

--   DMS uses your default encryption key.
--   
--   KMS creates the default encryption key for your Amazon Web Services
--   account. Your Amazon Web Services account has a different default
--   encryption key for each Amazon Web Services Region.
--   
--   <a>$sel:mongoDbSettings:Endpoint'</a>, <a>endpoint_mongoDbSettings</a>
--   - The settings for the MongoDB source endpoint. For more information,
--   see the <tt>MongoDbSettings</tt> structure.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sslMode:Endpoint'</a>, <a>endpoint_sslMode</a> - The SSL mode
--   used to connect to the endpoint. The default value is <tt>none</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sybaseSettings:Endpoint'</a>, <a>endpoint_sybaseSettings</a> -
--   The settings for the SAP ASE source and target endpoint. For more
--   information, see the <tt>SybaseSettings</tt> structure.
--   
--   <a>$sel:databaseName:Endpoint'</a>, <a>endpoint_databaseName</a> - The
--   name of the database at the endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:s3Settings:Endpoint'</a>, <a>endpoint_s3Settings</a> - The
--   settings for the S3 target endpoint. For more information, see the
--   <tt>S3Settings</tt> structure.
--   
--   <a>$sel:kinesisSettings:Endpoint'</a>, <a>endpoint_kinesisSettings</a>
--   - The settings for the Amazon Kinesis target endpoint. For more
--   information, see the <tt>KinesisSettings</tt> structure.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endpointIdentifier:Endpoint'</a>,
--   <a>endpoint_endpointIdentifier</a> - The database endpoint identifier.
--   Identifiers must begin with a letter and must contain only ASCII
--   letters, digits, and hyphens. They can't end with a hyphen or contain
--   two consecutive hyphens.
--   
--   <a>$sel:externalId:Endpoint'</a>, <a>endpoint_externalId</a> - Value
--   returned by a call to CreateEndpoint that can be used for
--   cross-account validation. Use it on a subsequent call to
--   CreateEndpoint to create the endpoint with a cross-account.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dynamoDbSettings:Endpoint'</a>,
--   <a>endpoint_dynamoDbSettings</a> - The settings for the DynamoDB
--   target endpoint. For more information, see the
--   <tt>DynamoDBSettings</tt> structure.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endpointArn:Endpoint'</a>, <a>endpoint_endpointArn</a> - The
--   Amazon Resource Name (ARN) string that uniquely identifies the
--   endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:port:Endpoint'</a>, <a>endpoint_port</a> - The port value used
--   to access the endpoint.
newEndpoint :: Endpoint

-- | The status of the endpoint.
endpoint_status :: Lens' Endpoint (Maybe Text)

-- | The settings in JSON format for the DMS transfer type of source
--   endpoint.
--   
--   Possible settings include the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>ServiceAccessRoleArn</tt> - - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN)
--   used by the service access IAM role. The role must allow the
--   <tt>iam:PassRole</tt> action.</li>
--   <li><tt>BucketName</tt> - The name of the S3 bucket to use.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   Shorthand syntax for these settings is as follows:
--   <tt>ServiceAccessRoleArn=string,BucketName=string,</tt>
--   
--   JSON syntax for these settings is as follows: <tt>{
--   "ServiceAccessRoleArn": "string", "BucketName": "string"} </tt>
endpoint_dmsTransferSettings :: Lens' Endpoint (Maybe DmsTransferSettings)

--   information, see the <tt>MySQLSettings</tt> structure.
endpoint_mySQLSettings :: Lens' Endpoint (Maybe MySQLSettings)

endpoint_serverName :: Lens' Endpoint (Maybe Text)

--   structure.
endpoint_microsoftSQLServerSettings :: Lens' Endpoint (Maybe MicrosoftSQLServerSettings)

--   endpoint.
endpoint_certificateArn :: Lens' Endpoint (Maybe Text)

endpoint_serviceAccessRoleArn :: Lens' Endpoint (Maybe Text)

--   cross-account validation. Use it on a subsequent call to
--   CreateEndpoint to create the endpoint with a cross-account.

--   see the <tt>DynamoDBSettings</tt> structure.

--   endpoint.
endpoint_endpointArn :: Lens' Endpoint (Maybe Text)
