--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> that contains the MongoDB endpoint
--   connection details.
mongoDbSettings_secretsManagerSecretId :: Lens' MongoDbSettings (Maybe Text)

--   is set to <tt>"none"</tt>.
--   
--   Default value is <tt>"false"</tt>.
mongoDbSettings_extractDocId :: Lens' MongoDbSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | The authentication type you use to access the MongoDB source endpoint.
--   
--   When when set to <tt>"no"</tt>, user name and password parameters are
--   not used and can be empty.
mongoDbSettings_authType :: Lens' MongoDbSettings (Maybe AuthTypeValue)

-- | The port value for the MongoDB source endpoint.
mongoDbSettings_port :: Lens' MongoDbSettings (Maybe Int)

-- | Provides information that defines a MySQL endpoint.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMySQLSettings</a> smart constructor.
data MySQLSettings
MySQLSettings' :: Maybe Int -> Maybe TargetDbType -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> MySQLSettings

-- | Specifies the maximum size (in KB) of any .csv file used to transfer
--   data to a MySQL-compatible database.
--   
--   Example: <tt>maxFileSize=512</tt>
[$sel:maxFileSize:MySQLSettings'] :: MySQLSettings -> Maybe Int

-- | Specifies where to migrate source tables on the target, either to a
--   single database or multiple databases.
--   
--   Example: <tt>targetDbType=MULTIPLE_DATABASES</tt>
[$sel:targetDbType:MySQLSettings'] :: MySQLSettings -> Maybe TargetDbType

-- | Fully qualified domain name of the endpoint.
[$sel:serverName:MySQLSettings'] :: MySQLSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | Adjusts the behavior of DMS when migrating from an SQL Server source
--   database that is hosted as part of an Always On availability group
--   cluster. If you need DMS to poll all the nodes in the Always On
--   cluster for transaction backups, set this attribute to <tt>false</tt>.
[$sel:cleanSourceMetadataOnMismatch:MySQLSettings'] :: MySQLSettings -> Maybe Bool

-- | Improves performance when loading data into the MySQL-compatible
--   target database. Specifies how many threads to use to load the data
--   into the MySQL-compatible target database. Setting a large number of
--   threads can have an adverse effect on database performance, because a
--   separate connection is required for each thread.
--   
--   Example: <tt>parallelLoadThreads=1</tt>
[$sel:parallelLoadThreads:MySQLSettings'] :: MySQLSettings -> Maybe Int

-- | The full Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role that specifies DMS
--   as the trusted entity and grants the required permissions to access
--   the value in <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt>. The role must allow the
--   <tt>iam:PassRole</tt> action. <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> has the
--   value of the Amazon Web Services Secrets Manager secret that allows
--   access to the MySQL endpoint.
--   
--   You can specify one of two sets of values for these permissions. You
--   can specify the values for this setting and
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecretId</tt>. Or you can specify clear-text values
--   for <tt>UserName</tt>, <tt>Password</tt>, <tt>ServerName</tt>, and
--   <tt>Port</tt>. You can't specify both. For more information on
--   creating this <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> and the
--   <tt>SecretsManagerAccessRoleArn</tt> and
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecretId</tt> required to access it, see <a>Using
--   secrets to access Database Migration Service resources</a> in the
--   <i>Database Migration Service User Guide</i>.
[$sel:secretsManagerAccessRoleArn:MySQLSettings'] :: MySQLSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | Endpoint connection user name.
[$sel:username:MySQLSettings'] :: MySQLSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | Endpoint connection password.
[$sel:password:MySQLSettings'] :: MySQLSettings -> Maybe (Sensitive Text)

-- | Specifies how often to check the binary log for new changes/events
--   when the database is idle.
--   
--   Example: <tt>eventsPollInterval=5;</tt>
--   
--   In the example, DMS checks for changes in the binary logs every five
--   seconds.
[$sel:eventsPollInterval:MySQLSettings'] :: MySQLSettings -> Maybe Int

-- | Database name for the endpoint. For a MySQL source or target endpoint,
--   don't explicitly specify the database using the <tt>DatabaseName</tt>
--   request parameter on either the <tt>CreateEndpoint</tt> or
--   <tt>ModifyEndpoint</tt> API call. Specifying <tt>DatabaseName</tt>
--   when you create or modify a MySQL endpoint replicates all the task
--   tables to this single database. For MySQL endpoints, you specify the
--   database only when you specify the schema in the table-mapping rules
--   of the DMS task.
[$sel:databaseName:MySQLSettings'] :: MySQLSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies a script to run immediately after DMS connects to the
--   endpoint. The migration task continues running regardless if the SQL
--   statement succeeds or fails.
--   
--   For this parameter, provide the code of the script itself, not the
--   name of a file containing the script.
[$sel:afterConnectScript:MySQLSettings'] :: MySQLSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | The full ARN, partial ARN, or friendly name of the
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> that contains the MySQL endpoint
--   connection details.
[$sel:secretsManagerSecretId:MySQLSettings'] :: MySQLSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies the time zone for the source MySQL database.
--   
--   Example: <tt>serverTimezone=US/Pacific;</tt>
--   
--   Note: Do not enclose time zones in single quotes.
[$sel:serverTimezone:MySQLSettings'] :: MySQLSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | Endpoint TCP port.
[$sel:port:MySQLSettings'] :: MySQLSettings -> Maybe Int

-- | Create a value of <a>MySQLSettings</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxFileSize:MySQLSettings'</a>,
--   <a>mySQLSettings_maxFileSize</a> - Specifies the maximum size (in KB)
--   of any .csv file used to transfer data to a MySQL-compatible database.
--   
--   Example: <tt>maxFileSize=512</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:targetDbType:MySQLSettings'</a>,
--   <a>mySQLSettings_targetDbType</a> - Specifies where to migrate source
--   tables on the target, either to a single database or multiple
--   databases.
--   
--   Example: <tt>targetDbType=MULTIPLE_DATABASES</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:serverName:MySQLSettings'</a>, <a>mySQLSettings_serverName</a>
--   - Fully qualified domain name of the endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:cleanSourceMetadataOnMismatch:MySQLSettings'</a>,
--   <a>mySQLSettings_cleanSourceMetadataOnMismatch</a> - Adjusts the
--   behavior of DMS when migrating from an SQL Server source database that
--   is hosted as part of an Always On availability group cluster. If you
--   need DMS to poll all the nodes in the Always On cluster for
--   transaction backups, set this attribute to <tt>false</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:parallelLoadThreads:MySQLSettings'</a>,
--   <a>mySQLSettings_parallelLoadThreads</a> - Improves performance when
--   loading data into the MySQL-compatible target database. Specifies how
--   many threads to use to load the data into the MySQL-compatible target
--   database. Setting a large number of threads can have an adverse effect
--   on database performance, because a separate connection is required for
--   each thread.
--   
--   Example: <tt>parallelLoadThreads=1</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:secretsManagerAccessRoleArn:MySQLSettings'</a>,
--   <a>mySQLSettings_secretsManagerAccessRoleArn</a> - The full Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role that specifies DMS as the trusted
--   entity and grants the required permissions to access the value in
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt>. The role must allow the
--   <tt>iam:PassRole</tt> action. <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> has the
--   value of the Amazon Web Services Secrets Manager secret that allows
--   access to the MySQL endpoint.
--   
--   You can specify one of two sets of values for these permissions. You
--   can specify the values for this setting and
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecretId</tt>. Or you can specify clear-text values
--   for <tt>UserName</tt>, <tt>Password</tt>, <tt>ServerName</tt>, and
--   <tt>Port</tt>. You can't specify both. For more information on
--   creating this <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> and the
--   <tt>SecretsManagerAccessRoleArn</tt> and
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecretId</tt> required to access it, see <a>Using
--   secrets to access Database Migration Service resources</a> in the
--   <i>Database Migration Service User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:username:MySQLSettings'</a>, <a>mySQLSettings_username</a> -
--   Endpoint connection user name.
--   
--   <a>$sel:password:MySQLSettings'</a>, <a>mySQLSettings_password</a> -
--   Endpoint connection password.
--   
--   <a>$sel:eventsPollInterval:MySQLSettings'</a>,
--   <a>mySQLSettings_eventsPollInterval</a> - Specifies how often to check
--   the binary log for new changes/events when the database is idle.
--   
--   Example: <tt>eventsPollInterval=5;</tt>
--   
--   In the example, DMS checks for changes in the binary logs every five
--   seconds.
--   
--   <a>$sel:databaseName:MySQLSettings'</a>,
--   <a>mySQLSettings_databaseName</a> - Database name for the endpoint.
--   For a MySQL source or target endpoint, don't explicitly specify the
--   database using the <tt>DatabaseName</tt> request parameter on either
--   the <tt>CreateEndpoint</tt> or <tt>ModifyEndpoint</tt> API call.
--   Specifying <tt>DatabaseName</tt> when you create or modify a MySQL
--   endpoint replicates all the task tables to this single database. For
--   MySQL endpoints, you specify the database only when you specify the
--   schema in the table-mapping rules of the DMS task.
--   
--   <a>$sel:afterConnectScript:MySQLSettings'</a>,
--   <a>mySQLSettings_afterConnectScript</a> - Specifies a script to run
--   immediately after DMS connects to the endpoint. The migration task
--   continues running regardless if the SQL statement succeeds or fails.
--   
--   For this parameter, provide the code of the script itself, not the
--   name of a file containing the script.
--   
--   <a>$sel:secretsManagerSecretId:MySQLSettings'</a>,
--   <a>mySQLSettings_secretsManagerSecretId</a> - The full ARN, partial
--   ARN, or friendly name of the <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> that
--   contains the MySQL endpoint connection details.
--   
--   <a>$sel:serverTimezone:MySQLSettings'</a>,
--   <a>mySQLSettings_serverTimezone</a> - Specifies the time zone for the
--   source MySQL database.
--   
--   Example: <tt>serverTimezone=US/Pacific;</tt>
--   
--   Note: Do not enclose time zones in single quotes.
--   
--   <a>$sel:port:MySQLSettings'</a>, <a>mySQLSettings_port</a> - Endpoint
--   TCP port.
newMySQLSettings :: MySQLSettings

-- | Specifies the maximum size (in KB) of any .csv file used to transfer
--   data to a MySQL-compatible database.
--   
--   Example: <tt>maxFileSize=512</tt>
mySQLSettings_maxFileSize :: Lens' MySQLSettings (Maybe Int)

-- | Specifies where to migrate source tables on the target, either to a
--   single database or multiple databases.
--   
--   Example: <tt>targetDbType=MULTIPLE_DATABASES</tt>
mySQLSettings_targetDbType :: Lens' MySQLSettings (Maybe TargetDbType)

-- | Fully qualified domain name of the endpoint.
mySQLSettings_serverName :: Lens' MySQLSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | Adjusts the behavior of DMS when migrating from an SQL Server source
--   database that is hosted as part of an Always On availability group
--   cluster. If you need DMS to poll all the nodes in the Always On
--   cluster for transaction backups, set this attribute to <tt>false</tt>.
mySQLSettings_cleanSourceMetadataOnMismatch :: Lens' MySQLSettings (Maybe Bool)

-- | Improves performance when loading data into the MySQL-compatible
--   target database. Specifies how many threads to use to load the data
--   into the MySQL-compatible target database. Setting a large number of
--   threads can have an adverse effect on database performance, because a
--   separate connection is required for each thread.
--   
--   Example: <tt>parallelLoadThreads=1</tt>
mySQLSettings_parallelLoadThreads :: Lens' MySQLSettings (Maybe Int)

-- | The full Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role that specifies DMS
--   as the trusted entity and grants the required permissions to access
--   the value in <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt>. The role must allow the
--   <tt>iam:PassRole</tt> action. <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> has the
--   value of the Amazon Web Services Secrets Manager secret that allows
--   access to the MySQL endpoint.
--   
--   You can specify one of two sets of values for these permissions. You
--   can specify the values for this setting and
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecretId</tt>. Or you can specify clear-text values
--   for <tt>UserName</tt>, <tt>Password</tt>, <tt>ServerName</tt>, and
--   <tt>Port</tt>. You can't specify both. For more information on
--   creating this <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> and the
--   <tt>SecretsManagerAccessRoleArn</tt> and
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecretId</tt> required to access it, see <a>Using
--   secrets to access Database Migration Service resources</a> in the
--   <i>Database Migration Service User Guide</i>.
mySQLSettings_secretsManagerAccessRoleArn :: Lens' MySQLSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | Endpoint connection user name.
mySQLSettings_username :: Lens' MySQLSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | Endpoint connection password.
mySQLSettings_password :: Lens' MySQLSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies how often to check the binary log for new changes/events
--   when the database is idle.
--   
--   Example: <tt>eventsPollInterval=5;</tt>
--   
--   In the example, DMS checks for changes in the binary logs every five
--   seconds.
mySQLSettings_eventsPollInterval :: Lens' MySQLSettings (Maybe Int)

-- | Database name for the endpoint. For a MySQL source or target endpoint,
--   don't explicitly specify the database using the <tt>DatabaseName</tt>
--   request parameter on either the <tt>CreateEndpoint</tt> or
--   <tt>ModifyEndpoint</tt> API call. Specifying <tt>DatabaseName</tt>
--   when you create or modify a MySQL endpoint replicates all the task
--   tables to this single database. For MySQL endpoints, you specify the
--   database only when you specify the schema in the table-mapping rules
--   of the DMS task.
mySQLSettings_databaseName :: Lens' MySQLSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies a script to run immediately after DMS connects to the
--   endpoint. The migration task continues running regardless if the SQL
--   statement succeeds or fails.
--   
--   For this parameter, provide the code of the script itself, not the
--   name of a file containing the script.
mySQLSettings_afterConnectScript :: Lens' MySQLSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | The full ARN, partial ARN, or friendly name of the
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> that contains the MySQL endpoint
--   connection details.
mySQLSettings_secretsManagerSecretId :: Lens' MySQLSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the time zone for the source MySQL database.
--   
--   Example: <tt>serverTimezone=US/Pacific;</tt>
--   
--   Note: Do not enclose time zones in single quotes.
mySQLSettings_serverTimezone :: Lens' MySQLSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | Endpoint TCP port.
mySQLSettings_port :: Lens' MySQLSettings (Maybe Int)

-- | Provides information that defines an Amazon Neptune endpoint.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newNeptuneSettings</a> smart constructor.
data NeptuneSettings
NeptuneSettings' :: Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Int -> Text -> Text -> NeptuneSettings

-- | The maximum size in kilobytes of migrated graph data stored in a .csv
--   file before DMS bulk-loads the data to the Neptune target database.
--   The default is 1,048,576 KB. If the bulk load is successful, DMS
--   clears the bucket, ready to store the next batch of migrated graph
--   data.
[$sel:maxFileSize:NeptuneSettings'] :: NeptuneSettings -> Maybe Int

-- | The number of times for DMS to retry a bulk load of migrated graph
--   data to the Neptune target database before raising an error. The
--   default is 5.
[$sel:maxRetryCount:NeptuneSettings'] :: NeptuneSettings -> Maybe Int

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the service role that you created
--   for the Neptune target endpoint. The role must allow the
--   <tt>iam:PassRole</tt> action. For more information, see <a>Creating an
--   IAM Service Role for Accessing Amazon Neptune as a Target</a> in the
--   <i>Database Migration Service User Guide.</i>
[$sel:serviceAccessRoleArn:NeptuneSettings'] :: NeptuneSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | If you want Identity and Access Management (IAM) authorization enabled
--   for this endpoint, set this parameter to <tt>true</tt>. Then attach
--   the appropriate IAM policy document to your service role specified by
--   <tt>ServiceAccessRoleArn</tt>. The default is <tt>false</tt>.
[$sel:iamAuthEnabled:NeptuneSettings'] :: NeptuneSettings -> Maybe Bool

-- | The number of milliseconds for DMS to wait to retry a bulk-load of
--   migrated graph data to the Neptune target database before raising an
--   error. The default is 250.
[$sel:errorRetryDuration:NeptuneSettings'] :: NeptuneSettings -> Maybe Int

-- | The name of the Amazon S3 bucket where DMS can temporarily store
--   migrated graph data in .csv files before bulk-loading it to the
--   Neptune target database. DMS maps the SQL source data to graph data
--   before storing it in these .csv files.
[$sel:s3BucketName:NeptuneSettings'] :: NeptuneSettings -> Text

-- | A folder path where you want DMS to store migrated graph data in the
--   S3 bucket specified by <tt>S3BucketName</tt>
[$sel:s3BucketFolder:NeptuneSettings'] :: NeptuneSettings -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>NeptuneSettings</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxFileSize:NeptuneSettings'</a>,
--   <a>neptuneSettings_maxFileSize</a> - The maximum size in kilobytes of
--   migrated graph data stored in a .csv file before DMS bulk-loads the
--   data to the Neptune target database. The default is 1,048,576 KB. If
--   the bulk load is successful, DMS clears the bucket, ready to store the
--   next batch of migrated graph data.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxRetryCount:NeptuneSettings'</a>,
--   <a>neptuneSettings_maxRetryCount</a> - The number of times for DMS to
--   retry a bulk load of migrated graph data to the Neptune target
--   database before raising an error. The default is 5.
--   
--   <a>$sel:serviceAccessRoleArn:NeptuneSettings'</a>,
--   <a>neptuneSettings_serviceAccessRoleArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name
--   (ARN) of the service role that you created for the Neptune target
--   endpoint. The role must allow the <tt>iam:PassRole</tt> action. For
--   more information, see <a>Creating an IAM Service Role for Accessing
--   Amazon Neptune as a Target</a> in the <i>Database Migration Service
--   User Guide.</i>
--   
--   <a>$sel:iamAuthEnabled:NeptuneSettings'</a>,
--   <a>neptuneSettings_iamAuthEnabled</a> - If you want Identity and
--   Access Management (IAM) authorization enabled for this endpoint, set
--   this parameter to <tt>true</tt>. Then attach the appropriate IAM
--   policy document to your service role specified by
--   <tt>ServiceAccessRoleArn</tt>. The default is <tt>false</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:errorRetryDuration:NeptuneSettings'</a>,
--   <a>neptuneSettings_errorRetryDuration</a> - The number of milliseconds
--   for DMS to wait to retry a bulk-load of migrated graph data to the
--   Neptune target database before raising an error. The default is 250.
--   
--   <a>$sel:s3BucketName:NeptuneSettings'</a>,
--   <a>neptuneSettings_s3BucketName</a> - The name of the Amazon S3 bucket
--   where DMS can temporarily store migrated graph data in .csv files
--   before bulk-loading it to the Neptune target database. DMS maps the
--   SQL source data to graph data before storing it in these .csv files.
--   
--   <a>$sel:s3BucketFolder:NeptuneSettings'</a>,
--   <a>neptuneSettings_s3BucketFolder</a> - A folder path where you want
--   DMS to store migrated graph data in the S3 bucket specified by
--   <tt>S3BucketName</tt>
newNeptuneSettings :: Text -> Text -> NeptuneSettings

-- | The maximum size in kilobytes of migrated graph data stored in a .csv
--   file before DMS bulk-loads the data to the Neptune target database.
--   The default is 1,048,576 KB. If the bulk load is successful, DMS
--   clears the bucket, ready to store the next batch of migrated graph
--   data.
neptuneSettings_maxFileSize :: Lens' NeptuneSettings (Maybe Int)

-- | The number of times for DMS to retry a bulk load of migrated graph
--   data to the Neptune target database before raising an error. The
--   default is 5.
neptuneSettings_maxRetryCount :: Lens' NeptuneSettings (Maybe Int)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the service role that you created
--   for the Neptune target endpoint. The role must allow the
--   <tt>iam:PassRole</tt> action. For more information, see <a>Creating an
--   IAM Service Role for Accessing Amazon Neptune as a Target</a> in the
--   <i>Database Migration Service User Guide.</i>
neptuneSettings_serviceAccessRoleArn :: Lens' NeptuneSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | If you want Identity and Access Management (IAM) authorization enabled
--   for this endpoint, set this parameter to <tt>true</tt>. Then attach
--   the appropriate IAM policy document to your service role specified by
--   <tt>ServiceAccessRoleArn</tt>. The default is <tt>false</tt>.
neptuneSettings_iamAuthEnabled :: Lens' NeptuneSettings (Maybe Bool)

-- | The number of milliseconds for DMS to wait to retry a bulk-load of
--   migrated graph data to the Neptune target database before raising an
--   error. The default is 250.
neptuneSettings_errorRetryDuration :: Lens' NeptuneSettings (Maybe Int)

-- | The name of the Amazon S3 bucket where DMS can temporarily store
--   migrated graph data in .csv files before bulk-loading it to the
--   Neptune target database. DMS maps the SQL source data to graph data
--   before storing it in these .csv files.
neptuneSettings_s3BucketName :: Lens' NeptuneSettings Text

-- | A folder path where you want DMS to store migrated graph data in the
--   S3 bucket specified by <tt>S3BucketName</tt>
neptuneSettings_s3BucketFolder :: Lens' NeptuneSettings Text

-- | Provides information that defines an Oracle endpoint.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newOracleSettings</a> smart constructor.
data OracleSettings
OracleSettings' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe [Int] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Int -> Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe CharLengthSemantics -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Int -> OracleSettings

-- | Set this attribute to Y to capture change data using the Binary Reader
--   utility. Set <tt>UseLogminerReader</tt> to N to set this attribute to
--   Y. To use Binary Reader with Amazon RDS for Oracle as the source, you
--   set additional attributes. For more information about using this
--   setting with Oracle Automatic Storage Management (ASM), see <a>Using
--   Oracle LogMiner or DMS Binary Reader for CDC</a>.
[$sel:useBFile:OracleSettings'] :: OracleSettings -> Maybe Bool

-- | Use this attribute to specify a time in minutes for the delay in
--   standby sync. If the source is an Oracle Active Data Guard standby
--   database, use this attribute to specify the time lag between primary
--   and standby databases.
--   
--   In DMS, you can create an Oracle CDC task that uses an Active Data
--   Guard standby instance as a source for replicating ongoing changes.
--   Doing this eliminates the need to connect to an active database that
--   might be in production.
[$sel:standbyDelayTime:OracleSettings'] :: OracleSettings -> Maybe Int

-- | When set to <tt>true</tt>, this attribute causes a task to fail if the
--   actual size of an LOB column is greater than the specified
--   <tt>LobMaxSize</tt>.
--   
--   If a task is set to limited LOB mode and this option is set to
--   <tt>true</tt>, the task fails instead of truncating the LOB data.
[$sel:failTasksOnLobTruncation:OracleSettings'] :: OracleSettings -> Maybe Bool

-- | Fully qualified domain name of the endpoint.
[$sel:serverName:OracleSettings'] :: OracleSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | When set to <tt>true</tt>, this attribute helps to increase the commit
--   rate on the Oracle target database by writing directly to tables and
--   not writing a trail to database logs.
[$sel:directPathNoLog:OracleSettings'] :: OracleSettings -> Maybe Bool

-- | Specifies the IDs of one more destinations for one or more archived
--   redo logs. These IDs are the values of the <tt>dest_id</tt> column in
--   the <tt>v$archived_log</tt> view. Use this setting with the
--   <tt>archivedLogDestId</tt> extra connection attribute in a
--   primary-to-single setup or a primary-to-multiple-standby setup.
--   
--   This setting is useful in a switchover when you use an Oracle Data
--   Guard database as a source. In this case, DMS needs information about
--   what destination to get archive redo logs from to read changes. DMS
--   needs this because after the switchover the previous primary is a
--   standby instance. For example, in a primary-to-single standby setup
--   you might apply the following settings.
--   
--   <pre>
--   archivedLogDestId=1; ExtraArchivedLogDestIds=[2]
--   </pre>
--   
--   In a primary-to-multiple-standby setup, you might apply the following
--   settings.
--   
--   <pre>
--   archivedLogDestId=1; ExtraArchivedLogDestIds=[2,3,4]
--   </pre>
--   
--   Although DMS supports the use of the Oracle <tt>RESETLOGS</tt> option
--   to open the database, never use <tt>RESETLOGS</tt> unless it's
--   necessary. For more information about <tt>RESETLOGS</tt>, see <a>RMAN
--   Data Repair Concepts</a> in the <i>Oracle Database Backup and Recovery
--   User's Guide</i>.
[$sel:extraArchivedLogDestIds:OracleSettings'] :: OracleSettings -> Maybe [Int]

-- | For an Oracle source endpoint, the name of a key used for the
--   transparent data encryption (TDE) of the columns and tablespaces in an
--   Oracle source database that is encrypted using TDE. The key value is
--   the value of the <tt>SecurityDbEncryption</tt> setting. For more
--   information on setting the key name value of
--   <tt>SecurityDbEncryptionName</tt>, see the information and example for
--   setting the <tt>securityDbEncryptionName</tt> extra connection
--   attribute in <a>Supported encryption methods for using Oracle as a
--   source for DMS</a> in the <i>Database Migration Service User
--   Guide</i>.
[$sel:securityDbEncryptionName:OracleSettings'] :: OracleSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | Set this string attribute to the required value in order to use the
--   Binary Reader to capture change data for an Amazon RDS for Oracle as
--   the source. This value specifies the default Oracle root used to
--   access the redo logs.
[$sel:oraclePathPrefix:OracleSettings'] :: OracleSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | The full Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role that specifies DMS
--   as the trusted entity and grants the required permissions to access
--   the value in <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt>. The role must allow the
--   <tt>iam:PassRole</tt> action. <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> has the
--   value of the Amazon Web Services Secrets Manager secret that allows
--   access to the Oracle endpoint.
--   
--   You can specify one of two sets of values for these permissions. You
--   can specify the values for this setting and
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecretId</tt>. Or you can specify clear-text values
--   for <tt>UserName</tt>, <tt>Password</tt>, <tt>ServerName</tt>, and
--   <tt>Port</tt>. You can't specify both. For more information on
--   creating this <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> and the
--   <tt>SecretsManagerAccessRoleArn</tt> and
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecretId</tt> required to access it, see <a>Using
--   secrets to access Database Migration Service resources</a> in the
--   <i>Database Migration Service User Guide</i>.
[$sel:secretsManagerAccessRoleArn:OracleSettings'] :: OracleSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | Set this attribute to Y to have DMS use a direct path full load.
--   Specify this value to use the direct path protocol in the Oracle Call
--   Interface (OCI). By using this OCI protocol, you can bulk-load Oracle
--   target tables during a full load.
[$sel:useDirectPathFullLoad:OracleSettings'] :: OracleSettings -> Maybe Bool

-- | Endpoint connection user name.
[$sel:username:OracleSettings'] :: OracleSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | Set this attribute to <tt>true</tt> to enable replication of Oracle
--   tables containing columns that are nested tables or defined types.
[$sel:allowSelectNestedTables:OracleSettings'] :: OracleSettings -> Maybe Bool

-- | Set this attribute to change the number of read-ahead blocks that DMS
--   configures to perform a change data capture (CDC) load using Oracle
--   Automatic Storage Management (ASM). You can specify an integer value
--   between 1000 (the default) and 200,000 (the maximum).
[$sel:readAheadBlocks:OracleSettings'] :: OracleSettings -> Maybe Int

-- | Specifies the ID of the destination for the archived redo logs. This
--   value should be the same as a number in the dest_id column of the
--   v$archived_log view. If you work with an additional redo log
--   destination, use the <tt>AdditionalArchivedLogDestId</tt> option to
--   specify the additional destination ID. Doing this improves performance
--   by ensuring that the correct logs are accessed from the outset.
[$sel:archivedLogDestId:OracleSettings'] :: OracleSettings -> Maybe Int

-- | Set this attribute to true in order to use the Binary Reader to
--   capture change data for an Amazon RDS for Oracle as the source. This
--   setting tells DMS instance to replace the default Oracle root with the
--   specified <tt>usePathPrefix</tt> setting to access the redo logs.
[$sel:replacePathPrefix:OracleSettings'] :: OracleSettings -> Maybe Bool

-- | Set this attribute to <tt>false</tt> in order to use the Binary Reader
--   to capture change data for an Amazon RDS for Oracle as the source.
--   This tells the DMS instance to not access redo logs through any
--   specified path prefix replacement using direct file access.
[$sel:accessAlternateDirectly:OracleSettings'] :: OracleSettings -> Maybe Bool

-- | Required only if your Oracle endpoint uses Advanced Storage Manager
--   (ASM). The full ARN, partial ARN, or friendly name of the
--   <tt>SecretsManagerOracleAsmSecret</tt> that contains the Oracle ASM
--   connection details for the Oracle endpoint.
[$sel:secretsManagerOracleAsmSecretId:OracleSettings'] :: OracleSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | For an Oracle source endpoint, the transparent data encryption (TDE)
--   password required by AWM DMS to access Oracle redo logs encrypted by
--   TDE using Binary Reader. It is also the <tt> TDE_Password </tt> part
--   of the comma-separated value you set to the <tt>Password</tt> request
--   parameter when you create the endpoint. The
--   <tt>SecurityDbEncryptian</tt> setting is related to this
--   <tt>SecurityDbEncryptionName</tt> setting. For more information, see
--   <a>Supported encryption methods for using Oracle as a source for
--   DMS</a> in the <i>Database Migration Service User Guide</i>.
[$sel:securityDbEncryption:OracleSettings'] :: OracleSettings -> Maybe (Sensitive Text)

-- | Set this attribute to Y to capture change data using the Oracle
--   LogMiner utility (the default). Set this attribute to N if you want to
--   access the redo logs as a binary file. When you set
--   <tt>UseLogminerReader</tt> to N, also set <tt>UseBfile</tt> to Y. For
--   more information on this setting and using Oracle ASM, see <a>Using
--   Oracle LogMiner or DMS Binary Reader for CDC</a> in the <i>DMS User
--   Guide</i>.
[$sel:useLogminerReader:OracleSettings'] :: OracleSettings -> Maybe Bool

-- | When set to <tt>true</tt>, this attribute supports tablespace
--   replication.
[$sel:readTableSpaceName:OracleSettings'] :: OracleSettings -> Maybe Bool

-- | Specifies the number of seconds that the system waits before resending
--   a query.
--   
--   Example: <tt>retryInterval=6;</tt>
[$sel:retryInterval:OracleSettings'] :: OracleSettings -> Maybe Int

-- | Endpoint connection password.
[$sel:password:OracleSettings'] :: OracleSettings -> Maybe (Sensitive Text)

-- | Use this attribute to convert <tt>SDO_GEOMETRY</tt> to
--   <tt>GEOJSON</tt> format. By default, DMS calls the
--   <tt>SDO2GEOJSON</tt> custom function if present and accessible. Or you
--   can create your own custom function that mimics the operation of
--   <tt>SDOGEOJSON</tt> and set
--   <tt>SpatialDataOptionToGeoJsonFunctionName</tt> to call it instead.
[$sel:spatialDataOptionToGeoJsonFunctionName:OracleSettings'] :: OracleSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | Database name for the endpoint.
[$sel:databaseName:OracleSettings'] :: OracleSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | Set this attribute to set up table-level supplemental logging for the
--   Oracle database. This attribute enables PRIMARY KEY supplemental
--   logging on all tables selected for a migration task.
--   
--   If you use this option, you still need to enable database-level
--   supplemental logging.
[$sel:addSupplementalLogging:OracleSettings'] :: OracleSettings -> Maybe Bool

-- | Required only if your Oracle endpoint uses Advanced Storage Manager
--   (ASM). The full ARN of the IAM role that specifies DMS as the trusted
--   entity and grants the required permissions to access the
--   <tt>SecretsManagerOracleAsmSecret</tt>. This
--   <tt>SecretsManagerOracleAsmSecret</tt> has the secret value that
--   allows access to the Oracle ASM of the endpoint.
--   
--   You can specify one of two sets of values for these permissions. You
--   can specify the values for this setting and
--   <tt>SecretsManagerOracleAsmSecretId</tt>. Or you can specify
--   clear-text values for <tt>AsmUserName</tt>, <tt>AsmPassword</tt>, and
--   <tt>AsmServerName</tt>. You can't specify both. For more information
--   on creating this <tt>SecretsManagerOracleAsmSecret</tt> and the
--   <tt>SecretsManagerOracleAsmAccessRoleArn</tt> and
--   <tt>SecretsManagerOracleAsmSecretId</tt> required to access it, see
--   <a>Using secrets to access Database Migration Service resources</a> in
--   the <i>Database Migration Service User Guide</i>.
[$sel:secretsManagerOracleAsmAccessRoleArn:OracleSettings'] :: OracleSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | For an Oracle source endpoint, your ASM server address. You can set
--   this value from the <tt>asm_server</tt> value. You set
--   <tt>asm_server</tt> as part of the extra connection attribute string
--   to access an Oracle server with Binary Reader that uses ASM. For more
--   information, see <a>Configuration for change data capture (CDC) on an
--   Oracle source database</a>.
[$sel:asmServer:OracleSettings'] :: OracleSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies whether the length of a character column is in bytes or in
--   characters. To indicate that the character column length is in
--   characters, set this attribute to <tt>CHAR</tt>. Otherwise, the
--   character column length is in bytes.
--   
--   Example: <tt>charLengthSemantics=CHAR;</tt>
[$sel:charLengthSemantics:OracleSettings'] :: OracleSettings -> Maybe CharLengthSemantics

-- | When this field is set to <tt>Y</tt>, DMS only accesses the archived
--   redo logs. If the archived redo logs are stored on Oracle ASM only,
--   the DMS user account needs to be granted ASM privileges.
[$sel:archivedLogsOnly:OracleSettings'] :: OracleSettings -> Maybe Bool

-- | When set to <tt>true</tt>, this attribute specifies a parallel load
--   when <tt>useDirectPathFullLoad</tt> is set to <tt>Y</tt>. This
--   attribute also only applies when you use the DMS parallel load
--   feature. Note that the target table cannot have any constraints or
--   indexes.
[$sel:directPathParallelLoad:OracleSettings'] :: OracleSettings -> Maybe Bool

-- | The full ARN, partial ARN, or friendly name of the
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> that contains the Oracle endpoint
--   connection details.
[$sel:secretsManagerSecretId:OracleSettings'] :: OracleSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | Set this attribute with <tt>ArchivedLogDestId</tt> in a primary/
--   standby setup. This attribute is useful in the case of a switchover.
--   In this case, DMS needs to know which destination to get archive redo
--   logs from to read changes. This need arises because the previous
--   primary instance is now a standby instance after switchover.
--   
--   Although DMS supports the use of the Oracle <tt>RESETLOGS</tt> option
--   to open the database, never use <tt>RESETLOGS</tt> unless necessary.
--   For additional information about <tt>RESETLOGS</tt>, see <a>RMAN Data
--   Repair Concepts</a> in the <i>Oracle Database Backup and Recovery
--   User's Guide</i>.
[$sel:additionalArchivedLogDestId:OracleSettings'] :: OracleSettings -> Maybe Int

-- | For an Oracle source endpoint, your Oracle Automatic Storage
--   Management (ASM) password. You can set this value from the <tt>
--   asm_user_password </tt> value. You set this value as part of the
--   comma-separated value that you set to the <tt>Password</tt> request
--   parameter when you create the endpoint to access transaction logs
--   using Binary Reader. For more information, see <a>Configuration for
--   change data capture (CDC) on an Oracle source database</a>.
[$sel:asmPassword:OracleSettings'] :: OracleSettings -> Maybe (Sensitive Text)

-- | Set this attribute to enable homogenous tablespace replication and
--   create existing tables or indexes under the same tablespace on the
--   target.
[$sel:enableHomogenousTablespace:OracleSettings'] :: OracleSettings -> Maybe Bool

-- | Set this attribute to change the number of threads that DMS configures
--   to perform a change data capture (CDC) load using Oracle Automatic
--   Storage Management (ASM). You can specify an integer value between 2
--   (the default) and 8 (the maximum). Use this attribute together with
--   the <tt>readAheadBlocks</tt> attribute.
[$sel:parallelAsmReadThreads:OracleSettings'] :: OracleSettings -> Maybe Int

-- | Specifies the number scale. You can select a scale up to 38, or you
--   can select FLOAT. By default, the NUMBER data type is converted to
--   precision 38, scale 10.
--   
--   Example: <tt>numberDataTypeScale=12</tt>
[$sel:numberDatatypeScale:OracleSettings'] :: OracleSettings -> Maybe Int

-- | Set this string attribute to the required value in order to use the
--   Binary Reader to capture change data for an Amazon RDS for Oracle as
--   the source. This value specifies the path prefix used to replace the
--   default Oracle root to access the redo logs.
[$sel:usePathPrefix:OracleSettings'] :: OracleSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | For an Oracle source endpoint, your ASM user name. You can set this
--   value from the <tt>asm_user</tt> value. You set <tt>asm_user</tt> as
--   part of the extra connection attribute string to access an Oracle
--   server with Binary Reader that uses ASM. For more information, see
--   <a>Configuration for change data capture (CDC) on an Oracle source
--   database</a>.
[$sel:asmUser:OracleSettings'] :: OracleSettings -> Maybe Text

-- | Set this attribute to <tt>true</tt> in order to use the Binary Reader
--   to capture change data for an Amazon RDS for Oracle as the source.
--   This tells the DMS instance to use any specified prefix replacement to
--   access all online redo logs.
[$sel:useAlternateFolderForOnline:OracleSettings'] :: OracleSettings -> Maybe Bool

-- | Endpoint TCP port.
[$sel:port:OracleSettings'] :: OracleSettings -> Maybe Int

-- | Create a value of <a>OracleSettings</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:useBFile:OracleSettings'</a>, <a>oracleSettings_useBFile</a> -
--   Set this attribute to Y to capture change data using the Binary Reader
--   utility. Set <tt>UseLogminerReader</tt> to N to set this attribute to
--   Y. To use Binary Reader with Amazon RDS for Oracle as the source, you
--   set additional attributes. For more information about using this
--   setting with Oracle Automatic Storage Management (ASM), see <a>Using
--   Oracle LogMiner or DMS Binary Reader for CDC</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:standbyDelayTime:OracleSettings'</a>,
--   <a>oracleSettings_standbyDelayTime</a> - Use this attribute to specify
--   a time in minutes for the delay in standby sync. If the source is an
--   Oracle Active Data Guard standby database, use this attribute to
--   specify the time lag between primary and standby databases.
--   
--   In DMS, you can create an Oracle CDC task that uses an Active Data
--   Guard standby instance as a source for replicating ongoing changes.
--   Doing this eliminates the need to connect to an active database that
--   might be in production.
--   
--   <a>$sel:failTasksOnLobTruncation:OracleSettings'</a>,
--   <a>oracleSettings_failTasksOnLobTruncation</a> - When set to
--   <tt>true</tt>, this attribute causes a task to fail if the actual size
--   of an LOB column is greater than the specified <tt>LobMaxSize</tt>.
--   
--   If a task is set to limited LOB mode and this option is set to
--   <tt>true</tt>, the task fails instead of truncating the LOB data.
--   
--   <a>$sel:serverName:OracleSettings'</a>,
--   <a>oracleSettings_serverName</a> - Fully qualified domain name of the
--   endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:directPathNoLog:OracleSettings'</a>,
--   <a>oracleSettings_directPathNoLog</a> - When set to <tt>true</tt>,
--   this attribute helps to increase the commit rate on the Oracle target
--   database by writing directly to tables and not writing a trail to
--   database logs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:extraArchivedLogDestIds:OracleSettings'</a>,
--   <a>oracleSettings_extraArchivedLogDestIds</a> - Specifies the IDs of
--   one more destinations for one or more archived redo logs. These IDs
--   are the values of the <tt>dest_id</tt> column in the
--   <tt>v$archived_log</tt> view. Use this setting with the
--   <tt>archivedLogDestId</tt> extra connection attribute in a
--   primary-to-single setup or a primary-to-multiple-standby setup.
--   
--   This setting is useful in a switchover when you use an Oracle Data
--   Guard database as a source. In this case, DMS needs information about
--   what destination to get archive redo logs from to read changes. DMS
--   needs this because after the switchover the previous primary is a
--   standby instance. For example, in a primary-to-single standby setup
--   you might apply the following settings.
--   
--   <pre>
--   archivedLogDestId=1; ExtraArchivedLogDestIds=[2]
--   </pre>
--   
--   In a primary-to-multiple-standby setup, you might apply the following
--   settings.
--   
--   <pre>
--   archivedLogDestId=1; ExtraArchivedLogDestIds=[2,3,4]
--   </pre>
--   
--   Although DMS supports the use of the Oracle <tt>RESETLOGS</tt> option
--   to open the database, never use <tt>RESETLOGS</tt> unless it's
--   necessary. For more information about <tt>RESETLOGS</tt>, see <a>RMAN
--   Data Repair Concepts</a> in the <i>Oracle Database Backup and Recovery
--   User's Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:securityDbEncryptionName:OracleSettings'</a>,
--   <a>oracleSettings_securityDbEncryptionName</a> - For an Oracle source
--   endpoint, the name of a key used for the transparent data encryption
--   (TDE) of the columns and tablespaces in an Oracle source database that
--   is encrypted using TDE. The key value is the value of the
--   <tt>SecurityDbEncryption</tt> setting. For more information on setting
--   the key name value of <tt>SecurityDbEncryptionName</tt>, see the
--   information and example for setting the
--   <tt>securityDbEncryptionName</tt> extra connection attribute in
--   <a>Supported encryption methods for using Oracle as a source for
--   DMS</a> in the <i>Database Migration Service User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:oraclePathPrefix:OracleSettings'</a>,
--   <a>oracleSettings_oraclePathPrefix</a> - Set this string attribute to
--   the required value in order to use the Binary Reader to capture change
--   data for an Amazon RDS for Oracle as the source. This value specifies
--   the default Oracle root used to access the redo logs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:secretsManagerAccessRoleArn:OracleSettings'</a>,
--   <a>oracleSettings_secretsManagerAccessRoleArn</a> - The full Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role that specifies DMS as the trusted
--   entity and grants the required permissions to access the value in
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt>. The role must allow the
--   <tt>iam:PassRole</tt> action. <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> has the
--   value of the Amazon Web Services Secrets Manager secret that allows
--   access to the Oracle endpoint.
--   
--   You can specify one of two sets of values for these permissions. You
--   can specify the values for this setting and
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecretId</tt>. Or you can specify clear-text values
--   for <tt>UserName</tt>, <tt>Password</tt>, <tt>ServerName</tt>, and
--   <tt>Port</tt>. You can't specify both. For more information on
--   creating this <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> and the
--   <tt>SecretsManagerAccessRoleArn</tt> and
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecretId</tt> required to access it, see <a>Using
--   secrets to access Database Migration Service resources</a> in the
--   <i>Database Migration Service User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:useDirectPathFullLoad:OracleSettings'</a>,
--   <a>oracleSettings_useDirectPathFullLoad</a> - Set this attribute to Y
--   to have DMS use a direct path full load. Specify this value to use the
--   direct path protocol in the Oracle Call Interface (OCI). By using this
--   OCI protocol, you can bulk-load Oracle target tables during a full
--   load.
--   
--   <a>$sel:username:OracleSettings'</a>, <a>oracleSettings_username</a> -
--   Endpoint connection user name.
--   
--   <a>$sel:allowSelectNestedTables:OracleSettings'</a>,
--   <a>oracleSettings_allowSelectNestedTables</a> - Set this attribute to
--   <tt>true</tt> to enable replication of Oracle tables containing
--   columns that are nested tables or defined types.
--   
--   <a>$sel:readAheadBlocks:OracleSettings'</a>,
--   <a>oracleSettings_readAheadBlocks</a> - Set this attribute to change
--   the number of read-ahead blocks that DMS configures to perform a
--   change data capture (CDC) load using Oracle Automatic Storage
--   Management (ASM). You can specify an integer value between 1000 (the
--   default) and 200,000 (the maximum).
--   
--   <a>$sel:archivedLogDestId:OracleSettings'</a>,
--   <a>oracleSettings_archivedLogDestId</a> - Specifies the ID of the
--   destination for the archived redo logs. This value should be the same
--   as a number in the dest_id column of the v$archived_log view. If you
--   work with an additional redo log destination, use the
--   <tt>AdditionalArchivedLogDestId</tt> option to specify the additional
--   destination ID. Doing this improves performance by ensuring that the
--   correct logs are accessed from the outset.
--   
--   <a>$sel:replacePathPrefix:OracleSettings'</a>,
--   <a>oracleSettings_replacePathPrefix</a> - Set this attribute to true
--   in order to use the Binary Reader to capture change data for an Amazon
--   RDS for Oracle as the source. This setting tells DMS instance to
--   replace the default Oracle root with the specified
--   <tt>usePathPrefix</tt> setting to access the redo logs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:accessAlternateDirectly:OracleSettings'</a>,
--   <a>oracleSettings_accessAlternateDirectly</a> - Set this attribute to
--   <tt>false</tt> in order to use the Binary Reader to capture change
--   data for an Amazon RDS for Oracle as the source. This tells the DMS
--   instance to not access redo logs through any specified path prefix
--   replacement using direct file access.
--   
--   <a>$sel:secretsManagerOracleAsmSecretId:OracleSettings'</a>,
--   <a>oracleSettings_secretsManagerOracleAsmSecretId</a> - Required only
--   if your Oracle endpoint uses Advanced Storage Manager (ASM). The full
--   ARN, partial ARN, or friendly name of the
--   <tt>SecretsManagerOracleAsmSecret</tt> that contains the Oracle ASM
--   connection details for the Oracle endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:securityDbEncryption:OracleSettings'</a>,
--   <a>oracleSettings_securityDbEncryption</a> - For an Oracle source
--   endpoint, the transparent data encryption (TDE) password required by
--   AWM DMS to access Oracle redo logs encrypted by TDE using Binary
--   Reader. It is also the <tt> TDE_Password </tt> part of the
--   comma-separated value you set to the <tt>Password</tt> request
--   parameter when you create the endpoint. The
--   <tt>SecurityDbEncryptian</tt> setting is related to this
--   <tt>SecurityDbEncryptionName</tt> setting. For more information, see
--   <a>Supported encryption methods for using Oracle as a source for
--   DMS</a> in the <i>Database Migration Service User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:useLogminerReader:OracleSettings'</a>,
--   <a>oracleSettings_useLogminerReader</a> - Set this attribute to Y to
--   capture change data using the Oracle LogMiner utility (the default).
--   Set this attribute to N if you want to access the redo logs as a
--   binary file. When you set <tt>UseLogminerReader</tt> to N, also set
--   <tt>UseBfile</tt> to Y. For more information on this setting and using
--   Oracle ASM, see <a>Using Oracle LogMiner or DMS Binary Reader for
--   CDC</a> in the <i>DMS User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:readTableSpaceName:OracleSettings'</a>,
--   <a>oracleSettings_readTableSpaceName</a> - When set to <tt>true</tt>,
--   this attribute supports tablespace replication.
--   
--   <a>$sel:retryInterval:OracleSettings'</a>,
--   <a>oracleSettings_retryInterval</a> - Specifies the number of seconds
--   that the system waits before resending a query.
--   
--   Example: <tt>retryInterval=6;</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:password:OracleSettings'</a>, <a>oracleSettings_password</a> -
--   Endpoint connection password.
--   
--   <a>$sel:spatialDataOptionToGeoJsonFunctionName:OracleSettings'</a>,
--   <a>oracleSettings_spatialDataOptionToGeoJsonFunctionName</a> - Use
--   this attribute to convert <tt>SDO_GEOMETRY</tt> to <tt>GEOJSON</tt>
--   format. By default, DMS calls the <tt>SDO2GEOJSON</tt> custom function
--   if present and accessible. Or you can create your own custom function
--   that mimics the operation of <tt>SDOGEOJSON</tt> and set
--   <tt>SpatialDataOptionToGeoJsonFunctionName</tt> to call it instead.
--   
--   <a>$sel:databaseName:OracleSettings'</a>,
--   <a>oracleSettings_databaseName</a> - Database name for the endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:addSupplementalLogging:OracleSettings'</a>,
--   <a>oracleSettings_addSupplementalLogging</a> - Set this attribute to
--   set up table-level supplemental logging for the Oracle database. This
--   attribute enables PRIMARY KEY supplemental logging on all tables
--   selected for a migration task.
--   
--   If you use this option, you still need to enable database-level
--   supplemental logging.
--   
--   <a>$sel:secretsManagerOracleAsmAccessRoleArn:OracleSettings'</a>,
--   <a>oracleSettings_secretsManagerOracleAsmAccessRoleArn</a> - Required
--   only if your Oracle endpoint uses Advanced Storage Manager (ASM). The
--   full ARN of the IAM role that specifies DMS as the trusted entity and
--   grants the required permissions to access the
--   <tt>SecretsManagerOracleAsmSecret</tt>. This
--   <tt>SecretsManagerOracleAsmSecret</tt> has the secret value that
--   allows access to the Oracle ASM of the endpoint.
--   
--   You can specify one of two sets of values for these permissions. You
--   can specify the values for this setting and
--   <tt>SecretsManagerOracleAsmSecretId</tt>. Or you can specify
--   clear-text values for <tt>AsmUserName</tt>, <tt>AsmPassword</tt>, and
--   <tt>AsmServerName</tt>. You can't specify both. For more information
--   on creating this <tt>SecretsManagerOracleAsmSecret</tt> and the
--   <tt>SecretsManagerOracleAsmAccessRoleArn</tt> and
--   <tt>SecretsManagerOracleAsmSecretId</tt> required to access it, see
--   <a>Using secrets to access Database Migration Service resources</a> in
--   the <i>Database Migration Service User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:asmServer:OracleSettings'</a>, <a>oracleSettings_asmServer</a>
--   - For an Oracle source endpoint, your ASM server address. You can set
--   this value from the <tt>asm_server</tt> value. You set
--   <tt>asm_server</tt> as part of the extra connection attribute string
--   to access an Oracle server with Binary Reader that uses ASM. For more
--   information, see <a>Configuration for change data capture (CDC) on an
--   Oracle source database</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:charLengthSemantics:OracleSettings'</a>,
--   <a>oracleSettings_charLengthSemantics</a> - Specifies whether the
--   length of a character column is in bytes or in characters. To indicate
--   that the character column length is in characters, set this attribute
--   to <tt>CHAR</tt>. Otherwise, the character column length is in bytes.
--   
--   Example: <tt>charLengthSemantics=CHAR;</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:archivedLogsOnly:OracleSettings'</a>,
--   <a>oracleSettings_archivedLogsOnly</a> - When this field is set to
--   <tt>Y</tt>, DMS only accesses the archived redo logs. If the archived
--   redo logs are stored on Oracle ASM only, the DMS user account needs to
--   be granted ASM privileges.
--   
--   <a>$sel:directPathParallelLoad:OracleSettings'</a>,
--   <a>oracleSettings_directPathParallelLoad</a> - When set to
--   <tt>true</tt>, this attribute specifies a parallel load when
--   <tt>useDirectPathFullLoad</tt> is set to <tt>Y</tt>. This attribute
--   also only applies when you use the DMS parallel load feature. Note
--   that the target table cannot have any constraints or indexes.
--   
--   <a>$sel:secretsManagerSecretId:OracleSettings'</a>,
--   <a>oracleSettings_secretsManagerSecretId</a> - The full ARN, partial
--   ARN, or friendly name of the <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> that
--   contains the Oracle endpoint connection details.
--   
--   <a>$sel:additionalArchivedLogDestId:OracleSettings'</a>,
--   <a>oracleSettings_additionalArchivedLogDestId</a> - Set this attribute
--   with <tt>ArchivedLogDestId</tt> in a primary/ standby setup. This
--   attribute is useful in the case of a switchover. In this case, DMS
--   needs to know which destination to get archive redo logs from to read
--   changes. This need arises because the previous primary instance is now
--   a standby instance after switchover.
--   
--   Although DMS supports the use of the Oracle <tt>RESETLOGS</tt> option
--   to open the database, never use <tt>RESETLOGS</tt> unless necessary.
--   For additional information about <tt>RESETLOGS</tt>, see <a>RMAN Data
--   Repair Concepts</a> in the <i>Oracle Database Backup and Recovery
--   User's Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:asmPassword:OracleSettings'</a>,
--   <a>oracleSettings_asmPassword</a> - For an Oracle source endpoint,
--   your Oracle Automatic Storage Management (ASM) password. You can set
--   this value from the <tt> asm_user_password </tt> value. You set this
--   value as part of the comma-separated value that you set to the
--   <tt>Password</tt> request parameter when you create the endpoint to
--   access transaction logs using Binary Reader. For more information, see
--   <a>Configuration for change data capture (CDC) on an Oracle source
--   database</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:enableHomogenousTablespace:OracleSettings'</a>,
--   <a>oracleSettings_enableHomogenousTablespace</a> - Set this attribute
--   to enable homogenous tablespace replication and create existing tables
--   or indexes under the same tablespace on the target.
--   
--   <a>$sel:parallelAsmReadThreads:OracleSettings'</a>,
--   <a>oracleSettings_parallelAsmReadThreads</a> - Set this attribute to
--   change the number of threads that DMS configures to perform a change
--   data capture (CDC) load using Oracle Automatic Storage Management
--   (ASM). You can specify an integer value between 2 (the default) and 8
--   (the maximum). Use this attribute together with the
--   <tt>readAheadBlocks</tt> attribute.
--   
--   <a>$sel:numberDatatypeScale:OracleSettings'</a>,
--   <a>oracleSettings_numberDatatypeScale</a> - Specifies the number
--   scale. You can select a scale up to 38, or you can select FLOAT. By
--   default, the NUMBER data type is converted to precision 38, scale 10.
--   
--   Example: <tt>numberDataTypeScale=12</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:usePathPrefix:OracleSettings'</a>,
--   <a>oracleSettings_usePathPrefix</a> - Set this string attribute to the
--   required value in order to use the Binary Reader to capture change
--   data for an Amazon RDS for Oracle as the source. This value specifies
--   the path prefix used to replace the default Oracle root to access the
--   redo logs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:asmUser:OracleSettings'</a>, <a>oracleSettings_asmUser</a> -
--   For an Oracle source endpoint, your ASM user name. You can set this
--   value from the <tt>asm_user</tt> value. You set <tt>asm_user</tt> as
--   part of the extra connection attribute string to access an Oracle
--   server with Binary Reader that uses ASM. For more information, see
--   <a>Configuration for change data capture (CDC) on an Oracle source
--   database</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:useAlternateFolderForOnline:OracleSettings'</a>,
--   <a>oracleSettings_useAlternateFolderForOnline</a> - Set this attribute
--   to <tt>true</tt> in order to use the Binary Reader to capture change
--   data for an Amazon RDS for Oracle as the source. This tells the DMS
--   instance to use any specified prefix replacement to access all online
--   redo logs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:port:OracleSettings'</a>, <a>oracleSettings_port</a> -
--   Endpoint TCP port.
newOracleSettings :: OracleSettings

-- | Set this attribute to Y to capture change data using the Binary Reader
--   utility. Set <tt>UseLogminerReader</tt> to N to set this attribute to
--   Y. To use Binary Reader with Amazon RDS for Oracle as the source, you
--   set additional attributes. For more information about using this
--   setting with Oracle Automatic Storage Management (ASM), see <a>Using
--   Oracle LogMiner or DMS Binary Reader for CDC</a>.
oracleSettings_useBFile :: Lens' OracleSettings (Maybe Bool)

-- | Use this attribute to specify a time in minutes for the delay in
--   standby sync. If the source is an Oracle Active Data Guard standby
--   database, use this attribute to specify the time lag between primary
--   and standby databases.
--   
--   In DMS, you can create an Oracle CDC task that uses an Active Data
--   Guard standby instance as a source for replicating ongoing changes.
--   Doing this eliminates the need to connect to an active database that
--   might be in production.
oracleSettings_standbyDelayTime :: Lens' OracleSettings (Maybe Int)

-- | When set to <tt>true</tt>, this attribute causes a task to fail if the
--   actual size of an LOB column is greater than the specified
--   <tt>LobMaxSize</tt>.
--   
--   If a task is set to limited LOB mode and this option is set to
--   <tt>true</tt>, the task fails instead of truncating the LOB data.
oracleSettings_failTasksOnLobTruncation :: Lens' OracleSettings (Maybe Bool)

-- | Fully qualified domain name of the endpoint.
oracleSettings_serverName :: Lens' OracleSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | When set to <tt>true</tt>, this attribute helps to increase the commit
--   rate on the Oracle target database by writing directly to tables and
--   not writing a trail to database logs.
oracleSettings_directPathNoLog :: Lens' OracleSettings (Maybe Bool)

-- | Specifies the IDs of one more destinations for one or more archived
--   redo logs. These IDs are the values of the <tt>dest_id</tt> column in
--   the <tt>v$archived_log</tt> view. Use this setting with the
--   <tt>archivedLogDestId</tt> extra connection attribute in a
--   primary-to-single setup or a primary-to-multiple-standby setup.
--   
--   This setting is useful in a switchover when you use an Oracle Data
--   Guard database as a source. In this case, DMS needs information about
--   what destination to get archive redo logs from to read changes. DMS
--   needs this because after the switchover the previous primary is a
--   standby instance. For example, in a primary-to-single standby setup
--   you might apply the following settings.
--   
--   <pre>
--   archivedLogDestId=1; ExtraArchivedLogDestIds=[2]
--   </pre>
--   
--   In a primary-to-multiple-standby setup, you might apply the following
--   settings.
--   
--   <pre>
--   archivedLogDestId=1; ExtraArchivedLogDestIds=[2,3,4]
--   </pre>
--   
--   Although DMS supports the use of the Oracle <tt>RESETLOGS</tt> option
--   to open the database, never use <tt>RESETLOGS</tt> unless it's
--   necessary. For more information about <tt>RESETLOGS</tt>, see <a>RMAN
--   Data Repair Concepts</a> in the <i>Oracle Database Backup and Recovery
--   User's Guide</i>.
oracleSettings_extraArchivedLogDestIds :: Lens' OracleSettings (Maybe [Int])

-- | For an Oracle source endpoint, the name of a key used for the
--   transparent data encryption (TDE) of the columns and tablespaces in an
--   Oracle source database that is encrypted using TDE. The key value is
--   the value of the <tt>SecurityDbEncryption</tt> setting. For more
--   information on setting the key name value of
--   <tt>SecurityDbEncryptionName</tt>, see the information and example for
--   setting the <tt>securityDbEncryptionName</tt> extra connection
--   attribute in <a>Supported encryption methods for using Oracle as a
--   source for DMS</a> in the <i>Database Migration Service User
--   Guide</i>.
oracleSettings_securityDbEncryptionName :: Lens' OracleSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | Set this string attribute to the required value in order to use the
--   Binary Reader to capture change data for an Amazon RDS for Oracle as
--   the source. This value specifies the default Oracle root used to
--   access the redo logs.
oracleSettings_oraclePathPrefix :: Lens' OracleSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | The full Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role that specifies DMS
--   as the trusted entity and grants the required permissions to access
--   the value in <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt>. The role must allow the
--   <tt>iam:PassRole</tt> action. <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> has the
--   value of the Amazon Web Services Secrets Manager secret that allows
--   access to the Oracle endpoint.
--   
--   You can specify one of two sets of values for these permissions. You
--   can specify the values for this setting and
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecretId</tt>. Or you can specify clear-text values
--   for <tt>UserName</tt>, <tt>Password</tt>, <tt>ServerName</tt>, and
--   <tt>Port</tt>. You can't specify both. For more information on
--   creating this <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> and the
--   <tt>SecretsManagerAccessRoleArn</tt> and
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecretId</tt> required to access it, see <a>Using
--   secrets to access Database Migration Service resources</a> in the
--   <i>Database Migration Service User Guide</i>.
oracleSettings_secretsManagerAccessRoleArn :: Lens' OracleSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | Set this attribute to Y to have DMS use a direct path full load.
--   Specify this value to use the direct path protocol in the Oracle Call
--   Interface (OCI). By using this OCI protocol, you can bulk-load Oracle
--   target tables during a full load.
oracleSettings_useDirectPathFullLoad :: Lens' OracleSettings (Maybe Bool)

-- | Endpoint connection user name.
oracleSettings_username :: Lens' OracleSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | Set this attribute to <tt>true</tt> to enable replication of Oracle
--   tables containing columns that are nested tables or defined types.
oracleSettings_allowSelectNestedTables :: Lens' OracleSettings (Maybe Bool)

-- | Set this attribute to change the number of read-ahead blocks that DMS
--   configures to perform a change data capture (CDC) load using Oracle
--   Automatic Storage Management (ASM). You can specify an integer value
--   between 1000 (the default) and 200,000 (the maximum).
oracleSettings_readAheadBlocks :: Lens' OracleSettings (Maybe Int)

-- | Specifies the ID of the destination for the archived redo logs. This
--   value should be the same as a number in the dest_id column of the
--   v$archived_log view. If you work with an additional redo log
--   destination, use the <tt>AdditionalArchivedLogDestId</tt> option to
--   specify the additional destination ID. Doing this improves performance
--   by ensuring that the correct logs are accessed from the outset.
oracleSettings_archivedLogDestId :: Lens' OracleSettings (Maybe Int)

-- | Set this attribute to true in order to use the Binary Reader to
--   capture change data for an Amazon RDS for Oracle as the source. This
--   setting tells DMS instance to replace the default Oracle root with the
--   specified <tt>usePathPrefix</tt> setting to access the redo logs.
oracleSettings_replacePathPrefix :: Lens' OracleSettings (Maybe Bool)

-- | Set this attribute to <tt>false</tt> in order to use the Binary Reader
--   to capture change data for an Amazon RDS for Oracle as the source.
--   This tells the DMS instance to not access redo logs through any
--   specified path prefix replacement using direct file access.
oracleSettings_accessAlternateDirectly :: Lens' OracleSettings (Maybe Bool)

-- | Required only if your Oracle endpoint uses Advanced Storage Manager
--   (ASM). The full ARN, partial ARN, or friendly name of the
--   <tt>SecretsManagerOracleAsmSecret</tt> that contains the Oracle ASM
--   connection details for the Oracle endpoint.
oracleSettings_secretsManagerOracleAsmSecretId :: Lens' OracleSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | For an Oracle source endpoint, the transparent data encryption (TDE)
--   password required by AWM DMS to access Oracle redo logs encrypted by
--   TDE using Binary Reader. It is also the <tt> TDE_Password </tt> part
--   of the comma-separated value you set to the <tt>Password</tt> request
--   parameter when you create the endpoint. The
--   <tt>SecurityDbEncryptian</tt> setting is related to this
--   <tt>SecurityDbEncryptionName</tt> setting. For more information, see
--   <a>Supported encryption methods for using Oracle as a source for
--   DMS</a> in the <i>Database Migration Service User Guide</i>.
oracleSettings_securityDbEncryption :: Lens' OracleSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | Set this attribute to Y to capture change data using the Oracle
--   LogMiner utility (the default). Set this attribute to N if you want to
--   access the redo logs as a binary file. When you set
--   <tt>UseLogminerReader</tt> to N, also set <tt>UseBfile</tt> to Y. For
--   more information on this setting and using Oracle ASM, see <a>Using
--   Oracle LogMiner or DMS Binary Reader for CDC</a> in the <i>DMS User
--   Guide</i>.
oracleSettings_useLogminerReader :: Lens' OracleSettings (Maybe Bool)

-- | When set to <tt>true</tt>, this attribute supports tablespace
--   replication.
oracleSettings_readTableSpaceName :: Lens' OracleSettings (Maybe Bool)

-- | Specifies the number of seconds that the system waits before resending
--   a query.
--   
--   Example: <tt>retryInterval=6;</tt>
oracleSettings_retryInterval :: Lens' OracleSettings (Maybe Int)

-- | Endpoint connection password.
oracleSettings_password :: Lens' OracleSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | Use this attribute to convert <tt>SDO_GEOMETRY</tt> to
--   <tt>GEOJSON</tt> format. By default, DMS calls the
--   <tt>SDO2GEOJSON</tt> custom function if present and accessible. Or you
--   can create your own custom function that mimics the operation of
--   <tt>SDOGEOJSON</tt> and set
--   <tt>SpatialDataOptionToGeoJsonFunctionName</tt> to call it instead.
oracleSettings_spatialDataOptionToGeoJsonFunctionName :: Lens' OracleSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | Database name for the endpoint.
oracleSettings_databaseName :: Lens' OracleSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | Set this attribute to set up table-level supplemental logging for the
--   Oracle database. This attribute enables PRIMARY KEY supplemental
--   logging on all tables selected for a migration task.
--   
--   If you use this option, you still need to enable database-level
--   supplemental logging.
oracleSettings_addSupplementalLogging :: Lens' OracleSettings (Maybe Bool)

-- | Required only if your Oracle endpoint uses Advanced Storage Manager
--   (ASM). The full ARN of the IAM role that specifies DMS as the trusted
--   entity and grants the required permissions to access the
--   <tt>SecretsManagerOracleAsmSecret</tt>. This
--   <tt>SecretsManagerOracleAsmSecret</tt> has the secret value that
--   allows access to the Oracle ASM of the endpoint.
--   
--   You can specify one of two sets of values for these permissions. You
--   can specify the values for this setting and
--   <tt>SecretsManagerOracleAsmSecretId</tt>. Or you can specify
--   clear-text values for <tt>AsmUserName</tt>, <tt>AsmPassword</tt>, and
--   <tt>AsmServerName</tt>. You can't specify both. For more information
--   on creating this <tt>SecretsManagerOracleAsmSecret</tt> and the
--   <tt>SecretsManagerOracleAsmAccessRoleArn</tt> and
--   <tt>SecretsManagerOracleAsmSecretId</tt> required to access it, see
--   <a>Using secrets to access Database Migration Service resources</a> in
--   the <i>Database Migration Service User Guide</i>.
oracleSettings_secretsManagerOracleAsmAccessRoleArn :: Lens' OracleSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | For an Oracle source endpoint, your ASM server address. You can set
--   this value from the <tt>asm_server</tt> value. You set
--   <tt>asm_server</tt> as part of the extra connection attribute string
--   to access an Oracle server with Binary Reader that uses ASM. For more
--   information, see <a>Configuration for change data capture (CDC) on an
--   Oracle source database</a>.
oracleSettings_asmServer :: Lens' OracleSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies whether the length of a character column is in bytes or in
--   characters. To indicate that the character column length is in
--   characters, set this attribute to <tt>CHAR</tt>. Otherwise, the
--   character column length is in bytes.
--   
--   Example: <tt>charLengthSemantics=CHAR;</tt>
oracleSettings_charLengthSemantics :: Lens' OracleSettings (Maybe CharLengthSemantics)

-- | When this field is set to <tt>Y</tt>, DMS only accesses the archived
--   redo logs. If the archived redo logs are stored on Oracle ASM only,
--   the DMS user account needs to be granted ASM privileges.
oracleSettings_archivedLogsOnly :: Lens' OracleSettings (Maybe Bool)

-- | When set to <tt>true</tt>, this attribute specifies a parallel load
--   when <tt>useDirectPathFullLoad</tt> is set to <tt>Y</tt>. This
--   attribute also only applies when you use the DMS parallel load
--   feature. Note that the target table cannot have any constraints or
--   indexes.
oracleSettings_directPathParallelLoad :: Lens' OracleSettings (Maybe Bool)

-- | The full ARN, partial ARN, or friendly name of the
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> that contains the Oracle endpoint
--   connection details.
oracleSettings_secretsManagerSecretId :: Lens' OracleSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | Set this attribute with <tt>ArchivedLogDestId</tt> in a primary/
--   standby setup. This attribute is useful in the case of a switchover.
--   In this case, DMS needs to know which destination to get archive redo
--   logs from to read changes. This need arises because the previous
--   primary instance is now a standby instance after switchover.
--   
--   Although DMS supports the use of the Oracle <tt>RESETLOGS</tt> option
--   to open the database, never use <tt>RESETLOGS</tt> unless necessary.
--   For additional information about <tt>RESETLOGS</tt>, see <a>RMAN Data
--   Repair Concepts</a> in the <i>Oracle Database Backup and Recovery
--   User's Guide</i>.
oracleSettings_additionalArchivedLogDestId :: Lens' OracleSettings (Maybe Int)

-- | For an Oracle source endpoint, your Oracle Automatic Storage
--   Management (ASM) password. You can set this value from the <tt>
--   asm_user_password </tt> value. You set this value as part of the
--   comma-separated value that you set to the <tt>Password</tt> request
--   parameter when you create the endpoint to access transaction logs
--   using Binary Reader. For more information, see <a>Configuration for
--   change data capture (CDC) on an Oracle source database</a>.
oracleSettings_asmPassword :: Lens' OracleSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | Set this attribute to enable homogenous tablespace replication and
--   create existing tables or indexes under the same tablespace on the
--   target.
oracleSettings_enableHomogenousTablespace :: Lens' OracleSettings (Maybe Bool)

-- | Set this attribute to change the number of threads that DMS configures
--   to perform a change data capture (CDC) load using Oracle Automatic
--   Storage Management (ASM). You can specify an integer value between 2
--   (the default) and 8 (the maximum). Use this attribute together with
--   the <tt>readAheadBlocks</tt> attribute.
oracleSettings_parallelAsmReadThreads :: Lens' OracleSettings (Maybe Int)

-- | Specifies the number scale. You can select a scale up to 38, or you
--   can select FLOAT. By default, the NUMBER data type is converted to
--   precision 38, scale 10.
--   
--   Example: <tt>numberDataTypeScale=12</tt>
oracleSettings_numberDatatypeScale :: Lens' OracleSettings (Maybe Int)

-- | Set this string attribute to the required value in order to use the
--   Binary Reader to capture change data for an Amazon RDS for Oracle as
--   the source. This value specifies the path prefix used to replace the
--   default Oracle root to access the redo logs.
oracleSettings_usePathPrefix :: Lens' OracleSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | For an Oracle source endpoint, your ASM user name. You can set this
--   value from the <tt>asm_user</tt> value. You set <tt>asm_user</tt> as
--   part of the extra connection attribute string to access an Oracle
--   server with Binary Reader that uses ASM. For more information, see
--   <a>Configuration for change data capture (CDC) on an Oracle source
--   database</a>.
oracleSettings_asmUser :: Lens' OracleSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | Set this attribute to <tt>true</tt> in order to use the Binary Reader
--   to capture change data for an Amazon RDS for Oracle as the source.
--   This tells the DMS instance to use any specified prefix replacement to
--   access all online redo logs.
oracleSettings_useAlternateFolderForOnline :: Lens' OracleSettings (Maybe Bool)

-- | Endpoint TCP port.
oracleSettings_port :: Lens' OracleSettings (Maybe Int)

-- | In response to the <tt>DescribeOrderableReplicationInstances</tt>
--   operation, this object describes an available replication instance.
--   This description includes the replication instance's type, engine
--   version, and allocated storage.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newOrderableReplicationInstance</a> smart constructor.
data OrderableReplicationInstance
OrderableReplicationInstance' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe ReleaseStatusValues -> Maybe Int -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> OrderableReplicationInstance

-- | The version of the replication engine.
[$sel:engineVersion:OrderableReplicationInstance'] :: OrderableReplicationInstance -> Maybe Text

-- | The minimum amount of storage (in gigabytes) that can be allocated for
--   the replication instance.
[$sel:minAllocatedStorage:OrderableReplicationInstance'] :: OrderableReplicationInstance -> Maybe Int

-- | The value returned when the specified <tt>EngineVersion</tt> of the
--   replication instance is in Beta or test mode. This indicates some
--   features might not work as expected.
--   
--   DMS supports the <tt>ReleaseStatus</tt> parameter in versions 3.1.4
--   and later.
[$sel:releaseStatus:OrderableReplicationInstance'] :: OrderableReplicationInstance -> Maybe ReleaseStatusValues

-- | The amount of storage (in gigabytes) that is allocated for the
--   replication instance.
[$sel:includedAllocatedStorage:OrderableReplicationInstance'] :: OrderableReplicationInstance -> Maybe Int

-- | List of Availability Zones for this replication instance.
[$sel:availabilityZones:OrderableReplicationInstance'] :: OrderableReplicationInstance -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The minimum amount of storage (in gigabytes) that can be allocated for
--   the replication instance.
[$sel:maxAllocatedStorage:OrderableReplicationInstance'] :: OrderableReplicationInstance -> Maybe Int

-- | The compute and memory capacity of the replication instance as defined
--   for the specified replication instance class. For example to specify
--   the instance class dms.c4.large, set this parameter to
--   <tt>"dms.c4.large"</tt>.
--   
--   For more information on the settings and capacities for the available
--   replication instance classes, see <a>Selecting the right DMS
--   replication instance for your migration</a>.
[$sel:replicationInstanceClass:OrderableReplicationInstance'] :: OrderableReplicationInstance -> Maybe Text

-- | The default amount of storage (in gigabytes) that is allocated for the
--   replication instance.
[$sel:defaultAllocatedStorage:OrderableReplicationInstance'] :: OrderableReplicationInstance -> Maybe Int

-- | The type of storage used by the replication instance.
[$sel:storageType:OrderableReplicationInstance'] :: OrderableReplicationInstance -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>OrderableReplicationInstance</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:engineVersion:OrderableReplicationInstance'</a>,
--   <a>orderableReplicationInstance_engineVersion</a> - The version of the
--   replication engine.
--   
--   <a>$sel:minAllocatedStorage:OrderableReplicationInstance'</a>,
--   <a>orderableReplicationInstance_minAllocatedStorage</a> - The minimum
--   amount of storage (in gigabytes) that can be allocated for the
--   replication instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:releaseStatus:OrderableReplicationInstance'</a>,
--   <a>orderableReplicationInstance_releaseStatus</a> - The value returned
--   when the specified <tt>EngineVersion</tt> of the replication instance
--   is in Beta or test mode. This indicates some features might not work
--   as expected.
--
