-- | Modifies the replication instance to apply new settings. You can
--   change one or more parameters by specifying these parameters and the
--   new values in the request.
--   
--   Some settings are applied during the maintenance window.
module Network.AWS.DMS.ModifyReplicationInstance

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newModifyReplicationInstance</a> smart constructor.
data ModifyReplicationInstance
ModifyReplicationInstance' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Text -> ModifyReplicationInstance

-- | The engine version number of the replication instance.
--   
--   When modifying a major engine version of an instance, also set
--   <tt>AllowMajorVersionUpgrade</tt> to <tt>true</tt>.
[$sel:engineVersion:ModifyReplicationInstance'] :: ModifyReplicationInstance -> Maybe Text

-- | A value that indicates that minor version upgrades are applied
--   automatically to the replication instance during the maintenance
--   window. Changing this parameter doesn't result in an outage, except in
--   the case described following. The change is asynchronously applied as
--   soon as possible.
--   
--   An outage does result if these factors apply:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>This parameter is set to <tt>true</tt> during the maintenance
--   window.</li>
--   <li>A newer minor version is available.</li>
--   <li>DMS has enabled automatic patching for the given engine
--   version.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:autoMinorVersionUpgrade:ModifyReplicationInstance'] :: ModifyReplicationInstance -> Maybe Bool

-- | Indicates that major version upgrades are allowed. Changing this
--   parameter does not result in an outage, and the change is
--   asynchronously applied as soon as possible.
--   
--   This parameter must be set to <tt>true</tt> when specifying a value
--   for the <tt>EngineVersion</tt> parameter that is a different major
--   version than the replication instance's current version.
[$sel:allowMajorVersionUpgrade:ModifyReplicationInstance'] :: ModifyReplicationInstance -> Maybe Bool

-- | The weekly time range (in UTC) during which system maintenance can
--   occur, which might result in an outage. Changing this parameter does
--   not result in an outage, except in the following situation, and the
--   change is asynchronously applied as soon as possible. If moving this
--   window to the current time, there must be at least 30 minutes between
--   the current time and end of the window to ensure pending changes are
--   applied.
--   
--   Default: Uses existing setting
--   
--   Format: ddd:hh24:mi-ddd:hh24:mi
--   
--   Valid Days: Mon | Tue | Wed | Thu | Fri | Sat | Sun
--   
--   Constraints: Must be at least 30 minutes
[$sel:preferredMaintenanceWindow:ModifyReplicationInstance'] :: ModifyReplicationInstance -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies the VPC security group to be used with the replication
--   instance. The VPC security group must work with the VPC containing the
--   replication instance.
[$sel:vpcSecurityGroupIds:ModifyReplicationInstance'] :: ModifyReplicationInstance -> Maybe [Text]

-- | Specifies whether the replication instance is a Multi-AZ deployment.
--   You can't set the <tt>AvailabilityZone</tt> parameter if the Multi-AZ
--   parameter is set to <tt>true</tt>.
[$sel:multiAZ:ModifyReplicationInstance'] :: ModifyReplicationInstance -> Maybe Bool

-- | The amount of storage (in gigabytes) to be allocated for the
--   replication instance.
[$sel:allocatedStorage:ModifyReplicationInstance'] :: ModifyReplicationInstance -> Maybe Int

-- | Indicates whether the changes should be applied immediately or during
--   the next maintenance window.
[$sel:applyImmediately:ModifyReplicationInstance'] :: ModifyReplicationInstance -> Maybe Bool

-- | The compute and memory capacity of the replication instance as defined
--   for the specified replication instance class. For example to specify
--   the instance class dms.c4.large, set this parameter to
--   <tt>"dms.c4.large"</tt>.
--   
--   For more information on the settings and capacities for the available
--   replication instance classes, see <a>Selecting the right DMS
--   replication instance for your migration</a>.
[$sel:replicationInstanceClass:ModifyReplicationInstance'] :: ModifyReplicationInstance -> Maybe Text

-- | The replication instance identifier. This parameter is stored as a
--   lowercase string.
[$sel:replicationInstanceIdentifier:ModifyReplicationInstance'] :: ModifyReplicationInstance -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the replication instance.
[$sel:replicationInstanceArn:ModifyReplicationInstance'] :: ModifyReplicationInstance -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ModifyReplicationInstance</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:engineVersion:ModifyReplicationInstance'</a>,
--   <a>modifyReplicationInstance_engineVersion</a> - The engine version
--   number of the replication instance.
--   
--   When modifying a major engine version of an instance, also set
--   <tt>AllowMajorVersionUpgrade</tt> to <tt>true</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:autoMinorVersionUpgrade:ModifyReplicationInstance'</a>,
--   <a>modifyReplicationInstance_autoMinorVersionUpgrade</a> - A value
--   that indicates that minor version upgrades are applied automatically
--   to the replication instance during the maintenance window. Changing
--   this parameter doesn't result in an outage, except in the case
--   described following. The change is asynchronously applied as soon as
--   possible.
--   
--   An outage does result if these factors apply:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>This parameter is set to <tt>true</tt> during the maintenance
--   window.</li>
--   <li>A newer minor version is available.</li>
--   <li>DMS has enabled automatic patching for the given engine
--   version.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:allowMajorVersionUpgrade:ModifyReplicationInstance'</a>,
--   <a>modifyReplicationInstance_allowMajorVersionUpgrade</a> - Indicates
--   that major version upgrades are allowed. Changing this parameter does
--   not result in an outage, and the change is asynchronously applied as
--   soon as possible.
--   
--   This parameter must be set to <tt>true</tt> when specifying a value
--   for the <tt>EngineVersion</tt> parameter that is a different major
--   version than the replication instance's current version.
--   
--   <a>$sel:preferredMaintenanceWindow:ModifyReplicationInstance'</a>,
--   <a>modifyReplicationInstance_preferredMaintenanceWindow</a> - The
--   weekly time range (in UTC) during which system maintenance can occur,
--   which might result in an outage. Changing this parameter does not
--   result in an outage, except in the following situation, and the change
--   is asynchronously applied as soon as possible. If moving this window
--   to the current time, there must be at least 30 minutes between the
--   current time and end of the window to ensure pending changes are
--   applied.
--   
--   Default: Uses existing setting
--   
--   Format: ddd:hh24:mi-ddd:hh24:mi
--   
--   Valid Days: Mon | Tue | Wed | Thu | Fri | Sat | Sun
--   
--   Constraints: Must be at least 30 minutes
--   
--   <a>$sel:vpcSecurityGroupIds:ModifyReplicationInstance'</a>,
--   <a>modifyReplicationInstance_vpcSecurityGroupIds</a> - Specifies the
--   VPC security group to be used with the replication instance. The VPC
--   security group must work with the VPC containing the replication
--   instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:multiAZ:ModifyReplicationInstance'</a>,
--   <a>modifyReplicationInstance_multiAZ</a> - Specifies whether the
--   replication instance is a Multi-AZ deployment. You can't set the
--   <tt>AvailabilityZone</tt> parameter if the Multi-AZ parameter is set
--   to <tt>true</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:allocatedStorage:ModifyReplicationInstance'</a>,
--   <a>modifyReplicationInstance_allocatedStorage</a> - The amount of
--   storage (in gigabytes) to be allocated for the replication instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:applyImmediately:ModifyReplicationInstance'</a>,
--   <a>modifyReplicationInstance_applyImmediately</a> - Indicates whether
--   the changes should be applied immediately or during the next
--   maintenance window.
--   
--   <a>$sel:replicationInstanceClass:ModifyReplicationInstance'</a>,
--   <a>modifyReplicationInstance_replicationInstanceClass</a> - The
--   compute and memory capacity of the replication instance as defined for
--   the specified replication instance class. For example to specify the
--   instance class dms.c4.large, set this parameter to
--   <tt>"dms.c4.large"</tt>.
--   
--   For more information on the settings and capacities for the available
--   replication instance classes, see <a>Selecting the right DMS
--   replication instance for your migration</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:replicationInstanceIdentifier:ModifyReplicationInstance'</a>,
--   <a>modifyReplicationInstance_replicationInstanceIdentifier</a> - The
--   replication instance identifier. This parameter is stored as a
--   lowercase string.
--   
--   <a>$sel:replicationInstanceArn:ModifyReplicationInstance'</a>,
--   <a>modifyReplicationInstance_replicationInstanceArn</a> - The Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN) of the replication instance.
newModifyReplicationInstance :: Text -> ModifyReplicationInstance

-- | The engine version number of the replication instance.
--   
--   When modifying a major engine version of an instance, also set
--   <tt>AllowMajorVersionUpgrade</tt> to <tt>true</tt>.
modifyReplicationInstance_engineVersion :: Lens' ModifyReplicationInstance (Maybe Text)

-- | A value that indicates that minor version upgrades are applied
--   automatically to the replication instance during the maintenance
--   window. Changing this parameter doesn't result in an outage, except in
--   the case described following. The change is asynchronously applied as
--   soon as possible.
--   
--   An outage does result if these factors apply:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>This parameter is set to <tt>true</tt> during the maintenance
--   window.</li>
--   <li>A newer minor version is available.</li>
--   <li>DMS has enabled automatic patching for the given engine
--   version.</li>
--   </ul>
modifyReplicationInstance_autoMinorVersionUpgrade :: Lens' ModifyReplicationInstance (Maybe Bool)

-- | Indicates that major version upgrades are allowed. Changing this
--   parameter does not result in an outage, and the change is
--   asynchronously applied as soon as possible.
--   
--   This parameter must be set to <tt>true</tt> when specifying a value
--   for the <tt>EngineVersion</tt> parameter that is a different major
--   version than the replication instance's current version.
modifyReplicationInstance_allowMajorVersionUpgrade :: Lens' ModifyReplicationInstance (Maybe Bool)

-- | The weekly time range (in UTC) during which system maintenance can
--   occur, which might result in an outage. Changing this parameter does
--   not result in an outage, except in the following situation, and the
--   change is asynchronously applied as soon as possible. If moving this
--   window to the current time, there must be at least 30 minutes between
--   the current time and end of the window to ensure pending changes are
--   applied.
--   
--   Default: Uses existing setting
--   
--   Format: ddd:hh24:mi-ddd:hh24:mi
--   
--   Valid Days: Mon | Tue | Wed | Thu | Fri | Sat | Sun
--   
--   Constraints: Must be at least 30 minutes
modifyReplicationInstance_preferredMaintenanceWindow :: Lens' ModifyReplicationInstance (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the VPC security group to be used with the replication
--   instance. The VPC security group must work with the VPC containing the
--   replication instance.
modifyReplicationInstance_vpcSecurityGroupIds :: Lens' ModifyReplicationInstance (Maybe [Text])

-- | Specifies whether the replication instance is a Multi-AZ deployment.
--   You can't set the <tt>AvailabilityZone</tt> parameter if the Multi-AZ
--   parameter is set to <tt>true</tt>.
modifyReplicationInstance_multiAZ :: Lens' ModifyReplicationInstance (Maybe Bool)

-- | The amount of storage (in gigabytes) to be allocated for the
--   replication instance.
modifyReplicationInstance_allocatedStorage :: Lens' ModifyReplicationInstance (Maybe Int)

-- | Indicates whether the changes should be applied immediately or during
--   the next maintenance window.
modifyReplicationInstance_applyImmediately :: Lens' ModifyReplicationInstance (Maybe Bool)

-- | The compute and memory capacity of the replication instance as defined
--   for the specified replication instance class. For example to specify
--   the instance class dms.c4.large, set this parameter to
--   <tt>"dms.c4.large"</tt>.
--   
--   For more information on the settings and capacities for the available
--   replication instance classes, see <a>Selecting the right DMS
--   replication instance for your migration</a>.
modifyReplicationInstance_replicationInstanceClass :: Lens' ModifyReplicationInstance (Maybe Text)

-- | The replication instance identifier. This parameter is stored as a
--   lowercase string.
modifyReplicationInstance_replicationInstanceIdentifier :: Lens' ModifyReplicationInstance (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the replication instance.
modifyReplicationInstance_replicationInstanceArn :: Lens' ModifyReplicationInstance Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newModifyReplicationInstanceResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.
data ModifyReplicationInstanceResponse
ModifyReplicationInstanceResponse' :: Maybe ReplicationInstance -> Int -> ModifyReplicationInstanceResponse

-- | The modified replication instance.
[$sel:replicationInstance:ModifyReplicationInstanceResponse'] :: ModifyReplicationInstanceResponse -> Maybe ReplicationInstance

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:ModifyReplicationInstanceResponse'] :: ModifyReplicationInstanceResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>ModifyReplicationInstanceResponse</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:replicationInstance:ModifyReplicationInstanceResponse'</a>,
--   <a>modifyReplicationInstanceResponse_replicationInstance</a> - The
--   modified replication instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:ModifyReplicationInstanceResponse'</a>,
--   <a>modifyReplicationInstanceResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's
--   http status code.
newModifyReplicationInstanceResponse :: Int -> ModifyReplicationInstanceResponse

-- | The modified replication instance.
modifyReplicationInstanceResponse_replicationInstance :: Lens' ModifyReplicationInstanceResponse (Maybe ReplicationInstance)

-- | The response's http status code.
modifyReplicationInstanceResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' ModifyReplicationInstanceResponse Int

-- | Modifies an existing DMS event notification subscription.
module Network.AWS.DMS.ModifyEventSubscription

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newModifyEventSubscription</a> smart constructor.
data ModifyEventSubscription
ModifyEventSubscription' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> Text -> ModifyEventSubscription

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon SNS topic created for
--   event notification. The ARN is created by Amazon SNS when you create a
--   topic and subscribe to it.
[$sel:snsTopicArn:ModifyEventSubscription'] :: ModifyEventSubscription -> Maybe Text

-- | A Boolean value; set to <b>true</b> to activate the subscription.
[$sel:enabled:ModifyEventSubscription'] :: ModifyEventSubscription -> Maybe Bool

-- | The type of DMS resource that generates the events you want to
--   subscribe to.
--   
--   Valid values: replication-instance | replication-task
[$sel:sourceType:ModifyEventSubscription'] :: ModifyEventSubscription -> Maybe Text

-- | A list of event categories for a source type that you want to
--   subscribe to. Use the <tt>DescribeEventCategories</tt> action to see a
--   list of event categories.
[$sel:eventCategories:ModifyEventSubscription'] :: ModifyEventSubscription -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The name of the DMS event notification subscription to be modified.
[$sel:subscriptionName:ModifyEventSubscription'] :: ModifyEventSubscription -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ModifyEventSubscription</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   <a>modifyEventSubscription_snsTopicArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name
--   (ARN) of the Amazon SNS topic created for event notification. The ARN
--   is created by Amazon SNS when you create a topic and subscribe to it.
--   
--   <a>$sel:enabled:ModifyEventSubscription'</a>,
--   <a>modifyEventSubscription_enabled</a> - A Boolean value; set to
--   <b>true</b> to activate the subscription.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sourceType:ModifyEventSubscription'</a>,
--   <a>modifyEventSubscription_sourceType</a> - The type of DMS resource
--   that generates the events you want to subscribe to.
--   
--   Valid values: replication-instance | replication-task
--   
--   <a>$sel:eventCategories:ModifyEventSubscription'</a>,
--   <a>modifyEventSubscription_eventCategories</a> - A list of event
--   categories for a source type that you want to subscribe to. Use the
--   <tt>DescribeEventCategories</tt> action to see a list of event
--   categories.
--   
--   <a>$sel:subscriptionName:ModifyEventSubscription'</a>,
--   <a>modifyEventSubscription_subscriptionName</a> - The name of the DMS
--   event notification subscription to be modified.
newModifyEventSubscription :: Text -> ModifyEventSubscription

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon SNS topic created for
--   event notification. The ARN is created by Amazon SNS when you create a
--   topic and subscribe to it.
modifyEventSubscription_snsTopicArn :: Lens' ModifyEventSubscription (Maybe Text)

--   subscribe to.
--

modifyEventSubscription_sourceType :: Lens' ModifyEventSubscription (Maybe Text)

-- | A list of event categories for a source type that you want to
--   subscribe to. Use the <tt>DescribeEventCategories</tt> action to see a
--   list of event categories.
modifyEventSubscription_eventCategories :: Lens' ModifyEventSubscription (Maybe [Text])

-- | The name of the DMS event notification subscription to be modified.
modifyEventSubscription_subscriptionName :: Lens' ModifyEventSubscription Text

-- | Modifies the specified endpoint.
--   
--   For a MySQL source or target endpoint, don't explicitly specify the
--   database using the <tt>DatabaseName</tt> request parameter on the
--   <tt>ModifyEndpoint</tt> API call. Specifying <tt>DatabaseName</tt>
--   when you modify a MySQL endpoint replicates all the task tables to
--   this single database. For MySQL endpoints, you specify the database
--   only when you specify the schema in the table-mapping rules of the DMS
--   task.
module Network.AWS.DMS.ModifyEndpoint

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newModifyEndpoint</a> smart constructor.
data ModifyEndpoint
ModifyEndpoint' :: Maybe DmsTransferSettings -> Maybe MySQLSettings -> Maybe Text -> Maybe MicrosoftSQLServerSettings -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe DocDbSettings -> Maybe PostgreSQLSettings -> Maybe Text -> Maybe KafkaSettings -> Maybe OracleSettings -> Maybe ReplicationEndpointTypeValue -> Maybe RedshiftSettings -> Maybe ElasticsearchSettings -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe RedisSettings -> Maybe NeptuneSettings -> Maybe IBMDb2Settings -> Maybe MongoDbSettings -> Maybe DmsSslModeValue -> Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> Maybe SybaseSettings -> Maybe Text -> Maybe S3Settings -> Maybe KinesisSettings -> Maybe Text -> Maybe DynamoDbSettings -> Maybe Int -> Text -> ModifyEndpoint

-- | The settings in JSON format for the DMS transfer type of source
--   endpoint.
--   
--   Attributes include the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>serviceAccessRoleArn - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) used by the
--   service access IAM role. The role must allow the <tt>iam:PassRole</tt>
--   action.</li>
--   <li>BucketName - The name of the S3 bucket to use.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   Shorthand syntax for these settings is as follows:
--   <tt>ServiceAccessRoleArn=string ,BucketName=string</tt>
--   
--   JSON syntax for these settings is as follows: <tt>{
--   "ServiceAccessRoleArn": "string", "BucketName": "string"} </tt>
[$sel:dmsTransferSettings:ModifyEndpoint'] :: ModifyEndpoint -> Maybe DmsTransferSettings

-- | Settings in JSON format for the source and target MySQL endpoint. For
--   information about other available settings, see <a>Extra connection
--   attributes when using MySQL as a source for DMS</a> and <a>Extra
--   connection attributes when using a MySQL-compatible database as a
--   target for DMS</a> in the <i>Database Migration Service User
--   Guide.</i>
[$sel:mySQLSettings:ModifyEndpoint'] :: ModifyEndpoint -> Maybe MySQLSettings

-- | The name of the server where the endpoint database resides.
[$sel:serverName:ModifyEndpoint'] :: ModifyEndpoint -> Maybe Text

-- | Settings in JSON format for the source and target Microsoft SQL Server
--   endpoint. For information about other available settings, see <a>Extra
--   connection attributes when using SQL Server as a source for DMS</a>
--   and <a>Extra connection attributes when using SQL Server as a target
--   for DMS</a> in the <i>Database Migration Service User Guide.</i>
[$sel:microsoftSQLServerSettings:ModifyEndpoint'] :: ModifyEndpoint -> Maybe MicrosoftSQLServerSettings

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the certificate used for SSL
--   connection.
[$sel:certificateArn:ModifyEndpoint'] :: ModifyEndpoint -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the IAM role you want to use to
--   modify the endpoint. The role must allow the <tt>iam:PassRole</tt>
--   action.
[$sel:serviceAccessRoleArn:ModifyEndpoint'] :: ModifyEndpoint -> Maybe Text

-- | Settings in JSON format for the source DocumentDB endpoint. For more
--   information about the available settings, see the configuration
--   properties section in <a>Using DocumentDB as a Target for Database
--   Migration Service</a> in the <i>Database Migration Service User
--   Guide.</i>
[$sel:docDbSettings:ModifyEndpoint'] :: ModifyEndpoint -> Maybe DocDbSettings

-- | Settings in JSON format for the source and target PostgreSQL endpoint.
--   For information about other available settings, see <a>Extra
--   connection attributes when using PostgreSQL as a source for DMS</a>
--   and <a>Extra connection attributes when using PostgreSQL as a target
--   for DMS</a> in the <i>Database Migration Service User Guide.</i>
[$sel:postgreSQLSettings:ModifyEndpoint'] :: ModifyEndpoint -> Maybe PostgreSQLSettings

-- | Additional attributes associated with the connection. To reset this
--   parameter, pass the empty string ("") as an argument.
[$sel:extraConnectionAttributes:ModifyEndpoint'] :: ModifyEndpoint -> Maybe Text

-- | Settings in JSON format for the target Apache Kafka endpoint. For more
--   information about the available settings, see <a>Using object mapping
--   to migrate data to a Kafka topic</a> in the <i>Database Migration
--   Service User Guide.</i>
[$sel:kafkaSettings:ModifyEndpoint'] :: ModifyEndpoint -> Maybe KafkaSettings

-- | Settings in JSON format for the source and target Oracle endpoint. For
--   information about other available settings, see <a>Extra connection
--   attributes when using Oracle as a source for DMS</a> and <a>Extra
--   connection attributes when using Oracle as a target for DMS</a> in the
--   <i>Database Migration Service User Guide.</i>
[$sel:oracleSettings:ModifyEndpoint'] :: ModifyEndpoint -> Maybe OracleSettings

-- | The type of endpoint. Valid values are <tt>source</tt> and
--   <tt>target</tt>.
[$sel:endpointType:ModifyEndpoint'] :: ModifyEndpoint -> Maybe ReplicationEndpointTypeValue
[$sel:redshiftSettings:ModifyEndpoint'] :: ModifyEndpoint -> Maybe RedshiftSettings

-- | Settings in JSON format for the target Elasticsearch endpoint. For
--   more information about the available settings, see <a>Extra Connection
--   Attributes When Using Elasticsearch as a Target for DMS</a> in the
--   <i>Database Migration Service User Guide.</i>
[$sel:elasticsearchSettings:ModifyEndpoint'] :: ModifyEndpoint -> Maybe ElasticsearchSettings

-- | If this attribute is Y, the current call to <tt>ModifyEndpoint</tt>
--   replaces all existing endpoint settings with the exact settings that
--   you specify in this call. If this attribute is N, the current call to
--   <tt>ModifyEndpoint</tt> does two things:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>It replaces any endpoint settings that already exist with new
--   values, for settings with the same names.</li>
--   <li>It creates new endpoint settings that you specify in the call, for
--   settings with different names.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   For example, if you call <tt>create-endpoint ... --endpoint-settings
--   '{"a":1}' ...</tt>, the endpoint has the following endpoint settings:
--   <tt>'{"a":1}'</tt>. If you then call <tt>modify-endpoint ...
--   --endpoint-settings '{"b":2}' ...</tt> for the same endpoint, the
--   endpoint has the following settings: <tt>'{"a":1,"b":2}'</tt>.
--   
--   However, suppose that you follow this with a call to
--   <tt>modify-endpoint ... --endpoint-settings '{"b":2}' --exact-settings
--   ...</tt> for that same endpoint again. Then the endpoint has the
--   following settings: <tt>'{"b":2}'</tt>. All existing settings are
--   replaced with the exact settings that you specify.
[$sel:exactSettings:ModifyEndpoint'] :: ModifyEndpoint -> Maybe Bool

-- | The user name to be used to login to the endpoint database.
[$sel:username:ModifyEndpoint'] :: ModifyEndpoint -> Maybe Text

-- | The external table definition.
[$sel:externalTableDefinition:ModifyEndpoint'] :: ModifyEndpoint -> Maybe Text

-- | The type of engine for the endpoint. Valid values, depending on the
--   EndpointType, include <tt>"mysql"</tt>, <tt>"oracle"</tt>,
--   <tt>"postgres"</tt>, <tt>"mariadb"</tt>, <tt>"aurora"</tt>,
--   <tt>"aurora-postgresql"</tt>, <tt>"redshift"</tt>, <tt>"s3"</tt>,
--   <tt>"db2"</tt>, <tt>"azuredb"</tt>, <tt>"sybase"</tt>,
--   <tt>"dynamodb"</tt>, <tt>"mongodb"</tt>, <tt>"kinesis"</tt>,
--   <tt>"kafka"</tt>, <tt>"elasticsearch"</tt>, <tt>"documentdb"</tt>,
--   <tt>"sqlserver"</tt>, and <tt>"neptune"</tt>.
[$sel:engineName:ModifyEndpoint'] :: ModifyEndpoint -> Maybe Text

-- | Settings in JSON format for the Redis target endpoint.
[$sel:redisSettings:ModifyEndpoint'] :: ModifyEndpoint -> Maybe RedisSettings

-- | Settings in JSON format for the target Amazon Neptune endpoint. For
--   more information about the available settings, see <a>Specifying
--   graph-mapping rules using Gremlin and R2RML for Amazon Neptune as a
--   target</a> in the <i>Database Migration Service User Guide.</i>
[$sel:neptuneSettings:ModifyEndpoint'] :: ModifyEndpoint -> Maybe NeptuneSettings

-- | Settings in JSON format for the source IBM Db2 LUW endpoint. For
--   information about other available settings, see <a>Extra connection
--   attributes when using Db2 LUW as a source for DMS</a> in the
--   <i>Database Migration Service User Guide.</i>
[$sel:iBMDb2Settings:ModifyEndpoint'] :: ModifyEndpoint -> Maybe IBMDb2Settings

-- | Settings in JSON format for the source MongoDB endpoint. For more
--   information about the available settings, see the configuration
--   properties section in <a>Endpoint configuration settings when using
--   MongoDB as a source for Database Migration Service</a> in the
--   <i>Database Migration Service User Guide.</i>
[$sel:mongoDbSettings:ModifyEndpoint'] :: ModifyEndpoint -> Maybe MongoDbSettings

-- | The SSL mode used to connect to the endpoint. The default value is
--   <tt>none</tt>.
[$sel:sslMode:ModifyEndpoint'] :: ModifyEndpoint -> Maybe DmsSslModeValue

-- | The password to be used to login to the endpoint database.
[$sel:password:ModifyEndpoint'] :: ModifyEndpoint -> Maybe (Sensitive Text)

-- | Settings in JSON format for the source and target SAP ASE endpoint.
--   For information about other available settings, see <a>Extra
--   connection attributes when using SAP ASE as a source for DMS</a> and
--   <a>Extra connection attributes when using SAP ASE as a target for
--   DMS</a> in the <i>Database Migration Service User Guide.</i>
[$sel:sybaseSettings:ModifyEndpoint'] :: ModifyEndpoint -> Maybe SybaseSettings

-- | The name of the endpoint database. For a MySQL source or target
--   endpoint, do not specify DatabaseName.
[$sel:databaseName:ModifyEndpoint'] :: ModifyEndpoint -> Maybe Text

-- | Settings in JSON format for the target Amazon S3 endpoint. For more
--   information about the available settings, see <a>Extra Connection
--   Attributes When Using Amazon S3 as a Target for DMS</a> in the
--   <i>Database Migration Service User Guide.</i>
[$sel:s3Settings:ModifyEndpoint'] :: ModifyEndpoint -> Maybe S3Settings

-- | Settings in JSON format for the target endpoint for Amazon Kinesis
--   Data Streams. For more information about the available settings, see
--   <a>Using object mapping to migrate data to a Kinesis data stream</a>
--   in the <i>Database Migration Service User Guide.</i>
[$sel:kinesisSettings:ModifyEndpoint'] :: ModifyEndpoint -> Maybe KinesisSettings

-- | The database endpoint identifier. Identifiers must begin with a letter
--   and must contain only ASCII letters, digits, and hyphens. They can't
--   end with a hyphen or contain two consecutive hyphens.
[$sel:endpointIdentifier:ModifyEndpoint'] :: ModifyEndpoint -> Maybe Text

-- | Settings in JSON format for the target Amazon DynamoDB endpoint. For
--   information about other available settings, see <a>Using Object
--   Mapping to Migrate Data to DynamoDB</a> in the <i>Database Migration
--   Service User Guide.</i>
[$sel:dynamoDbSettings:ModifyEndpoint'] :: ModifyEndpoint -> Maybe DynamoDbSettings

-- | The port used by the endpoint database.
[$sel:port:ModifyEndpoint'] :: ModifyEndpoint -> Maybe Int

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) string that uniquely identifies the
--   endpoint.
[$sel:endpointArn:ModifyEndpoint'] :: ModifyEndpoint -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ModifyEndpoint</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:dmsTransferSettings:ModifyEndpoint'</a>,
--   <a>modifyEndpoint_dmsTransferSettings</a> - The settings in JSON
--   format for the DMS transfer type of source endpoint.
--   
--   Attributes include the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>serviceAccessRoleArn - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) used by the
--   service access IAM role. The role must allow the <tt>iam:PassRole</tt>
--   action.</li>
--   <li>BucketName - The name of the S3 bucket to use.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   Shorthand syntax for these settings is as follows:
--   <tt>ServiceAccessRoleArn=string ,BucketName=string</tt>
--   
--   JSON syntax for these settings is as follows: <tt>{
--   "ServiceAccessRoleArn": "string", "BucketName": "string"} </tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:mySQLSettings:ModifyEndpoint'</a>,
--   <a>modifyEndpoint_mySQLSettings</a> - Settings in JSON format for the
--   source and target MySQL endpoint. For information about other
--   available settings, see <a>Extra connection attributes when using
--   MySQL as a source for DMS</a> and <a>Extra connection attributes when
--   using a MySQL-compatible database as a target for DMS</a> in the
--   <i>Database Migration Service User Guide.</i>
--   
--   <a>$sel:serverName:ModifyEndpoint'</a>,
--   <a>modifyEndpoint_serverName</a> - The name of the server where the
--   endpoint database resides.
--   
--   <a>$sel:microsoftSQLServerSettings:ModifyEndpoint'</a>,
--   <a>modifyEndpoint_microsoftSQLServerSettings</a> - Settings in JSON
--   format for the source and target Microsoft SQL Server endpoint. For
--   information about other available settings, see <a>Extra connection
--   attributes when using SQL Server as a source for DMS</a> and <a>Extra
--   connection attributes when using SQL Server as a target for DMS</a> in
--   the <i>Database Migration Service User Guide.</i>
--   
--   <a>$sel:certificateArn:ModifyEndpoint'</a>,
--   <a>modifyEndpoint_certificateArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN)
--   of the certificate used for SSL connection.
--   
--   <a>$sel:serviceAccessRoleArn:ModifyEndpoint'</a>,
--   <a>modifyEndpoint_serviceAccessRoleArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name
--   (ARN) for the IAM role you want to use to modify the endpoint. The
--   role must allow the <tt>iam:PassRole</tt> action.
--   
--   <a>$sel:docDbSettings:ModifyEndpoint'</a>,
--   <a>modifyEndpoint_docDbSettings</a> - Settings in JSON format for the
--   source DocumentDB endpoint. For more information about the available
--   settings, see the configuration properties section in <a>Using
--   DocumentDB as a Target for Database Migration Service</a> in the
--   <i>Database Migration Service User Guide.</i>
--   
--   <a>$sel:postgreSQLSettings:ModifyEndpoint'</a>,
--   <a>modifyEndpoint_postgreSQLSettings</a> - Settings in JSON format for
--   the source and target PostgreSQL endpoint. For information about other
--   available settings, see <a>Extra connection attributes when using
--   PostgreSQL as a source for DMS</a> and <a>Extra connection attributes
--   when using PostgreSQL as a target for DMS</a> in the <i>Database
--   Migration Service User Guide.</i>
--   
--   <a>$sel:extraConnectionAttributes:ModifyEndpoint'</a>,
--   <a>modifyEndpoint_extraConnectionAttributes</a> - Additional
--   attributes associated with the connection. To reset this parameter,
--   pass the empty string ("") as an argument.
--   
--   <a>$sel:kafkaSettings:ModifyEndpoint'</a>,
--   <a>modifyEndpoint_kafkaSettings</a> - Settings in JSON format for the
--   target Apache Kafka endpoint. For more information about the available
--   settings, see <a>Using object mapping to migrate data to a Kafka
--   topic</a> in the <i>Database Migration Service User Guide.</i>
--   
--   <a>$sel:oracleSettings:ModifyEndpoint'</a>,
--   <a>modifyEndpoint_oracleSettings</a> - Settings in JSON format for the
--   source and target Oracle endpoint. For information about other
--   available settings, see <a>Extra connection attributes when using
--   Oracle as a source for DMS</a> and <a>Extra connection attributes when
--   using Oracle as a target for DMS</a> in the <i>Database Migration
--   Service User Guide.</i>
--   
--   <a>$sel:endpointType:ModifyEndpoint'</a>,
--   <a>modifyEndpoint_endpointType</a> - The type of endpoint. Valid
--   values are <tt>source</tt> and <tt>target</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:redshiftSettings:ModifyEndpoint'</a>,
--   <a>modifyEndpoint_redshiftSettings</a> - Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:elasticsearchSettings:ModifyEndpoint'</a>,
--   <a>modifyEndpoint_elasticsearchSettings</a> - Settings in JSON format
--   for the target Elasticsearch endpoint. For more information about the
--   available settings, see <a>Extra Connection Attributes When Using
--   Elasticsearch as a Target for DMS</a> in the <i>Database Migration
--   Service User Guide.</i>
--   
--   <a>$sel:exactSettings:ModifyEndpoint'</a>,
--   <a>modifyEndpoint_exactSettings</a> - If this attribute is Y, the
--   current call to <tt>ModifyEndpoint</tt> replaces all existing endpoint
--   settings with the exact settings that you specify in this call. If
--   this attribute is N, the current call to <tt>ModifyEndpoint</tt> does
--   two things:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>It replaces any endpoint settings that already exist with new
--   values, for settings with the same names.</li>
--   <li>It creates new endpoint settings that you specify in the call, for
--   settings with different names.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   For example, if you call <tt>create-endpoint ... --endpoint-settings
--   '{"a":1}' ...</tt>, the endpoint has the following endpoint settings:
--   <tt>'{"a":1}'</tt>. If you then call <tt>modify-endpoint ...
--   --endpoint-settings '{"b":2}' ...</tt> for the same endpoint, the
--   endpoint has the following settings: <tt>'{"a":1,"b":2}'</tt>.
--   
--   However, suppose that you follow this with a call to
--   <tt>modify-endpoint ... --endpoint-settings '{"b":2}' --exact-settings
--   ...</tt> for that same endpoint again. Then the endpoint has the
--   following settings: <tt>'{"b":2}'</tt>. All existing settings are
--   replaced with the exact settings that you specify.
--   
--   <a>$sel:username:ModifyEndpoint'</a>, <a>modifyEndpoint_username</a> -
--   The user name to be used to login to the endpoint database.
--   
--   <a>$sel:externalTableDefinition:ModifyEndpoint'</a>,
--   <a>modifyEndpoint_externalTableDefinition</a> - The external table
--   definition.
--   
--   <a>$sel:engineName:ModifyEndpoint'</a>,
--   <a>modifyEndpoint_engineName</a> - The type of engine for the
--   endpoint. Valid values, depending on the EndpointType, include
--   <tt>"mysql"</tt>, <tt>"oracle"</tt>, <tt>"postgres"</tt>,
--   <tt>"mariadb"</tt>, <tt>"aurora"</tt>, <tt>"aurora-postgresql"</tt>,
--   <tt>"redshift"</tt>, <tt>"s3"</tt>, <tt>"db2"</tt>,
--   <tt>"azuredb"</tt>, <tt>"sybase"</tt>, <tt>"dynamodb"</tt>,
--   <tt>"mongodb"</tt>, <tt>"kinesis"</tt>, <tt>"kafka"</tt>,
--   <tt>"elasticsearch"</tt>, <tt>"documentdb"</tt>, <tt>"sqlserver"</tt>,
--   and <tt>"neptune"</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:redisSettings:ModifyEndpoint'</a>,
--   <a>modifyEndpoint_redisSettings</a> - Settings in JSON format for the
--   Redis target endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:neptuneSettings:ModifyEndpoint'</a>,
--   <a>modifyEndpoint_neptuneSettings</a> - Settings in JSON format for
--   the target Amazon Neptune endpoint. For more information about the
--   available settings, see <a>Specifying graph-mapping rules using
--   Gremlin and R2RML for Amazon Neptune as a target</a> in the
--   <i>Database Migration Service User Guide.</i>
--   
--   <a>$sel:iBMDb2Settings:ModifyEndpoint'</a>,
--   <a>modifyEndpoint_iBMDb2Settings</a> - Settings in JSON format for the
--   source IBM Db2 LUW endpoint. For information about other available
--   settings, see <a>Extra connection attributes when using Db2 LUW as a
--   source for DMS</a> in the <i>Database Migration Service User
--   Guide.</i>
--   
--   <a>$sel:mongoDbSettings:ModifyEndpoint'</a>,
--   <a>modifyEndpoint_mongoDbSettings</a> - Settings in JSON format for
--   the source MongoDB endpoint. For more information about the available
--   settings, see the configuration properties section in <a>Endpoint
--   configuration settings when using MongoDB as a source for Database
--   Migration Service</a> in the <i>Database Migration Service User
--   Guide.</i>
--   
--   <a>$sel:sslMode:ModifyEndpoint'</a>, <a>modifyEndpoint_sslMode</a> -
--   The SSL mode used to connect to the endpoint. The default value is
--   <tt>none</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:password:ModifyEndpoint'</a>, <a>modifyEndpoint_password</a> -
--   The password to be used to login to the endpoint database.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sybaseSettings:ModifyEndpoint'</a>,
--   <a>modifyEndpoint_sybaseSettings</a> - Settings in JSON format for the
--   source and target SAP ASE endpoint. For information about other
--   available settings, see <a>Extra connection attributes when using SAP
--   ASE as a source for DMS</a> and <a>Extra connection attributes when
--   using SAP ASE as a target for DMS</a> in the <i>Database Migration
--   Service User Guide.</i>
--   
--   <a>$sel:databaseName:ModifyEndpoint'</a>,
--   <a>modifyEndpoint_databaseName</a> - The name of the endpoint
--   database. For a MySQL source or target endpoint, do not specify
--   DatabaseName.
--   
--   <a>$sel:s3Settings:ModifyEndpoint'</a>,
--   <a>modifyEndpoint_s3Settings</a> - Settings in JSON format for the
--   target Amazon S3 endpoint. For more information about the available
--   settings, see <a>Extra Connection Attributes When Using Amazon S3 as a
--   Target for DMS</a> in the <i>Database Migration Service User
--   Guide.</i>
--   
--   <a>$sel:kinesisSettings:ModifyEndpoint'</a>,
--   <a>modifyEndpoint_kinesisSettings</a> - Settings in JSON format for
--   the target endpoint for Amazon Kinesis Data Streams. For more
--   information about the available settings, see <a>Using object mapping
--   to migrate data to a Kinesis data stream</a> in the <i>Database
--   Migration Service User Guide.</i>
--   
--   <a>$sel:endpointIdentifier:ModifyEndpoint'</a>,
--   <a>modifyEndpoint_endpointIdentifier</a> - The database endpoint
--   identifier. Identifiers must begin with a letter and must contain only
--   ASCII letters, digits, and hyphens. They can't end with a hyphen or
--   contain two consecutive hyphens.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dynamoDbSettings:ModifyEndpoint'</a>,
--   <a>modifyEndpoint_dynamoDbSettings</a> - Settings in JSON format for
--   the target Amazon DynamoDB endpoint. For information about other
--   available settings, see <a>Using Object Mapping to Migrate Data to
--   DynamoDB</a> in the <i>Database Migration Service User Guide.</i>
--   
--   <a>$sel:port:ModifyEndpoint'</a>, <a>modifyEndpoint_port</a> - The
--   port used by the endpoint database.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endpointArn:ModifyEndpoint'</a>,
--   <a>modifyEndpoint_endpointArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN)
--   string that uniquely identifies the endpoint.
newModifyEndpoint :: Text -> ModifyEndpoint

-- | The settings in JSON format for the DMS transfer type of source
--   endpoint.
--   
--   Attributes include the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>serviceAccessRoleArn - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) used by the
--   service access IAM role. The role must allow the <tt>iam:PassRole</tt>
--   action.</li>
--   <li>BucketName - The name of the S3 bucket to use.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   Shorthand syntax for these settings is as follows:
--   <tt>ServiceAccessRoleArn=string ,BucketName=string</tt>
--   
--   JSON syntax for these settings is as follows: <tt>{
--   "ServiceAccessRoleArn": "string", "BucketName": "string"} </tt>
modifyEndpoint_dmsTransferSettings :: Lens' ModifyEndpoint (Maybe DmsTransferSettings)

-- | Settings in JSON format for the source and target MySQL endpoint. For
--   information about other available settings, see <a>Extra connection
--   attributes when using MySQL as a source for DMS</a> and <a>Extra
--   connection attributes when using a MySQL-compatible database as a
--   target for DMS</a> in the <i>Database Migration Service User
--   Guide.</i>
modifyEndpoint_mySQLSettings :: Lens' ModifyEndpoint (Maybe MySQLSettings)

-- | The name of the server where the endpoint database resides.
modifyEndpoint_serverName :: Lens' ModifyEndpoint (Maybe Text)

-- | Settings in JSON format for the source and target Microsoft SQL Server
--   endpoint. For information about other available settings, see <a>Extra
--   connection attributes when using SQL Server as a source for DMS</a>
--   and <a>Extra connection attributes when using SQL Server as a target
--   for DMS</a> in the <i>Database Migration Service User Guide.</i>
modifyEndpoint_microsoftSQLServerSettings :: Lens' ModifyEndpoint (Maybe MicrosoftSQLServerSettings)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the certificate used for SSL
--   connection.
modifyEndpoint_certificateArn :: Lens' ModifyEndpoint (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the IAM role you want to use to
--   modify the endpoint. The role must allow the <tt>iam:PassRole</tt>
--   action.
modifyEndpoint_serviceAccessRoleArn :: Lens' ModifyEndpoint (Maybe Text)

-- | Settings in JSON format for the source DocumentDB endpoint. For more
--   information about the available settings, see the configuration
--   properties section in <a>Using DocumentDB as a Target for Database
--   Migration Service</a> in the <i>Database Migration Service User
--   Guide.</i>
modifyEndpoint_docDbSettings :: Lens' ModifyEndpoint (Maybe DocDbSettings)

-- | Settings in JSON format for the source and target PostgreSQL endpoint.
--   For information about other available settings, see <a>Extra
--   connection attributes when using PostgreSQL as a source for DMS</a>
--   and <a>Extra connection attributes when using PostgreSQL as a target
--   for DMS</a> in the <i>Database Migration Service User Guide.</i>
modifyEndpoint_postgreSQLSettings :: Lens' ModifyEndpoint (Maybe PostgreSQLSettings)

-- | Additional attributes associated with the connection. To reset this
--   parameter, pass the empty string ("") as an argument.
modifyEndpoint_extraConnectionAttributes :: Lens' ModifyEndpoint (Maybe Text)

-- | Settings in JSON format for the target Apache Kafka endpoint. For more
--   information about the available settings, see <a>Using object mapping
--   to migrate data to a Kafka topic</a> in the <i>Database Migration
--   Service User Guide.</i>
modifyEndpoint_kafkaSettings :: Lens' ModifyEndpoint (Maybe KafkaSettings)

-- | Settings in JSON format for the source and target Oracle endpoint. For
--   information about other available settings, see <a>Extra connection
--   attributes when using Oracle as a source for DMS</a> and <a>Extra
--   connection attributes when using Oracle as a target for DMS</a> in the
--   <i>Database Migration Service User Guide.</i>
modifyEndpoint_oracleSettings :: Lens' ModifyEndpoint (Maybe OracleSettings)

-- | The type of endpoint. Valid values are <tt>source</tt> and
--   <tt>target</tt>.
modifyEndpoint_endpointType :: Lens' ModifyEndpoint (Maybe ReplicationEndpointTypeValue)

-- | Undocumented member.
modifyEndpoint_redshiftSettings :: Lens' ModifyEndpoint (Maybe RedshiftSettings)

-- | Settings in JSON format for the target Elasticsearch endpoint. For
--   more information about the available settings, see <a>Extra Connection
--   Attributes When Using Elasticsearch as a Target for DMS</a> in the
--   <i>Database Migration Service User Guide.</i>
modifyEndpoint_elasticsearchSettings :: Lens' ModifyEndpoint (Maybe ElasticsearchSettings)

-- | If this attribute is Y, the current call to <tt>ModifyEndpoint</tt>
--   replaces all existing endpoint settings with the exact settings that
--   you specify in this call. If this attribute is N, the current call to
--   <tt>ModifyEndpoint</tt> does two things:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>It replaces any endpoint settings that already exist with new
--   values, for settings with the same names.</li>
--   <li>It creates new endpoint settings that you specify in the call, for
--   settings with different names.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   For example, if you call <tt>create-endpoint ... --endpoint-settings
--   '{"a":1}' ...</tt>, the endpoint has the following endpoint settings:
--   <tt>'{"a":1}'</tt>. If you then call <tt>modify-endpoint ...
--   --endpoint-settings '{"b":2}' ...</tt> for the same endpoint, the
--   endpoint has the following settings: <tt>'{"a":1,"b":2}'</tt>.
--   
--   However, suppose that you follow this with a call to
--   <tt>modify-endpoint ... --endpoint-settings '{"b":2}' --exact-settings
--   ...</tt> for that same endpoint again. Then the endpoint has the
--   following settings: <tt>'{"b":2}'</tt>. All existing settings are
--   replaced with the exact settings that you specify.
modifyEndpoint_exactSettings :: Lens' ModifyEndpoint (Maybe Bool)

-- | The user name to be used to login to the endpoint database.
modifyEndpoint_username :: Lens' ModifyEndpoint (Maybe Text)

-- | The external table definition.
modifyEndpoint_externalTableDefinition :: Lens' ModifyEndpoint (Maybe Text)

-- | The type of engine for the endpoint. Valid values, depending on the
--   EndpointType, include <tt>"mysql"</tt>, <tt>"oracle"</tt>,
--   <tt>"postgres"</tt>, <tt>"mariadb"</tt>, <tt>"aurora"</tt>,
--   <tt>"aurora-postgresql"</tt>, <tt>"redshift"</tt>, <tt>"s3"</tt>,
--   <tt>"db2"</tt>, <tt>"azuredb"</tt>, <tt>"sybase"</tt>,
--   <tt>"dynamodb"</tt>, <tt>"mongodb"</tt>, <tt>"kinesis"</tt>,
--   <tt>"kafka"</tt>, <tt>"elasticsearch"</tt>, <tt>"documentdb"</tt>,
--   <tt>"sqlserver"</tt>, and <tt>"neptune"</tt>.
modifyEndpoint_engineName :: Lens' ModifyEndpoint (Maybe Text)

-- | Settings in JSON format for the Redis target endpoint.
modifyEndpoint_redisSettings :: Lens' ModifyEndpoint (Maybe RedisSettings)

-- | Settings in JSON format for the target Amazon Neptune endpoint. For
--   more information about the available settings, see <a>Specifying
--   graph-mapping rules using Gremlin and R2RML for Amazon Neptune as a
--   target</a> in the <i>Database Migration Service User Guide.</i>
modifyEndpoint_neptuneSettings :: Lens' ModifyEndpoint (Maybe NeptuneSettings)

-- | Settings in JSON format for the source IBM Db2 LUW endpoint. For
--   information about other available settings, see <a>Extra connection
--   attributes when using Db2 LUW as a source for DMS</a> in the
--   <i>Database Migration Service User Guide.</i>
modifyEndpoint_iBMDb2Settings :: Lens' ModifyEndpoint (Maybe IBMDb2Settings)

-- | Settings in JSON format for the source MongoDB endpoint. For more
--   information about the available settings, see the configuration
--   properties section in <a>Endpoint configuration settings when using
--   MongoDB as a source for Database Migration Service</a> in the
--   <i>Database Migration Service User Guide.</i>
modifyEndpoint_mongoDbSettings :: Lens' ModifyEndpoint (Maybe MongoDbSettings)

-- | The SSL mode used to connect to the endpoint. The default value is
--   <tt>none</tt>.
modifyEndpoint_sslMode :: Lens' ModifyEndpoint (Maybe DmsSslModeValue)

-- | The password to be used to login to the endpoint database.
modifyEndpoint_password :: Lens' ModifyEndpoint (Maybe Text)

-- | Settings in JSON format for the source and target SAP ASE endpoint.
--   For information about other available settings, see <a>Extra
--   connection attributes when using SAP ASE as a source for DMS</a> and
--   <a>Extra connection attributes when using SAP ASE as a target for
--   DMS</a> in the <i>Database Migration Service User Guide.</i>
modifyEndpoint_sybaseSettings :: Lens' ModifyEndpoint (Maybe SybaseSettings)

-- | The name of the endpoint database. For a MySQL source or target
--   endpoint, do not specify DatabaseName.
modifyEndpoint_databaseName :: Lens' ModifyEndpoint (Maybe Text)

-- | Settings in JSON format for the target Amazon S3 endpoint. For more
--   information about the available settings, see <a>Extra Connection
--   Attributes When Using Amazon S3 as a Target for DMS</a> in the
--   <i>Database Migration Service User Guide.</i>
modifyEndpoint_s3Settings :: Lens' ModifyEndpoint (Maybe S3Settings)

-- | Settings in JSON format for the target endpoint for Amazon Kinesis
--   Data Streams. For more information about the available settings, see
--   <a>Using object mapping to migrate data to a Kinesis data stream</a>
--   in the <i>Database Migration Service User Guide.</i>
modifyEndpoint_kinesisSettings :: Lens' ModifyEndpoint (Maybe KinesisSettings)

-- | The database endpoint identifier. Identifiers must begin with a letter
--   and must contain only ASCII letters, digits, and hyphens. They can't
--   end with a hyphen or contain two consecutive hyphens.
modifyEndpoint_endpointIdentifier :: Lens' ModifyEndpoint (Maybe Text)

-- | Settings in JSON format for the target Amazon DynamoDB endpoint. For
--   information about other available settings, see <a>Using Object
--   Mapping to Migrate Data to DynamoDB</a> in the <i>Database Migration
--   Service User Guide.</i>
modifyEndpoint_dynamoDbSettings :: Lens' ModifyEndpoint (Maybe DynamoDbSettings)

-- | The port used by the endpoint database.
modifyEndpoint_port :: Lens' ModifyEndpoint (Maybe Int)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) string that uniquely identifies the
--   endpoint.
modifyEndpoint_endpointArn :: Lens' ModifyEndpoint Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newModifyEndpointResponse</a> smart constructor.
data ModifyEndpointResponse
ModifyEndpointResponse' :: Maybe Endpoint -> Int -> ModifyEndpointResponse

-- | The modified endpoint.
[$sel:endpoint:ModifyEndpointResponse'] :: ModifyEndpointResponse -> Maybe Endpoint

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:ModifyEndpointResponse'] :: ModifyEndpointResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>ModifyEndpointResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:endpoint:ModifyEndpointResponse'</a>,
--   <a>modifyEndpointResponse_endpoint</a> - The modified endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:ModifyEndpointResponse'</a>,
--   <a>modifyEndpointResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.
newModifyEndpointResponse :: Int -> ModifyEndpointResponse

-- | The modified endpoint.
modifyEndpointResponse_endpoint :: Lens' ModifyEndpointResponse (Maybe Endpoint)

-- | The response's http status code.
modifyEndpointResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' ModifyEndpointResponse Int

instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.DMS.ModifyEndpoint.ModifyEndpoint
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.DMS.ModifyEndpoint.ModifyEndpoint
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.DMS.ModifyEndpoint.ModifyEndpointResponse
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.DMS.ModifyEndpoint.ModifyEndpointResponse
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.DMS.ModifyEndpoint.ModifyEndpointResponse
instance Network.AWS.Types.AWSRequest Network.AWS.DMS.ModifyEndpoint.ModifyEndpoint
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.DMS.ModifyEndpoint.ModifyEndpointResponse
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.DMS.ModifyEndpoint.ModifyEndpoint

-- | Lists all metadata tags attached to an DMS resource, including
--   replication instance, endpoint, security group, and migration task.
--   For more information, see <a>Tag</a> data type description.
module Network.AWS.DMS.ListTagsForResource

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListTagsForResource</a> smart constructor.
data ListTagsForResource
ListTagsForResource' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> ListTagsForResource

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) string that uniquely identifies the DMS
--   resource to list tags for. This returns a list of keys (names of tags)
--   created for the resource and their associated tag values.
[$sel:resourceArn:ListTagsForResource'] :: ListTagsForResource -> Maybe Text

-- | List of ARNs that identify multiple DMS resources that you want to
--   list tags for. This returns a list of keys (tag names) and their
--   associated tag values. It also returns each tag's associated
--   <tt>ResourceArn</tt> value, which is the ARN of the resource for which
--   each listed tag is created.
[$sel:resourceArnList:ListTagsForResource'] :: ListTagsForResource -> Maybe [Text]

-- | Create a value of <a>ListTagsForResource</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceArn:ListTagsForResource'</a>,
--   <a>listTagsForResource_resourceArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name
--   (ARN) string that uniquely identifies the DMS resource to list tags
--   for. This returns a list of keys (names of tags) created for the
--   resource and their associated tag values.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceArnList:ListTagsForResource'</a>,
--   <a>listTagsForResource_resourceArnList</a> - List of ARNs that
--   identify multiple DMS resources that you want to list tags for. This
--   returns a list of keys (tag names) and their associated tag values. It
--   also returns each tag's associated <tt>ResourceArn</tt> value, which
--   is the ARN of the resource for which each listed tag is created.
newListTagsForResource :: ListTagsForResource

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) string that uniquely identifies the DMS
--   resource to list tags for. This returns a list of keys (names of tags)
--   created for the resource and their associated tag values.
listTagsForResource_resourceArn :: Lens' ListTagsForResource (Maybe Text)

-- | List of ARNs that identify multiple DMS resources that you want to
--   list tags for. This returns a list of keys (tag names) and their
--   associated tag values. It also returns each tag's associated
--   <tt>ResourceArn</tt> value, which is the ARN of the resource for which
--   each listed tag is created.
listTagsForResource_resourceArnList :: Lens' ListTagsForResource (Maybe [Text])

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListTagsForResourceResponse</a> smart constructor.
data ListTagsForResourceResponse
ListTagsForResourceResponse' :: Maybe [Tag] -> Int -> ListTagsForResourceResponse

-- | A list of tags for the resource.
[$sel:tagList:ListTagsForResourceResponse'] :: ListTagsForResourceResponse -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | The response's http status code.

-- | Uploads the specified certificate.
module Network.AWS.DMS.ImportCertificate

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newImportCertificate</a> smart constructor.
data ImportCertificate
ImportCertificate' :: Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> Maybe Base64 -> Maybe [Tag] -> Text -> ImportCertificate

-- | The contents of a <tt>.pem</tt> file, which contains an X.509
--   certificate.
[$sel:certificatePem:ImportCertificate'] :: ImportCertificate -> Maybe (Sensitive Text)

-- | The location of an imported Oracle Wallet certificate for use with
--   SSL. Provide the name of a <tt>.sso</tt> file using the
--   <tt>fileb://</tt> prefix. You can't provide the certificate inline.
[$sel:certificateWallet:ImportCertificate'] :: ImportCertificate -> Maybe Base64

-- | The tags associated with the certificate.
[$sel:tags:ImportCertificate'] :: ImportCertificate -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | A customer-assigned name for the certificate. Identifiers must begin
--   with a letter and must contain only ASCII letters, digits, and
--   hyphens. They can't end with a hyphen or contain two consecutive
--   hyphens.
[$sel:certificateIdentifier:ImportCertificate'] :: ImportCertificate -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ImportCertificate</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:certificatePem:ImportCertificate'</a>,

--   <tt>.pem</tt> file, which contains an X.509 certificate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:certificateWallet:ImportCertificate'</a>,
--   <a>importCertificate_certificateWallet</a> - The location of an
--   imported Oracle Wallet certificate for use with SSL. Provide the name
--   of a <tt>.sso</tt> file using the <tt>fileb://</tt> prefix. You can't
--   provide the certificate inline.-- -- <i>Note:</i> This <tt>Lens</tt>
--   automatically encodes and decodes Base64 data. -- The underlying
--   isomorphism will encode to Base64 representation during --
--   serialisation, and decode from Base64 representation during
--   deserialisation. -- This <tt>Lens</tt> accepts and returns only raw
--   unencoded data.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:ImportCertificate'</a>, <a>importCertificate_tags</a> -
--   The tags associated with the certificate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:certificateIdentifier:ImportCertificate'</a>,
--   <a>importCertificate_certificateIdentifier</a> - A customer-assigned
--   name for the certificate. Identifiers must begin with a letter and
--   must contain only ASCII letters, digits, and hyphens. They can't end
--   with a hyphen or contain two consecutive hyphens.
newImportCertificate :: Text -> ImportCertificate

-- | The contents of a <tt>.pem</tt> file, which contains an X.509
--   certificate.
importCertificate_certificatePem :: Lens' ImportCertificate (Maybe Text)

-- | The location of an imported Oracle Wallet certificate for use with
--   SSL. Provide the name of a <tt>.sso</tt> file using the
--   <tt>fileb://</tt> prefix. You can't provide the certificate inline.--
--   -- <i>Note:</i> This <tt>Lens</tt> automatically encodes and decodes
--   Base64 data. -- The underlying isomorphism will encode to Base64
--   representation during -- serialisation, and decode from Base64
--   representation during deserialisation. -- This <tt>Lens</tt> accepts
--   and returns only raw unencoded data.

--   with a letter and must contain only ASCII letters, digits, and
--   hyphens. They can't end with a hyphen or contain two consecutive
--   hyphens.
importCertificate_certificateIdentifier :: Lens' ImportCertificate Text

-- | Returns table statistics on the database migration task, including
--   table name, rows inserted, rows updated, and rows deleted.
--   
--   Note that the "last updated" column the DMS console only indicates the
--   time that DMS last updated the table statistics record for a table. It
--   does not indicate the time of the last update to the table.
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.

-- | Returns information about replication tasks for your account in the
--   current region.
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.
module Network.AWS.DMS.DescribeReplicationTasks

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeReplicationTasks</a> smart constructor.
data DescribeReplicationTasks
DescribeReplicationTasks' :: Maybe [Filter] -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> DescribeReplicationTasks

-- | Filters applied to replication tasks.
--   
--   Valid filter names: replication-task-arn | replication-task-id |
--   migration-type | endpoint-arn | replication-instance-arn
[$sel:filters:DescribeReplicationTasks'] :: DescribeReplicationTasks -> Maybe [Filter]

-- | An option to set to avoid returning information about settings. Use
--   this to reduce overhead when setting information is too large. To use
--   this option, choose <tt>true</tt>; otherwise, choose <tt>false</tt>
--   (the default).
[$sel:withoutSettings:DescribeReplicationTasks'] :: DescribeReplicationTasks -> Maybe Bool

-- | An optional pagination token provided by a previous request. If this
--   parameter is specified, the response includes only records beyond the
--   marker, up to the value specified by <tt>MaxRecords</tt>.
[$sel:marker:DescribeReplicationTasks'] :: DescribeReplicationTasks -> Maybe Text

-- | The maximum number of records to include in the response. If more
--   records exist than the specified <tt>MaxRecords</tt> value, a
--   pagination token called a marker is included in the response so that
--   the remaining results can be retrieved.
--   
--   Default: 100
--   
--   Constraints: Minimum 20, maximum 100.
[$sel:maxRecords:DescribeReplicationTasks'] :: DescribeReplicationTasks -> Maybe Int

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeReplicationTasks</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--

-- | Returns the task assessment results from the Amazon S3 bucket that DMS
--   creates in your Amazon Web Services account. This action always
--   returns the latest results.
--   
--   For more information about DMS task assessments, see <a>Creating a
--   task assessment report</a> in the <a>Database Migration Service User
--   Guide</a>.
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.
module Network.AWS.DMS.DescribeReplicationTaskAssessmentResults

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeReplicationTaskAssessmentResults</a> smart
--   constructor.
data DescribeReplicationTaskAssessmentResults
DescribeReplicationTaskAssessmentResults' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> DescribeReplicationTaskAssessmentResults

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) string that uniquely identifies the
--   task. When this input parameter is specified, the API returns only one
--   result and ignore the values of the <tt>MaxRecords</tt> and
--   <tt>Marker</tt> parameters.
[$sel:replicationTaskArn:DescribeReplicationTaskAssessmentResults'] :: DescribeReplicationTaskAssessmentResults -> Maybe Text

-- | An optional pagination token provided by a previous request. If this
--   parameter is specified, the response includes only records beyond the
--   marker, up to the value specified by <tt>MaxRecords</tt>.
[$sel:marker:DescribeReplicationTaskAssessmentResults'] :: DescribeReplicationTaskAssessmentResults -> Maybe Text

-- | The maximum number of records to include in the response. If more
--   records exist than the specified <tt>MaxRecords</tt> value, a
--   pagination token called a marker is included in the response so that
--   the remaining results can be retrieved.
--   
--   Default: 100
--   
--   Constraints: Minimum 20, maximum 100.
[$sel:maxRecords:DescribeReplicationTaskAssessmentResults'] :: DescribeReplicationTaskAssessmentResults -> Maybe Int

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeReplicationTaskAssessmentResults</a> with
--   all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

-- | Lists events for a given source identifier and source type. You can
--   also specify a start and end time. For more information on DMS events,
--   see <a>Working with Events and Notifications</a> in the <i>Database
--   Migration Service User Guide.</i>
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.
module Network.AWS.DMS.DescribeEvents

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeEvents</a> smart constructor.
data DescribeEvents
DescribeEvents' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe SourceType -> Maybe [Filter] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Int -> DescribeEvents

-- | The start time for the events to be listed.
[$sel:startTime:DescribeEvents'] :: DescribeEvents -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The type of DMS resource that generates events.
--   
--   Valid values: replication-instance | replication-task
[$sel:sourceType:DescribeEvents'] :: DescribeEvents -> Maybe SourceType

-- | Filters applied to events.
[$sel:filters:DescribeEvents'] :: DescribeEvents -> Maybe [Filter]

-- | The identifier of an event source.
[$sel:sourceIdentifier:DescribeEvents'] :: DescribeEvents -> Maybe Text

-- | A list of event categories for the source type that you've chosen.
[$sel:eventCategories:DescribeEvents'] :: DescribeEvents -> Maybe [Text]

-- | An optional pagination token provided by a previous request. If this
--   parameter is specified, the response includes only records beyond the
--   marker, up to the value specified by <tt>MaxRecords</tt>.
[$sel:marker:DescribeEvents'] :: DescribeEvents -> Maybe Text

-- | The maximum number of records to include in the response. If more
--   records exist than the specified <tt>MaxRecords</tt> value, a
--   pagination token called a marker is included in the response so that
--   the remaining results can be retrieved.
--   
--   Default: 100
--   
--   Constraints: Minimum 20, maximum 100.
[$sel:maxRecords:DescribeEvents'] :: DescribeEvents -> Maybe Int

-- | The end time for the events to be listed.
[$sel:endTime:DescribeEvents'] :: DescribeEvents -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The duration of the events to be listed.
[$sel:duration:DescribeEvents'] :: DescribeEvents -> Maybe Int

--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:startTime:DescribeEvents'</a>, <a>describeEvents_startTime</a>
--   - The start time for the events to be listed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sourceType:DescribeEvents'</a>,
--   <a>describeEvents_sourceType</a> - The type of DMS resource that
--   generates events.
--   
--   Valid values: replication-instance | replication-task
--   
--   <a>$sel:filters:DescribeEvents'</a>, <a>describeEvents_filters</a> -
--   Filters applied to events.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sourceIdentifier:DescribeEvents'</a>,
--   <a>describeEvents_sourceIdentifier</a> - The identifier of an event
--   source.
--   
--   <a>$sel:eventCategories:DescribeEvents'</a>,
--   <a>describeEvents_eventCategories</a> - A list of event categories for
--   the source type that you've chosen.
--   
--   <a>$sel:marker:DescribeEvents'</a>, <a>describeEvents_marker</a> - An
--   optional pagination token provided by a previous request. If this
--   parameter is specified, the response includes only records beyond the
--   marker, up to the value specified by <tt>MaxRecords</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxRecords:DescribeEvents'</a>,

--   include in the response. If more records exist than the specified
--   <tt>MaxRecords</tt> value, a pagination token called a marker is
--   included in the response so that the remaining results can be
--   retrieved.

--   Default: 100
--   
--   Constraints: Minimum 20, maximum 100.

--   The end time for the events to be listed.

-- | Lists all the event subscriptions for a customer account. The
--   description of a subscription includes <tt>SubscriptionName</tt>,
--   <tt>SNSTopicARN</tt>, <tt>CustomerID</tt>, <tt>SourceType</tt>,
--   <tt>SourceID</tt>, <tt>CreationTime</tt>, and <tt>Status</tt>.
--   
--   If you specify <tt>SubscriptionName</tt>, this action lists the
--   description for that subscription.
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.
module Network.AWS.DMS.DescribeEventSubscriptions

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeEventSubscriptions</a> smart constructor.
data DescribeEventSubscriptions

--   parameter is specified, the response includes only records beyond the
--   marker, up to the value specified by <tt>MaxRecords</tt>.
[$sel:marker:DescribeEventSubscriptions'] :: DescribeEventSubscriptions -> Maybe Text

-- | The maximum number of records to include in the response. If more
--   records exist than the specified <tt>MaxRecords</tt> value, a
--   pagination token called a marker is included in the response so that
--   the remaining results can be retrieved.
--   
--   Default: 100
--   
--   Constraints: Minimum 20, maximum 100.
[$sel:maxRecords:DescribeEventSubscriptions'] :: DescribeEventSubscriptions -> Maybe Int

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeEventSubscriptions</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.

--   fields.

--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   DMS event subscription to be described.

--   <a>describeEventSubscriptions_filters</a> - Filters applied to event
--   subscriptions.

--   <a>$sel:marker:DescribeEventSubscriptions'</a>,

-- | Returns information about the type of endpoints available.
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.
module Network.AWS.DMS.DescribeEndpointTypes

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeEndpointTypes</a> smart constructor.
data DescribeEndpointTypes
DescribeEndpointTypes' :: Maybe [Filter] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> DescribeEndpointTypes

-- | Filters applied to the endpoint types.
--   
--   Valid filter names: engine-name | endpoint-type
[$sel:filters:DescribeEndpointTypes'] :: DescribeEndpointTypes -> Maybe [Filter]

-- | An optional pagination token provided by a previous request. If this
--   parameter is specified, the response includes only records beyond the
--   marker, up to the value specified by <tt>MaxRecords</tt>.
[$sel:marker:DescribeEndpointTypes'] :: DescribeEndpointTypes -> Maybe Text

-- | The maximum number of records to include in the response. If more
--   records exist than the specified <tt>MaxRecords</tt> value, a
--   pagination token called a marker is included in the response so that
--   the remaining results can be retrieved.
--   
--   Default: 100
--   
--   Constraints: Minimum 20, maximum 100.
[$sel:maxRecords:DescribeEndpointTypes'] :: DescribeEndpointTypes -> Maybe Int

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeEndpointTypes</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:filters:DescribeEndpointTypes'</a>,
--   <a>describeEndpointTypes_filters</a> - Filters applied to the endpoint
--   types.
--   
--   Valid filter names: engine-name | endpoint-type
--   
--   <a>$sel:marker:DescribeEndpointTypes'</a>,
--   <a>describeEndpointTypes_marker</a> - An optional pagination token
--   provided by a previous request. If this parameter is specified, the
--   response includes only records beyond the marker, up to the value
--   specified by <tt>MaxRecords</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxRecords:DescribeEndpointTypes'</a>,
--   <a>describeEndpointTypes_maxRecords</a> - The maximum number of
--   records to include in the response. If more records exist than the
--   specified <tt>MaxRecords</tt> value, a pagination token called a
--   marker is included in the response so that the remaining results can
--   be retrieved.
--   
--   Default: 100
--   
--   Constraints: Minimum 20, maximum 100.

--   
--   Valid filter names: engine-name | endpoint-type
describeEndpointTypes_filters :: Lens' DescribeEndpointTypes (Maybe [Filter])

--   parameter is specified, the response includes only records beyond the

--   records exist than the specified <tt>MaxRecords</tt> value, a

--   the remaining results can be retrieved.
--   
--   Default: 100
--   
--   Constraints: Minimum 20, maximum 100.
describeEndpointTypes_maxRecords :: Lens' DescribeEndpointTypes (Maybe Int)

-- | Describes the status of the connections that have been made between
--   the replication instance and an endpoint. Connections are created when
--   you test an endpoint.
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.
module Network.AWS.DMS.DescribeConnections

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeConnections</a> smart constructor.
data DescribeConnections
DescribeConnections' :: Maybe [Filter] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> DescribeConnections

-- | The filters applied to the connection.
--   
--   Valid filter names: endpoint-arn | replication-instance-arn
[$sel:filters:DescribeConnections'] :: DescribeConnections -> Maybe [Filter]

-- | An optional pagination token provided by a previous request. If this
--   parameter is specified, the response includes only records beyond the
--   marker, up to the value specified by <tt>MaxRecords</tt>.
[$sel:marker:DescribeConnections'] :: DescribeConnections -> Maybe Text

-- | The maximum number of records to include in the response. If more
--   records exist than the specified <tt>MaxRecords</tt> value, a
--   pagination token called a marker is included in the response so that
--   the remaining results can be retrieved.
--   
--   Default: 100
--   
--   Constraints: Minimum 20, maximum 100.
[$sel:maxRecords:DescribeConnections'] :: DescribeConnections -> Maybe Int

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeConnections</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--

--   response includes only records beyond the marker, up to the value

--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.

--   the remaining results can be retrieved.
--

instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.DMS.DescribeCertificates.DescribeCertificates


-- | Provides a list of individual assessments that you can specify for a
--   new premigration assessment run, given one or more parameters.
--   
--   If you specify an existing migration task, this operation provides the
--   default individual assessments you can specify for that task.
--   Otherwise, the specified parameters model elements of a possible
--   migration task on which to base a premigration assessment run.
--   
--   To use these migration task modeling parameters, you must specify an
--   existing replication instance, a source database engine, a target
--   database engine, and a migration type. This combination of parameters
--   potentially limits the default individual assessments available for an
--   assessment run created for a corresponding migration task.
--   
--   If you specify no parameters, this operation provides a list of all
--   possible individual assessments that you can specify for an assessment
--   run. If you specify any one of the task modeling parameters, you must
--   specify all of them or the operation cannot provide a list of
--   individual assessments. The only parameter that you can specify alone
--   is for an existing migration task. The specified task definition then
--   determines the default list of individual assessments that you can
--   specify in an assessment run for the task.
module Network.AWS.DMS.DescribeApplicableIndividualAssessments

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeApplicableIndividualAssessments</a> smart
--   constructor.
data DescribeApplicableIndividualAssessments
DescribeApplicableIndividualAssessments' :: Maybe MigrationTypeValue -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> DescribeApplicableIndividualAssessments

-- | Name of the migration type that each provided individual assessment
--   must support.
[$sel:migrationType:DescribeApplicableIndividualAssessments'] :: DescribeApplicableIndividualAssessments -> Maybe MigrationTypeValue

-- | Name of a database engine that the specified replication instance
--   supports as a source.
[$sel:sourceEngineName:DescribeApplicableIndividualAssessments'] :: DescribeApplicableIndividualAssessments -> Maybe Text

-- | Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a migration task on which you want to
--   base the default list of individual assessments.
[$sel:replicationTaskArn:DescribeApplicableIndividualAssessments'] :: DescribeApplicableIndividualAssessments -> Maybe Text

-- | Optional pagination token provided by a previous request. If this
--   parameter is specified, the response includes only records beyond the
--   marker, up to the value specified by <tt>MaxRecords</tt>.
[$sel:marker:DescribeApplicableIndividualAssessments'] :: DescribeApplicableIndividualAssessments -> Maybe Text

-- | Maximum number of records to include in the response. If more records
--   exist than the specified <tt>MaxRecords</tt> value, a pagination token
--   called a marker is included in the response so that the remaining
--   results can be retrieved.
[$sel:maxRecords:DescribeApplicableIndividualAssessments'] :: DescribeApplicableIndividualAssessments -> Maybe Int

-- | Name of a database engine that the specified replication instance
--   supports as a target.
[$sel:targetEngineName:DescribeApplicableIndividualAssessments'] :: DescribeApplicableIndividualAssessments -> Maybe Text

-- | ARN of a replication instance on which you want to base the default
--   list of individual assessments.
[$sel:replicationInstanceArn:DescribeApplicableIndividualAssessments'] :: DescribeApplicableIndividualAssessments -> Maybe Text
