-- | The full Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role that specifies DMS
--   as the trusted entity and grants the required permissions to access
--   the value in <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt>. The role must allow the
--   <tt>iam:PassRole</tt> action. <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> has the
--   value of the Amazon Web Services Secrets Manager secret that allows
--   access to the DocumentDB endpoint.
--   
--   You can specify one of two sets of values for these permissions. You
--   can specify the values for this setting and
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecretId</tt>. Or you can specify clear-text values
--   for <tt>UserName</tt>, <tt>Password</tt>, <tt>ServerName</tt>, and
--   <tt>Port</tt>. You can't specify both. For more information on
--   creating this <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> and the
--   <tt>SecretsManagerAccessRoleArn</tt> and
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecretId</tt> required to access it, see <a>Using
--   secrets to access Database Migration Service resources</a> in the
--   <i>Database Migration Service User Guide</i>.

--   full load operation stops.
--   
--   To avoid early failure, this counter is only effective after 1000
--   records are transferred. Elasticsearch also has the concept of error
--   monitoring during the last 10 minutes of an Observation Window. If
--   transfer of all records fail in the last 10 minutes, the full load
--   operation stops.

eventCategoryGroup_sourceType :: Lens' EventCategoryGroup (Maybe Text)

-- | A list of event categories from a source type that you've chosen.
eventCategoryGroup_eventCategories :: Lens' EventCategoryGroup (Maybe [Text])

-- | The status of the DMS event notification subscription.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   Can be one of the following: creating | modifying | deleting | active
--   | no-permission | topic-not-exist
--   
--   The status "no-permission" indicates that DMS no longer has permission
--   to post to the SNS topic. The status "topic-not-exist" indicates that
--   the topic was deleted after the subscription was created.
eventSubscription_status :: Lens' EventSubscription (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Web Services customer account associated with the DMS event
--   notification subscription.
eventSubscription_customerAwsId :: Lens' EventSubscription (Maybe Text)

-- | The DMS event notification subscription Id.
eventSubscription_custSubscriptionId :: Lens' EventSubscription (Maybe Text)

-- | The topic ARN of the DMS event notification subscription.
eventSubscription_snsTopicArn :: Lens' EventSubscription (Maybe Text)

-- | Boolean value that indicates if the event subscription is enabled.
eventSubscription_enabled :: Lens' EventSubscription (Maybe Bool)

-- | The type of DMS resource that generates events.
--   
--   Valid values: replication-instance | replication-server |
--   security-group | replication-task
eventSubscription_sourceType :: Lens' EventSubscription (Maybe Text)

-- | The time the DMS event notification subscription was created.
eventSubscription_subscriptionCreationTime :: Lens' EventSubscription (Maybe Text)

-- | A lists of event categories.
eventSubscription_eventCategoriesList :: Lens' EventSubscription (Maybe [Text])

-- | A list of source Ids for the event subscription.
eventSubscription_sourceIdsList :: Lens' EventSubscription (Maybe [Text])

-- | The name of the filter as specified for a <tt>Describe*</tt> or
--   similar operation.
filter_name :: Lens' Filter Text

-- | The filter value, which can specify one or more values used to narrow
--   the returned results.
filter_values :: Lens' Filter [Text]

-- | Fully qualified domain name of the endpoint.
iBMDb2Settings_serverName :: Lens' IBMDb2Settings (Maybe Text)

-- | For ongoing replication (CDC), use CurrentLSN to specify a log
--   sequence number (LSN) where you want the replication to start.
iBMDb2Settings_currentLsn :: Lens' IBMDb2Settings (Maybe Text)

-- | Enables ongoing replication (CDC) as a BOOLEAN value. The default is
--   true.
iBMDb2Settings_setDataCaptureChanges :: Lens' IBMDb2Settings (Maybe Bool)

-- | The full Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role that specifies DMS
--   as the trusted entity and grants the required permissions to access
--   the value in <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt>. The role must allow the
--   <tt>iam:PassRole</tt> action. <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> has the
--   value of the Amazon Web Services Secrets Manager secret that allows
--   access to the Db2 LUW endpoint.
--   
--   You can specify one of two sets of values for these permissions. You
--   can specify the values for this setting and
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecretId</tt>. Or you can specify clear-text values
--   for <tt>UserName</tt>, <tt>Password</tt>, <tt>ServerName</tt>, and
--   <tt>Port</tt>. You can't specify both. For more information on
--   creating this <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> and the
--   <tt>SecretsManagerAccessRoleArn</tt> and
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecretId</tt> required to access it, see <a>Using
--   secrets to access Database Migration Service resources</a> in the
--   <i>Database Migration Service User Guide</i>.
iBMDb2Settings_secretsManagerAccessRoleArn :: Lens' IBMDb2Settings (Maybe Text)

-- | Endpoint connection user name.
iBMDb2Settings_username :: Lens' IBMDb2Settings (Maybe Text)

-- | Endpoint connection password.
iBMDb2Settings_password :: Lens' IBMDb2Settings (Maybe Text)

-- | Database name for the endpoint.
iBMDb2Settings_databaseName :: Lens' IBMDb2Settings (Maybe Text)

-- | The full ARN, partial ARN, or friendly name of the
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> that contains the Db2 LUW endpoint
--   connection details.
iBMDb2Settings_secretsManagerSecretId :: Lens' IBMDb2Settings (Maybe Text)

-- | Maximum number of bytes per read, as a NUMBER value. The default is 64
--   KB.
iBMDb2Settings_maxKBytesPerRead :: Lens' IBMDb2Settings (Maybe Int)

-- | Endpoint TCP port. The default value is 50000.
iBMDb2Settings_port :: Lens' IBMDb2Settings (Maybe Int)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the client private key used to
--   securely connect to a Kafka target endpoint.
kafkaSettings_sslClientKeyArn :: Lens' KafkaSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | Provides detailed transaction information from the source database.
--   This information includes a commit timestamp, a log position, and
--   values for <tt>transaction_id</tt>, previous <tt>transaction_id</tt>,
--   and <tt>transaction_record_id</tt> (the record offset within a
--   transaction). The default is <tt>false</tt>.
kafkaSettings_includeTransactionDetails :: Lens' KafkaSettings (Maybe Bool)

-- | Includes any data definition language (DDL) operations that change the
--   table in the control data, such as <tt>rename-table</tt>,
--   <tt>drop-table</tt>, <tt>add-column</tt>, <tt>drop-column</tt>, and
--   <tt>rename-column</tt>. The default is <tt>false</tt>.
kafkaSettings_includeTableAlterOperations :: Lens' KafkaSettings (Maybe Bool)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the client certificate used to
--   securely connect to a Kafka target endpoint.
kafkaSettings_sslClientCertificateArn :: Lens' KafkaSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the private certificate authority
--   (CA) cert that DMS uses to securely connect to your Kafka target
--   endpoint.
kafkaSettings_sslCaCertificateArn :: Lens' KafkaSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | Prefixes schema and table names to partition values, when the
--   partition type is <tt>primary-key-type</tt>. Doing this increases data
--   distribution among Kafka partitions. For example, suppose that a
--   SysBench schema has thousands of tables and each table has only
--   limited range for a primary key. In this case, the same primary key is
--   sent from thousands of tables to the same partition, which causes
--   throttling. The default is <tt>false</tt>.
kafkaSettings_partitionIncludeSchemaTable :: Lens' KafkaSettings (Maybe Bool)

-- | The topic to which you migrate the data. If you don't specify a topic,
--   DMS specifies <tt>"kafka-default-topic"</tt> as the migration topic.
kafkaSettings_topic :: Lens' KafkaSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | Shows detailed control information for table definition, column
--   definition, and table and column changes in the Kafka message output.
--   The default is <tt>false</tt>.
kafkaSettings_includeControlDetails :: Lens' KafkaSettings (Maybe Bool)

-- | Set this optional parameter to <tt>true</tt> to avoid adding a '0x'
--   prefix to raw data in hexadecimal format. For example, by default, DMS
--   adds a '0x' prefix to the LOB column type in hexadecimal format moving
--   from an Oracle source to a Kafka target. Use the <tt>NoHexPrefix</tt>
--   endpoint setting to enable migration of RAW data type columns without
--   adding the '0x' prefix.
kafkaSettings_noHexPrefix :: Lens' KafkaSettings (Maybe Bool)

-- | The secure password you created when you first set up your MSK cluster
--   to validate a client identity and make an encrypted connection between
--   server and client using SASL-SSL authentication.
kafkaSettings_saslPassword :: Lens' KafkaSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | The password for the client private key used to securely connect to a
--   Kafka target endpoint.
kafkaSettings_sslClientKeyPassword :: Lens' KafkaSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | Shows the partition value within the Kafka message output unless the
--   partition type is <tt>schema-table-type</tt>. The default is
--   <tt>false</tt>.
kafkaSettings_includePartitionValue :: Lens' KafkaSettings (Maybe Bool)

-- | The output format for the records created on the endpoint. The message
--   format is <tt>JSON</tt> (default) or <tt>JSON_UNFORMATTED</tt> (a
--   single line with no tab).
kafkaSettings_messageFormat :: Lens' KafkaSettings (Maybe MessageFormatValue)

-- | Set secure connection to a Kafka target endpoint using Transport Layer
--   Security (TLS). Options include <tt>ssl-encryption</tt>,
--   <tt>ssl-authentication</tt>, and <tt>sasl-ssl</tt>. <tt>sasl-ssl</tt>
--   requires <tt>SaslUsername</tt> and <tt>SaslPassword</tt>.
kafkaSettings_securityProtocol :: Lens' KafkaSettings (Maybe KafkaSecurityProtocol)

-- | The secure user name you created when you first set up your MSK
--   cluster to validate a client identity and make an encrypted connection
--   between server and client using SASL-SSL authentication.
kafkaSettings_saslUsername :: Lens' KafkaSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | A comma-separated list of one or more broker locations in your Kafka
--   cluster that host your Kafka instance. Specify each broker location in
--   the form <tt> broker-hostname-or-ip:port </tt>. For example,
--   <tt>"ec2-12-345-678-901.compute-1.amazonaws.com:2345"</tt>. For more
--   information and examples of specifying a list of broker locations, see
--   <a>Using Apache Kafka as a target for Database Migration Service</a>
--   in the <i>Database Migration Service User Guide</i>.
kafkaSettings_broker :: Lens' KafkaSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | The maximum size in bytes for records created on the endpoint The
--   default is 1,000,000.
kafkaSettings_messageMaxBytes :: Lens' KafkaSettings (Maybe Int)

-- | Include NULL and empty columns for records migrated to the endpoint.
--   The default is <tt>false</tt>.
kafkaSettings_includeNullAndEmpty :: Lens' KafkaSettings (Maybe Bool)

-- | Provides detailed transaction information from the source database.
--   This information includes a commit timestamp, a log position, and
--   values for <tt>transaction_id</tt>, previous <tt>transaction_id</tt>,
--   and <tt>transaction_record_id</tt> (the record offset within a
--   transaction). The default is <tt>false</tt>.
kinesisSettings_includeTransactionDetails :: Lens' KinesisSettings (Maybe Bool)

-- | Includes any data definition language (DDL) operations that change the
--   table in the control data, such as <tt>rename-table</tt>,
--   <tt>drop-table</tt>, <tt>add-column</tt>, <tt>drop-column</tt>, and
--   <tt>rename-column</tt>. The default is <tt>false</tt>.
kinesisSettings_includeTableAlterOperations :: Lens' KinesisSettings (Maybe Bool)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the IAM role that DMS uses to write
--   to the Kinesis data stream. The role must allow the
--   <tt>iam:PassRole</tt> action.
kinesisSettings_serviceAccessRoleArn :: Lens' KinesisSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | Prefixes schema and table names to partition values, when the
--   partition type is <tt>primary-key-type</tt>. Doing this increases data
--   distribution among Kinesis shards. For example, suppose that a
--   SysBench schema has thousands of tables and each table has only
--   limited range for a primary key. In this case, the same primary key is
--   sent from thousands of tables to the same shard, which causes
--   throttling. The default is <tt>false</tt>.
kinesisSettings_partitionIncludeSchemaTable :: Lens' KinesisSettings (Maybe Bool)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the Amazon Kinesis Data Streams
--   endpoint.
kinesisSettings_streamArn :: Lens' KinesisSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | Shows detailed control information for table definition, column
--   definition, and table and column changes in the Kinesis message
--   output. The default is <tt>false</tt>.
kinesisSettings_includeControlDetails :: Lens' KinesisSettings (Maybe Bool)

-- | Set this optional parameter to <tt>true</tt> to avoid adding a '0x'
--   prefix to raw data in hexadecimal format. For example, by default, DMS
--   adds a '0x' prefix to the LOB column type in hexadecimal format moving
--   from an Oracle source to an Amazon Kinesis target. Use the
--   <tt>NoHexPrefix</tt> endpoint setting to enable migration of RAW data
--   type columns without adding the '0x' prefix.
kinesisSettings_noHexPrefix :: Lens' KinesisSettings (Maybe Bool)

-- | Shows the partition value within the Kinesis message output, unless
--   the partition type is <tt>schema-table-type</tt>. The default is
--   <tt>false</tt>.
kinesisSettings_includePartitionValue :: Lens' KinesisSettings (Maybe Bool)

-- | The output format for the records created on the endpoint. The message
--   format is <tt>JSON</tt> (default) or <tt>JSON_UNFORMATTED</tt> (a
--   single line with no tab).
kinesisSettings_messageFormat :: Lens' KinesisSettings (Maybe MessageFormatValue)

-- | Include NULL and empty columns for records migrated to the endpoint.
--   The default is <tt>false</tt>.
kinesisSettings_includeNullAndEmpty :: Lens' KinesisSettings (Maybe Bool)

-- | The maximum size of the packets (in bytes) used to transfer data using
--   BCP.
microsoftSQLServerSettings_bcpPacketSize :: Lens' MicrosoftSQLServerSettings (Maybe Int)

-- | Use this to attribute to transfer data for full-load operations using
--   BCP. When the target table contains an identity column that does not
--   exist in the source table, you must disable the use BCP for loading
--   table option.
microsoftSQLServerSettings_useBcpFullLoad :: Lens' MicrosoftSQLServerSettings (Maybe Bool)

-- | Fully qualified domain name of the endpoint.
microsoftSQLServerSettings_serverName :: Lens' MicrosoftSQLServerSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | Cleans and recreates table metadata information on the replication
--   instance when a mismatch occurs. An example is a situation where
--   running an alter DDL statement on a table might result in different
--   information about the table cached in the replication instance.
microsoftSQLServerSettings_querySingleAlwaysOnNode :: Lens' MicrosoftSQLServerSettings (Maybe Bool)

-- | The full Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role that specifies DMS
--   as the trusted entity and grants the required permissions to access
--   the value in <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt>. The role must allow the
--   <tt>iam:PassRole</tt> action. <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> has the
--   value of the Amazon Web Services Secrets Manager secret that allows
--   access to the SQL Server endpoint.
--   
--   You can specify one of two sets of values for these permissions. You
--   can specify the values for this setting and
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecretId</tt>. Or you can specify clear-text values
--   for <tt>UserName</tt>, <tt>Password</tt>, <tt>ServerName</tt>, and
--   <tt>Port</tt>. You can't specify both. For more information on
--   creating this <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> and the
--   <tt>SecretsManagerAccessRoleArn</tt> and
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecretId</tt> required to access it, see <a>Using
--   secrets to access Database Migration Service resources</a> in the
--   <i>Database Migration Service User Guide</i>.
microsoftSQLServerSettings_secretsManagerAccessRoleArn :: Lens' MicrosoftSQLServerSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | Endpoint connection user name.
microsoftSQLServerSettings_username :: Lens' MicrosoftSQLServerSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | Use this attribute to minimize the need to access the backup log and
--   enable DMS to prevent truncation using one of the following two
--   methods.
--   
--   <i>Start transactions in the database:</i> This is the default method.
--   When this method is used, DMS prevents TLOG truncation by mimicking a
--   transaction in the database. As long as such a transaction is open,
--   changes that appear after the transaction started aren't truncated. If
--   you need Microsoft Replication to be enabled in your database, then
--   you must choose this method.
--   
--   <i>Exclusively use sp_repldone within a single task</i>: When this
--   method is used, DMS reads the changes and then uses sp_repldone to
--   mark the TLOG transactions as ready for truncation. Although this
--   method doesn't involve any transactional activities, it can only be
--   used when Microsoft Replication isn't running. Also, when using this
--   method, only one DMS task can access the database at any given time.
--   Therefore, if you need to run parallel DMS tasks against the same
--   database, use the default method.
microsoftSQLServerSettings_safeguardPolicy :: Lens' MicrosoftSQLServerSettings (Maybe SafeguardPolicy)

-- | Endpoint connection password.
microsoftSQLServerSettings_password :: Lens' MicrosoftSQLServerSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | Database name for the endpoint.
microsoftSQLServerSettings_databaseName :: Lens' MicrosoftSQLServerSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | The full ARN, partial ARN, or friendly name of the
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> that contains the SQL Server endpoint
--   connection details.
microsoftSQLServerSettings_secretsManagerSecretId :: Lens' MicrosoftSQLServerSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | When this attribute is set to <tt>Y</tt>, DMS only reads changes from
--   transaction log backups and doesn't read from the active transaction
--   log file during ongoing replication. Setting this parameter to
--   <tt>Y</tt> enables you to control active transaction log file growth
--   during full load and ongoing replication tasks. However, it can add
--   some source latency to ongoing replication.
microsoftSQLServerSettings_readBackupOnly :: Lens' MicrosoftSQLServerSettings (Maybe Bool)

-- | When this attribute is set to <tt>Y</tt>, DMS processes third-party
--   transaction log backups if they are created in native format.
microsoftSQLServerSettings_useThirdPartyBackupDevice :: Lens' MicrosoftSQLServerSettings (Maybe Bool)

-- | Specifies a file group for the DMS internal tables. When the
--   replication task starts, all the internal DMS control tables (awsdms_
--   apply_exception, awsdms_apply, awsdms_changes) are created for the
--   specified file group.
microsoftSQLServerSettings_controlTablesFileGroup :: Lens' MicrosoftSQLServerSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | Endpoint TCP port.
microsoftSQLServerSettings_port :: Lens' MicrosoftSQLServerSettings (Maybe Int)

-- | The name of the server on the MongoDB source endpoint.
mongoDbSettings_serverName :: Lens' MongoDbSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | The full Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role that specifies DMS
--   as the trusted entity and grants the required permissions to access
--   the value in <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt>. The role must allow the
--   <tt>iam:PassRole</tt> action. <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> has the
--   value of the Amazon Web Services Secrets Manager secret that allows
--   access to the MongoDB endpoint.
--   
--   You can specify one of two sets of values for these permissions. You
--   can specify the values for this setting and
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecretId</tt>. Or you can specify clear-text values
--   for <tt>UserName</tt>, <tt>Password</tt>, <tt>ServerName</tt>, and
--   <tt>Port</tt>. You can't specify both. For more information on
--   creating this <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> and the
--   <tt>SecretsManagerAccessRoleArn</tt> and
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecretId</tt> required to access it, see <a>Using
--   secrets to access Database Migration Service resources</a> in the
--   <i>Database Migration Service User Guide</i>.
mongoDbSettings_secretsManagerAccessRoleArn :: Lens' MongoDbSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | The authentication mechanism you use to access the MongoDB source
--   endpoint.
--   
--   For the default value, in MongoDB version 2.x, <tt>"default"</tt> is
--   <tt>"mongodb_cr"</tt>. For MongoDB version 3.x or later,
--   <tt>"default"</tt> is <tt>"scram_sha_1"</tt>. This setting isn't used
--   when <tt>AuthType</tt> is set to <tt>"no"</tt>.
mongoDbSettings_authMechanism :: Lens' MongoDbSettings (Maybe AuthMechanismValue)

-- | The user name you use to access the MongoDB source endpoint.
mongoDbSettings_username :: Lens' MongoDbSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | The KMS key identifier that is used to encrypt the content on the
--   replication instance. If you don't specify a value for the
--   <tt>KmsKeyId</tt> parameter, then DMS uses your default encryption
--   key. KMS creates the default encryption key for your Amazon Web
--   Services account. Your Amazon Web Services account has a different
--   default encryption key for each Amazon Web Services Region.
mongoDbSettings_kmsKeyId :: Lens' MongoDbSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | The password for the user account you use to access the MongoDB source
--   endpoint.
mongoDbSettings_password :: Lens' MongoDbSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies either document or table mode.
--   
--   Default value is <tt>"none"</tt>. Specify <tt>"none"</tt> to use
--   document mode. Specify <tt>"one"</tt> to use table mode.
mongoDbSettings_nestingLevel :: Lens' MongoDbSettings (Maybe NestingLevelValue)

-- | The database name on the MongoDB source endpoint.
mongoDbSettings_databaseName :: Lens' MongoDbSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | Indicates the number of documents to preview to determine the document
--   organization. Use this setting when <tt>NestingLevel</tt> is set to
--   <tt>"one"</tt>.
--   
--   Must be a positive value greater than <tt>0</tt>. Default value is
--   <tt>1000</tt>.
mongoDbSettings_docsToInvestigate :: Lens' MongoDbSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | The MongoDB database name. This setting isn't used when
--   <tt>AuthType</tt> is set to <tt>"no"</tt>.
--   
--   The default is <tt>"admin"</tt>.
mongoDbSettings_authSource :: Lens' MongoDbSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | The full ARN, partial ARN, or friendly name of the
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> that contains the MongoDB endpoint
--   connection details.
mongoDbSettings_secretsManagerSecretId :: Lens' MongoDbSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the document ID. Use this setting when <tt>NestingLevel</tt>
--   is set to <tt>"none"</tt>.
--   
--   Default value is <tt>"false"</tt>.
mongoDbSettings_extractDocId :: Lens' MongoDbSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | The authentication type you use to access the MongoDB source endpoint.
--   
--   When when set to <tt>"no"</tt>, user name and password parameters are
--   not used and can be empty.
mongoDbSettings_authType :: Lens' MongoDbSettings (Maybe AuthTypeValue)

-- | The port value for the MongoDB source endpoint.
mongoDbSettings_port :: Lens' MongoDbSettings (Maybe Int)

-- | Specifies the maximum size (in KB) of any .csv file used to transfer
--   data to a MySQL-compatible database.
--   
--   Example: <tt>maxFileSize=512</tt>
mySQLSettings_maxFileSize :: Lens' MySQLSettings (Maybe Int)

-- | Specifies where to migrate source tables on the target, either to a
--   single database or multiple databases.
--   
--   Example: <tt>targetDbType=MULTIPLE_DATABASES</tt>
mySQLSettings_targetDbType :: Lens' MySQLSettings (Maybe TargetDbType)

-- | Fully qualified domain name of the endpoint.
mySQLSettings_serverName :: Lens' MySQLSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | Adjusts the behavior of DMS when migrating from an SQL Server source
--   database that is hosted as part of an Always On availability group
--   cluster. If you need DMS to poll all the nodes in the Always On
--   cluster for transaction backups, set this attribute to <tt>false</tt>.
mySQLSettings_cleanSourceMetadataOnMismatch :: Lens' MySQLSettings (Maybe Bool)

-- | Improves performance when loading data into the MySQL-compatible
--   target database. Specifies how many threads to use to load the data
--   into the MySQL-compatible target database. Setting a large number of
--   threads can have an adverse effect on database performance, because a
--   separate connection is required for each thread.
--   
--   Example: <tt>parallelLoadThreads=1</tt>
mySQLSettings_parallelLoadThreads :: Lens' MySQLSettings (Maybe Int)

-- | The full Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role that specifies DMS
--   as the trusted entity and grants the required permissions to access
--   the value in <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt>. The role must allow the
--   <tt>iam:PassRole</tt> action. <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> has the
--   value of the Amazon Web Services Secrets Manager secret that allows
--   access to the MySQL endpoint.
--   
--   You can specify one of two sets of values for these permissions. You
--   can specify the values for this setting and
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecretId</tt>. Or you can specify clear-text values
--   for <tt>UserName</tt>, <tt>Password</tt>, <tt>ServerName</tt>, and
--   <tt>Port</tt>. You can't specify both. For more information on
--   creating this <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> and the
--   <tt>SecretsManagerAccessRoleArn</tt> and
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecretId</tt> required to access it, see <a>Using
--   secrets to access Database Migration Service resources</a> in the
--   <i>Database Migration Service User Guide</i>.
mySQLSettings_secretsManagerAccessRoleArn :: Lens' MySQLSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | Endpoint connection user name.
mySQLSettings_username :: Lens' MySQLSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | Endpoint connection password.
mySQLSettings_password :: Lens' MySQLSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies how often to check the binary log for new changes/events
--   when the database is idle.
--   
--   Example: <tt>eventsPollInterval=5;</tt>
--   
--   In the example, DMS checks for changes in the binary logs every five
--   seconds.
mySQLSettings_eventsPollInterval :: Lens' MySQLSettings (Maybe Int)

-- | Database name for the endpoint. For a MySQL source or target endpoint,
--   don't explicitly specify the database using the <tt>DatabaseName</tt>
--   request parameter on either the <tt>CreateEndpoint</tt> or
--   <tt>ModifyEndpoint</tt> API call. Specifying <tt>DatabaseName</tt>
--   when you create or modify a MySQL endpoint replicates all the task
--   tables to this single database. For MySQL endpoints, you specify the
--   database only when you specify the schema in the table-mapping rules
--   of the DMS task.
mySQLSettings_databaseName :: Lens' MySQLSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies a script to run immediately after DMS connects to the
--   endpoint. The migration task continues running regardless if the SQL
--   statement succeeds or fails.
--   
--   For this parameter, provide the code of the script itself, not the
--   name of a file containing the script.
mySQLSettings_afterConnectScript :: Lens' MySQLSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | The full ARN, partial ARN, or friendly name of the
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> that contains the MySQL endpoint
--   connection details.
mySQLSettings_secretsManagerSecretId :: Lens' MySQLSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the time zone for the source MySQL database.
--   
--   Example: <tt>serverTimezone=US/Pacific;</tt>
--   
--   Note: Do not enclose time zones in single quotes.
mySQLSettings_serverTimezone :: Lens' MySQLSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | Endpoint TCP port.
mySQLSettings_port :: Lens' MySQLSettings (Maybe Int)

-- | The maximum size in kilobytes of migrated graph data stored in a .csv
--   file before DMS bulk-loads the data to the Neptune target database.
--   The default is 1,048,576 KB. If the bulk load is successful, DMS
--   clears the bucket, ready to store the next batch of migrated graph
--   data.
neptuneSettings_maxFileSize :: Lens' NeptuneSettings (Maybe Int)

-- | The number of times for DMS to retry a bulk load of migrated graph
--   data to the Neptune target database before raising an error. The
--   default is 5.
neptuneSettings_maxRetryCount :: Lens' NeptuneSettings (Maybe Int)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the service role that you created
--   for the Neptune target endpoint. The role must allow the
--   <tt>iam:PassRole</tt> action. For more information, see <a>Creating an
--   IAM Service Role for Accessing Amazon Neptune as a Target</a> in the
--   <i>Database Migration Service User Guide.</i>
neptuneSettings_serviceAccessRoleArn :: Lens' NeptuneSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | If you want Identity and Access Management (IAM) authorization enabled
--   for this endpoint, set this parameter to <tt>true</tt>. Then attach
--   the appropriate IAM policy document to your service role specified by
--   <tt>ServiceAccessRoleArn</tt>. The default is <tt>false</tt>.
neptuneSettings_iamAuthEnabled :: Lens' NeptuneSettings (Maybe Bool)

-- | The number of milliseconds for DMS to wait to retry a bulk-load of
--   migrated graph data to the Neptune target database before raising an
--   error. The default is 250.
neptuneSettings_errorRetryDuration :: Lens' NeptuneSettings (Maybe Int)

-- | The name of the Amazon S3 bucket where DMS can temporarily store
--   migrated graph data in .csv files before bulk-loading it to the
--   Neptune target database. DMS maps the SQL source data to graph data
--   before storing it in these .csv files.
neptuneSettings_s3BucketName :: Lens' NeptuneSettings Text

-- | A folder path where you want DMS to store migrated graph data in the
--   S3 bucket specified by <tt>S3BucketName</tt>
neptuneSettings_s3BucketFolder :: Lens' NeptuneSettings Text

-- | Set this attribute to Y to capture change data using the Binary Reader
--   utility. Set <tt>UseLogminerReader</tt> to N to set this attribute to
--   Y. To use Binary Reader with Amazon RDS for Oracle as the source, you
--   set additional attributes. For more information about using this
--   setting with Oracle Automatic Storage Management (ASM), see <a>Using
--   Oracle LogMiner or DMS Binary Reader for CDC</a>.
oracleSettings_useBFile :: Lens' OracleSettings (Maybe Bool)

-- | Use this attribute to specify a time in minutes for the delay in
--   standby sync. If the source is an Oracle Active Data Guard standby
--   database, use this attribute to specify the time lag between primary
--   and standby databases.
--   
--   In DMS, you can create an Oracle CDC task that uses an Active Data
--   Guard standby instance as a source for replicating ongoing changes.
--   Doing this eliminates the need to connect to an active database that
--   might be in production.
oracleSettings_standbyDelayTime :: Lens' OracleSettings (Maybe Int)

-- | When set to <tt>true</tt>, this attribute causes a task to fail if the
--   actual size of an LOB column is greater than the specified
--   <tt>LobMaxSize</tt>.
--   
--   If a task is set to limited LOB mode and this option is set to
--   <tt>true</tt>, the task fails instead of truncating the LOB data.
oracleSettings_failTasksOnLobTruncation :: Lens' OracleSettings (Maybe Bool)

-- | Fully qualified domain name of the endpoint.
oracleSettings_serverName :: Lens' OracleSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | When set to <tt>true</tt>, this attribute helps to increase the commit
--   rate on the Oracle target database by writing directly to tables and
--   not writing a trail to database logs.
oracleSettings_directPathNoLog :: Lens' OracleSettings (Maybe Bool)

-- | Specifies the IDs of one more destinations for one or more archived
--   redo logs. These IDs are the values of the <tt>dest_id</tt> column in
--   the <tt>v$archived_log</tt> view. Use this setting with the
--   <tt>archivedLogDestId</tt> extra connection attribute in a
--   primary-to-single setup or a primary-to-multiple-standby setup.
--   
--   This setting is useful in a switchover when you use an Oracle Data
--   Guard database as a source. In this case, DMS needs information about
--   what destination to get archive redo logs from to read changes. DMS
--   needs this because after the switchover the previous primary is a
--   standby instance. For example, in a primary-to-single standby setup
--   you might apply the following settings.
--   
--   <pre>
--   archivedLogDestId=1; ExtraArchivedLogDestIds=[2]
--   </pre>
--   
--   In a primary-to-multiple-standby setup, you might apply the following
--   settings.
--   
--   <pre>
--   archivedLogDestId=1; ExtraArchivedLogDestIds=[2,3,4]
--   </pre>
--   
--   Although DMS supports the use of the Oracle <tt>RESETLOGS</tt> option
--   to open the database, never use <tt>RESETLOGS</tt> unless it's
--   necessary. For more information about <tt>RESETLOGS</tt>, see <a>RMAN
--   Data Repair Concepts</a> in the <i>Oracle Database Backup and Recovery
--   User's Guide</i>.
oracleSettings_extraArchivedLogDestIds :: Lens' OracleSettings (Maybe [Int])

-- | For an Oracle source endpoint, the name of a key used for the
--   transparent data encryption (TDE) of the columns and tablespaces in an
--   Oracle source database that is encrypted using TDE. The key value is
--   the value of the <tt>SecurityDbEncryption</tt> setting. For more
--   information on setting the key name value of
--   <tt>SecurityDbEncryptionName</tt>, see the information and example for
--   setting the <tt>securityDbEncryptionName</tt> extra connection
--   attribute in <a>Supported encryption methods for using Oracle as a
--   source for DMS</a> in the <i>Database Migration Service User
--   Guide</i>.
oracleSettings_securityDbEncryptionName :: Lens' OracleSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | Set this string attribute to the required value in order to use the
--   Binary Reader to capture change data for an Amazon RDS for Oracle as
--   the source. This value specifies the default Oracle root used to
--   access the redo logs.
oracleSettings_oraclePathPrefix :: Lens' OracleSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | The full Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role that specifies DMS
--   as the trusted entity and grants the required permissions to access
--   the value in <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt>. The role must allow the
--   <tt>iam:PassRole</tt> action. <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> has the
--   value of the Amazon Web Services Secrets Manager secret that allows
--   access to the Oracle endpoint.
--   
--   You can specify one of two sets of values for these permissions. You
--   can specify the values for this setting and
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecretId</tt>. Or you can specify clear-text values
--   for <tt>UserName</tt>, <tt>Password</tt>, <tt>ServerName</tt>, and
--   <tt>Port</tt>. You can't specify both. For more information on
--   creating this <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> and the
--   <tt>SecretsManagerAccessRoleArn</tt> and
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecretId</tt> required to access it, see <a>Using
--   secrets to access Database Migration Service resources</a> in the
--   <i>Database Migration Service User Guide</i>.
oracleSettings_secretsManagerAccessRoleArn :: Lens' OracleSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | Set this attribute to Y to have DMS use a direct path full load.
--   Specify this value to use the direct path protocol in the Oracle Call
--   Interface (OCI). By using this OCI protocol, you can bulk-load Oracle
--   target tables during a full load.
oracleSettings_useDirectPathFullLoad :: Lens' OracleSettings (Maybe Bool)

-- | Endpoint connection user name.
oracleSettings_username :: Lens' OracleSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | Set this attribute to <tt>true</tt> to enable replication of Oracle
--   tables containing columns that are nested tables or defined types.
oracleSettings_allowSelectNestedTables :: Lens' OracleSettings (Maybe Bool)

-- | Set this attribute to change the number of read-ahead blocks that DMS
--   configures to perform a change data capture (CDC) load using Oracle
--   Automatic Storage Management (ASM). You can specify an integer value
--   between 1000 (the default) and 200,000 (the maximum).
oracleSettings_readAheadBlocks :: Lens' OracleSettings (Maybe Int)

-- | Specifies the ID of the destination for the archived redo logs. This
--   value should be the same as a number in the dest_id column of the
--   v$archived_log view. If you work with an additional redo log
--   destination, use the <tt>AdditionalArchivedLogDestId</tt> option to
--   specify the additional destination ID. Doing this improves performance
--   by ensuring that the correct logs are accessed from the outset.
oracleSettings_archivedLogDestId :: Lens' OracleSettings (Maybe Int)

-- | Set this attribute to true in order to use the Binary Reader to
--   capture change data for an Amazon RDS for Oracle as the source. This
--   setting tells DMS instance to replace the default Oracle root with the
--   specified <tt>usePathPrefix</tt> setting to access the redo logs.
oracleSettings_replacePathPrefix :: Lens' OracleSettings (Maybe Bool)

-- | Set this attribute to <tt>false</tt> in order to use the Binary Reader
--   to capture change data for an Amazon RDS for Oracle as the source.
--   This tells the DMS instance to not access redo logs through any
--   specified path prefix replacement using direct file access.
oracleSettings_accessAlternateDirectly :: Lens' OracleSettings (Maybe Bool)

-- | Required only if your Oracle endpoint uses Advanced Storage Manager
--   (ASM). The full ARN, partial ARN, or friendly name of the
--   <tt>SecretsManagerOracleAsmSecret</tt> that contains the Oracle ASM
--   connection details for the Oracle endpoint.
oracleSettings_secretsManagerOracleAsmSecretId :: Lens' OracleSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | For an Oracle source endpoint, the transparent data encryption (TDE)
--   password required by AWM DMS to access Oracle redo logs encrypted by
--   TDE using Binary Reader. It is also the <tt> TDE_Password </tt> part
--   of the comma-separated value you set to the <tt>Password</tt> request
--   parameter when you create the endpoint. The
--   <tt>SecurityDbEncryptian</tt> setting is related to this
--   <tt>SecurityDbEncryptionName</tt> setting. For more information, see
--   <a>Supported encryption methods for using Oracle as a source for
--   DMS</a> in the <i>Database Migration Service User Guide</i>.
oracleSettings_securityDbEncryption :: Lens' OracleSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | Set this attribute to Y to capture change data using the Oracle
--   LogMiner utility (the default). Set this attribute to N if you want to
--   access the redo logs as a binary file. When you set
--   <tt>UseLogminerReader</tt> to N, also set <tt>UseBfile</tt> to Y. For
--   more information on this setting and using Oracle ASM, see <a>Using
--   Oracle LogMiner or DMS Binary Reader for CDC</a> in the <i>DMS User
--   Guide</i>.
oracleSettings_useLogminerReader :: Lens' OracleSettings (Maybe Bool)

-- | When set to <tt>true</tt>, this attribute supports tablespace
--   replication.
oracleSettings_readTableSpaceName :: Lens' OracleSettings (Maybe Bool)

-- | Specifies the number of seconds that the system waits before resending
--   a query.
--   
--   Example: <tt>retryInterval=6;</tt>
oracleSettings_retryInterval :: Lens' OracleSettings (Maybe Int)

-- | Endpoint connection password.
oracleSettings_password :: Lens' OracleSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | Use this attribute to convert <tt>SDO_GEOMETRY</tt> to
--   <tt>GEOJSON</tt> format. By default, DMS calls the
--   <tt>SDO2GEOJSON</tt> custom function if present and accessible. Or you
--   can create your own custom function that mimics the operation of
--   <tt>SDOGEOJSON</tt> and set
--   <tt>SpatialDataOptionToGeoJsonFunctionName</tt> to call it instead.
oracleSettings_spatialDataOptionToGeoJsonFunctionName :: Lens' OracleSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | Database name for the endpoint.
oracleSettings_databaseName :: Lens' OracleSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | Set this attribute to set up table-level supplemental logging for the
--   Oracle database. This attribute enables PRIMARY KEY supplemental
--   logging on all tables selected for a migration task.
--   
--   If you use this option, you still need to enable database-level
--   supplemental logging.
oracleSettings_addSupplementalLogging :: Lens' OracleSettings (Maybe Bool)

-- | Required only if your Oracle endpoint uses Advanced Storage Manager
--   (ASM). The full ARN of the IAM role that specifies DMS as the trusted
--   entity and grants the required permissions to access the
--   <tt>SecretsManagerOracleAsmSecret</tt>. This
--   <tt>SecretsManagerOracleAsmSecret</tt> has the secret value that
--   allows access to the Oracle ASM of the endpoint.
--   
--   You can specify one of two sets of values for these permissions. You
--   can specify the values for this setting and
--   <tt>SecretsManagerOracleAsmSecretId</tt>. Or you can specify
--   clear-text values for <tt>AsmUserName</tt>, <tt>AsmPassword</tt>, and
--   <tt>AsmServerName</tt>. You can't specify both. For more information
--   on creating this <tt>SecretsManagerOracleAsmSecret</tt> and the
--   <tt>SecretsManagerOracleAsmAccessRoleArn</tt> and
--   <tt>SecretsManagerOracleAsmSecretId</tt> required to access it, see
--   <a>Using secrets to access Database Migration Service resources</a> in
--   the <i>Database Migration Service User Guide</i>.
oracleSettings_secretsManagerOracleAsmAccessRoleArn :: Lens' OracleSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | For an Oracle source endpoint, your ASM server address. You can set
--   this value from the <tt>asm_server</tt> value. You set
--   <tt>asm_server</tt> as part of the extra connection attribute string
--   to access an Oracle server with Binary Reader that uses ASM. For more
--   information, see <a>Configuration for change data capture (CDC) on an
--   Oracle source database</a>.
oracleSettings_asmServer :: Lens' OracleSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies whether the length of a character column is in bytes or in
--   characters. To indicate that the character column length is in
--   characters, set this attribute to <tt>CHAR</tt>. Otherwise, the
--   character column length is in bytes.
--   
--   Example: <tt>charLengthSemantics=CHAR;</tt>
oracleSettings_charLengthSemantics :: Lens' OracleSettings (Maybe CharLengthSemantics)

-- | When this field is set to <tt>Y</tt>, DMS only accesses the archived
--   redo logs. If the archived redo logs are stored on Oracle ASM only,
--   the DMS user account needs to be granted ASM privileges.
oracleSettings_archivedLogsOnly :: Lens' OracleSettings (Maybe Bool)

-- | When set to <tt>true</tt>, this attribute specifies a parallel load
--   when <tt>useDirectPathFullLoad</tt> is set to <tt>Y</tt>. This
--   attribute also only applies when you use the DMS parallel load
--   feature. Note that the target table cannot have any constraints or
--   indexes.
oracleSettings_directPathParallelLoad :: Lens' OracleSettings (Maybe Bool)

-- | The full ARN, partial ARN, or friendly name of the
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> that contains the Oracle endpoint
--   connection details.
oracleSettings_secretsManagerSecretId :: Lens' OracleSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | Set this attribute with <tt>ArchivedLogDestId</tt> in a primary/
--   standby setup. This attribute is useful in the case of a switchover.
--   In this case, DMS needs to know which destination to get archive redo
--   logs from to read changes. This need arises because the previous
--   primary instance is now a standby instance after switchover.
--   
--   Although DMS supports the use of the Oracle <tt>RESETLOGS</tt> option
--   to open the database, never use <tt>RESETLOGS</tt> unless necessary.
--   For additional information about <tt>RESETLOGS</tt>, see <a>RMAN Data
--   Repair Concepts</a> in the <i>Oracle Database Backup and Recovery
--   User's Guide</i>.
oracleSettings_additionalArchivedLogDestId :: Lens' OracleSettings (Maybe Int)

-- | For an Oracle source endpoint, your Oracle Automatic Storage
--   Management (ASM) password. You can set this value from the <tt>
--   asm_user_password </tt> value. You set this value as part of the
--   comma-separated value that you set to the <tt>Password</tt> request
--   parameter when you create the endpoint to access transaction logs
--   using Binary Reader. For more information, see <a>Configuration for
--   change data capture (CDC) on an Oracle source database</a>.
oracleSettings_asmPassword :: Lens' OracleSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | Set this attribute to enable homogenous tablespace replication and
--   create existing tables or indexes under the same tablespace on the
--   target.
oracleSettings_enableHomogenousTablespace :: Lens' OracleSettings (Maybe Bool)

-- | Set this attribute to change the number of threads that DMS configures
--   to perform a change data capture (CDC) load using Oracle Automatic
--   Storage Management (ASM). You can specify an integer value between 2
--   (the default) and 8 (the maximum). Use this attribute together with
--   the <tt>readAheadBlocks</tt> attribute.
oracleSettings_parallelAsmReadThreads :: Lens' OracleSettings (Maybe Int)

-- | Specifies the number scale. You can select a scale up to 38, or you
--   can select FLOAT. By default, the NUMBER data type is converted to
--   precision 38, scale 10.
--   
--   Example: <tt>numberDataTypeScale=12</tt>
oracleSettings_numberDatatypeScale :: Lens' OracleSettings (Maybe Int)

-- | Set this string attribute to the required value in order to use the
--   Binary Reader to capture change data for an Amazon RDS for Oracle as
--   the source. This value specifies the path prefix used to replace the
--   default Oracle root to access the redo logs.
oracleSettings_usePathPrefix :: Lens' OracleSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | For an Oracle source endpoint, your ASM user name. You can set this
--   value from the <tt>asm_user</tt> value. You set <tt>asm_user</tt> as
--   part of the extra connection attribute string to access an Oracle
--   server with Binary Reader that uses ASM. For more information, see
--   <a>Configuration for change data capture (CDC) on an Oracle source
--   database</a>.
oracleSettings_asmUser :: Lens' OracleSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | Set this attribute to <tt>true</tt> in order to use the Binary Reader
--   to capture change data for an Amazon RDS for Oracle as the source.
--   This tells the DMS instance to use any specified prefix replacement to
--   access all online redo logs.
oracleSettings_useAlternateFolderForOnline :: Lens' OracleSettings (Maybe Bool)

-- | Endpoint TCP port.
oracleSettings_port :: Lens' OracleSettings (Maybe Int)

-- | The version of the replication engine.
orderableReplicationInstance_engineVersion :: Lens' OrderableReplicationInstance (Maybe Text)

-- | The minimum amount of storage (in gigabytes) that can be allocated for
--   the replication instance.
orderableReplicationInstance_minAllocatedStorage :: Lens' OrderableReplicationInstance (Maybe Int)

-- | The value returned when the specified <tt>EngineVersion</tt> of the
--   replication instance is in Beta or test mode. This indicates some
--   features might not work as expected.
--   
--   DMS supports the <tt>ReleaseStatus</tt> parameter in versions 3.1.4
--   and later.
orderableReplicationInstance_releaseStatus :: Lens' OrderableReplicationInstance (Maybe ReleaseStatusValues)

-- | The amount of storage (in gigabytes) that is allocated for the
--   replication instance.
orderableReplicationInstance_includedAllocatedStorage :: Lens' OrderableReplicationInstance (Maybe Int)

-- | List of Availability Zones for this replication instance.
orderableReplicationInstance_availabilityZones :: Lens' OrderableReplicationInstance (Maybe [Text])

-- | The minimum amount of storage (in gigabytes) that can be allocated for
--   the replication instance.
orderableReplicationInstance_maxAllocatedStorage :: Lens' OrderableReplicationInstance (Maybe Int)

-- | The compute and memory capacity of the replication instance as defined
--   for the specified replication instance class. For example to specify
--   the instance class dms.c4.large, set this parameter to
--   <tt>"dms.c4.large"</tt>.
--   
--   For more information on the settings and capacities for the available
--   replication instance classes, see <a>Selecting the right DMS
--   replication instance for your migration</a>.
orderableReplicationInstance_replicationInstanceClass :: Lens' OrderableReplicationInstance (Maybe Text)

-- | The default amount of storage (in gigabytes) that is allocated for the
--   replication instance.
orderableReplicationInstance_defaultAllocatedStorage :: Lens' OrderableReplicationInstance (Maybe Int)

-- | The type of storage used by the replication instance.
orderableReplicationInstance_storageType :: Lens' OrderableReplicationInstance (Maybe Text)

-- | The date of the maintenance window when the action is to be applied.
--   The maintenance action is applied to the resource during its first
--   maintenance window after this date. If this date is specified, any
--   <tt>next-maintenance</tt> opt-in requests are ignored.
pendingMaintenanceAction_autoAppliedAfterDate :: Lens' PendingMaintenanceAction (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The type of pending maintenance action that is available for the
--   resource.
pendingMaintenanceAction_action :: Lens' PendingMaintenanceAction (Maybe Text)

-- | The type of opt-in request that has been received for the resource.
pendingMaintenanceAction_optInStatus :: Lens' PendingMaintenanceAction (Maybe Text)

-- | A description providing more detail about the maintenance action.
pendingMaintenanceAction_description :: Lens' PendingMaintenanceAction (Maybe Text)

-- | The date when the maintenance action will be automatically applied.
--   The maintenance action is applied to the resource on this date
--   regardless of the maintenance window for the resource. If this date is
--   specified, any <tt>immediate</tt> opt-in requests are ignored.
pendingMaintenanceAction_forcedApplyDate :: Lens' PendingMaintenanceAction (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The effective date when the pending maintenance action will be applied
--   to the resource. This date takes into account opt-in requests received
--   from the <tt>ApplyPendingMaintenanceAction</tt> API operation, and
--   also the <tt>AutoAppliedAfterDate</tt> and <tt>ForcedApplyDate</tt>
--   parameter values. This value is blank if an opt-in request has not
--   been received and nothing has been specified for
--   <tt>AutoAppliedAfterDate</tt> or <tt>ForcedApplyDate</tt>.
pendingMaintenanceAction_currentApplyDate :: Lens' PendingMaintenanceAction (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | Sets the client statement timeout for the PostgreSQL instance, in
--   seconds. The default value is 60 seconds.
--   
--   Example: <tt>executeTimeout=100;</tt>
postgreSQLSettings_executeTimeout :: Lens' PostgreSQLSettings (Maybe Int)

-- | Specifies the maximum size (in KB) of any .csv file used to transfer
--   data to PostgreSQL.
--   
--   Example: <tt>maxFileSize=512</tt>
postgreSQLSettings_maxFileSize :: Lens' PostgreSQLSettings (Maybe Int)

-- | When set to <tt>true</tt>, this value causes a task to fail if the
--   actual size of a LOB column is greater than the specified
--   <tt>LobMaxSize</tt>.
--   
--   If task is set to Limited LOB mode and this option is set to true, the
--   task fails instead of truncating the LOB data.
postgreSQLSettings_failTasksOnLobTruncation :: Lens' PostgreSQLSettings (Maybe Bool)

-- | Fully qualified domain name of the endpoint.
postgreSQLSettings_serverName :: Lens' PostgreSQLSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | The schema in which the operational DDL database artifacts are
--   created.
--   
--   Example: <tt>ddlArtifactsSchema=xyzddlschema;</tt>
postgreSQLSettings_ddlArtifactsSchema :: Lens' PostgreSQLSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | Sets the name of a previously created logical replication slot for a
--   change data capture (CDC) load of the PostgreSQL source instance.
--   
--   When used with the <tt>CdcStartPosition</tt> request parameter for the
--   DMS API , this attribute also makes it possible to use native CDC
--   start points. DMS verifies that the specified logical replication slot
--   exists before starting the CDC load task. It also verifies that the
--   task was created with a valid setting of <tt>CdcStartPosition</tt>. If
--   the specified slot doesn't exist or the task doesn't have a valid
--   <tt>CdcStartPosition</tt> setting, DMS raises an error.
--   
--   For more information about setting the <tt>CdcStartPosition</tt>
--   request parameter, see <a>Determining a CDC native start point</a> in
--   the <i>Database Migration Service User Guide</i>. For more information
--   about using <tt>CdcStartPosition</tt>, see
--   <a>CreateReplicationTask</a>, <a>StartReplicationTask</a>, and
--   <a>ModifyReplicationTask</a>.
postgreSQLSettings_slotName :: Lens' PostgreSQLSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | The full Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role that specifies DMS
--   as the trusted entity and grants the required permissions to access
--   the value in <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt>. The role must allow the
--   <tt>iam:PassRole</tt> action. <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> has the
--   value of the Amazon Web Services Secrets Manager secret that allows
--   access to the PostgreSQL endpoint.
--   
--   You can specify one of two sets of values for these permissions. You
--   can specify the values for this setting and
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecretId</tt>. Or you can specify clear-text values
--   for <tt>UserName</tt>, <tt>Password</tt>, <tt>ServerName</tt>, and
--   <tt>Port</tt>. You can't specify both. For more information on
--   creating this <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> and the
--   <tt>SecretsManagerAccessRoleArn</tt> and
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecretId</tt> required to access it, see <a>Using
--   secrets to access Database Migration Service resources</a> in the
--   <i>Database Migration Service User Guide</i>.
postgreSQLSettings_secretsManagerAccessRoleArn :: Lens' PostgreSQLSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | Endpoint connection user name.
postgreSQLSettings_username :: Lens' PostgreSQLSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | Sets the WAL heartbeat frequency (in minutes).
postgreSQLSettings_heartbeatFrequency :: Lens' PostgreSQLSettings (Maybe Int)

-- | Endpoint connection password.
postgreSQLSettings_password :: Lens' PostgreSQLSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | Database name for the endpoint.
postgreSQLSettings_databaseName :: Lens' PostgreSQLSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | For use with change data capture (CDC) only, this attribute has DMS
--   bypass foreign keys and user triggers to reduce the time it takes to
--   bulk load data.
--   
--   Example: <tt>afterConnectScript=SET
--   session_replication_role='replica'</tt>
postgreSQLSettings_afterConnectScript :: Lens' PostgreSQLSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | The full ARN, partial ARN, or friendly name of the
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> that contains the PostgreSQL endpoint
--   connection details.
postgreSQLSettings_secretsManagerSecretId :: Lens' PostgreSQLSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | To capture DDL events, DMS creates various artifacts in the PostgreSQL
--   database when the task starts. You can later remove these artifacts.
--   
--   If this value is set to <tt>N</tt>, you don't have to create tables or
--   triggers on the source database.
postgreSQLSettings_captureDdls :: Lens' PostgreSQLSettings (Maybe Bool)

-- | Specifies the plugin to use to create a replication slot.
postgreSQLSettings_pluginName :: Lens' PostgreSQLSettings (Maybe PluginNameValue)

-- | Endpoint TCP port.
postgreSQLSettings_port :: Lens' PostgreSQLSettings (Maybe Int)

-- | Sets the schema in which the heartbeat artifacts are created.
postgreSQLSettings_heartbeatSchema :: Lens' PostgreSQLSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | The write-ahead log (WAL) heartbeat feature mimics a dummy
--   transaction. By doing this, it prevents idle logical replication slots
--   from holding onto old WAL logs, which can result in storage full
--   situations on the source. This heartbeat keeps <tt>restart_lsn</tt>
--   moving and prevents storage full scenarios.
postgreSQLSettings_heartbeatEnable :: Lens' PostgreSQLSettings (Maybe Bool)

-- | The connection to a Redis target endpoint using Transport Layer
--   Security (TLS). Valid values include <tt>plaintext</tt> and
--   <tt>ssl-encryption</tt>. The default is <tt>ssl-encryption</tt>. The
--   <tt>ssl-encryption</tt> option makes an encrypted connection.
--   Optionally, you can identify an Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for an SSL
--   certificate authority (CA) using the <tt>SslCaCertificateArn
--   </tt>setting. If an ARN isn't given for a CA, DMS uses the Amazon root
--   CA.
--   
--   The <tt>plaintext</tt> option doesn't provide Transport Layer Security
--   (TLS) encryption for traffic between endpoint and database.
redisSettings_sslSecurityProtocol :: Lens' RedisSettings (Maybe SslSecurityProtocolValue)

-- | The user name provided with the <tt>auth-role</tt> option of the
--   <tt>AuthType</tt> setting for a Redis target endpoint.
redisSettings_authUserName :: Lens' RedisSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the certificate authority (CA) that
--   DMS uses to connect to your Redis target endpoint.
redisSettings_sslCaCertificateArn :: Lens' RedisSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | The password provided with the <tt>auth-role</tt> and
--   <tt>auth-token</tt> options of the <tt>AuthType</tt> setting for a
--   Redis target endpoint.
redisSettings_authPassword :: Lens' RedisSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | The type of authentication to perform when connecting to a Redis
--   target. Options include <tt>none</tt>, <tt>auth-token</tt>, and
--   <tt>auth-role</tt>. The <tt>auth-token</tt> option requires an
--   <tt>AuthPassword</tt> value to be provided. The <tt>auth-role</tt>
--   option requires <tt>AuthUserName</tt> and <tt>AuthPassword</tt> values
--   to be provided.
redisSettings_authType :: Lens' RedisSettings (Maybe RedisAuthTypeValue)

-- | Fully qualified domain name of the endpoint.
redisSettings_serverName :: Lens' RedisSettings Text

-- | Transmission Control Protocol (TCP) port for the endpoint.
redisSettings_port :: Lens' RedisSettings Int

-- | A value that specifies whether DMS should migrate empty CHAR and
--   VARCHAR fields as NULL. A value of <tt>true</tt> sets empty CHAR and
--   VARCHAR fields to null. The default is <tt>false</tt>.
redshiftSettings_emptyAsNull :: Lens' RedshiftSettings (Maybe Bool)

-- | If Amazon Redshift is configured to support case sensitive schema
--   names, set <tt>CaseSensitiveNames</tt> to <tt>true</tt>. The default
--   is <tt>false</tt>.
redshiftSettings_caseSensitiveNames :: Lens' RedshiftSettings (Maybe Bool)

-- | The maximum size (in KB) of any .csv file used to load data on an S3
--   bucket and transfer data to Amazon Redshift. It defaults to 1048576KB
--   (1 GB).
redshiftSettings_maxFileSize :: Lens' RedshiftSettings (Maybe Int)

-- | A value that specifies to replaces the invalid characters specified in
--   <tt>ReplaceInvalidChars</tt>, substituting the specified characters
--   instead. The default is <tt>"?"</tt>.
redshiftSettings_replaceChars :: Lens' RedshiftSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the Amazon Redshift cluster you are using.
redshiftSettings_serverName :: Lens' RedshiftSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | A value that sets the amount of time to wait (in milliseconds) before
--   timing out, beginning from when you initially establish a connection.
redshiftSettings_connectionTimeout :: Lens' RedshiftSettings (Maybe Int)

-- | The amount of time to wait (in milliseconds) before timing out of
--   operations performed by DMS on a Redshift cluster, such as Redshift
--   COPY, INSERT, DELETE, and UPDATE.
redshiftSettings_loadTimeout :: Lens' RedshiftSettings (Maybe Int)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role that has access to the
--   Amazon Redshift service. The role must allow the <tt>iam:PassRole</tt>
--   action.
redshiftSettings_serviceAccessRoleArn :: Lens' RedshiftSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | This setting is only valid for a full-load migration task. Set
--   <tt>ExplicitIds</tt> to <tt>true</tt> to have tables with
--   <tt>IDENTITY</tt> columns override their auto-generated values with
--   explicit values loaded from the source data files used to populate the
--   tables. The default is <tt>false</tt>.
redshiftSettings_explicitIds :: Lens' RedshiftSettings (Maybe Bool)

-- | An S3 folder where the comma-separated-value (.csv) files are stored
--   before being uploaded to the target Redshift cluster.
--   
--   For full load mode, DMS converts source records into .csv files and
--   loads them to the <i>BucketFolder/TableID</i> path. DMS uses the
--   Redshift <tt>COPY</tt> command to upload the .csv files to the target
--   table. The files are deleted once the <tt>COPY</tt> operation has
--   finished. For more information, see <a>COPY</a> in the <i>Amazon
--   Redshift Database Developer Guide</i>.
--   
--   For change-data-capture (CDC) mode, DMS creates a <i>NetChanges</i>
--   table, and loads the .csv files to this
--   <i>BucketFolder/NetChangesTableID</i> path.
redshiftSettings_bucketFolder :: Lens' RedshiftSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | A value that specifies to truncate data in columns to the appropriate
--   number of characters, so that the data fits in the column. This
--   parameter applies only to columns with a VARCHAR or CHAR data type,
--   and rows with a size of 4 MB or less. Choose <tt>true</tt> to truncate
--   data. The default is <tt>false</tt>.
redshiftSettings_truncateColumns :: Lens' RedshiftSettings (Maybe Bool)

-- | The full Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role that specifies DMS
--   as the trusted entity and grants the required permissions to access
--   the value in <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt>. The role must allow the
--   <tt>iam:PassRole</tt> action. <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> has the
--   value of the Amazon Web Services Secrets Manager secret that allows
--   access to the Amazon Redshift endpoint.
--   
--   You can specify one of two sets of values for these permissions. You
--   can specify the values for this setting and
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecretId</tt>. Or you can specify clear-text values
--   for <tt>UserName</tt>, <tt>Password</tt>, <tt>ServerName</tt>, and
--   <tt>Port</tt>. You can't specify both. For more information on
--   creating this <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> and the
--   <tt>SecretsManagerAccessRoleArn</tt> and
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecretId</tt> required to access it, see <a>Using
--   secrets to access Database Migration Service resources</a> in the
--   <i>Database Migration Service User Guide</i>.
redshiftSettings_secretsManagerAccessRoleArn :: Lens' RedshiftSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | A list of characters that you want to replace. Use with
--   <tt>ReplaceChars</tt>.
redshiftSettings_replaceInvalidChars :: Lens' RedshiftSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | An Amazon Redshift user name for a registered user.
redshiftSettings_username :: Lens' RedshiftSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the intermediate S3 bucket used to store .csv files before
--   uploading data to Redshift.
redshiftSettings_bucketName :: Lens' RedshiftSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | The type of server-side encryption that you want to use for your data.
--   This encryption type is part of the endpoint settings or the extra
--   connections attributes for Amazon S3. You can choose either
--   <tt>SSE_S3</tt> (the default) or <tt>SSE_KMS</tt>.
--   
--   For the <tt>ModifyEndpoint</tt> operation, you can change the existing
--   value of the <tt>EncryptionMode</tt> parameter from <tt>SSE_KMS</tt>
--   to <tt>SSE_S3</tt>. But you canâ€™t change the existing value from
--   <tt>SSE_S3</tt> to <tt>SSE_KMS</tt>.
--   
--   To use <tt>SSE_S3</tt>, create an Identity and Access Management (IAM)
--   role with a policy that allows <tt>"arn:aws:s3:::*"</tt> to use the
--   following actions: <tt>"s3:PutObject", "s3:ListBucket"</tt>
redshiftSettings_encryptionMode :: Lens' RedshiftSettings (Maybe EncryptionModeValue)

-- | The date format that you are using. Valid values are <tt>auto</tt>
--   (case-sensitive), your date format string enclosed in quotes, or NULL.
--   If this parameter is left unset (NULL), it defaults to a format of
--   'YYYY-MM-DD'. Using <tt>auto</tt> recognizes most strings, even some
--   that aren't supported when you use a date format string.
--   
--   If your date and time values use formats different from each other,
--   set this to <tt>auto</tt>.
redshiftSettings_dateFormat :: Lens' RedshiftSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | A value that specifies to remove surrounding quotation marks from
--   strings in the incoming data. All characters within the quotation
--   marks, including delimiters, are retained. Choose <tt>true</tt> to
--   remove quotation marks. The default is <tt>false</tt>.
redshiftSettings_removeQuotes :: Lens' RedshiftSettings (Maybe Bool)

-- | The password for the user named in the <tt>username</tt> property.
redshiftSettings_password :: Lens' RedshiftSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the Amazon Redshift data warehouse (service) that you are
--   working with.
redshiftSettings_databaseName :: Lens' RedshiftSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | A value that indicates to allow any date format, including invalid
--   formats such as 00/00/00 00:00:00, to be loaded without generating an
--   error. You can choose <tt>true</tt> or <tt>false</tt> (the default).
--   
--   This parameter applies only to TIMESTAMP and DATE columns. Always use
--   ACCEPTANYDATE with the DATEFORMAT parameter. If the date format for
--   the data doesn't match the DATEFORMAT specification, Amazon Redshift
--   inserts a NULL value into that field.
redshiftSettings_acceptAnyDate :: Lens' RedshiftSettings (Maybe Bool)

-- | Code to run after connecting. This parameter should contain the code
--   itself, not the name of a file containing the code.
redshiftSettings_afterConnectScript :: Lens' RedshiftSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | The full ARN, partial ARN, or friendly name of the
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> that contains the Amazon Redshift
--   endpoint connection details.
redshiftSettings_secretsManagerSecretId :: Lens' RedshiftSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | The size (in KB) of the in-memory file write buffer used when
--   generating .csv files on the local disk at the DMS replication
--   instance. The default value is 1000 (buffer size is 1000KB).
redshiftSettings_writeBufferSize :: Lens' RedshiftSettings (Maybe Int)

-- | If you set <tt>CompUpdate</tt> to <tt>true</tt> Amazon Redshift
--   applies automatic compression if the table is empty. This applies even
--   if the table columns already have encodings other than <tt>RAW</tt>.
--   If you set <tt>CompUpdate</tt> to <tt>false</tt>, automatic
--   compression is disabled and existing column encodings aren't changed.
--   The default is <tt>true</tt>.
redshiftSettings_compUpdate :: Lens' RedshiftSettings (Maybe Bool)

-- | A value that specifies to remove the trailing white space characters
--   from a VARCHAR string. This parameter applies only to columns with a
--   VARCHAR data type. Choose <tt>true</tt> to remove unneeded white
--   space. The default is <tt>false</tt>.
redshiftSettings_trimBlanks :: Lens' RedshiftSettings (Maybe Bool)

-- | The time format that you want to use. Valid values are <tt>auto</tt>
--   (case-sensitive), <tt>'timeformat_string'</tt>, <tt>'epochsecs'</tt>,
--   or <tt>'epochmillisecs'</tt>. It defaults to 10. Using <tt>auto</tt>
--   recognizes most strings, even some that aren't supported when you use
--   a time format string.
--   
--   If your date and time values use formats different from each other,
--   set this parameter to <tt>auto</tt>.
redshiftSettings_timeFormat :: Lens' RedshiftSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | The KMS key ID. If you are using <tt>SSE_KMS</tt> for the
--   <tt>EncryptionMode</tt>, provide this key ID. The key that you use
--   needs an attached policy that enables IAM user permissions and allows
--   use of the key.
redshiftSettings_serverSideEncryptionKmsKeyId :: Lens' RedshiftSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | The port number for Amazon Redshift. The default value is 5439.
redshiftSettings_port :: Lens' RedshiftSettings (Maybe Int)

-- | The number of threads used to upload a single file. This parameter
--   accepts a value from 1 through 64. It defaults to 10.
--   
--   The number of parallel streams used to upload a single .csv file to an
--   S3 bucket using S3 Multipart Upload. For more information, see
--   <a>Multipart upload overview</a>.
--   
--   <tt>FileTransferUploadStreams</tt> accepts a value from 1 through 64.
--   It defaults to 10.
redshiftSettings_fileTransferUploadStreams :: Lens' RedshiftSettings (Maybe Int)

-- | The status of the schema.
refreshSchemasStatus_status :: Lens' RefreshSchemasStatus (Maybe RefreshSchemasStatusTypeValue)

-- | The date the schema was last refreshed.
refreshSchemasStatus_lastRefreshDate :: Lens' RefreshSchemasStatus (Maybe UTCTime)

--   endpoint.

refreshSchemasStatus_lastFailureMessage :: Lens' RefreshSchemasStatus (Maybe Text)

-- | The engine version number of the replication instance.
--   
--   If an engine version number is not specified when a replication
--   instance is created, the default is the latest engine version
--   available.
--   
--   When modifying a major engine version of an instance, also set
--   <tt>AllowMajorVersionUpgrade</tt> to <tt>true</tt>.
replicationInstance_engineVersion :: Lens' ReplicationInstance (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the accessibility options for the replication instance. A
--   value of <tt>true</tt> represents an instance with a public IP
--   address. A value of <tt>false</tt> represents an instance with a
--   private IP address. The default value is <tt>true</tt>.
replicationInstance_publiclyAccessible :: Lens' ReplicationInstance (Maybe Bool)

-- | Boolean value indicating if minor version upgrades will be
--   automatically applied to the instance.
replicationInstance_autoMinorVersionUpgrade :: Lens' ReplicationInstance (Maybe Bool)

-- | One or more public IP addresses for the replication instance.
replicationInstance_replicationInstancePublicIpAddresses :: Lens' ReplicationInstance (Maybe [Text])

-- | The subnet group for the replication instance.
replicationInstance_replicationSubnetGroup :: Lens' ReplicationInstance (Maybe ReplicationSubnetGroup)

-- | The time the replication instance was created.
replicationInstance_instanceCreateTime :: Lens' ReplicationInstance (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The expiration date of the free replication instance that is part of
--   the Free DMS program.
replicationInstance_freeUntil :: Lens' ReplicationInstance (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The status of the replication instance. The possible return values
--   include:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>"available"</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>"creating"</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>"deleted"</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>"deleting"</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>"failed"</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>"modifying"</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>"upgrading"</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>"rebooting"</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>"resetting-master-credentials"</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>"storage-full"</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>"incompatible-credentials"</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>"incompatible-network"</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>"maintenance"</pre></li>
--   </ul>
replicationInstance_replicationInstanceStatus :: Lens' ReplicationInstance (Maybe Text)

-- | One or more private IP addresses for the replication instance.
replicationInstance_replicationInstancePrivateIpAddresses :: Lens' ReplicationInstance (Maybe [Text])

-- | The maintenance window times for the replication instance. Any pending
--   upgrades to the replication instance are performed during this time.
replicationInstance_preferredMaintenanceWindow :: Lens' ReplicationInstance (Maybe Text)

-- | The private IP address of the replication instance.
replicationInstance_replicationInstancePrivateIpAddress :: Lens' ReplicationInstance (Maybe Text)

-- | An KMS key identifier that is used to encrypt the data on the
--   replication instance.
--   
--   If you don't specify a value for the <tt>KmsKeyId</tt> parameter, then
--   DMS uses your default encryption key.
--   
--   KMS creates the default encryption key for your Amazon Web Services
--   account. Your Amazon Web Services account has a different default
--   encryption key for each Amazon Web Services Region.
replicationInstance_kmsKeyId :: Lens' ReplicationInstance (Maybe Text)

-- | The Availability Zone for the instance.
replicationInstance_availabilityZone :: Lens' ReplicationInstance (Maybe Text)

-- | The VPC security group for the instance.
replicationInstance_vpcSecurityGroups :: Lens' ReplicationInstance (Maybe [VpcSecurityGroupMembership])

-- | Specifies whether the replication instance is a Multi-AZ deployment.
--   You can't set the <tt>AvailabilityZone</tt> parameter if the Multi-AZ
--   parameter is set to <tt>true</tt>.
replicationInstance_multiAZ :: Lens' ReplicationInstance (Maybe Bool)

-- | The Availability Zone of the standby replication instance in a
--   Multi-AZ deployment.
replicationInstance_secondaryAvailabilityZone :: Lens' ReplicationInstance (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the replication instance.
replicationInstance_replicationInstanceArn :: Lens' ReplicationInstance (Maybe Text)

-- | The amount of storage (in gigabytes) that is allocated for the
--   replication instance.
replicationInstance_allocatedStorage :: Lens' ReplicationInstance (Maybe Int)

-- | The DNS name servers supported for the replication instance to access
--   your on-premise source or target database.
replicationInstance_dnsNameServers :: Lens' ReplicationInstance (Maybe Text)

-- | The public IP address of the replication instance.
replicationInstance_replicationInstancePublicIpAddress :: Lens' ReplicationInstance (Maybe Text)

-- | The compute and memory capacity of the replication instance as defined
--   for the specified replication instance class. It is a required
--   parameter, although a default value is pre-selected in the DMS
--   console.
--   
--   For more information on the settings and capacities for the available
--   replication instance classes, see <a>Selecting the right DMS
--   replication instance for your migration</a>.
replicationInstance_replicationInstanceClass :: Lens' ReplicationInstance (Maybe Text)

-- | The replication instance identifier is a required parameter. This
--   parameter is stored as a lowercase string.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Must contain 1-63 alphanumeric characters or hyphens.</li>
--   <li>First character must be a letter.</li>
--   <li>Cannot end with a hyphen or contain two consecutive hyphens.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   Example: <tt>myrepinstance</tt>
replicationInstance_replicationInstanceIdentifier :: Lens' ReplicationInstance (Maybe Text)

replicationInstance_pendingModifiedValues :: Lens' ReplicationInstance (Maybe ReplicationPendingModifiedValues)

replicationInstanceTaskLog_replicationInstanceTaskLogSize :: Lens' ReplicationInstanceTaskLog (Maybe Integer)

replicationPendingModifiedValues_engineVersion :: Lens' ReplicationPendingModifiedValues (Maybe Text)

--   parameter is set to <tt>true</tt>.
replicationPendingModifiedValues_multiAZ :: Lens' ReplicationPendingModifiedValues (Maybe Bool)

--   replication instance.

--   replication instance classes, see <a>Selecting the right DMS
--   replication instance for your migration</a>.
replicationPendingModifiedValues_replicationInstanceClass :: Lens' ReplicationPendingModifiedValues (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the VPC.
replicationSubnetGroup_vpcId :: Lens' ReplicationSubnetGroup (Maybe Text)

-- | The subnets that are in the subnet group.
replicationSubnetGroup_subnets :: Lens' ReplicationSubnetGroup (Maybe [Subnet])
