replicationSubnetGroup_replicationSubnetGroupIdentifier :: Lens' ReplicationSubnetGroup (Maybe Text)

-- | The status of the subnet group.
replicationSubnetGroup_subnetGroupStatus :: Lens' ReplicationSubnetGroup (Maybe Text)

-- | A description for the replication subnet group.
replicationSubnetGroup_replicationSubnetGroupDescription :: Lens' ReplicationSubnetGroup (Maybe Text)

-- | The settings for the replication task.
replicationTask_replicationTaskSettings :: Lens' ReplicationTask (Maybe Text)

-- | The status of the replication task. This response parameter can return
--   one of the following values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>"moving"</tt> â€“ The task is being moved in response to running
--   the <a>MoveReplicationTask</a> operation.</li>
--   <li><tt>"creating"</tt> â€“ The task is being created in response to
--   running the <a>CreateReplicationTask</a> operation.</li>
--   <li><tt>"deleting"</tt> â€“ The task is being deleted in response to
--   running the <a>DeleteReplicationTask</a> operation.</li>
--   <li><tt>"failed"</tt> â€“ The task failed to successfully complete the
--   database migration in response to running the
--   <a>StartReplicationTask</a> operation.</li>
--   <li><tt>"failed-move"</tt> â€“ The task failed to move in response to
--   running the <a>MoveReplicationTask</a> operation.</li>
--   <li><tt>"modifying"</tt> â€“ The task definition is being modified in
--   response to running the <a>ModifyReplicationTask</a> operation.</li>
--   <li><tt>"ready"</tt> â€“ The task is in a <tt>ready</tt> state where it
--   can respond to other task operations, such as
--   <a>StartReplicationTask</a> or <a>DeleteReplicationTask</a> .</li>
--   <li><tt>"running"</tt> â€“ The task is performing a database migration
--   in response to running the <a>StartReplicationTask</a> operation.</li>
--   <li><tt>"starting"</tt> â€“ The task is preparing to perform a database
--   migration in response to running the <a>StartReplicationTask</a>
--   operation.</li>
--   <li><tt>"stopped"</tt> â€“ The task has stopped in response to running
--   the <a>StopReplicationTask</a> operation.</li>
--   <li><tt>"stopping"</tt> â€“ The task is preparing to stop in response to
--   running the <a>StopReplicationTask</a> operation.</li>
--   <li><tt>"testing"</tt> â€“ The database migration specified for this
--   task is being tested in response to running either the
--   <a>StartReplicationTaskAssessmentRun</a> or the
--   <a>StartReplicationTaskAssessment</a>
--   operation.<a>StartReplicationTaskAssessmentRun</a> is an improved
--   premigration task assessment operation. The
--   <a>StartReplicationTaskAssessment</a> operation assesses data type
--   compatibility only between the source and target database of a given
--   migration task. In contrast, <a>StartReplicationTaskAssessmentRun</a>
--   enables you to specify a variety of premigration task assessments in
--   addition to data type compatibility. These assessments include ones
--   for the validity of primary key definitions and likely issues with
--   database migration performance, among others.</li>
--   </ul>
replicationTask_status :: Lens' ReplicationTask (Maybe Text)

-- | The reason the replication task was stopped. This response parameter
--   can return one of the following values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>"STOP_REASON_FULL_LOAD_COMPLETED"</tt> â€“ Full-load migration
--   completed.</li>
--   <li><tt>"STOP_REASON_CACHED_CHANGES_APPLIED"</tt> â€“ Change data
--   capture (CDC) load completed.</li>
--   <li><tt>"STOP_REASON_CACHED_CHANGES_NOT_APPLIED"</tt> â€“ In a full-load
--   and CDC migration, the full load stopped as specified before starting
--   the CDC migration.</li>
--   <li><tt>"STOP_REASON_SERVER_TIME"</tt> â€“ The migration stopped at the
--   specified server time.</li>
--   </ul>
replicationTask_stopReason :: Lens' ReplicationTask (Maybe Text)

-- | The ARN that uniquely identifies the endpoint.
replicationTask_targetEndpointArn :: Lens' ReplicationTask (Maybe Text)

-- | The user-assigned replication task identifier or name.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Must contain 1-255 alphanumeric characters or hyphens.</li>
--   <li>First character must be a letter.</li>
--   <li>Cannot end with a hyphen or contain two consecutive hyphens.</li>
--   </ul>
replicationTask_replicationTaskIdentifier :: Lens' ReplicationTask (Maybe Text)

-- | Indicates when you want a change data capture (CDC) operation to
--   start. Use either <tt>CdcStartPosition</tt> or <tt>CdcStartTime</tt>
--   to specify when you want the CDC operation to start. Specifying both
--   values results in an error.
--   
--   The value can be in date, checkpoint, or LSN/SCN format.
--   
--   Date Example: --cdc-start-position â€œ2018-03-08T12:12:12â€
--   
--   Checkpoint Example: --cdc-start-position
--   "checkpoint:V1mysql-bin-changelog.157832:1975:-1:2002:677883278264080:mysql-bin-changelog.157832:187600#93"
--   
--   LSN Example: --cdc-start-position â€œmysql-bin-changelog.000024:373â€
replicationTask_cdcStartPosition :: Lens' ReplicationTask (Maybe Text)

-- | The date the replication task is scheduled to start.
replicationTask_replicationTaskStartDate :: Lens' ReplicationTask (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies the endpoint.
replicationTask_sourceEndpointArn :: Lens' ReplicationTask (Maybe Text)

-- | Indicates the last checkpoint that occurred during a change data
--   capture (CDC) operation. You can provide this value to the
--   <tt>CdcStartPosition</tt> parameter to start a CDC operation that
--   begins at that checkpoint.
replicationTask_recoveryCheckpoint :: Lens' ReplicationTask (Maybe Text)

-- | Table mappings specified in the task.
replicationTask_tableMappings :: Lens' ReplicationTask (Maybe Text)

-- | The ARN of the replication instance to which this task is moved in
--   response to running the <a>MoveReplicationTask</a> operation.
--   Otherwise, this response parameter isn't a member of the
--   <tt>ReplicationTask</tt> object.
replicationTask_targetReplicationInstanceArn :: Lens' ReplicationTask (Maybe Text)

-- | The date the replication task was created.
replicationTask_replicationTaskCreationDate :: Lens' ReplicationTask (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The type of migration.
replicationTask_migrationType :: Lens' ReplicationTask (Maybe MigrationTypeValue)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the replication task.
replicationTask_replicationTaskArn :: Lens' ReplicationTask (Maybe Text)

-- | Supplemental information that the task requires to migrate the data
--   for certain source and target endpoints. For more information, see
--   <a>Specifying Supplemental Data for Task Settings</a> in the
--   <i>Database Migration Service User Guide.</i>
replicationTask_taskData :: Lens' ReplicationTask (Maybe Text)

-- | Indicates when you want a change data capture (CDC) operation to stop.
--   The value can be either server time or commit time.
--   
--   Server time example: --cdc-stop-position
--   â€œserver_time:2018-02-09T12:12:12â€
--   
--   Commit time example: --cdc-stop-position â€œcommit_time:
--   2018-02-09T12:12:12 â€œ
replicationTask_cdcStopPosition :: Lens' ReplicationTask (Maybe Text)

-- | The statistics for the task, including elapsed time, tables loaded,
--   and table errors.
replicationTask_replicationTaskStats :: Lens' ReplicationTask (Maybe ReplicationTaskStats)

-- | The ARN of the replication instance.
replicationTask_replicationInstanceArn :: Lens' ReplicationTask (Maybe Text)

-- | The last error (failure) message generated for the replication task.
replicationTask_lastFailureMessage :: Lens' ReplicationTask (Maybe Text)

-- | The task assessment results in JSON format.
--   
--   The response object only contains this field if you provide
--   DescribeReplicationTaskAssessmentResultsMessage$ReplicationTaskArn in
--   the request.
replicationTaskAssessmentResult_assessmentResults :: Lens' ReplicationTaskAssessmentResult (Maybe Text)

-- | The file containing the results of the task assessment.
replicationTaskAssessmentResult_assessmentResultsFile :: Lens' ReplicationTaskAssessmentResult (Maybe Text)

-- | The replication task identifier of the task on which the task
--   assessment was run.
replicationTaskAssessmentResult_replicationTaskIdentifier :: Lens' ReplicationTaskAssessmentResult (Maybe Text)

-- | The status of the task assessment.
replicationTaskAssessmentResult_assessmentStatus :: Lens' ReplicationTaskAssessmentResult (Maybe Text)

-- | The URL of the S3 object containing the task assessment results.
--   
--   The response object only contains this field if you provide
--   DescribeReplicationTaskAssessmentResultsMessage$ReplicationTaskArn in
--   the request.
replicationTaskAssessmentResult_s3ObjectUrl :: Lens' ReplicationTaskAssessmentResult (Maybe Text)

-- | The date the task assessment was completed.
replicationTaskAssessmentResult_replicationTaskLastAssessmentDate :: Lens' ReplicationTaskAssessmentResult (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the replication task.
replicationTaskAssessmentResult_replicationTaskArn :: Lens' ReplicationTaskAssessmentResult (Maybe Text)

-- | Assessment run status.
--   
--   This status can have one of the following values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>"cancelling"</tt> â€“ The assessment run was canceled by the
--   <tt>CancelReplicationTaskAssessmentRun</tt> operation.</li>
--   <li><tt>"deleting"</tt> â€“ The assessment run was deleted by the
--   <tt>DeleteReplicationTaskAssessmentRun</tt> operation.</li>
--   <li><tt>"failed"</tt> â€“ At least one individual assessment completed
--   with a <tt>failed</tt> status.</li>
--   <li><tt>"error-provisioning"</tt> â€“ An internal error occurred while
--   resources were provisioned (during <tt>provisioning</tt> status).</li>
--   <li><tt>"error-executing"</tt> â€“ An internal error occurred while
--   individual assessments ran (during <tt>running</tt> status).</li>
--   <li><tt>"invalid state"</tt> â€“ The assessment run is in an unknown
--   state.</li>
--   <li><tt>"passed"</tt> â€“ All individual assessments have completed, and
--   none has a <tt>failed</tt> status.</li>
--   <li><tt>"provisioning"</tt> â€“ Resources required to run individual
--   assessments are being provisioned.</li>
--   <li><tt>"running"</tt> â€“ Individual assessments are being run.</li>
--   <li><tt>"starting"</tt> â€“ The assessment run is starting, but
--   resources are not yet being provisioned for individual
--   assessments.</li>
--   </ul>
replicationTaskAssessmentRun_status :: Lens' ReplicationTaskAssessmentRun (Maybe Text)

-- | ARN of the service role used to start the assessment run using the
--   <tt>StartReplicationTaskAssessmentRun</tt> operation. The role must
--   allow the <tt>iam:PassRole</tt> action.
replicationTaskAssessmentRun_serviceAccessRoleArn :: Lens' ReplicationTaskAssessmentRun (Maybe Text)

-- | Date on which the assessment run was created using the
--   <tt>StartReplicationTaskAssessmentRun</tt> operation.
replicationTaskAssessmentRun_replicationTaskAssessmentRunCreationDate :: Lens' ReplicationTaskAssessmentRun (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | Indication of the completion progress for the individual assessments
--   specified to run.
replicationTaskAssessmentRun_assessmentProgress :: Lens' ReplicationTaskAssessmentRun (Maybe ReplicationTaskAssessmentRunProgress)

-- | ARN of the KMS encryption key used to encrypt the assessment run
--   results.
replicationTaskAssessmentRun_resultKmsKeyArn :: Lens' ReplicationTaskAssessmentRun (Maybe Text)

-- | ARN of the migration task associated with this premigration assessment
--   run.
replicationTaskAssessmentRun_replicationTaskArn :: Lens' ReplicationTaskAssessmentRun (Maybe Text)

-- | Amazon S3 bucket where DMS stores the results of this assessment run.
replicationTaskAssessmentRun_resultLocationBucket :: Lens' ReplicationTaskAssessmentRun (Maybe Text)

-- | Folder in an Amazon S3 bucket where DMS stores the results of this
--   assessment run.
replicationTaskAssessmentRun_resultLocationFolder :: Lens' ReplicationTaskAssessmentRun (Maybe Text)

-- | Encryption mode used to encrypt the assessment run results.
replicationTaskAssessmentRun_resultEncryptionMode :: Lens' ReplicationTaskAssessmentRun (Maybe Text)

-- | Unique name of the assessment run.
replicationTaskAssessmentRun_assessmentRunName :: Lens' ReplicationTaskAssessmentRun (Maybe Text)

-- | Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of this assessment run.
replicationTaskAssessmentRun_replicationTaskAssessmentRunArn :: Lens' ReplicationTaskAssessmentRun (Maybe Text)

-- | Last message generated by an individual assessment failure.
replicationTaskAssessmentRun_lastFailureMessage :: Lens' ReplicationTaskAssessmentRun (Maybe Text)

-- | The number of individual assessments that are specified to run.
replicationTaskAssessmentRunProgress_individualAssessmentCount :: Lens' ReplicationTaskAssessmentRunProgress (Maybe Int)

-- | The number of individual assessments that have completed, successfully
--   or not.
replicationTaskAssessmentRunProgress_individualAssessmentCompletedCount :: Lens' ReplicationTaskAssessmentRunProgress (Maybe Int)

-- | Individual assessment status.
--   
--   This status can have one of the following values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>"cancelled"</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>"error"</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>"failed"</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>"passed"</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>"pending"</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>"running"</pre></li>
--   </ul>
replicationTaskIndividualAssessment_status :: Lens' ReplicationTaskIndividualAssessment (Maybe Text)

-- | Date when this individual assessment was started as part of running
--   the <tt>StartReplicationTaskAssessmentRun</tt> operation.
replicationTaskIndividualAssessment_replicationTaskIndividualAssessmentStartDate :: Lens' ReplicationTaskIndividualAssessment (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | Name of this individual assessment.
replicationTaskIndividualAssessment_individualAssessmentName :: Lens' ReplicationTaskIndividualAssessment (Maybe Text)

-- | ARN of the premigration assessment run that is created to run this
--   individual assessment.
replicationTaskIndividualAssessment_replicationTaskAssessmentRunArn :: Lens' ReplicationTaskIndividualAssessment (Maybe Text)

-- | The date the replication task was stopped.
replicationTaskStats_stopDate :: Lens' ReplicationTaskStats (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The percent complete for the full load migration task.
replicationTaskStats_fullLoadProgressPercent :: Lens' ReplicationTaskStats (Maybe Int)

-- | The date the replication task full load was started.

-- | The elapsed time of the task, in milliseconds.
replicationTaskStats_elapsedTimeMillis :: Lens' ReplicationTaskStats (Maybe Integer)

--   a resume. For more information, see <a>StartReplicationTaskType</a>.
replicationTaskStats_startDate :: Lens' ReplicationTaskStats (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The number of errors that have occurred during this task.
replicationTaskStats_tablesErrored :: Lens' ReplicationTaskStats (Maybe Int)

--   a target reload.
replicationTaskStats_freshStartDate :: Lens' ReplicationTaskStats (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | Detailed information about the pending maintenance action.
resourcePendingMaintenanceActions_pendingMaintenanceActionDetails :: Lens' ResourcePendingMaintenanceActions (Maybe [PendingMaintenanceAction])

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the DMS resource that the pending
--   maintenance action applies to. For information about creating an ARN,
--   see <a>Constructing an Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for DMS</a> in the
--   DMS documentation.
resourcePendingMaintenanceActions_resourceIdentifier :: Lens' ResourcePendingMaintenanceActions (Maybe Text)

-- | The version of the Apache Parquet format that you want to use:
--   <tt>parquet_1_0</tt> (the default) or <tt>parquet_2_0</tt>.
s3Settings_parquetVersion :: Lens' S3Settings (Maybe ParquetVersionValue)

-- | If set to <tt>true</tt>, DMS saves the transaction order for a change
--   data capture (CDC) load on the Amazon S3 target specified by
--   <a>CdcPath</a> . For more information, see <a>Capturing data changes
--   (CDC) including transaction order on the S3 target</a>.
--   
--   This setting is supported in DMS versions 3.4.2 and later.
s3Settings_preserveTransactions :: Lens' S3Settings (Maybe Bool)

-- | A value that specifies the maximum size (in KB) of any .csv file to be
--   created while migrating to an S3 target during full load.
--   
--   The default value is 1,048,576 KB (1 GB). Valid values include 1 to
--   1,048,576.
s3Settings_maxFileSize :: Lens' S3Settings (Maybe Int)

-- | This setting only applies if your Amazon S3 output files during a
--   change data capture (CDC) load are written in .csv format. If
--   <a>UseCsvNoSupValue</a> is set to true, specify a string value that
--   you want DMS to use for all columns not included in the supplemental
--   log. If you do not specify a string value, DMS uses the null value for
--   these columns regardless of the <tt>UseCsvNoSupValue</tt> setting.
--   
--   This setting is supported in DMS versions 3.4.1 and later.
s3Settings_csvNoSupValue :: Lens' S3Settings (Maybe Text)

-- | For an S3 source, when this value is set to <tt>true</tt> or
--   <tt>y</tt>, each leading double quotation mark has to be followed by
--   an ending double quotation mark. This formatting complies with RFC
--   4180. When this value is set to <tt>false</tt> or <tt>n</tt>, string
--   literals are copied to the target as is. In this case, a delimiter
--   (row or column) signals the end of the field. Thus, you can't use a
--   delimiter as part of the string, because it signals the end of the
--   value.
--   
--   For an S3 target, an optional parameter used to set behavior to comply
--   with RFC 4180 for data migrated to Amazon S3 using .csv file format
--   only. When this value is set to <tt>true</tt> or <tt>y</tt> using
--   Amazon S3 as a target, if the data has quotation marks or newline
--   characters in it, DMS encloses the entire column with an additional
--   pair of double quotation marks ("). Every quotation mark within the
--   data is repeated twice.
--   
--   The default value is <tt>true</tt>. Valid values include
--   <tt>true</tt>, <tt>false</tt>, <tt>y</tt>, and <tt>n</tt>.
s3Settings_rfc4180 :: Lens' S3Settings (Maybe Bool)

-- | A value that specifies the precision of any <tt>TIMESTAMP</tt> column
--   values that are written to an Amazon S3 object file in .parquet
--   format.
--   
--   DMS supports the <tt>ParquetTimestampInMillisecond</tt> parameter in
--   versions 3.1.4 and later.
--   
--   When <tt>ParquetTimestampInMillisecond</tt> is set to <tt>true</tt> or
--   <tt>y</tt>, DMS writes all <tt>TIMESTAMP</tt> columns in a .parquet
--   formatted file with millisecond precision. Otherwise, DMS writes them
--   with microsecond precision.
--   
--   Currently, Amazon Athena and Glue can handle only millisecond
--   precision for <tt>TIMESTAMP</tt> values. Set this parameter to
--   <tt>true</tt> for S3 endpoint object files that are .parquet formatted
--   only if you plan to query or process the data with Athena or Glue.
--   
--   DMS writes any <tt>TIMESTAMP</tt> column values written to an S3 file
--   in .csv format with microsecond precision.
--   
--   Setting <tt>ParquetTimestampInMillisecond</tt> has no effect on the
--   string format of the timestamp column value that is inserted by
--   setting the <tt>TimestampColumnName</tt> parameter.
s3Settings_parquetTimestampInMillisecond :: Lens' S3Settings (Maybe Bool)

-- | A value that enables a full load to write INSERT operations to the
--   comma-separated value (.csv) output files only to indicate how the
--   rows were added to the source database.
--   
--   DMS supports the <tt>IncludeOpForFullLoad</tt> parameter in versions
--   3.1.4 and later.
--   
--   For full load, records can only be inserted. By default (the
--   <tt>false</tt> setting), no information is recorded in these output
--   files for a full load to indicate that the rows were inserted at the
--   source database. If <tt>IncludeOpForFullLoad</tt> is set to
--   <tt>true</tt> or <tt>y</tt>, the INSERT is recorded as an I annotation
--   in the first field of the .csv file. This allows the format of your
--   target records from a full load to be consistent with the target
--   records from a CDC load.
--   
--   This setting works together with the <tt>CdcInsertsOnly</tt> and the
--   <tt>CdcInsertsAndUpdates</tt> parameters for output to .csv files
--   only. For more information about how these settings work together, see
--   <a>Indicating Source DB Operations in Migrated S3 Data</a> in the
--   <i>Database Migration Service User Guide.</i>.
s3Settings_includeOpForFullLoad :: Lens' S3Settings (Maybe Bool)

-- | Minimum file size, defined in megabytes, to reach for a file output to
--   Amazon S3.
--   
--   When <tt>CdcMinFileSize</tt> and <tt>CdcMaxBatchInterval</tt> are both
--   specified, the file write is triggered by whichever parameter
--   condition is met first within an DMS CloudFormation template.
--   
--   The default value is 32 MB.
s3Settings_cdcMinFileSize :: Lens' S3Settings (Maybe Int)

-- | The delimiter used to separate columns in the .csv file for both
--   source and target. The default is a comma.
s3Settings_csvDelimiter :: Lens' S3Settings (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) used by the service to access the IAM
--   role. The role must allow the <tt>iam:PassRole</tt> action. It is a
--   required parameter that enables DMS to write and read objects from an
--   S3 bucket.
s3Settings_serviceAccessRoleArn :: Lens' S3Settings (Maybe Text)

-- | An optional parameter to set a folder name in the S3 bucket. If
--   provided, tables are created in the path <tt>
--   bucketFolder/schema_name/table_name/</tt>. If this parameter isn't
--   specified, then the path used is <tt> schema_name/table_name/</tt>.
s3Settings_bucketFolder :: Lens' S3Settings (Maybe Text)

-- | The format of the data that you want to use for output. You can choose
--   one of the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>csv</tt> : This is a row-based file format with
--   comma-separated values (.csv).</li>
--   <li><tt>parquet</tt> : Apache Parquet (.parquet) is a columnar storage
--   file format that features efficient compression and provides faster
--   query response.</li>
--   </ul>
s3Settings_dataFormat :: Lens' S3Settings (Maybe DataFormatValue)

-- | When set to <tt>true</tt>, this parameter partitions S3 bucket folders
--   based on transaction commit dates. The default value is
--   <tt>false</tt>. For more information about date-based folder
--   partitioning, see <a>Using date-based folder partitioning</a>.
s3Settings_datePartitionEnabled :: Lens' S3Settings (Maybe Bool)

-- | The type of encoding you are using:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>RLE_DICTIONARY</tt> uses a combination of bit-packing and
--   run-length encoding to store repeated values more efficiently. This is
--   the default.</li>
--   <li><tt>PLAIN</tt> doesn't use encoding at all. Values are stored as
--   they are.</li>
--   <li><tt>PLAIN_DICTIONARY</tt> builds a dictionary of the values
--   encountered in a given column. The dictionary is stored in a
--   dictionary page for each column chunk.</li>
--   </ul>
s3Settings_encodingType :: Lens' S3Settings (Maybe EncodingTypeValue)

-- | Maximum length of the interval, defined in seconds, after which to
--   output a file to Amazon S3.
--   
--   When <tt>CdcMaxBatchInterval</tt> and <tt>CdcMinFileSize</tt> are both
--   specified, the file write is triggered by whichever parameter
--   condition is met first within an DMS CloudFormation template.
--   
--   The default value is 60 seconds.
s3Settings_cdcMaxBatchInterval :: Lens' S3Settings (Maybe Int)

-- | When this value is set to 1, DMS ignores the first row header in a
--   .csv file. A value of 1 turns on the feature; a value of 0 turns off
--   the feature.
--   
--   The default is 0.
s3Settings_ignoreHeaderRows :: Lens' S3Settings (Maybe Int)

-- | Specifies how tables are defined in the S3 source files only.
s3Settings_externalTableDefinition :: Lens' S3Settings (Maybe Text)

-- | The maximum size of an encoded dictionary page of a column. If the
--   dictionary page exceeds this, this column is stored using an encoding
--   type of <tt>PLAIN</tt>. This parameter defaults to 1024 * 1024 bytes
--   (1 MiB), the maximum size of a dictionary page before it reverts to
--   <tt>PLAIN</tt> encoding. This size is used for .parquet file format
--   only.
s3Settings_dictPageSizeLimit :: Lens' S3Settings (Maybe Int)

-- | The name of the S3 bucket.
s3Settings_bucketName :: Lens' S3Settings (Maybe Text)

-- | The type of server-side encryption that you want to use for your data.
--   This encryption type is part of the endpoint settings or the extra
--   connections attributes for Amazon S3. You can choose either
--   <tt>SSE_S3</tt> (the default) or <tt>SSE_KMS</tt>.
--   
--   For the <tt>ModifyEndpoint</tt> operation, you can change the existing
--   value of the <tt>EncryptionMode</tt> parameter from <tt>SSE_KMS</tt>
--   to <tt>SSE_S3</tt>. But you canâ€™t change the existing value from
--   <tt>SSE_S3</tt> to <tt>SSE_KMS</tt>.
--   
--   To use <tt>SSE_S3</tt>, you need an Identity and Access Management
--   (IAM) role with permission to allow <tt>"arn:aws:s3:::dms-*"</tt> to
--   use the following actions:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>s3:CreateBucket</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>s3:ListBucket</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>s3:DeleteBucket</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>s3:GetBucketLocation</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>s3:GetObject</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>s3:PutObject</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>s3:DeleteObject</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>s3:GetObjectVersion</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>s3:GetBucketPolicy</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>s3:PutBucketPolicy</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>s3:DeleteBucketPolicy</pre></li>
--   </ul>
s3Settings_encryptionMode :: Lens' S3Settings (Maybe EncryptionModeValue)

-- | A value that enables statistics for Parquet pages and row groups.
--   Choose <tt>true</tt> to enable statistics, <tt>false</tt> to disable.
--   Statistics include <tt>NULL</tt>, <tt>DISTINCT</tt>, <tt>MAX</tt>, and
--   <tt>MIN</tt> values. This parameter defaults to <tt>true</tt>. This
--   value is used for .parquet file format only.
s3Settings_enableStatistics :: Lens' S3Settings (Maybe Bool)

-- | A value that enables a change data capture (CDC) load to write only
--   INSERT operations to .csv or columnar storage (.parquet) output files.
--   By default (the <tt>false</tt> setting), the first field in a .csv or
--   .parquet record contains the letter I (INSERT), U (UPDATE), or D
--   (DELETE). These values indicate whether the row was inserted, updated,
--   or deleted at the source database for a CDC load to the target.
--   
--   If <tt>CdcInsertsOnly</tt> is set to <tt>true</tt> or <tt>y</tt>, only
--   INSERTs from the source database are migrated to the .csv or .parquet
--   file. For .csv format only, how these INSERTs are recorded depends on
--   the value of <tt>IncludeOpForFullLoad</tt>. If
--   <tt>IncludeOpForFullLoad</tt> is set to <tt>true</tt>, the first field
--   of every CDC record is set to I to indicate the INSERT operation at
--   the source. If <tt>IncludeOpForFullLoad</tt> is set to <tt>false</tt>,
--   every CDC record is written without a first field to indicate the
--   INSERT operation at the source. For more information about how these
--   settings work together, see <a>Indicating Source DB Operations in
--   Migrated S3 Data</a> in the <i>Database Migration Service User
--   Guide.</i>.
--   
--   DMS supports the interaction described preceding between the
--   <tt>CdcInsertsOnly</tt> and <tt>IncludeOpForFullLoad</tt> parameters
--   in versions 3.1.4 and later.
--   
--   <tt>CdcInsertsOnly</tt> and <tt>CdcInsertsAndUpdates</tt> can't both
--   be set to <tt>true</tt> for the same endpoint. Set either
--   <tt>CdcInsertsOnly</tt> or <tt>CdcInsertsAndUpdates</tt> to
--   <tt>true</tt> for the same endpoint, but not both.
s3Settings_cdcInsertsOnly :: Lens' S3Settings (Maybe Bool)

-- | A value that when nonblank causes DMS to add a column with timestamp
--   information to the endpoint data for an Amazon S3 target.
--   
--   DMS supports the <tt>TimestampColumnName</tt> parameter in versions
--   3.1.4 and later.
--   
--   DMS includes an additional <tt>STRING</tt> column in the .csv or
--   .parquet object files of your migrated data when you set
--   <tt>TimestampColumnName</tt> to a nonblank value.
--   
--   For a full load, each row of this timestamp column contains a
--   timestamp for when the data was transferred from the source to the
--   target by DMS.
--   
--   For a change data capture (CDC) load, each row of the timestamp column
--   contains the timestamp for the commit of that row in the source
--   database.
--   
--   The string format for this timestamp column value is <tt>yyyy-MM-dd
--   HH:mm:ss.SSSSSS</tt>. By default, the precision of this value is in
--   microseconds. For a CDC load, the rounding of the precision depends on
--   the commit timestamp supported by DMS for the source database.
--   
--   When the <tt>AddColumnName</tt> parameter is set to <tt>true</tt>, DMS
--   also includes a name for the timestamp column that you set with
--   <tt>TimestampColumnName</tt>.
s3Settings_timestampColumnName :: Lens' S3Settings (Maybe Text)

-- | The delimiter used to separate rows in the .csv file for both source
--   and target. The default is a carriage return (<tt>\n</tt>).
s3Settings_csvRowDelimiter :: Lens' S3Settings (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies a date separating delimiter to use during folder
--   partitioning. The default value is <tt>SLASH</tt>. Use this parameter
--   when <tt>DatePartitionedEnabled</tt> is set to <tt>true</tt>.
s3Settings_datePartitionDelimiter :: Lens' S3Settings (Maybe DatePartitionDelimiterValue)

-- | An optional parameter that, when set to <tt>true</tt> or <tt>y</tt>,
--   you can use to add column name information to the .csv output file.
--   
--   The default value is <tt>false</tt>. Valid values are <tt>true</tt>,
--   <tt>false</tt>, <tt>y</tt>, and <tt>n</tt>.
s3Settings_addColumnName :: Lens' S3Settings (Maybe Bool)

-- | A value that enables DMS to specify a predefined (canned) access
--   control list for objects created in an Amazon S3 bucket as .csv or
--   .parquet files. For more information about Amazon S3 canned ACLs, see
--   <a>Canned ACL</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 Developer Guide.</i>
--   
--   The default value is NONE. Valid values include NONE, PRIVATE,
--   PUBLIC_READ, PUBLIC_READ_WRITE, AUTHENTICATED_READ, AWS_EXEC_READ,
--   BUCKET_OWNER_READ, and BUCKET_OWNER_FULL_CONTROL.
s3Settings_cannedAclForObjects :: Lens' S3Settings (Maybe CannedAclForObjectsValue)

-- | An optional parameter to use GZIP to compress the target files. Set to
--   GZIP to compress the target files. Either set this parameter to NONE
--   (the default) or don't use it to leave the files uncompressed. This
--   parameter applies to both .csv and .parquet file formats.
s3Settings_compressionType :: Lens' S3Settings (Maybe CompressionTypeValue)

-- | An optional parameter that specifies how DMS treats null values. While
--   handling the null value, you can use this parameter to pass a
--   user-defined string as null when writing to the target. For example,
--   when target columns are not nullable, you can use this option to
--   differentiate between the empty string value and the null value. So,
--   if you set this parameter value to the empty string ("" or ''), DMS
--   treats the empty string as the null value instead of <tt>NULL</tt>.
--   
--   The default value is <tt>NULL</tt>. Valid values include any valid
--   string.
s3Settings_csvNullValue :: Lens' S3Settings (Maybe Text)

-- | If you are using <tt>SSE_KMS</tt> for the <tt>EncryptionMode</tt>,
--   provide the KMS key ID. The key that you use needs an attached policy
--   that enables Identity and Access Management (IAM) user permissions and
--   allows use of the key.
--   
--   Here is a CLI example: <tt>aws dms create-endpoint
--   --endpoint-identifier value --endpoint-type target --engine-name s3
--   --s3-settings
--   ServiceAccessRoleArn=value,BucketFolder=value,BucketName=value,EncryptionMode=SSE_KMS,ServerSideEncryptionKmsKeyId=value
--   </tt>
s3Settings_serverSideEncryptionKmsKeyId :: Lens' S3Settings (Maybe Text)

-- | The size of one data page in bytes. This parameter defaults to 1024 *
--   1024 bytes (1 MiB). This number is used for .parquet file format only.
s3Settings_dataPageSize :: Lens' S3Settings (Maybe Int)

-- | This setting applies if the S3 output files during a change data
--   capture (CDC) load are written in .csv format. If set to <tt>true</tt>
--   for columns not included in the supplemental log, DMS uses the value
--   specified by <a>CsvNoSupValue</a> . If not set or set to
--   <tt>false</tt>, DMS uses the null value for these columns.
--   
--   This setting is supported in DMS versions 3.4.1 and later.
s3Settings_useCsvNoSupValue :: Lens' S3Settings (Maybe Bool)

-- | A value that enables a change data capture (CDC) load to write INSERT
--   and UPDATE operations to .csv or .parquet (columnar storage) output
--   files. The default setting is <tt>false</tt>, but when
--   <tt>CdcInsertsAndUpdates</tt> is set to <tt>true</tt> or <tt>y</tt>,
--   only INSERTs and UPDATEs from the source database are migrated to the
--   .csv or .parquet file.
--   
--   For .csv file format only, how these INSERTs and UPDATEs are recorded
--   depends on the value of the <tt>IncludeOpForFullLoad</tt> parameter.
--   If <tt>IncludeOpForFullLoad</tt> is set to <tt>true</tt>, the first
--   field of every CDC record is set to either <tt>I</tt> or <tt>U</tt> to
--   indicate INSERT and UPDATE operations at the source. But if
--   <tt>IncludeOpForFullLoad</tt> is set to <tt>false</tt>, CDC records
--   are written without an indication of INSERT or UPDATE operations at
--   the source. For more information about how these settings work
--   together, see <a>Indicating Source DB Operations in Migrated S3
--   Data</a> in the <i>Database Migration Service User Guide.</i>.
--   
--   DMS supports the use of the <tt>CdcInsertsAndUpdates</tt> parameter in
--   versions 3.3.1 and later.
--   
--   <tt>CdcInsertsOnly</tt> and <tt>CdcInsertsAndUpdates</tt> can't both
--   be set to <tt>true</tt> for the same endpoint. Set either
--   <tt>CdcInsertsOnly</tt> or <tt>CdcInsertsAndUpdates</tt> to
--   <tt>true</tt> for the same endpoint, but not both.
s3Settings_cdcInsertsAndUpdates :: Lens' S3Settings (Maybe Bool)

-- | Identifies the sequence of the date format to use during folder
--   partitioning. The default value is <tt>YYYYMMDD</tt>. Use this
--   parameter when <tt>DatePartitionedEnabled</tt> is set to
--   <tt>true</tt>.
s3Settings_datePartitionSequence :: Lens' S3Settings (Maybe DatePartitionSequenceValue)

-- | The number of rows in a row group. A smaller row group size provides
--   faster reads. But as the number of row groups grows, the slower writes
--   become. This parameter defaults to 10,000 rows. This number is used
--   for .parquet file format only.
--   
--   If you choose a value larger than the maximum, <tt>RowGroupLength</tt>
--   is set to the max row group length in bytes (64 * 1024 * 1024).
s3Settings_rowGroupLength :: Lens' S3Settings (Maybe Int)

-- | Specifies the folder path of CDC files. For an S3 source, this setting
--   is required if a task captures change data; otherwise, it's optional.
--   If <tt>CdcPath</tt> is set, DMS reads CDC files from this path and
--   replicates the data changes to the target endpoint. For an S3 target
--   if you set <a>PreserveTransactions</a> to <tt>true</tt>, DMS verifies
--   that you have set this parameter to a folder path on your S3 target
--   where DMS can save the transaction order for the CDC load. DMS creates
--   this CDC folder path in either your S3 target working directory or the
--   S3 target location specified by <a>BucketFolder</a> and
--   <a>BucketName</a> .
--   
--   For example, if you specify <tt>CdcPath</tt> as
--   <tt>MyChangedData</tt>, and you specify <tt>BucketName</tt> as
--   <tt>MyTargetBucket</tt> but do not specify <tt>BucketFolder</tt>, DMS
--   creates the CDC folder path following:
--   <tt>MyTargetBucket/MyChangedData</tt>.
--   
--   If you specify the same <tt>CdcPath</tt>, and you specify
--   <tt>BucketName</tt> as <tt>MyTargetBucket</tt> and
--   <tt>BucketFolder</tt> as <tt>MyTargetData</tt>, DMS creates the CDC
--   folder path following:
--   <tt>MyTargetBucket/MyTargetData/MyChangedData</tt>.
--   
--   For more information on CDC including transaction order on an S3
--   target, see <a>Capturing data changes (CDC) including transaction
--   order on the S3 target</a>.
--   
--   This setting is supported in DMS versions 3.4.2 and later.
s3Settings_cdcPath :: Lens' S3Settings (Maybe Text)

-- | The status of the subnet.
subnet_subnetStatus :: Lens' Subnet (Maybe Text)

-- | The subnet identifier.
subnet_subnetIdentifier :: Lens' Subnet (Maybe Text)

-- | The Availability Zone of the subnet.
subnet_subnetAvailabilityZone :: Lens' Subnet (Maybe AvailabilityZone)

-- | The expanded name for the engine name. For example, if the
--   <tt>EngineName</tt> parameter is "aurora," this value would be "Amazon
--   Aurora MySQL."
supportedEndpointType_engineDisplayName :: Lens' SupportedEndpointType (Maybe Text)

-- | The type of endpoint. Valid values are <tt>source</tt> and
--   <tt>target</tt>.
supportedEndpointType_endpointType :: Lens' SupportedEndpointType (Maybe ReplicationEndpointTypeValue)

-- | The database engine name. Valid values, depending on the EndpointType,
--   include <tt>"mysql"</tt>, <tt>"oracle"</tt>, <tt>"postgres"</tt>,
--   <tt>"mariadb"</tt>, <tt>"aurora"</tt>, <tt>"aurora-postgresql"</tt>,
--   <tt>"redshift"</tt>, <tt>"s3"</tt>, <tt>"db2"</tt>,
--   <tt>"azuredb"</tt>, <tt>"sybase"</tt>, <tt>"dynamodb"</tt>,
--   <tt>"mongodb"</tt>, <tt>"kinesis"</tt>, <tt>"kafka"</tt>,
--   <tt>"elasticsearch"</tt>, <tt>"documentdb"</tt>, <tt>"sqlserver"</tt>,
--   and <tt>"neptune"</tt>.
supportedEndpointType_engineName :: Lens' SupportedEndpointType (Maybe Text)

-- | The earliest DMS engine version that supports this endpoint engine.
--   Note that endpoint engines released with DMS versions earlier than
--   3.1.1 do not return a value for this parameter.
supportedEndpointType_replicationInstanceEngineMinimumVersion :: Lens' SupportedEndpointType (Maybe Text)

-- | Indicates if change data capture (CDC) is supported.
supportedEndpointType_supportsCDC :: Lens' SupportedEndpointType (Maybe Bool)

-- | Fully qualified domain name of the endpoint.
sybaseSettings_serverName :: Lens' SybaseSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | The full Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role that specifies DMS
--   as the trusted entity and grants the required permissions to access
--   the value in <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt>. The role must allow the
--   <tt>iam:PassRole</tt> action. <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> has the
--   value of the Amazon Web Services Secrets Manager secret that allows
--   access to the SAP ASE endpoint.
--   
--   You can specify one of two sets of values for these permissions. You
--   can specify the values for this setting and
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecretId</tt>. Or you can specify clear-text values
--   for <tt>UserName</tt>, <tt>Password</tt>, <tt>ServerName</tt>, and
--   <tt>Port</tt>. You can't specify both. For more information on
--   creating this <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> and the
--   <tt>SecretsManagerAccessRoleArn</tt> and
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecretId</tt> required to access it, see <a>Using
--   secrets to access Database Migration Service resources</a> in the
--   <i>Database Migration Service User Guide</i>.
sybaseSettings_secretsManagerAccessRoleArn :: Lens' SybaseSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | Endpoint connection user name.
sybaseSettings_username :: Lens' SybaseSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | Endpoint connection password.
sybaseSettings_password :: Lens' SybaseSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | Database name for the endpoint.
sybaseSettings_databaseName :: Lens' SybaseSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | The full ARN, partial ARN, or friendly name of the
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> that contains the SAP SAE endpoint
--   connection details.
sybaseSettings_secretsManagerSecretId :: Lens' SybaseSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | Endpoint TCP port.
sybaseSettings_port :: Lens' SybaseSettings (Maybe Int)

-- | The validation state of the table.
--   
--   This parameter can have the following values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Not enabled â€“ Validation isn't enabled for the table in the
--   migration task.</li>
--   <li>Pending records â€“ Some records in the table are waiting for
--   validation.</li>
--   <li>Mismatched records â€“ Some records in the table don't match between
--   the source and target.</li>
--   <li>Suspended records â€“ Some records in the table couldn't be
--   validated.</li>
--   <li>No primary key â€“The table couldn't be validated because it has no
--   primary key.</li>
--   <li>Table error â€“ The table wasn't validated because it's in an error
--   state and some data wasn't migrated.</li>
--   <li>Validated â€“ All rows in the table are validated. If the table is
--   updated, the status can change from Validated.</li>
--   <li>Error â€“ The table couldn't be validated because of an unexpected
--   error.</li>
--   <li>Pending validation â€“ The table is waiting validation.</li>
--   <li>Preparing table â€“ Preparing the table enabled in the migration
--   task for validation.</li>
--   <li>Pending revalidation â€“ All rows in the table are pending
--   validation after the table was updated.</li>
--   </ul>
tableStatistics_validationState :: Lens' TableStatistics (Maybe Text)

-- | The number of rows added during the full load operation.
tableStatistics_fullLoadRows :: Lens' TableStatistics (Maybe Integer)

-- | The number of insert actions performed on a table.
tableStatistics_inserts :: Lens' TableStatistics (Maybe Integer)

-- | The time when the full load operation completed.
tableStatistics_fullLoadEndTime :: Lens' TableStatistics (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The number of rows that failed conditional checks during the full load
--   operation (valid only for migrations where DynamoDB is the target).
tableStatistics_fullLoadCondtnlChkFailedRows :: Lens' TableStatistics (Maybe Integer)

-- | A value that indicates if the table was reloaded (<tt>true</tt>) or
--   loaded as part of a new full load operation (<tt>false</tt>).
tableStatistics_fullLoadReloaded :: Lens' TableStatistics (Maybe Bool)

-- | The number of records that failed validation.
tableStatistics_validationFailedRecords :: Lens' TableStatistics (Maybe Integer)

-- | The number of records that couldn't be validated.
tableStatistics_validationSuspendedRecords :: Lens' TableStatistics (Maybe Integer)

-- | The schema name.
tableStatistics_schemaName :: Lens' TableStatistics (Maybe Text)

-- | Additional details about the state of validation.
tableStatistics_validationStateDetails :: Lens' TableStatistics (Maybe Text)

-- | The state of the tables described.
--   
--   Valid states: Table does not exist | Before load | Full load | Table
--   completed | Table cancelled | Table error | Table all | Table updates
--   | Table is being reloaded
tableStatistics_tableState :: Lens' TableStatistics (Maybe Text)

-- | The number of rows that failed to load during the full load operation
--   (valid only for migrations where DynamoDB is the target).
tableStatistics_fullLoadErrorRows :: Lens' TableStatistics (Maybe Integer)

-- | The data definition language (DDL) used to build and modify the
--   structure of your tables.
tableStatistics_ddls :: Lens' TableStatistics (Maybe Integer)

-- | The number of delete actions performed on a table.
tableStatistics_deletes :: Lens' TableStatistics (Maybe Integer)

-- | The number of update actions performed on a table.
tableStatistics_updates :: Lens' TableStatistics (Maybe Integer)

-- | The number of records that have yet to be validated.
tableStatistics_validationPendingRecords :: Lens' TableStatistics (Maybe Integer)

-- | The time when the full load operation started.
tableStatistics_fullLoadStartTime :: Lens' TableStatistics (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The last time a table was updated.
tableStatistics_lastUpdateTime :: Lens' TableStatistics (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The name of the table.
tableStatistics_tableName :: Lens' TableStatistics (Maybe Text)

-- | The schema name of the table to be reloaded.
tableToReload_schemaName :: Lens' TableToReload Text

-- | The table name of the table to be reloaded.
tableToReload_tableName :: Lens' TableToReload Text

-- | A value is the optional value of the tag. The string value can be
--   1-256 Unicode characters in length and can't be prefixed with "aws:"
--   or "dms:". The string can only contain only the set of Unicode
--   letters, digits, white-space, '_', '.', '/', '=', '+', '-' (Java
--   regular expressions: "^([\\p{L}\\p{Z}\\p{N}_.:/=+\\-]*)$").
tag_value :: Lens' Tag (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) string that uniquely identifies the
--   resource for which the tag is created.
tag_resourceArn :: Lens' Tag (Maybe Text)

-- | A key is the required name of the tag. The string value can be 1-128
--   Unicode characters in length and can't be prefixed with "aws:" or
--   "dms:". The string can only contain only the set of Unicode letters,
--   digits, white-space, '_', '.', '/', '=', '+', '-' (Java regular
--   expressions: "^([\\p{L}\\p{Z}\\p{N}_.:/=+\\-]*)$").
tag_key :: Lens' Tag (Maybe Text)

-- | The status of the VPC security group.
vpcSecurityGroupMembership_status :: Lens' VpcSecurityGroupMembership (Maybe Text)

-- | The VPC security group ID.
vpcSecurityGroupMembership_vpcSecurityGroupId :: Lens' VpcSecurityGroupMembership (Maybe Text)


module Network.AWS.DMS.Waiters

-- | Polls <a>DescribeReplicationInstances</a> every 60 seconds until a
--   successful state is reached. An error is returned after 60 failed
--   checks.
newReplicationInstanceAvailable :: Wait DescribeReplicationInstances

-- | Polls <a>DescribeReplicationTasks</a> every 15 seconds until a
--   successful state is reached. An error is returned after 60 failed
--   checks.
newReplicationTaskDeleted :: Wait DescribeReplicationTasks

-- | Polls <a>DescribeReplicationTasks</a> every 15 seconds until a
--   successful state is reached. An error is returned after 60 failed
--   checks.
newReplicationTaskReady :: Wait DescribeReplicationTasks

-- | Polls <a>DescribeReplicationInstances</a> every 15 seconds until a
--   successful state is reached. An error is returned after 60 failed
--   checks.
newReplicationInstanceDeleted :: Wait DescribeReplicationInstances

-- | Polls <a>DescribeEndpoints</a> every 5 seconds until a successful
--   state is reached. An error is returned after 60 failed checks.
newEndpointDeleted :: Wait DescribeEndpoints

-- | Polls <a>DescribeReplicationTasks</a> every 15 seconds until a
--   successful state is reached. An error is returned after 60 failed
--   checks.
newReplicationTaskStopped :: Wait DescribeReplicationTasks

-- | Polls <a>DescribeReplicationTasks</a> every 15 seconds until a
--   successful state is reached. An error is returned after 60 failed
--   checks.
newReplicationTaskRunning :: Wait DescribeReplicationTasks

-- | Polls <a>DescribeConnections</a> every 5 seconds until a successful
--   state is reached. An error is returned after 60 failed checks.
newTestConnectionSucceeds :: Wait DescribeConnections


-- | Derived from API version <tt>2016-01-01</tt> of the AWS service
--   descriptions, licensed under Apache 2.0.
--   
--   Database Migration Service
--   
--   Database Migration Service (DMS) can migrate your data to and from the
--   most widely used commercial and open-source databases such as Oracle,
--   PostgreSQL, Microsoft SQL Server, Amazon Redshift, MariaDB, Amazon
--   Aurora, MySQL, and SAP Adaptive Server Enterprise (ASE). The service
--   supports homogeneous migrations such as Oracle to Oracle, as well as
--   heterogeneous migrations between different database platforms, such as
--   Oracle to MySQL or SQL Server to PostgreSQL.
--   
--   For more information about DMS, see <a>What Is Database Migration
--   Service?</a> in the <i>Database Migration Service User Guide.</i>
module Network.AWS.DMS

-- | API version <tt>2016-01-01</tt> of the Amazon Database Migration
--   Service SDK configuration.
defaultService :: Service

-- | The ciphertext references a key that doesn't exist or that the DMS
--   account doesn't have access to.
_KMSAccessDeniedFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The specified master key (CMK) isn't enabled.
_KMSDisabledFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | An Key Management Service (KMS) error is preventing access to KMS.
_KMSFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The subnet provided is invalid.
_InvalidSubnet :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | DMS cannot access the KMS key.
_KMSKeyNotAccessibleFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The replication subnet group does not cover enough Availability Zones
--   (AZs). Edit the replication subnet group and add more AZs.
_ReplicationSubnetGroupDoesNotCoverEnoughAZs :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | A specified Amazon S3 bucket, bucket folder, or other object can't be
--   found.
_S3ResourceNotFoundFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The resource is in a state that prevents it from being used for
--   database migration.
_InvalidResourceStateFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The certificate was not valid.
_InvalidCertificateFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | You are not authorized for the SNS subscription.
_SNSNoAuthorizationFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The resource you are attempting to create already exists.
_ResourceAlreadyExistsFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | There are not enough resources allocated to the database migration.
_InsufficientResourceCapacityFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Insufficient privileges are preventing access to an Amazon S3 object.
_S3AccessDeniedFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The SNS topic is invalid.
_SNSInvalidTopicFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The specified KMS entity or resource can't be found.
_KMSNotFoundFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | This request triggered KMS request throttling.
_KMSThrottlingFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The quota for this resource quota has been exceeded.
_ResourceQuotaExceededFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | An upgrade dependency is preventing the database migration.
_UpgradeDependencyFailureFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The resource could not be found.
_ResourceNotFoundFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The storage quota has been exceeded.
_StorageQuotaExceededFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | DMS was denied access to the endpoint. Check that the role is
--   correctly configured.
_AccessDeniedFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The specified subnet is already in use.
_SubnetAlreadyInUse :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The state of the specified KMS resource isn't valid for this request.
_KMSInvalidStateFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Polls <a>DescribeReplicationInstances</a> every 60 seconds until a
--   successful state is reached. An error is returned after 60 failed
--   checks.
newReplicationInstanceAvailable :: Wait DescribeReplicationInstances

-- | Polls <a>DescribeReplicationTasks</a> every 15 seconds until a
--   successful state is reached. An error is returned after 60 failed
--   checks.
newReplicationTaskDeleted :: Wait DescribeReplicationTasks

--   successful state is reached. An error is returned after 60 failed
--   checks.
newReplicationTaskReady :: Wait DescribeReplicationTasks

--   successful state is reached. An error is returned after 60 failed
--   checks.
newReplicationInstanceDeleted :: Wait DescribeReplicationInstances

--   checks.
newReplicationTaskStopped :: Wait DescribeReplicationTasks

newReplicationTaskRunning :: Wait DescribeReplicationTasks

--   parameter is <tt>true</tt>, the reboot is conducted through a planned
--   Multi-AZ failover where resources are released and cleaned up prior to
--   conducting the failover. If the instance isn''t configured for
--   Multi-AZ, then you can't specify <tt>true</tt>. (
--   <tt>--force-planned-failover</tt> and <tt>--force-failover</tt> can't
--   both be set to <tt>true</tt>.)
--   
--   <a>$sel:forceFailover:RebootReplicationInstance'</a>,

--   <tt>true</tt>, the reboot is conducted through a Multi-AZ failover. If
--   the instance isn't configured for Multi-AZ, then you can't specify
--   <tt>true</tt>. ( <tt>--force-planned-failover</tt> and
--   <tt>--force-failover</tt> can't both be set to <tt>true</tt>.)

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newStartReplicationTaskAssessment</a> smart
--   constructor.
data StartReplicationTaskAssessment
StartReplicationTaskAssessment' :: Text -> StartReplicationTaskAssessment

-- | Create a value of <a>StartReplicationTaskAssessment</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:replicationTaskArn:StartReplicationTaskAssessment'</a>,

--   resource identifier at the end of the <tt>EndpointArn</tt> response
--   parameter that is returned in the created <tt>Endpoint</tt> object.
--   The value for this parameter can have up to 31 characters. It can
--   contain only ASCII letters, digits, and hyphen ('-'). Also, it can't
--   end with a hyphen or contain two consecutive hyphens, and can only
--   begin with a letter, such as <tt>Example-App-ARN1</tt>. For example,
--   this value might result in the <tt>EndpointArn</tt> value
--   <tt>arn:aws:dms:eu-west-1:012345678901:rep:Example-App-ARN1</tt>. If
--   you don't specify a <tt>ResourceIdentifier</tt> value, DMS generates a
--   default identifier value for the end of <tt>EndpointArn</tt>.
--

--   more tags to be assigned to the endpoint.
--

--

--   <a>createEndpoint_endpointIdentifier</a> - The database endpoint
--   identifier. Identifiers must begin with a letter and must contain only
--   ASCII letters, digits, and hyphens. They can't end with a hyphen, or

--

--   <tt>"elasticsearch"</tt>, <tt>"docdb"</tt>, <tt>"sqlserver"</tt>, and
--   <tt>"neptune"</tt>.

--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:RemoveTagsFromResourceResponse'</a>,
--   <a>removeTagsFromResourceResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http
--   status code.
newRemoveTagsFromResourceResponse :: Int -> RemoveTagsFromResourceResponse

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newModifyEndpoint</a> smart constructor.
data ModifyEndpoint
ModifyEndpoint' :: Maybe DmsTransferSettings -> Maybe MySQLSettings -> Maybe Text -> Maybe MicrosoftSQLServerSettings -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe DocDbSettings -> Maybe PostgreSQLSettings -> Maybe Text -> Maybe KafkaSettings -> Maybe OracleSettings -> Maybe ReplicationEndpointTypeValue -> Maybe RedshiftSettings -> Maybe ElasticsearchSettings -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe RedisSettings -> Maybe NeptuneSettings -> Maybe IBMDb2Settings -> Maybe MongoDbSettings -> Maybe DmsSslModeValue -> Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> Maybe SybaseSettings -> Maybe Text -> Maybe S3Settings -> Maybe KinesisSettings -> Maybe Text -> Maybe DynamoDbSettings -> Maybe Int -> Text -> ModifyEndpoint

-- | Create a value of <a>ModifyEndpoint</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:dmsTransferSettings:ModifyEndpoint'</a>,
--   <a>modifyEndpoint_dmsTransferSettings</a> - The settings in JSON
--   format for the DMS transfer type of source endpoint.
--   
--   Attributes include the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>serviceAccessRoleArn - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) used by the
--   service access IAM role. The role must allow the <tt>iam:PassRole</tt>
--   action.</li>
--   <li>BucketName - The name of the S3 bucket to use.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   Shorthand syntax for these settings is as follows:
--   <tt>ServiceAccessRoleArn=string ,BucketName=string</tt>
--   
--   JSON syntax for these settings is as follows: <tt>{
--   "ServiceAccessRoleArn": "string", "BucketName": "string"} </tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:mySQLSettings:ModifyEndpoint'</a>,
--   <a>modifyEndpoint_mySQLSettings</a> - Settings in JSON format for the
--   source and target MySQL endpoint. For information about other
--   available settings, see <a>Extra connection attributes when using
--   MySQL as a source for DMS</a> and <a>Extra connection attributes when
--   using a MySQL-compatible database as a target for DMS</a> in the
--   <i>Database Migration Service User Guide.</i>
--   
--   <a>$sel:serverName:ModifyEndpoint'</a>,
--   <a>modifyEndpoint_serverName</a> - The name of the server where the
--   endpoint database resides.
--   
--   <a>$sel:microsoftSQLServerSettings:ModifyEndpoint'</a>,
--   <a>modifyEndpoint_microsoftSQLServerSettings</a> - Settings in JSON
--   format for the source and target Microsoft SQL Server endpoint. For
--   information about other available settings, see <a>Extra connection
--   attributes when using SQL Server as a source for DMS</a> and <a>Extra
--   connection attributes when using SQL Server as a target for DMS</a> in
--   the <i>Database Migration Service User Guide.</i>
--   
--   <a>$sel:certificateArn:ModifyEndpoint'</a>,

--   of the certificate used for SSL connection.
--   
--   <a>$sel:serviceAccessRoleArn:ModifyEndpoint'</a>,
--   <a>modifyEndpoint_serviceAccessRoleArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name
--   (ARN) for the IAM role you want to use to modify the endpoint. The
--   role must allow the <tt>iam:PassRole</tt> action.
--   
--   <a>$sel:docDbSettings:ModifyEndpoint'</a>,
--   <a>modifyEndpoint_docDbSettings</a> - Settings in JSON format for the
--   source DocumentDB endpoint. For more information about the available
--   settings, see the configuration properties section in <a>Using
--   DocumentDB as a Target for Database Migration Service</a> in the
--   <i>Database Migration Service User Guide.</i>
--   
--   <a>$sel:postgreSQLSettings:ModifyEndpoint'</a>,
--   <a>modifyEndpoint_postgreSQLSettings</a> - Settings in JSON format for
--   the source and target PostgreSQL endpoint. For information about other
--   available settings, see <a>Extra connection attributes when using
--   PostgreSQL as a source for DMS</a> and <a>Extra connection attributes
--   when using PostgreSQL as a target for DMS</a> in the <i>Database
--   Migration Service User Guide.</i>
--   
--   <a>$sel:extraConnectionAttributes:ModifyEndpoint'</a>,
--   <a>modifyEndpoint_extraConnectionAttributes</a> - Additional
--   attributes associated with the connection. To reset this parameter,
--   pass the empty string ("") as an argument.
--   
--   <a>$sel:kafkaSettings:ModifyEndpoint'</a>,
--   <a>modifyEndpoint_kafkaSettings</a> - Settings in JSON format for the
--   target Apache Kafka endpoint. For more information about the available
--   settings, see <a>Using object mapping to migrate data to a Kafka
--   topic</a> in the <i>Database Migration Service User Guide.</i>
--   
--   <a>$sel:oracleSettings:ModifyEndpoint'</a>,
--   <a>modifyEndpoint_oracleSettings</a> - Settings in JSON format for the
--   source and target Oracle endpoint. For information about other
--   available settings, see <a>Extra connection attributes when using
--   Oracle as a source for DMS</a> and <a>Extra connection attributes when
--   using Oracle as a target for DMS</a> in the <i>Database Migration
--   Service User Guide.</i>
--   
--   <a>$sel:endpointType:ModifyEndpoint'</a>,
--   <a>modifyEndpoint_endpointType</a> - The type of endpoint. Valid
--   values are <tt>source</tt> and <tt>target</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:redshiftSettings:ModifyEndpoint'</a>,
--   <a>modifyEndpoint_redshiftSettings</a> - Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:elasticsearchSettings:ModifyEndpoint'</a>,
--   <a>modifyEndpoint_elasticsearchSettings</a> - Settings in JSON format
--   for the target Elasticsearch endpoint. For more information about the
--   available settings, see <a>Extra Connection Attributes When Using
--   Elasticsearch as a Target for DMS</a> in the <i>Database Migration
--   Service User Guide.</i>
--   
--   <a>$sel:exactSettings:ModifyEndpoint'</a>,
--   <a>modifyEndpoint_exactSettings</a> - If this attribute is Y, the
--   current call to <tt>ModifyEndpoint</tt> replaces all existing endpoint
--   settings with the exact settings that you specify in this call. If
--   this attribute is N, the current call to <tt>ModifyEndpoint</tt> does
--   two things:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>It replaces any endpoint settings that already exist with new
--   values, for settings with the same names.</li>
--   <li>It creates new endpoint settings that you specify in the call, for
--   settings with different names.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   For example, if you call <tt>create-endpoint ... --endpoint-settings
--   '{"a":1}' ...</tt>, the endpoint has the following endpoint settings:
--   <tt>'{"a":1}'</tt>. If you then call <tt>modify-endpoint ...
--   --endpoint-settings '{"b":2}' ...</tt> for the same endpoint, the
--   endpoint has the following settings: <tt>'{"a":1,"b":2}'</tt>.
--   
--   However, suppose that you follow this with a call to
--   <tt>modify-endpoint ... --endpoint-settings '{"b":2}' --exact-settings
--   ...</tt> for that same endpoint again. Then the endpoint has the
--   following settings: <tt>'{"b":2}'</tt>. All existing settings are
--   replaced with the exact settings that you specify.
--   
--   <a>$sel:username:ModifyEndpoint'</a>, <a>modifyEndpoint_username</a> -
--   The user name to be used to login to the endpoint database.
--   
--   <a>$sel:externalTableDefinition:ModifyEndpoint'</a>,
--   <a>modifyEndpoint_externalTableDefinition</a> - The external table
--   definition.
--   
--   <a>$sel:engineName:ModifyEndpoint'</a>,
--   <a>modifyEndpoint_engineName</a> - The type of engine for the
--   endpoint. Valid values, depending on the EndpointType, include
--   <tt>"mysql"</tt>, <tt>"oracle"</tt>, <tt>"postgres"</tt>,
--   <tt>"mariadb"</tt>, <tt>"aurora"</tt>, <tt>"aurora-postgresql"</tt>,
--   <tt>"redshift"</tt>, <tt>"s3"</tt>, <tt>"db2"</tt>,
--   <tt>"azuredb"</tt>, <tt>"sybase"</tt>, <tt>"dynamodb"</tt>,
--   <tt>"mongodb"</tt>, <tt>"kinesis"</tt>, <tt>"kafka"</tt>,
--   <tt>"elasticsearch"</tt>, <tt>"documentdb"</tt>, <tt>"sqlserver"</tt>,
--   and <tt>"neptune"</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:redisSettings:ModifyEndpoint'</a>,
--   <a>modifyEndpoint_redisSettings</a> - Settings in JSON format for the
--   Redis target endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:neptuneSettings:ModifyEndpoint'</a>,
--   <a>modifyEndpoint_neptuneSettings</a> - Settings in JSON format for
--   the target Amazon Neptune endpoint. For more information about the
--   available settings, see <a>Specifying graph-mapping rules using
--   Gremlin and R2RML for Amazon Neptune as a target</a> in the
--   <i>Database Migration Service User Guide.</i>
--   
--   <a>$sel:iBMDb2Settings:ModifyEndpoint'</a>,
--   <a>modifyEndpoint_iBMDb2Settings</a> - Settings in JSON format for the
--   source IBM Db2 LUW endpoint. For information about other available
--   settings, see <a>Extra connection attributes when using Db2 LUW as a
--   source for DMS</a> in the <i>Database Migration Service User
--   Guide.</i>
--   
--   <a>$sel:mongoDbSettings:ModifyEndpoint'</a>,
--   <a>modifyEndpoint_mongoDbSettings</a> - Settings in JSON format for
--   the source MongoDB endpoint. For more information about the available
--   settings, see the configuration properties section in <a>Endpoint
--   configuration settings when using MongoDB as a source for Database
--   Migration Service</a> in the <i>Database Migration Service User
--   Guide.</i>
--   
--   <a>$sel:sslMode:ModifyEndpoint'</a>, <a>modifyEndpoint_sslMode</a> -
--   The SSL mode used to connect to the endpoint. The default value is
--   <tt>none</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:password:ModifyEndpoint'</a>, <a>modifyEndpoint_password</a> -
--   The password to be used to login to the endpoint database.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sybaseSettings:ModifyEndpoint'</a>,
--   <a>modifyEndpoint_sybaseSettings</a> - Settings in JSON format for the
--   source and target SAP ASE endpoint. For information about other
--   available settings, see <a>Extra connection attributes when using SAP
--   ASE as a source for DMS</a> and <a>Extra connection attributes when
--   using SAP ASE as a target for DMS</a> in the <i>Database Migration
--   Service User Guide.</i>
--   
--   <a>$sel:databaseName:ModifyEndpoint'</a>,
--   <a>modifyEndpoint_databaseName</a> - The name of the endpoint
--   database. For a MySQL source or target endpoint, do not specify
--   DatabaseName.
--   
--   <a>$sel:s3Settings:ModifyEndpoint'</a>,
--   <a>modifyEndpoint_s3Settings</a> - Settings in JSON format for the
--   target Amazon S3 endpoint. For more information about the available
--   settings, see <a>Extra Connection Attributes When Using Amazon S3 as a
--   Target for DMS</a> in the <i>Database Migration Service User
--   Guide.</i>
--   
--   <a>$sel:kinesisSettings:ModifyEndpoint'</a>,
--   <a>modifyEndpoint_kinesisSettings</a> - Settings in JSON format for
--   the target endpoint for Amazon Kinesis Data Streams. For more
--   information about the available settings, see <a>Using object mapping
--   to migrate data to a Kinesis data stream</a> in the <i>Database
--   Migration Service User Guide.</i>
--   
--   <a>$sel:endpointIdentifier:ModifyEndpoint'</a>,
--   <a>modifyEndpoint_endpointIdentifier</a> - The database endpoint
--   identifier. Identifiers must begin with a letter and must contain only
--   ASCII letters, digits, and hyphens. They can't end with a hyphen or
--   contain two consecutive hyphens.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dynamoDbSettings:ModifyEndpoint'</a>,
--   <a>modifyEndpoint_dynamoDbSettings</a> - Settings in JSON format for
--   the target Amazon DynamoDB endpoint. For information about other
--   available settings, see <a>Using Object Mapping to Migrate Data to
--   DynamoDB</a> in the <i>Database Migration Service User Guide.</i>
--   
--   <a>$sel:port:ModifyEndpoint'</a>, <a>modifyEndpoint_port</a> - The
--   port used by the endpoint database.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endpointArn:ModifyEndpoint'</a>,
--   <a>modifyEndpoint_endpointArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN)
--   string that uniquely identifies the endpoint.
newModifyEndpoint :: Text -> ModifyEndpoint

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newStartReplicationTaskAssessmentRun</a> smart
--   constructor.
data StartReplicationTaskAssessmentRun
StartReplicationTaskAssessmentRun' :: Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> StartReplicationTaskAssessmentRun

-- | Create a value of <a>StartReplicationTaskAssessmentRun</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:includeOnly:StartReplicationTaskAssessmentRun'</a>,
--   <a>startReplicationTaskAssessmentRun_includeOnly</a> - Space-separated
--   list of names for specific individual assessments that you want to
--   include. These names come from the default list of individual
--   assessments that DMS supports for the associated migration task. This
--   task is specified by <tt>ReplicationTaskArn</tt>.
--   
--   You can't set a value for <tt>IncludeOnly</tt> if you also set a value
--   for <tt>Exclude</tt> in the API operation.
--   
--   To identify the names of the default individual assessments that DMS
--   supports for the associated migration task, run the
--   <tt>DescribeApplicableIndividualAssessments</tt> operation using its
--   own <tt>ReplicationTaskArn</tt> request parameter.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resultKmsKeyArn:StartReplicationTaskAssessmentRun'</a>,
--   <a>startReplicationTaskAssessmentRun_resultKmsKeyArn</a> - ARN of a
--   custom KMS encryption key that you specify when you set
--   <tt>ResultEncryptionMode</tt> to <tt>"SSE_KMS</tt>".
--   
--   <a>$sel:resultLocationFolder:StartReplicationTaskAssessmentRun'</a>,
--   <a>startReplicationTaskAssessmentRun_resultLocationFolder</a> - Folder
--   within an Amazon S3 bucket where you want DMS to store the results of
--   this assessment run.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resultEncryptionMode:StartReplicationTaskAssessmentRun'</a>,
--   <a>startReplicationTaskAssessmentRun_resultEncryptionMode</a> -
--   Encryption mode that you can specify to encrypt the results of this
--   assessment run. If you don't specify this request parameter, DMS
--   stores the assessment run results without encryption. You can specify
--   one of the options following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>"SSE_S3"</tt> â€“ The server-side encryption provided as a
--   default by Amazon S3.</li>
--   <li><tt>"SSE_KMS"</tt> â€“ Key Management Service (KMS) encryption. This
--   encryption can use either a custom KMS encryption key that you specify
--   or the default KMS encryption key that DMS provides.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:exclude:StartReplicationTaskAssessmentRun'</a>,
--   <a>startReplicationTaskAssessmentRun_exclude</a> - Space-separated
--   list of names for specific individual assessments that you want to
--   exclude. These names come from the default list of individual
--   assessments that DMS supports for the associated migration task. This
--   task is specified by <tt>ReplicationTaskArn</tt>.
--   
--   You can't set a value for <tt>Exclude</tt> if you also set a value for
--   <tt>IncludeOnly</tt> in the API operation.
--   
--   To identify the names of the default individual assessments that DMS
--   supports for the associated migration task, run the
--   <tt>DescribeApplicableIndividualAssessments</tt> operation using its
--   own <tt>ReplicationTaskArn</tt> request parameter.
--   
--   <a>$sel:replicationTaskArn:StartReplicationTaskAssessmentRun'</a>,
--   <a>startReplicationTaskAssessmentRun_replicationTaskArn</a> - Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN) of the migration task associated with the
--   premigration assessment run that you want to start.
--   
--   <a>$sel:serviceAccessRoleArn:StartReplicationTaskAssessmentRun'</a>,
--   <a>startReplicationTaskAssessmentRun_serviceAccessRoleArn</a> - ARN of
--   the service role needed to start the assessment run. The role must
--   allow the <tt>iam:PassRole</tt> action.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resultLocationBucket:StartReplicationTaskAssessmentRun'</a>,
--   <a>startReplicationTaskAssessmentRun_resultLocationBucket</a> - Amazon
--   S3 bucket where you want DMS to store the results of this assessment
--   run.
--   
--   <a>$sel:assessmentRunName:StartReplicationTaskAssessmentRun'</a>,
--   <a>startReplicationTaskAssessmentRun_assessmentRunName</a> - Unique
--   name to identify the assessment run.
newStartReplicationTaskAssessmentRun :: Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> StartReplicationTaskAssessmentRun

data CreateReplicationTask
CreateReplicationTask' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Tag] -> Maybe POSIX -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> MigrationTypeValue -> Text -> CreateReplicationTask

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateReplicationTask</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:replicationTaskSettings:CreateReplicationTask'</a>,
--   <a>createReplicationTask_replicationTaskSettings</a> - Overall
--   settings for the task, in JSON format. For more information, see
--   <a>Specifying Task Settings for Database Migration Service Tasks</a>
--   in the <i>Database Migration Service User Guide.</i>
--   
--   <a>$sel:cdcStartPosition:CreateReplicationTask'</a>,
--   <a>createReplicationTask_cdcStartPosition</a> - Indicates when you
--   want a change data capture (CDC) operation to start. Use either
--   CdcStartPosition or CdcStartTime to specify when you want a CDC
--   operation to start. Specifying both values results in an error.
--   
--   The value can be in date, checkpoint, or LSN/SCN format.
--   
--   Date Example: --cdc-start-position â€œ2018-03-08T12:12:12â€
--   
--   Checkpoint Example: --cdc-start-position
--   "checkpoint:V1mysql-bin-changelog.157832:1975:-1:2002:677883278264080:mysql-bin-changelog.157832:187600#93"
--   
--   LSN Example: --cdc-start-position â€œmysql-bin-changelog.000024:373â€
--   
--   When you use this task setting with a source PostgreSQL database, a
--   logical replication slot should already be created and associated with
--   the source endpoint. You can verify this by setting the
--   <tt>slotName</tt> extra connection attribute to the name of this
--   logical replication slot. For more information, see <a>Extra
--   Connection Attributes When Using PostgreSQL as a Source for DMS</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:taskData:CreateReplicationTask'</a>,
--   <a>createReplicationTask_taskData</a> - Supplemental information that
--   the task requires to migrate the data for certain source and target
--   endpoints. For more information, see <a>Specifying Supplemental Data
--   for Task Settings</a> in the <i>Database Migration Service User
--   Guide.</i>
--   
--   <a>$sel:cdcStopPosition:CreateReplicationTask'</a>,
--   <a>createReplicationTask_cdcStopPosition</a> - Indicates when you want
--   a change data capture (CDC) operation to stop. The value can be either
--   server time or commit time.
--   
--   Server time example: --cdc-stop-position
--   â€œserver_time:2018-02-09T12:12:12â€
--   
--   Commit time example: --cdc-stop-position â€œcommit_time:
--   2018-02-09T12:12:12 â€œ
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceIdentifier:CreateReplicationTask'</a>,
--   <a>createReplicationTask_resourceIdentifier</a> - A friendly name for
--   the resource identifier at the end of the <tt>EndpointArn</tt>
--   response parameter that is returned in the created <tt>Endpoint</tt>
--   object. The value for this parameter can have up to 31 characters. It
--   can contain only ASCII letters, digits, and hyphen ('-'). Also, it
--   can't end with a hyphen or contain two consecutive hyphens, and can
--   only begin with a letter, such as <tt>Example-App-ARN1</tt>. For
--   example, this value might result in the <tt>EndpointArn</tt> value
--   <tt>arn:aws:dms:eu-west-1:012345678901:rep:Example-App-ARN1</tt>. If
--   you don't specify a <tt>ResourceIdentifier</tt> value, DMS generates a
--   default identifier value for the end of <tt>EndpointArn</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:CreateReplicationTask'</a>,
--   <a>createReplicationTask_tags</a> - One or more tags to be assigned to
--   the replication task.
--   
--   <a>$sel:cdcStartTime:CreateReplicationTask'</a>,
--   <a>createReplicationTask_cdcStartTime</a> - Indicates the start time
--   for a change data capture (CDC) operation. Use either CdcStartTime or
--   CdcStartPosition to specify when you want a CDC operation to start.
--   Specifying both values results in an error.
--   
--   Timestamp Example: --cdc-start-time â€œ2018-03-08T12:12:12â€
--   
--   <a>$sel:replicationTaskIdentifier:CreateReplicationTask'</a>,
--   <a>createReplicationTask_replicationTaskIdentifier</a> - An identifier
--   for the replication task.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Must contain 1-255 alphanumeric characters or hyphens.</li>
--   <li>First character must be a letter.</li>
--   <li>Cannot end with a hyphen or contain two consecutive hyphens.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:sourceEndpointArn:CreateReplicationTask'</a>,
--   <a>createReplicationTask_sourceEndpointArn</a> - An Amazon Resource
--   Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies the source endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:targetEndpointArn:CreateReplicationTask'</a>,
--   <a>createReplicationTask_targetEndpointArn</a> - An Amazon Resource
--   Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies the target endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:replicationInstanceArn:CreateReplicationTask'</a>,
--   <a>createReplicationTask_replicationInstanceArn</a> - The Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN) of a replication instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:migrationType:CreateReplicationTask'</a>,
--   <a>createReplicationTask_migrationType</a> - The migration type. Valid
--   values: <tt>full-load</tt> | <tt>cdc</tt> | <tt>full-load-and-cdc</tt>
