-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newModifyReplicationInstance</a> smart constructor.
data ModifyReplicationInstance
ModifyReplicationInstance' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Text -> ModifyReplicationInstance

-- | Create a value of <a>ModifyReplicationInstance</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:engineVersion:ModifyReplicationInstance'</a>,
--   <a>modifyReplicationInstance_engineVersion</a> - The engine version
--   number of the replication instance.
--   
--   When modifying a major engine version of an instance, also set
--   <tt>AllowMajorVersionUpgrade</tt> to <tt>true</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:autoMinorVersionUpgrade:ModifyReplicationInstance'</a>,
--   <a>modifyReplicationInstance_autoMinorVersionUpgrade</a> - A value
--   that indicates that minor version upgrades are applied automatically
--   to the replication instance during the maintenance window. Changing
--   this parameter doesn't result in an outage, except in the case
--   described following. The change is asynchronously applied as soon as
--   possible.
--   
--   An outage does result if these factors apply:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>This parameter is set to <tt>true</tt> during the maintenance
--   window.</li>
--   <li>A newer minor version is available.</li>
--   <li>DMS has enabled automatic patching for the given engine
--   version.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:allowMajorVersionUpgrade:ModifyReplicationInstance'</a>,
--   <a>modifyReplicationInstance_allowMajorVersionUpgrade</a> - Indicates
--   that major version upgrades are allowed. Changing this parameter does
--   not result in an outage, and the change is asynchronously applied as
--   soon as possible.
--   
--   This parameter must be set to <tt>true</tt> when specifying a value
--   for the <tt>EngineVersion</tt> parameter that is a different major
--   version than the replication instance's current version.
--   
--   <a>$sel:preferredMaintenanceWindow:ModifyReplicationInstance'</a>,
--   <a>modifyReplicationInstance_preferredMaintenanceWindow</a> - The
--   weekly time range (in UTC) during which system maintenance can occur,
--   which might result in an outage. Changing this parameter does not
--   result in an outage, except in the following situation, and the change
--   is asynchronously applied as soon as possible. If moving this window
--   to the current time, there must be at least 30 minutes between the
--   current time and end of the window to ensure pending changes are
--   applied.
--   
--   Default: Uses existing setting
--   
--   Format: ddd:hh24:mi-ddd:hh24:mi
--   
--   Valid Days: Mon | Tue | Wed | Thu | Fri | Sat | Sun
--   
--   Constraints: Must be at least 30 minutes
--   
--   <a>$sel:vpcSecurityGroupIds:ModifyReplicationInstance'</a>,
--   <a>modifyReplicationInstance_vpcSecurityGroupIds</a> - Specifies the
--   VPC security group to be used with the replication instance. The VPC
--   security group must work with the VPC containing the replication
--   instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:multiAZ:ModifyReplicationInstance'</a>,
--   <a>modifyReplicationInstance_multiAZ</a> - Specifies whether the
--   replication instance is a Multi-AZ deployment. You can't set the
--   <tt>AvailabilityZone</tt> parameter if the Multi-AZ parameter is set
--   to <tt>true</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:allocatedStorage:ModifyReplicationInstance'</a>,
--   <a>modifyReplicationInstance_allocatedStorage</a> - The amount of
--   storage (in gigabytes) to be allocated for the replication instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:applyImmediately:ModifyReplicationInstance'</a>,
--   <a>modifyReplicationInstance_applyImmediately</a> - Indicates whether
--   the changes should be applied immediately or during the next
--   maintenance window.
--   
--   <a>$sel:replicationInstanceClass:ModifyReplicationInstance'</a>,
--   <a>modifyReplicationInstance_replicationInstanceClass</a> - The
--   compute and memory capacity of the replication instance as defined for
--   the specified replication instance class. For example to specify the
--   instance class dms.c4.large, set this parameter to
--   <tt>"dms.c4.large"</tt>.
--   
--   For more information on the settings and capacities for the available
--   replication instance classes, see <a>Selecting the right DMS
--   replication instance for your migration</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:replicationInstanceIdentifier:ModifyReplicationInstance'</a>,
--   <a>modifyReplicationInstance_replicationInstanceIdentifier</a> - The
--   replication instance identifier. This parameter is stored as a
--   lowercase string.
--   
--   <a>$sel:replicationInstanceArn:ModifyReplicationInstance'</a>,
--   <a>modifyReplicationInstance_replicationInstanceArn</a> - The Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN) of the replication instance.
newModifyReplicationInstance :: Text -> ModifyReplicationInstance

data ModifyReplicationTask
ModifyReplicationTask' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe MigrationTypeValue -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Text -> ModifyReplicationTask

-- | Create a value of <a>ModifyReplicationTask</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:replicationTaskSettings:ModifyReplicationTask'</a>,
--   <a>modifyReplicationTask_replicationTaskSettings</a> - JSON file that
--   contains settings for the task, such as task metadata settings.
--   
--   <a>$sel:replicationTaskIdentifier:ModifyReplicationTask'</a>,
--   <a>modifyReplicationTask_replicationTaskIdentifier</a> - The
--   replication task identifier.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Must contain 1-255 alphanumeric characters or hyphens.</li>
--   <li>First character must be a letter.</li>
--   <li>Cannot end with a hyphen or contain two consecutive hyphens.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:cdcStartPosition:ModifyReplicationTask'</a>,
--   <a>modifyReplicationTask_cdcStartPosition</a> - Indicates when you
--   want a change data capture (CDC) operation to start. Use either
--   CdcStartPosition or CdcStartTime to specify when you want a CDC
--   operation to start. Specifying both values results in an error.
--   
--   The value can be in date, checkpoint, or LSN/SCN format.
--   
--   Date Example: --cdc-start-position â€œ2018-03-08T12:12:12â€
--   
--   Checkpoint Example: --cdc-start-position
--   "checkpoint:V1mysql-bin-changelog.157832:1975:-1:2002:677883278264080:mysql-bin-changelog.157832:187600#93"
--   
--   LSN Example: --cdc-start-position â€œmysql-bin-changelog.000024:373â€
--   
--   When you use this task setting with a source PostgreSQL database, a
--   logical replication slot should already be created and associated with
--   the source endpoint. You can verify this by setting the
--   <tt>slotName</tt> extra connection attribute to the name of this
--   logical replication slot. For more information, see <a>Extra
--   Connection Attributes When Using PostgreSQL as a Source for DMS</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tableMappings:ModifyReplicationTask'</a>,
--   <a>modifyReplicationTask_tableMappings</a> - When using the CLI or
--   boto3, provide the path of the JSON file that contains the table
--   mappings. Precede the path with <tt>file://</tt>. For example,
--   <tt>--table-mappings file://mappingfile.json</tt>. When working with
--   the DMS API, provide the JSON as the parameter value.
--   
--   <a>$sel:migrationType:ModifyReplicationTask'</a>,
--   <a>modifyReplicationTask_migrationType</a> - The migration type. Valid
--   values: <tt>full-load</tt> | <tt>cdc</tt> | <tt>full-load-and-cdc</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:taskData:ModifyReplicationTask'</a>,
--   <a>modifyReplicationTask_taskData</a> - Supplemental information that
--   the task requires to migrate the data for certain source and target
--   endpoints. For more information, see <a>Specifying Supplemental Data
--   for Task Settings</a> in the <i>Database Migration Service User
--   Guide.</i>
--   
--   <a>$sel:cdcStopPosition:ModifyReplicationTask'</a>,
--   <a>modifyReplicationTask_cdcStopPosition</a> - Indicates when you want
--   a change data capture (CDC) operation to stop. The value can be either
--   server time or commit time.
--   
--   Server time example: --cdc-stop-position
--   â€œserver_time:2018-02-09T12:12:12â€
--   
--   Commit time example: --cdc-stop-position â€œcommit_time:
--   2018-02-09T12:12:12 â€œ
--   
--   <a>$sel:cdcStartTime:ModifyReplicationTask'</a>,
--   <a>modifyReplicationTask_cdcStartTime</a> - Indicates the start time
--   for a change data capture (CDC) operation. Use either CdcStartTime or
--   CdcStartPosition to specify when you want a CDC operation to start.
--   Specifying both values results in an error.
--   
--   Timestamp Example: --cdc-start-time â€œ2018-03-08T12:12:12â€
--   
--   <a>$sel:replicationTaskArn:ModifyReplicationTask'</a>,
--   <a>modifyReplicationTask_replicationTaskArn</a> - The Amazon Resource
--   Name (ARN) of the replication task.
newModifyReplicationTask :: Text -> ModifyReplicationTask

--   <a>createReplicationInstance_resourceIdentifier</a> - A friendly name
--   for the resource identifier at the end of the <tt>EndpointArn</tt>
--   response parameter that is returned in the created <tt>Endpoint</tt>
--   object. The value for this parameter can have up to 31 characters. It
--   can contain only ASCII letters, digits, and hyphen ('-'). Also, it
--   can't end with a hyphen or contain two consecutive hyphens, and can
--   only begin with a letter, such as <tt>Example-App-ARN1</tt>. For
--   example, this value might result in the <tt>EndpointArn</tt> value
--   <tt>arn:aws:dms:eu-west-1:012345678901:rep:Example-App-ARN1</tt>. If
--   you don't specify a <tt>ResourceIdentifier</tt> value, DMS generates a
--   default identifier value for the end of <tt>EndpointArn</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:CreateReplicationInstance'</a>,
--   <a>createReplicationInstance_tags</a> - One or more tags to be
--   assigned to the replication instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:replicationInstanceIdentifier:CreateReplicationInstance'</a>,
--   <a>createReplicationInstance_replicationInstanceIdentifier</a> - The
--   replication instance identifier. This parameter is stored as a
--   lowercase string.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Must contain 1-63 alphanumeric characters or hyphens.</li>
--   <li>First character must be a letter.</li>
--   <li>Can't end with a hyphen or contain two consecutive hyphens.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   Example: <tt>myrepinstance</tt>
--

--   <tt>"dms.c4.large"</tt>.
--

--   replication instance classes, see <a>Selecting the right DMS
--   replication instance for your migration</a>.

newCertificate :: Certificate

-- | Status of the connection between an endpoint and a replication
--   instance, including Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) and the last error
--   message issued.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newConnection</a> smart constructor.
data Connection
Connection' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Connection

-- | Create a value of <a>Connection</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:Connection'</a>, <a>connection_status</a> - The
--   connection status. This parameter can return one of the following
--   values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>"successful"</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>"testing"</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>"failed"</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>"deleting"</pre></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:replicationInstanceArn:Connection'</a>,
--   <a>connection_replicationInstanceArn</a> - The ARN of the replication
--   instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endpointIdentifier:Connection'</a>,
--   <a>connection_endpointIdentifier</a> - The identifier of the endpoint.
--   Identifiers must begin with a letter and must contain only ASCII
--   letters, digits, and hyphens. They can't end with a hyphen or contain
--   two consecutive hyphens.
--   
--   <a>$sel:replicationInstanceIdentifier:Connection'</a>,
--   <a>connection_replicationInstanceIdentifier</a> - The replication
--   instance identifier. This parameter is stored as a lowercase string.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endpointArn:Connection'</a>, <a>connection_endpointArn</a> -
--   The ARN string that uniquely identifies the endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastFailureMessage:Connection'</a>,
--   <a>connection_lastFailureMessage</a> - The error message when the
--   connection last failed.
newConnection :: Connection

--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDmsTransferSettings</a> smart constructor.
data DmsTransferSettings
DmsTransferSettings' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> DmsTransferSettings

-- | Create a value of <a>DmsTransferSettings</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:serviceAccessRoleArn:DmsTransferSettings'</a>,
--   <a>dmsTransferSettings_serviceAccessRoleArn</a> - The Amazon Resource
--   Name (ARN) used by the service access IAM role. The role must allow
--   the <tt>iam:PassRole</tt> action.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bucketName:DmsTransferSettings'</a>,
--   <a>dmsTransferSettings_bucketName</a> - The name of the S3 bucket to
--   use.
newDmsTransferSettings :: DmsTransferSettings

-- | Provides information that defines a DocumentDB endpoint.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDocDbSettings</a> smart constructor.
data DocDbSettings
DocDbSettings' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> Maybe NestingLevelValue -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Int -> DocDbSettings

-- | Create a value of <a>DocDbSettings</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:serverName:DocDbSettings'</a>, <a>docDbSettings_serverName</a>
--   - The name of the server on the DocumentDB source endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:secretsManagerAccessRoleArn:DocDbSettings'</a>,
--   <a>docDbSettings_secretsManagerAccessRoleArn</a> - The full Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role that specifies DMS as the trusted
--   entity and grants the required permissions to access the value in
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt>. The role must allow the
--   <tt>iam:PassRole</tt> action. <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> has the
--   value of the Amazon Web Services Secrets Manager secret that allows
--   access to the DocumentDB endpoint.
--   
--   You can specify one of two sets of values for these permissions. You
--   can specify the values for this setting and
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecretId</tt>. Or you can specify clear-text values
--   for <tt>UserName</tt>, <tt>Password</tt>, <tt>ServerName</tt>, and
--   <tt>Port</tt>. You can't specify both. For more information on
--   creating this <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> and the
--   <tt>SecretsManagerAccessRoleArn</tt> and
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecretId</tt> required to access it, see <a>Using
--   secrets to access Database Migration Service resources</a> in the
--   <i>Database Migration Service User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:username:DocDbSettings'</a>, <a>docDbSettings_username</a> -
--   The user name you use to access the DocumentDB source endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:kmsKeyId:DocDbSettings'</a>, <a>docDbSettings_kmsKeyId</a> -
--   The KMS key identifier that is used to encrypt the content on the
--   replication instance. If you don't specify a value for the
--   <tt>KmsKeyId</tt> parameter, then DMS uses your default encryption
--   key. KMS creates the default encryption key for your Amazon Web
--   Services account. Your Amazon Web Services account has a different
--   default encryption key for each Amazon Web Services Region.
--   
--   <a>$sel:password:DocDbSettings'</a>, <a>docDbSettings_password</a> -
--   The password for the user account you use to access the DocumentDB
--   source endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:nestingLevel:DocDbSettings'</a>,
--   <a>docDbSettings_nestingLevel</a> - Specifies either document or table
--   mode.
--   
--   Default value is <tt>"none"</tt>. Specify <tt>"none"</tt> to use
--   document mode. Specify <tt>"one"</tt> to use table mode.
--   
--   <a>$sel:databaseName:DocDbSettings'</a>,
--   <a>docDbSettings_databaseName</a> - The database name on the
--   DocumentDB source endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:docsToInvestigate:DocDbSettings'</a>,
--   <a>docDbSettings_docsToInvestigate</a> - Indicates the number of
--   documents to preview to determine the document organization. Use this
--   setting when <tt>NestingLevel</tt> is set to <tt>"one"</tt>.
--   
--   Must be a positive value greater than <tt>0</tt>. Default value is
--   <tt>1000</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:secretsManagerSecretId:DocDbSettings'</a>,
--   <a>docDbSettings_secretsManagerSecretId</a> - The full ARN, partial
--   ARN, or friendly name of the <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> that
--   contains the DocumentDB endpoint connection details.
--   
--   <a>$sel:extractDocId:DocDbSettings'</a>,
--   <a>docDbSettings_extractDocId</a> - Specifies the document ID. Use
--   this setting when <tt>NestingLevel</tt> is set to <tt>"none"</tt>.
--   
--   Default value is <tt>"false"</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:port:DocDbSettings'</a>, <a>docDbSettings_port</a> - The port
--   value for the DocumentDB source endpoint.
newDocDbSettings :: DocDbSettings

newDynamoDbSettings :: Text -> DynamoDbSettings

-- | Provides information that defines an Elasticsearch endpoint.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newElasticsearchSettings</a> smart constructor.
data ElasticsearchSettings
ElasticsearchSettings' :: Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Text -> Text -> ElasticsearchSettings

-- | Create a value of <a>ElasticsearchSettings</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:fullLoadErrorPercentage:ElasticsearchSettings'</a>,
--   <a>elasticsearchSettings_fullLoadErrorPercentage</a> - The maximum
--   percentage of records that can fail to be written before a full load
--   operation stops.
--   
--   To avoid early failure, this counter is only effective after 1000
--   records are transferred. Elasticsearch also has the concept of error
--   monitoring during the last 10 minutes of an Observation Window. If
--   transfer of all records fail in the last 10 minutes, the full load
--   operation stops.
--   
--   <a>$sel:errorRetryDuration:ElasticsearchSettings'</a>,
--   <a>elasticsearchSettings_errorRetryDuration</a> - The maximum number
--   of seconds for which DMS retries failed API requests to the
--   Elasticsearch cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:serviceAccessRoleArn:ElasticsearchSettings'</a>,
--   <a>elasticsearchSettings_serviceAccessRoleArn</a> - The Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN) used by the service to access the IAM role. The
--   role must allow the <tt>iam:PassRole</tt> action.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endpointUri:ElasticsearchSettings'</a>,
--   <a>elasticsearchSettings_endpointUri</a> - The endpoint for the
--   Elasticsearch cluster. DMS uses HTTPS if a transport protocol
--   (http/https) is not specified.
newElasticsearchSettings :: Text -> Text -> ElasticsearchSettings

-- | Describes an endpoint of a database instance in response to operations
--   such as the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>CreateEndpoint</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>DescribeEndpoint</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>ModifyEndpoint</pre></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEndpoint</a> smart constructor.
data Endpoint
Endpoint' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe DmsTransferSettings -> Maybe MySQLSettings -> Maybe Text -> Maybe MicrosoftSQLServerSettings -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe DocDbSettings -> Maybe Text -> Maybe PostgreSQLSettings -> Maybe Text -> Maybe KafkaSettings -> Maybe OracleSettings -> Maybe ReplicationEndpointTypeValue -> Maybe RedshiftSettings -> Maybe ElasticsearchSettings -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe RedisSettings -> Maybe NeptuneSettings -> Maybe IBMDb2Settings -> Maybe Text -> Maybe MongoDbSettings -> Maybe DmsSslModeValue -> Maybe SybaseSettings -> Maybe Text -> Maybe S3Settings -> Maybe KinesisSettings -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe DynamoDbSettings -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Endpoint

-- | Create a value of <a>Endpoint</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:Endpoint'</a>, <a>endpoint_status</a> - The status of
--   the endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dmsTransferSettings:Endpoint'</a>,
--   <a>endpoint_dmsTransferSettings</a> - The settings in JSON format for
--   the DMS transfer type of source endpoint.
--   
--   Possible settings include the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>ServiceAccessRoleArn</tt> - - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN)
--   used by the service access IAM role. The role must allow the
--   <tt>iam:PassRole</tt> action.</li>
--   <li><tt>BucketName</tt> - The name of the S3 bucket to use.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   Shorthand syntax for these settings is as follows:
--   <tt>ServiceAccessRoleArn=string,BucketName=string,</tt>
--   
--   JSON syntax for these settings is as follows: <tt>{
--   "ServiceAccessRoleArn": "string", "BucketName": "string"} </tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:mySQLSettings:Endpoint'</a>, <a>endpoint_mySQLSettings</a> -
--   The settings for the MySQL source and target endpoint. For more
--   information, see the <tt>MySQLSettings</tt> structure.
--   
--   <a>$sel:serverName:Endpoint'</a>, <a>endpoint_serverName</a> - The
--   name of the server at the endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:microsoftSQLServerSettings:Endpoint'</a>,
--   <a>endpoint_microsoftSQLServerSettings</a> - The settings for the
--   Microsoft SQL Server source and target endpoint. For more information,
--   see the <tt>MicrosoftSQLServerSettings</tt> structure.
--   
--   <a>$sel:certificateArn:Endpoint'</a>, <a>endpoint_certificateArn</a> -
--   The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) used for SSL connection to the
--   endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:serviceAccessRoleArn:Endpoint'</a>,
--   <a>endpoint_serviceAccessRoleArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN)
--   used by the service to access the IAM role. The role must allow the
--   <tt>iam:PassRole</tt> action.
--   
--   <a>$sel:docDbSettings:Endpoint'</a>, <a>endpoint_docDbSettings</a> -
--   Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:engineDisplayName:Endpoint'</a>,
--   <a>endpoint_engineDisplayName</a> - The expanded name for the engine
--   name. For example, if the <tt>EngineName</tt> parameter is "aurora,"
--   this value would be "Amazon Aurora MySQL."
--   
--   <a>$sel:postgreSQLSettings:Endpoint'</a>,
--   <a>endpoint_postgreSQLSettings</a> - The settings for the PostgreSQL
--   source and target endpoint. For more information, see the
--   <tt>PostgreSQLSettings</tt> structure.
--   
--   <a>$sel:extraConnectionAttributes:Endpoint'</a>,
--   <a>endpoint_extraConnectionAttributes</a> - Additional connection
--   attributes used to connect to the endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:kafkaSettings:Endpoint'</a>, <a>endpoint_kafkaSettings</a> -
--   The settings for the Apache Kafka target endpoint. For more
--   information, see the <tt>KafkaSettings</tt> structure.
--   
--   <a>$sel:oracleSettings:Endpoint'</a>, <a>endpoint_oracleSettings</a> -
--   The settings for the Oracle source and target endpoint. For more
--   information, see the <tt>OracleSettings</tt> structure.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endpointType:Endpoint'</a>, <a>endpoint_endpointType</a> - The
--   type of endpoint. Valid values are <tt>source</tt> and
--   <tt>target</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:redshiftSettings:Endpoint'</a>,
--   <a>endpoint_redshiftSettings</a> - Settings for the Amazon Redshift
--   endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:elasticsearchSettings:Endpoint'</a>,
--   <a>endpoint_elasticsearchSettings</a> - The settings for the
--   Elasticsearch source endpoint. For more information, see the
--   <tt>ElasticsearchSettings</tt> structure.
--   
--   <a>$sel:username:Endpoint'</a>, <a>endpoint_username</a> - The user
--   name used to connect to the endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:externalTableDefinition:Endpoint'</a>,
--   <a>endpoint_externalTableDefinition</a> - The external table
--   definition.
--   
--   <a>$sel:engineName:Endpoint'</a>, <a>endpoint_engineName</a> - The
--   database engine name. Valid values, depending on the EndpointType,
--   include <tt>"mysql"</tt>, <tt>"oracle"</tt>, <tt>"postgres"</tt>,
--   <tt>"mariadb"</tt>, <tt>"aurora"</tt>, <tt>"aurora-postgresql"</tt>,
--   <tt>"redshift"</tt>, <tt>"s3"</tt>, <tt>"db2"</tt>,
--   <tt>"azuredb"</tt>, <tt>"sybase"</tt>, <tt>"dynamodb"</tt>,
--   <tt>"mongodb"</tt>, <tt>"kinesis"</tt>, <tt>"kafka"</tt>,
--   <tt>"elasticsearch"</tt>, <tt>"documentdb"</tt>, <tt>"sqlserver"</tt>,
--   and <tt>"neptune"</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:redisSettings:Endpoint'</a>, <a>endpoint_redisSettings</a> -
--   The settings for the Redis target endpoint. For more information, see
--   the <tt>RedisSettings</tt> structure.
--   
--   <a>$sel:neptuneSettings:Endpoint'</a>, <a>endpoint_neptuneSettings</a>
--   - The settings for the Amazon Neptune target endpoint. For more
--   information, see the <tt>NeptuneSettings</tt> structure.
--   
--   <a>$sel:iBMDb2Settings:Endpoint'</a>, <a>endpoint_iBMDb2Settings</a> -
--   The settings for the IBM Db2 LUW source endpoint. For more
--   information, see the <tt>IBMDb2Settings</tt> structure.
--   
--   <a>$sel:kmsKeyId:Endpoint'</a>, <a>endpoint_kmsKeyId</a> - An KMS key
--   identifier that is used to encrypt the connection parameters for the
--   endpoint.
--   
--   If you don't specify a value for the <tt>KmsKeyId</tt> parameter, then
--   DMS uses your default encryption key.
--   
--   KMS creates the default encryption key for your Amazon Web Services
--   account. Your Amazon Web Services account has a different default
--   encryption key for each Amazon Web Services Region.
--   
--   <a>$sel:mongoDbSettings:Endpoint'</a>, <a>endpoint_mongoDbSettings</a>
--   - The settings for the MongoDB source endpoint. For more information,
--   see the <tt>MongoDbSettings</tt> structure.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sslMode:Endpoint'</a>, <a>endpoint_sslMode</a> - The SSL mode
--   used to connect to the endpoint. The default value is <tt>none</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sybaseSettings:Endpoint'</a>, <a>endpoint_sybaseSettings</a> -
--   The settings for the SAP ASE source and target endpoint. For more
--   information, see the <tt>SybaseSettings</tt> structure.
--   
--   <a>$sel:databaseName:Endpoint'</a>, <a>endpoint_databaseName</a> - The
--   name of the database at the endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:s3Settings:Endpoint'</a>, <a>endpoint_s3Settings</a> - The
--   settings for the S3 target endpoint. For more information, see the
--   <tt>S3Settings</tt> structure.
--   
--   <a>$sel:kinesisSettings:Endpoint'</a>, <a>endpoint_kinesisSettings</a>
--   - The settings for the Amazon Kinesis target endpoint. For more
--   information, see the <tt>KinesisSettings</tt> structure.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endpointIdentifier:Endpoint'</a>,
--   <a>endpoint_endpointIdentifier</a> - The database endpoint identifier.
--   Identifiers must begin with a letter and must contain only ASCII
--   letters, digits, and hyphens. They can't end with a hyphen or contain
--   two consecutive hyphens.
--   
--   <a>$sel:externalId:Endpoint'</a>, <a>endpoint_externalId</a> - Value
--   returned by a call to CreateEndpoint that can be used for
--   cross-account validation. Use it on a subsequent call to
--   CreateEndpoint to create the endpoint with a cross-account.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dynamoDbSettings:Endpoint'</a>,
--   <a>endpoint_dynamoDbSettings</a> - The settings for the DynamoDB
--   target endpoint. For more information, see the
--   <tt>DynamoDBSettings</tt> structure.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endpointArn:Endpoint'</a>, <a>endpoint_endpointArn</a> - The
--   Amazon Resource Name (ARN) string that uniquely identifies the
--   endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:port:Endpoint'</a>, <a>endpoint_port</a> - The port value used
--   to access the endpoint.
newEndpoint :: Endpoint

-- | Endpoint settings.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEndpointSetting</a> smart constructor.
data EndpointSetting
EndpointSetting' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe EndpointSettingTypeValue -> Maybe [Text] -> EndpointSetting

-- | Create a value of <a>EndpointSetting</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:sensitive:EndpointSetting'</a>,
--   <a>endpointSetting_sensitive</a> - A value that marks this endpoint
--   setting as sensitive.
--   
--   <a>$sel:intValueMax:EndpointSetting'</a>,
--   <a>endpointSetting_intValueMax</a> - The maximum value of an endpoint
--   setting that is of type <tt>int</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:applicability:EndpointSetting'</a>,
--   <a>endpointSetting_applicability</a> - The relevance or validity of an
--   endpoint setting for an engine name and its endpoint type.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:EndpointSetting'</a>, <a>endpointSetting_name</a> - The
--   name that you want to give the endpoint settings.
--   
--   <a>$sel:intValueMin:EndpointSetting'</a>,
--   <a>endpointSetting_intValueMin</a> - The minimum value of an endpoint
--   setting that is of type <tt>int</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:units:EndpointSetting'</a>, <a>endpointSetting_units</a> - The
--   unit of measure for this endpoint setting.
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultValue:EndpointSetting'</a>,
--   <a>endpointSetting_defaultValue</a> - The default value of the
--   endpoint setting if no value is specified using
--   <tt>CreateEndpoint</tt> or <tt>ModifyEndpoint</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':EndpointSetting'</a>, <a>endpointSetting_type</a> - The
--   type of endpoint. Valid values are <tt>source</tt> and
--   <tt>target</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:enumValues:EndpointSetting'</a>,
--   <a>endpointSetting_enumValues</a> - Enumerated values to use for this
--   endpoint.
newEndpointSetting :: EndpointSetting

-- | Describes an identifiable significant activity that affects a
--   replication instance or task. This object can provide the message, the
--   available event categories, the date and source of the event, and the
--   DMS resource type.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEvent</a> smart constructor.
data Event
Event' :: Maybe SourceType -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> Event

-- | Create a value of <a>Event</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:sourceType:Event'</a>, <a>event_sourceType</a> - The type of
--   DMS resource that generates events.
--   
--   Valid values: replication-instance | endpoint | replication-task
--   
--   <a>$sel:sourceIdentifier:Event'</a>, <a>event_sourceIdentifier</a> -
--   The identifier of an event source.
--   
--   <a>$sel:date:Event'</a>, <a>event_date</a> - The date of the event.
--   
--   <a>$sel:eventCategories:Event'</a>, <a>event_eventCategories</a> - The
--   event categories available for the specified source type.
--   
--   <a>$sel:message:Event'</a>, <a>event_message</a> - The event message.
newEvent :: Event

-- | Lists categories of events subscribed to, and generated by, the
--   applicable DMS resource type. This data type appears in response to
--   the <a>DescribeEventCategories</a> action.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEventCategoryGroup</a> smart constructor.
data EventCategoryGroup
EventCategoryGroup' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> EventCategoryGroup

-- | Create a value of <a>EventCategoryGroup</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:sourceType:EventCategoryGroup'</a>,
--   <a>eventCategoryGroup_sourceType</a> - The type of DMS resource that
--   generates events.
--   
--   Valid values: replication-instance | replication-server |
--   security-group | replication-task
--   
--   <a>$sel:eventCategories:EventCategoryGroup'</a>,
--   <a>eventCategoryGroup_eventCategories</a> - A list of event categories
--   from a source type that you've chosen.
newEventCategoryGroup :: EventCategoryGroup

-- | Describes an event notification subscription created by the
--   <tt>CreateEventSubscription</tt> operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEventSubscription</a> smart constructor.
data EventSubscription
EventSubscription' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe [Text] -> EventSubscription

-- | Create a value of <a>EventSubscription</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:EventSubscription'</a>, <a>eventSubscription_status</a>
--   - The status of the DMS event notification subscription.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   Can be one of the following: creating | modifying | deleting | active
--   | no-permission | topic-not-exist
--   
--   The status "no-permission" indicates that DMS no longer has permission
--   to post to the SNS topic. The status "topic-not-exist" indicates that
--   the topic was deleted after the subscription was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:customerAwsId:EventSubscription'</a>,
--   <a>eventSubscription_customerAwsId</a> - The Amazon Web Services
--   customer account associated with the DMS event notification
--   subscription.
--   
--   <a>$sel:custSubscriptionId:EventSubscription'</a>,
--   <a>eventSubscription_custSubscriptionId</a> - The DMS event
--   notification subscription Id.
--   
--   <a>$sel:snsTopicArn:EventSubscription'</a>,
--   <a>eventSubscription_snsTopicArn</a> - The topic ARN of the DMS event
--   notification subscription.
--   
--   <a>$sel:enabled:EventSubscription'</a>,
--   <a>eventSubscription_enabled</a> - Boolean value that indicates if the
--   event subscription is enabled.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sourceType:EventSubscription'</a>,
--   <a>eventSubscription_sourceType</a> - The type of DMS resource that
--   generates events.
--   
--   Valid values: replication-instance | replication-server |
--   security-group | replication-task
--   
--   <a>$sel:subscriptionCreationTime:EventSubscription'</a>,
--   <a>eventSubscription_subscriptionCreationTime</a> - The time the DMS
--   event notification subscription was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:eventCategoriesList:EventSubscription'</a>,
--   <a>eventSubscription_eventCategoriesList</a> - A lists of event
--   categories.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sourceIdsList:EventSubscription'</a>,
--   <a>eventSubscription_sourceIdsList</a> - A list of source Ids for the
--   event subscription.
newEventSubscription :: EventSubscription

-- | Identifies the name and value of a filter object. This filter is used
--   to limit the number and type of DMS objects that are returned for a
--   particular <tt>Describe*</tt> call or similar operation. Filters are
--   used as an optional parameter for certain API operations.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newFilter</a> smart constructor.
data Filter
Filter' :: Text -> [Text] -> Filter

-- | Create a value of <a>Filter</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:Filter'</a>, <a>filter_name</a> - The name of the filter
--   as specified for a <tt>Describe*</tt> or similar operation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:values:Filter'</a>, <a>filter_values</a> - The filter value,
--   which can specify one or more values used to narrow the returned
--   results.
newFilter :: Text -> Filter

-- | Provides information that defines an IBM Db2 LUW endpoint.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newIBMDb2Settings</a> smart constructor.
data IBMDb2Settings
IBMDb2Settings' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> IBMDb2Settings

-- | Create a value of <a>IBMDb2Settings</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:serverName:IBMDb2Settings'</a>,
--   <a>iBMDb2Settings_serverName</a> - Fully qualified domain name of the
--   endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:currentLsn:IBMDb2Settings'</a>,
--   <a>iBMDb2Settings_currentLsn</a> - For ongoing replication (CDC), use
--   CurrentLSN to specify a log sequence number (LSN) where you want the
--   replication to start.
--   
--   <a>$sel:setDataCaptureChanges:IBMDb2Settings'</a>,
--   <a>iBMDb2Settings_setDataCaptureChanges</a> - Enables ongoing
--   replication (CDC) as a BOOLEAN value. The default is true.
--   
--   <a>$sel:secretsManagerAccessRoleArn:IBMDb2Settings'</a>,
--   <a>iBMDb2Settings_secretsManagerAccessRoleArn</a> - The full Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role that specifies DMS as the trusted
--   entity and grants the required permissions to access the value in
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt>. The role must allow the
--   <tt>iam:PassRole</tt> action. <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> has the
--   value of the Amazon Web Services Secrets Manager secret that allows
--   access to the Db2 LUW endpoint.
--   
--   You can specify one of two sets of values for these permissions. You
--   can specify the values for this setting and
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecretId</tt>. Or you can specify clear-text values
--   for <tt>UserName</tt>, <tt>Password</tt>, <tt>ServerName</tt>, and
--   <tt>Port</tt>. You can't specify both. For more information on
--   creating this <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> and the
--   <tt>SecretsManagerAccessRoleArn</tt> and
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecretId</tt> required to access it, see <a>Using
--   secrets to access Database Migration Service resources</a> in the
--   <i>Database Migration Service User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:username:IBMDb2Settings'</a>, <a>iBMDb2Settings_username</a> -
--   Endpoint connection user name.
--   
--   <a>$sel:password:IBMDb2Settings'</a>, <a>iBMDb2Settings_password</a> -
--   Endpoint connection password.
--   
--   <a>$sel:databaseName:IBMDb2Settings'</a>,
--   <a>iBMDb2Settings_databaseName</a> - Database name for the endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:secretsManagerSecretId:IBMDb2Settings'</a>,
--   <a>iBMDb2Settings_secretsManagerSecretId</a> - The full ARN, partial
--   ARN, or friendly name of the <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> that
--   contains the Db2 LUW endpoint connection details.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxKBytesPerRead:IBMDb2Settings'</a>,
--   <a>iBMDb2Settings_maxKBytesPerRead</a> - Maximum number of bytes per
--   read, as a NUMBER value. The default is 64 KB.
--   
--   <a>$sel:port:IBMDb2Settings'</a>, <a>iBMDb2Settings_port</a> -
--   Endpoint TCP port. The default value is 50000.
newIBMDb2Settings :: IBMDb2Settings

-- | Provides information that describes an Apache Kafka endpoint. This
--   information includes the output format of records applied to the
--   endpoint and details of transaction and control table data
--   information.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newKafkaSettings</a> smart constructor.
data KafkaSettings
KafkaSettings' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe MessageFormatValue -> Maybe KafkaSecurityProtocol -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Bool -> KafkaSettings

-- | Create a value of <a>KafkaSettings</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:sslClientKeyArn:KafkaSettings'</a>,
--   <a>kafkaSettings_sslClientKeyArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN)
--   for the client private key used to securely connect to a Kafka target
--   endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:includeTransactionDetails:KafkaSettings'</a>,
--   <a>kafkaSettings_includeTransactionDetails</a> - Provides detailed
--   transaction information from the source database. This information
--   includes a commit timestamp, a log position, and values for
--   <tt>transaction_id</tt>, previous <tt>transaction_id</tt>, and
--   <tt>transaction_record_id</tt> (the record offset within a
--   transaction). The default is <tt>false</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:includeTableAlterOperations:KafkaSettings'</a>,
--   <a>kafkaSettings_includeTableAlterOperations</a> - Includes any data
--   definition language (DDL) operations that change the table in the
--   control data, such as <tt>rename-table</tt>, <tt>drop-table</tt>,
--   <tt>add-column</tt>, <tt>drop-column</tt>, and <tt>rename-column</tt>.
--   The default is <tt>false</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sslClientCertificateArn:KafkaSettings'</a>,
--   <a>kafkaSettings_sslClientCertificateArn</a> - The Amazon Resource
--   Name (ARN) of the client certificate used to securely connect to a
--   Kafka target endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sslCaCertificateArn:KafkaSettings'</a>,
--   <a>kafkaSettings_sslCaCertificateArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name
--   (ARN) for the private certificate authority (CA) cert that DMS uses to
--   securely connect to your Kafka target endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:partitionIncludeSchemaTable:KafkaSettings'</a>,
--   <a>kafkaSettings_partitionIncludeSchemaTable</a> - Prefixes schema and
--   table names to partition values, when the partition type is
--   <tt>primary-key-type</tt>. Doing this increases data distribution
--   among Kafka partitions. For example, suppose that a SysBench schema
--   has thousands of tables and each table has only limited range for a
--   primary key. In this case, the same primary key is sent from thousands
--   of tables to the same partition, which causes throttling. The default
--   is <tt>false</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:topic:KafkaSettings'</a>, <a>kafkaSettings_topic</a> - The
--   topic to which you migrate the data. If you don't specify a topic, DMS
--   specifies <tt>"kafka-default-topic"</tt> as the migration topic.
--   
--   <a>$sel:includeControlDetails:KafkaSettings'</a>,
--   <a>kafkaSettings_includeControlDetails</a> - Shows detailed control
--   information for table definition, column definition, and table and
--   column changes in the Kafka message output. The default is
--   <tt>false</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:noHexPrefix:KafkaSettings'</a>,
--   <a>kafkaSettings_noHexPrefix</a> - Set this optional parameter to
--   <tt>true</tt> to avoid adding a '0x' prefix to raw data in hexadecimal
--   format. For example, by default, DMS adds a '0x' prefix to the LOB
--   column type in hexadecimal format moving from an Oracle source to a
--   Kafka target. Use the <tt>NoHexPrefix</tt> endpoint setting to enable
--   migration of RAW data type columns without adding the '0x' prefix.
--   
--   <a>$sel:saslPassword:KafkaSettings'</a>,
--   <a>kafkaSettings_saslPassword</a> - The secure password you created
--   when you first set up your MSK cluster to validate a client identity
--   and make an encrypted connection between server and client using
--   SASL-SSL authentication.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sslClientKeyPassword:KafkaSettings'</a>,
--   <a>kafkaSettings_sslClientKeyPassword</a> - The password for the
--   client private key used to securely connect to a Kafka target
--   endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:includePartitionValue:KafkaSettings'</a>,
--   <a>kafkaSettings_includePartitionValue</a> - Shows the partition value
--   within the Kafka message output unless the partition type is
--   <tt>schema-table-type</tt>. The default is <tt>false</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:messageFormat:KafkaSettings'</a>,
--   <a>kafkaSettings_messageFormat</a> - The output format for the records
--   created on the endpoint. The message format is <tt>JSON</tt> (default)
--   or <tt>JSON_UNFORMATTED</tt> (a single line with no tab).
--   
--   <a>$sel:securityProtocol:KafkaSettings'</a>,
--   <a>kafkaSettings_securityProtocol</a> - Set secure connection to a
--   Kafka target endpoint using Transport Layer Security (TLS). Options
--   include <tt>ssl-encryption</tt>, <tt>ssl-authentication</tt>, and
--   <tt>sasl-ssl</tt>. <tt>sasl-ssl</tt> requires <tt>SaslUsername</tt>
--   and <tt>SaslPassword</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:saslUsername:KafkaSettings'</a>,
--   <a>kafkaSettings_saslUsername</a> - The secure user name you created
--   when you first set up your MSK cluster to validate a client identity
--   and make an encrypted connection between server and client using
--   SASL-SSL authentication.
--   
--   <a>$sel:broker:KafkaSettings'</a>, <a>kafkaSettings_broker</a> - A
--   comma-separated list of one or more broker locations in your Kafka
--   cluster that host your Kafka instance. Specify each broker location in
--   the form <tt> broker-hostname-or-ip:port </tt>. For example,
--   <tt>"ec2-12-345-678-901.compute-1.amazonaws.com:2345"</tt>. For more
--   information and examples of specifying a list of broker locations, see
--   <a>Using Apache Kafka as a target for Database Migration Service</a>
--   in the <i>Database Migration Service User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:messageMaxBytes:KafkaSettings'</a>,
--   <a>kafkaSettings_messageMaxBytes</a> - The maximum size in bytes for
--   records created on the endpoint The default is 1,000,000.
--   
--   <a>$sel:includeNullAndEmpty:KafkaSettings'</a>,
--   <a>kafkaSettings_includeNullAndEmpty</a> - Include NULL and empty
--   columns for records migrated to the endpoint. The default is
--   <tt>false</tt>.
newKafkaSettings :: KafkaSettings

-- | Provides information that describes an Amazon Kinesis Data Stream
--   endpoint. This information includes the output format of records
--   applied to the endpoint and details of transaction and control table
--   data information.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newKinesisSettings</a> smart constructor.
data KinesisSettings
KinesisSettings' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe MessageFormatValue -> Maybe Bool -> KinesisSettings

-- | Create a value of <a>KinesisSettings</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:includeTransactionDetails:KinesisSettings'</a>,
--   <a>kinesisSettings_includeTransactionDetails</a> - Provides detailed
--   transaction information from the source database. This information
--   includes a commit timestamp, a log position, and values for
--   <tt>transaction_id</tt>, previous <tt>transaction_id</tt>, and
--   <tt>transaction_record_id</tt> (the record offset within a
--   transaction). The default is <tt>false</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:includeTableAlterOperations:KinesisSettings'</a>,
--   <a>kinesisSettings_includeTableAlterOperations</a> - Includes any data
--   definition language (DDL) operations that change the table in the
--   control data, such as <tt>rename-table</tt>, <tt>drop-table</tt>,
--   <tt>add-column</tt>, <tt>drop-column</tt>, and <tt>rename-column</tt>.
--   The default is <tt>false</tt>.

--   and table names to partition values, when the partition type is
--   <tt>primary-key-type</tt>. Doing this increases data distribution
--   among Kinesis shards. For example, suppose that a SysBench schema has
--   thousands of tables and each table has only limited range for a
--   primary key. In this case, the same primary key is sent from thousands
--   of tables to the same shard, which causes throttling. The default is
--   <tt>false</tt>.
