-- | Provides information that describes a replication task created by the
--   <tt>CreateReplicationTask</tt> operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newReplicationTask</a> smart constructor.
data ReplicationTask
ReplicationTask' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe MigrationTypeValue -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ReplicationTaskStats -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> ReplicationTask

-- | Create a value of <a>ReplicationTask</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:replicationTaskSettings:ReplicationTask'</a>,
--   <a>replicationTask_replicationTaskSettings</a> - The settings for the
--   replication task.
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:ReplicationTask'</a>, <a>replicationTask_status</a> -
--   The status of the replication task. This response parameter can return
--   one of the following values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>"moving"</tt> â€“ The task is being moved in response to running
--   the <a>MoveReplicationTask</a> operation.</li>
--   <li><tt>"creating"</tt> â€“ The task is being created in response to
--   running the <a>CreateReplicationTask</a> operation.</li>
--   <li><tt>"deleting"</tt> â€“ The task is being deleted in response to
--   running the <a>DeleteReplicationTask</a> operation.</li>
--   <li><tt>"failed"</tt> â€“ The task failed to successfully complete the
--   database migration in response to running the
--   <a>StartReplicationTask</a> operation.</li>
--   <li><tt>"failed-move"</tt> â€“ The task failed to move in response to
--   running the <a>MoveReplicationTask</a> operation.</li>
--   <li><tt>"modifying"</tt> â€“ The task definition is being modified in
--   response to running the <a>ModifyReplicationTask</a> operation.</li>
--   <li><tt>"ready"</tt> â€“ The task is in a <tt>ready</tt> state where it
--   can respond to other task operations, such as
--   <a>StartReplicationTask</a> or <a>DeleteReplicationTask</a> .</li>
--   <li><tt>"running"</tt> â€“ The task is performing a database migration
--   in response to running the <a>StartReplicationTask</a> operation.</li>
--   <li><tt>"starting"</tt> â€“ The task is preparing to perform a database
--   migration in response to running the <a>StartReplicationTask</a>
--   operation.</li>
--   <li><tt>"stopped"</tt> â€“ The task has stopped in response to running
--   the <a>StopReplicationTask</a> operation.</li>
--   <li><tt>"stopping"</tt> â€“ The task is preparing to stop in response to
--   running the <a>StopReplicationTask</a> operation.</li>
--   <li><tt>"testing"</tt> â€“ The database migration specified for this
--   task is being tested in response to running either the
--   <a>StartReplicationTaskAssessmentRun</a> or the
--   <a>StartReplicationTaskAssessment</a>
--   operation.<a>StartReplicationTaskAssessmentRun</a> is an improved
--   premigration task assessment operation. The
--   <a>StartReplicationTaskAssessment</a> operation assesses data type
--   compatibility only between the source and target database of a given
--   migration task. In contrast, <a>StartReplicationTaskAssessmentRun</a>
--   enables you to specify a variety of premigration task assessments in
--   addition to data type compatibility. These assessments include ones
--   for the validity of primary key definitions and likely issues with
--   database migration performance, among others.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:stopReason:ReplicationTask'</a>,
--   <a>replicationTask_stopReason</a> - The reason the replication task
--   was stopped. This response parameter can return one of the following
--   values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>"STOP_REASON_FULL_LOAD_COMPLETED"</tt> â€“ Full-load migration
--   completed.</li>
--   <li><tt>"STOP_REASON_CACHED_CHANGES_APPLIED"</tt> â€“ Change data
--   capture (CDC) load completed.</li>
--   <li><tt>"STOP_REASON_CACHED_CHANGES_NOT_APPLIED"</tt> â€“ In a full-load
--   and CDC migration, the full load stopped as specified before starting
--   the CDC migration.</li>
--   <li><tt>"STOP_REASON_SERVER_TIME"</tt> â€“ The migration stopped at the
--   specified server time.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:targetEndpointArn:ReplicationTask'</a>,
--   <a>replicationTask_targetEndpointArn</a> - The ARN that uniquely
--   identifies the endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:replicationTaskIdentifier:ReplicationTask'</a>,
--   <a>replicationTask_replicationTaskIdentifier</a> - The user-assigned
--   replication task identifier or name.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Must contain 1-255 alphanumeric characters or hyphens.</li>
--   <li>First character must be a letter.</li>
--   <li>Cannot end with a hyphen or contain two consecutive hyphens.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:cdcStartPosition:ReplicationTask'</a>,
--   <a>replicationTask_cdcStartPosition</a> - Indicates when you want a
--   change data capture (CDC) operation to start. Use either
--   <tt>CdcStartPosition</tt> or <tt>CdcStartTime</tt> to specify when you
--   want the CDC operation to start. Specifying both values results in an
--   error.
--   
--   The value can be in date, checkpoint, or LSN/SCN format.
--   
--   Date Example: --cdc-start-position â€œ2018-03-08T12:12:12â€
--   
--   Checkpoint Example: --cdc-start-position
--   "checkpoint:V1mysql-bin-changelog.157832:1975:-1:2002:677883278264080:mysql-bin-changelog.157832:187600#93"
--   
--   LSN Example: --cdc-start-position â€œmysql-bin-changelog.000024:373â€
--   
--   <a>$sel:replicationTaskStartDate:ReplicationTask'</a>,
--   <a>replicationTask_replicationTaskStartDate</a> - The date the
--   replication task is scheduled to start.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sourceEndpointArn:ReplicationTask'</a>,
--   <a>replicationTask_sourceEndpointArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name
--   (ARN) that uniquely identifies the endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:recoveryCheckpoint:ReplicationTask'</a>,
--   <a>replicationTask_recoveryCheckpoint</a> - Indicates the last
--   checkpoint that occurred during a change data capture (CDC) operation.
--   You can provide this value to the <tt>CdcStartPosition</tt> parameter
--   to start a CDC operation that begins at that checkpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tableMappings:ReplicationTask'</a>,
--   <a>replicationTask_tableMappings</a> - Table mappings specified in the
--   task.
--   
--   <a>$sel:targetReplicationInstanceArn:ReplicationTask'</a>,
--   <a>replicationTask_targetReplicationInstanceArn</a> - The ARN of the
--   replication instance to which this task is moved in response to
--   running the <a>MoveReplicationTask</a> operation. Otherwise, this
--   response parameter isn't a member of the <tt>ReplicationTask</tt>
--   object.
--   
--   <a>$sel:replicationTaskCreationDate:ReplicationTask'</a>,
--   <a>replicationTask_replicationTaskCreationDate</a> - The date the
--   replication task was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:migrationType:ReplicationTask'</a>,
--   <a>replicationTask_migrationType</a> - The type of migration.
--   
--   <a>$sel:replicationTaskArn:ReplicationTask'</a>,
--   <a>replicationTask_replicationTaskArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name
--   (ARN) of the replication task.
--   
--   <a>$sel:taskData:ReplicationTask'</a>, <a>replicationTask_taskData</a>
--   - Supplemental information that the task requires to migrate the data
--   for certain source and target endpoints. For more information, see
--   <a>Specifying Supplemental Data for Task Settings</a> in the
--   <i>Database Migration Service User Guide.</i>
--   
--   <a>$sel:cdcStopPosition:ReplicationTask'</a>,
--   <a>replicationTask_cdcStopPosition</a> - Indicates when you want a
--   change data capture (CDC) operation to stop. The value can be either
--   server time or commit time.
--   
--   Server time example: --cdc-stop-position
--   â€œserver_time:2018-02-09T12:12:12â€
--   
--   Commit time example: --cdc-stop-position â€œcommit_time:
--   2018-02-09T12:12:12 â€œ
--   
--   <a>$sel:replicationTaskStats:ReplicationTask'</a>,
--   <a>replicationTask_replicationTaskStats</a> - The statistics for the
--   task, including elapsed time, tables loaded, and table errors.
--   
--   <a>$sel:replicationInstanceArn:ReplicationTask'</a>,
--   <a>replicationTask_replicationInstanceArn</a> - The ARN of the
--   replication instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastFailureMessage:ReplicationTask'</a>,
--   <a>replicationTask_lastFailureMessage</a> - The last error (failure)
--   message generated for the replication task.
newReplicationTask :: ReplicationTask

ReplicationTaskAssessmentRun' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe ReplicationTaskAssessmentRunProgress -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> ReplicationTaskAssessmentRun

-- | Create a value of <a>ReplicationTaskAssessmentRun</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:ReplicationTaskAssessmentRun'</a>,
--   <a>replicationTaskAssessmentRun_status</a> - Assessment run status.
--   
--   This status can have one of the following values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>"cancelling"</tt> â€“ The assessment run was canceled by the
--   <tt>CancelReplicationTaskAssessmentRun</tt> operation.</li>
--   <li><tt>"deleting"</tt> â€“ The assessment run was deleted by the
--   <tt>DeleteReplicationTaskAssessmentRun</tt> operation.</li>
--   <li><tt>"failed"</tt> â€“ At least one individual assessment completed
--   with a <tt>failed</tt> status.</li>
--   <li><tt>"error-provisioning"</tt> â€“ An internal error occurred while
--   resources were provisioned (during <tt>provisioning</tt> status).</li>
--   <li><tt>"error-executing"</tt> â€“ An internal error occurred while
--   individual assessments ran (during <tt>running</tt> status).</li>
--   <li><tt>"invalid state"</tt> â€“ The assessment run is in an unknown
--   state.</li>
--   <li><tt>"passed"</tt> â€“ All individual assessments have completed, and
--   none has a <tt>failed</tt> status.</li>
--   <li><tt>"provisioning"</tt> â€“ Resources required to run individual
--   assessments are being provisioned.</li>
--   <li><tt>"running"</tt> â€“ Individual assessments are being run.</li>
--   <li><tt>"starting"</tt> â€“ The assessment run is starting, but
--   resources are not yet being provisioned for individual
--   assessments.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:serviceAccessRoleArn:ReplicationTaskAssessmentRun'</a>,

--   Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of this assessment run.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastFailureMessage:ReplicationTaskAssessmentRun'</a>,
--   <a>replicationTaskAssessmentRun_lastFailureMessage</a> - Last message
--   generated by an individual assessment failure.
newReplicationTaskAssessmentRun :: ReplicationTaskAssessmentRun

-- | Settings for exporting data to Amazon S3.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newS3Settings</a> smart constructor.
data S3Settings
S3Settings' :: Maybe ParquetVersionValue -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe DataFormatValue -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe EncodingTypeValue -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe EncryptionModeValue -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe DatePartitionDelimiterValue -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe CannedAclForObjectsValue -> Maybe CompressionTypeValue -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe DatePartitionSequenceValue -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> S3Settings

-- | Create a value of <a>S3Settings</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:parquetVersion:S3Settings'</a>,
--   <a>s3Settings_parquetVersion</a> - The version of the Apache Parquet
--   format that you want to use: <tt>parquet_1_0</tt> (the default) or
--   <tt>parquet_2_0</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:preserveTransactions:S3Settings'</a>,
--   <a>s3Settings_preserveTransactions</a> - If set to <tt>true</tt>, DMS
--   saves the transaction order for a change data capture (CDC) load on
--   the Amazon S3 target specified by <a>CdcPath</a> . For more
--   information, see <a>Capturing data changes (CDC) including transaction
--   order on the S3 target</a>.
--   
--   This setting is supported in DMS versions 3.4.2 and later.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxFileSize:S3Settings'</a>, <a>s3Settings_maxFileSize</a> - A
--   value that specifies the maximum size (in KB) of any .csv file to be
--   created while migrating to an S3 target during full load.
--   
--   The default value is 1,048,576 KB (1 GB). Valid values include 1 to
--   1,048,576.
--   
--   <a>$sel:csvNoSupValue:S3Settings'</a>, <a>s3Settings_csvNoSupValue</a>
--   - This setting only applies if your Amazon S3 output files during a
--   change data capture (CDC) load are written in .csv format. If
--   <a>UseCsvNoSupValue</a> is set to true, specify a string value that
--   you want DMS to use for all columns not included in the supplemental
--   log. If you do not specify a string value, DMS uses the null value for
--   these columns regardless of the <tt>UseCsvNoSupValue</tt> setting.
--   
--   This setting is supported in DMS versions 3.4.1 and later.
--   
--   <a>$sel:rfc4180:S3Settings'</a>, <a>s3Settings_rfc4180</a> - For an S3
--   source, when this value is set to <tt>true</tt> or <tt>y</tt>, each
--   leading double quotation mark has to be followed by an ending double
--   quotation mark. This formatting complies with RFC 4180. When this
--   value is set to <tt>false</tt> or <tt>n</tt>, string literals are
--   copied to the target as is. In this case, a delimiter (row or column)
--   signals the end of the field. Thus, you can't use a delimiter as part
--   of the string, because it signals the end of the value.
--   
--   For an S3 target, an optional parameter used to set behavior to comply
--   with RFC 4180 for data migrated to Amazon S3 using .csv file format
--   only. When this value is set to <tt>true</tt> or <tt>y</tt> using
--   Amazon S3 as a target, if the data has quotation marks or newline
--   characters in it, DMS encloses the entire column with an additional
--   pair of double quotation marks ("). Every quotation mark within the
--   data is repeated twice.
--   
--   The default value is <tt>true</tt>. Valid values include
--   <tt>true</tt>, <tt>false</tt>, <tt>y</tt>, and <tt>n</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:parquetTimestampInMillisecond:S3Settings'</a>,
--   <a>s3Settings_parquetTimestampInMillisecond</a> - A value that
--   specifies the precision of any <tt>TIMESTAMP</tt> column values that
--   are written to an Amazon S3 object file in .parquet format.
--   
--   DMS supports the <tt>ParquetTimestampInMillisecond</tt> parameter in
--   versions 3.1.4 and later.
--   
--   When <tt>ParquetTimestampInMillisecond</tt> is set to <tt>true</tt> or
--   <tt>y</tt>, DMS writes all <tt>TIMESTAMP</tt> columns in a .parquet
--   formatted file with millisecond precision. Otherwise, DMS writes them
--   with microsecond precision.
--   
--   Currently, Amazon Athena and Glue can handle only millisecond
--   precision for <tt>TIMESTAMP</tt> values. Set this parameter to
--   <tt>true</tt> for S3 endpoint object files that are .parquet formatted
--   only if you plan to query or process the data with Athena or Glue.
--   
--   DMS writes any <tt>TIMESTAMP</tt> column values written to an S3 file
--   in .csv format with microsecond precision.
--   
--   Setting <tt>ParquetTimestampInMillisecond</tt> has no effect on the
--   string format of the timestamp column value that is inserted by
--   setting the <tt>TimestampColumnName</tt> parameter.
--   
--   <a>$sel:includeOpForFullLoad:S3Settings'</a>,
--   <a>s3Settings_includeOpForFullLoad</a> - A value that enables a full
--   load to write INSERT operations to the comma-separated value (.csv)
--   output files only to indicate how the rows were added to the source
--   database.
--   
--   DMS supports the <tt>IncludeOpForFullLoad</tt> parameter in versions
--   3.1.4 and later.
--   
--   For full load, records can only be inserted. By default (the
--   <tt>false</tt> setting), no information is recorded in these output
--   files for a full load to indicate that the rows were inserted at the
--   source database. If <tt>IncludeOpForFullLoad</tt> is set to
--   <tt>true</tt> or <tt>y</tt>, the INSERT is recorded as an I annotation
--   in the first field of the .csv file. This allows the format of your
--   target records from a full load to be consistent with the target
--   records from a CDC load.
--   
--   This setting works together with the <tt>CdcInsertsOnly</tt> and the
--   <tt>CdcInsertsAndUpdates</tt> parameters for output to .csv files
--   only. For more information about how these settings work together, see
--   <a>Indicating Source DB Operations in Migrated S3 Data</a> in the
--   <i>Database Migration Service User Guide.</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:cdcMinFileSize:S3Settings'</a>,
--   <a>s3Settings_cdcMinFileSize</a> - Minimum file size, defined in
--   megabytes, to reach for a file output to Amazon S3.
--   
--   When <tt>CdcMinFileSize</tt> and <tt>CdcMaxBatchInterval</tt> are both
--   specified, the file write is triggered by whichever parameter
--   condition is met first within an DMS CloudFormation template.
--   
--   The default value is 32 MB.
--   
--   <a>$sel:csvDelimiter:S3Settings'</a>, <a>s3Settings_csvDelimiter</a> -
--   The delimiter used to separate columns in the .csv file for both
--   source and target. The default is a comma.
--   
--   <a>$sel:serviceAccessRoleArn:S3Settings'</a>,
--   <a>s3Settings_serviceAccessRoleArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name
--   (ARN) used by the service to access the IAM role. The role must allow
--   the <tt>iam:PassRole</tt> action. It is a required parameter that
--   enables DMS to write and read objects from an S3 bucket.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bucketFolder:S3Settings'</a>, <a>s3Settings_bucketFolder</a> -
--   An optional parameter to set a folder name in the S3 bucket. If
--   provided, tables are created in the path <tt>
--   bucketFolder/schema_name/table_name/</tt>. If this parameter isn't
--   specified, then the path used is <tt> schema_name/table_name/</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dataFormat:S3Settings'</a>, <a>s3Settings_dataFormat</a> - The
--   format of the data that you want to use for output. You can choose one
--   of the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>csv</tt> : This is a row-based file format with
--   comma-separated values (.csv).</li>
--   <li><tt>parquet</tt> : Apache Parquet (.parquet) is a columnar storage
--   file format that features efficient compression and provides faster
--   query response.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:datePartitionEnabled:S3Settings'</a>,
--   <a>s3Settings_datePartitionEnabled</a> - When set to <tt>true</tt>,
--   this parameter partitions S3 bucket folders based on transaction
--   commit dates. The default value is <tt>false</tt>. For more
--   information about date-based folder partitioning, see <a>Using
--   date-based folder partitioning</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:encodingType:S3Settings'</a>, <a>s3Settings_encodingType</a> -
--   The type of encoding you are using:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>RLE_DICTIONARY</tt> uses a combination of bit-packing and
--   run-length encoding to store repeated values more efficiently. This is
--   the default.</li>
--   <li><tt>PLAIN</tt> doesn't use encoding at all. Values are stored as
--   they are.</li>
--   <li><tt>PLAIN_DICTIONARY</tt> builds a dictionary of the values
--   encountered in a given column. The dictionary is stored in a
--   dictionary page for each column chunk.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:cdcMaxBatchInterval:S3Settings'</a>,
--   <a>s3Settings_cdcMaxBatchInterval</a> - Maximum length of the
--   interval, defined in seconds, after which to output a file to Amazon
--   S3.
--   
--   When <tt>CdcMaxBatchInterval</tt> and <tt>CdcMinFileSize</tt> are both
--   specified, the file write is triggered by whichever parameter
--   condition is met first within an DMS CloudFormation template.
--   
--   The default value is 60 seconds.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ignoreHeaderRows:S3Settings'</a>,
--   <a>s3Settings_ignoreHeaderRows</a> - When this value is set to 1, DMS
--   ignores the first row header in a .csv file. A value of 1 turns on the
--   feature; a value of 0 turns off the feature.
--   
--   The default is 0.
--   
--   <a>$sel:externalTableDefinition:S3Settings'</a>,
--   <a>s3Settings_externalTableDefinition</a> - Specifies how tables are
--   defined in the S3 source files only.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dictPageSizeLimit:S3Settings'</a>,
--   <a>s3Settings_dictPageSizeLimit</a> - The maximum size of an encoded
--   dictionary page of a column. If the dictionary page exceeds this, this
--   column is stored using an encoding type of <tt>PLAIN</tt>. This
--   parameter defaults to 1024 * 1024 bytes (1 MiB), the maximum size of a
--   dictionary page before it reverts to <tt>PLAIN</tt> encoding. This
--   size is used for .parquet file format only.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bucketName:S3Settings'</a>, <a>s3Settings_bucketName</a> - The
--   name of the S3 bucket.
--   
--   <a>$sel:encryptionMode:S3Settings'</a>,
--   <a>s3Settings_encryptionMode</a> - The type of server-side encryption
--   that you want to use for your data. This encryption type is part of
--   the endpoint settings or the extra connections attributes for Amazon
--   S3. You can choose either <tt>SSE_S3</tt> (the default) or
--   <tt>SSE_KMS</tt>.
--   
--   For the <tt>ModifyEndpoint</tt> operation, you can change the existing
--   value of the <tt>EncryptionMode</tt> parameter from <tt>SSE_KMS</tt>
--   to <tt>SSE_S3</tt>. But you canâ€™t change the existing value from
--   <tt>SSE_S3</tt> to <tt>SSE_KMS</tt>.
--   
--   To use <tt>SSE_S3</tt>, you need an Identity and Access Management
--   (IAM) role with permission to allow <tt>"arn:aws:s3:::dms-*"</tt> to
--   use the following actions:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>s3:CreateBucket</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>s3:ListBucket</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>s3:DeleteBucket</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>s3:GetBucketLocation</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>s3:GetObject</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>s3:PutObject</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>s3:DeleteObject</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>s3:GetObjectVersion</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>s3:GetBucketPolicy</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>s3:PutBucketPolicy</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>s3:DeleteBucketPolicy</pre></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:enableStatistics:S3Settings'</a>,
--   <a>s3Settings_enableStatistics</a> - A value that enables statistics
--   for Parquet pages and row groups. Choose <tt>true</tt> to enable
--   statistics, <tt>false</tt> to disable. Statistics include
--   <tt>NULL</tt>, <tt>DISTINCT</tt>, <tt>MAX</tt>, and <tt>MIN</tt>
--   values. This parameter defaults to <tt>true</tt>. This value is used
--   for .parquet file format only.
--   
--   <a>$sel:cdcInsertsOnly:S3Settings'</a>,
--   <a>s3Settings_cdcInsertsOnly</a> - A value that enables a change data
--   capture (CDC) load to write only INSERT operations to .csv or columnar
--   storage (.parquet) output files. By default (the <tt>false</tt>
--   setting), the first field in a .csv or .parquet record contains the
--   letter I (INSERT), U (UPDATE), or D (DELETE). These values indicate
--   whether the row was inserted, updated, or deleted at the source
--   database for a CDC load to the target.
--   
--   If <tt>CdcInsertsOnly</tt> is set to <tt>true</tt> or <tt>y</tt>, only
--   INSERTs from the source database are migrated to the .csv or .parquet
--   file. For .csv format only, how these INSERTs are recorded depends on
--   the value of <tt>IncludeOpForFullLoad</tt>. If
--   <tt>IncludeOpForFullLoad</tt> is set to <tt>true</tt>, the first field
--   of every CDC record is set to I to indicate the INSERT operation at
--   the source. If <tt>IncludeOpForFullLoad</tt> is set to <tt>false</tt>,
--   every CDC record is written without a first field to indicate the
--   INSERT operation at the source. For more information about how these
--   settings work together, see <a>Indicating Source DB Operations in
--   Migrated S3 Data</a> in the <i>Database Migration Service User
--   Guide.</i>.
--   
--   DMS supports the interaction described preceding between the
--   <tt>CdcInsertsOnly</tt> and <tt>IncludeOpForFullLoad</tt> parameters
--   in versions 3.1.4 and later.
--   
--   <tt>CdcInsertsOnly</tt> and <tt>CdcInsertsAndUpdates</tt> can't both
--   be set to <tt>true</tt> for the same endpoint. Set either
--   <tt>CdcInsertsOnly</tt> or <tt>CdcInsertsAndUpdates</tt> to
--   <tt>true</tt> for the same endpoint, but not both.
--   
--   <a>$sel:timestampColumnName:S3Settings'</a>,
--   <a>s3Settings_timestampColumnName</a> - A value that when nonblank
--   causes DMS to add a column with timestamp information to the endpoint
--   data for an Amazon S3 target.
--   
--   DMS supports the <tt>TimestampColumnName</tt> parameter in versions
--   3.1.4 and later.
--   
--   DMS includes an additional <tt>STRING</tt> column in the .csv or
--   .parquet object files of your migrated data when you set
--   <tt>TimestampColumnName</tt> to a nonblank value.
--   
--   For a full load, each row of this timestamp column contains a
--   timestamp for when the data was transferred from the source to the
--   target by DMS.
--   
--   For a change data capture (CDC) load, each row of the timestamp column
--   contains the timestamp for the commit of that row in the source
--   database.
--   
--   The string format for this timestamp column value is <tt>yyyy-MM-dd
--   HH:mm:ss.SSSSSS</tt>. By default, the precision of this value is in
--   microseconds. For a CDC load, the rounding of the precision depends on
--   the commit timestamp supported by DMS for the source database.
--   
--   When the <tt>AddColumnName</tt> parameter is set to <tt>true</tt>, DMS
--   also includes a name for the timestamp column that you set with
--   <tt>TimestampColumnName</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:csvRowDelimiter:S3Settings'</a>,
--   <a>s3Settings_csvRowDelimiter</a> - The delimiter used to separate
--   rows in the .csv file for both source and target. The default is a
--   carriage return (<tt>\n</tt>).
--   
--   <a>$sel:datePartitionDelimiter:S3Settings'</a>,
--   <a>s3Settings_datePartitionDelimiter</a> - Specifies a date separating
--   delimiter to use during folder partitioning. The default value is
--   <tt>SLASH</tt>. Use this parameter when
--   <tt>DatePartitionedEnabled</tt> is set to <tt>true</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:addColumnName:S3Settings'</a>, <a>s3Settings_addColumnName</a>
--   - An optional parameter that, when set to <tt>true</tt> or <tt>y</tt>,
--   you can use to add column name information to the .csv output file.
--   
--   The default value is <tt>false</tt>. Valid values are <tt>true</tt>,
--   <tt>false</tt>, <tt>y</tt>, and <tt>n</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:cannedAclForObjects:S3Settings'</a>,
--   <a>s3Settings_cannedAclForObjects</a> - A value that enables DMS to
--   specify a predefined (canned) access control list for objects created
--   in an Amazon S3 bucket as .csv or .parquet files. For more information
--   about Amazon S3 canned ACLs, see <a>Canned ACL</a> in the <i>Amazon S3
--   Developer Guide.</i>
--   
--   The default value is NONE. Valid values include NONE, PRIVATE,
--   PUBLIC_READ, PUBLIC_READ_WRITE, AUTHENTICATED_READ, AWS_EXEC_READ,
--   BUCKET_OWNER_READ, and BUCKET_OWNER_FULL_CONTROL.
--   
--   <a>$sel:compressionType:S3Settings'</a>,
--   <a>s3Settings_compressionType</a> - An optional parameter to use GZIP
--   to compress the target files. Set to GZIP to compress the target
--   files. Either set this parameter to NONE (the default) or don't use it
--   to leave the files uncompressed. This parameter applies to both .csv
--   and .parquet file formats.
--   
--   <a>$sel:csvNullValue:S3Settings'</a>, <a>s3Settings_csvNullValue</a> -
--   An optional parameter that specifies how DMS treats null values. While
--   handling the null value, you can use this parameter to pass a
--   user-defined string as null when writing to the target. For example,
--   when target columns are not nullable, you can use this option to
--   differentiate between the empty string value and the null value. So,
--   if you set this parameter value to the empty string ("" or ''), DMS
--   treats the empty string as the null value instead of <tt>NULL</tt>.
--   
--   The default value is <tt>NULL</tt>. Valid values include any valid
--   string.
--   
--   <a>$sel:serverSideEncryptionKmsKeyId:S3Settings'</a>,
--   <a>s3Settings_serverSideEncryptionKmsKeyId</a> - If you are using
--   <tt>SSE_KMS</tt> for the <tt>EncryptionMode</tt>, provide the KMS key
--   ID. The key that you use needs an attached policy that enables
--   Identity and Access Management (IAM) user permissions and allows use
--   of the key.
--   
--   Here is a CLI example: <tt>aws dms create-endpoint
--   --endpoint-identifier value --endpoint-type target --engine-name s3
--   --s3-settings
--   ServiceAccessRoleArn=value,BucketFolder=value,BucketName=value,EncryptionMode=SSE_KMS,ServerSideEncryptionKmsKeyId=value
--   </tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:dataPageSize:S3Settings'</a>, <a>s3Settings_dataPageSize</a> -
--   The size of one data page in bytes. This parameter defaults to 1024 *
--   1024 bytes (1 MiB). This number is used for .parquet file format only.
--   
--   <a>$sel:useCsvNoSupValue:S3Settings'</a>,
--   <a>s3Settings_useCsvNoSupValue</a> - This setting applies if the S3
--   output files during a change data capture (CDC) load are written in
--   .csv format. If set to <tt>true</tt> for columns not included in the
--   supplemental log, DMS uses the value specified by <a>CsvNoSupValue</a>
--   . If not set or set to <tt>false</tt>, DMS uses the null value for
--   these columns.
--   
--   This setting is supported in DMS versions 3.4.1 and later.
--   
--   <a>$sel:cdcInsertsAndUpdates:S3Settings'</a>,
--   <a>s3Settings_cdcInsertsAndUpdates</a> - A value that enables a change
--   data capture (CDC) load to write INSERT and UPDATE operations to .csv
--   or .parquet (columnar storage) output files. The default setting is
--   <tt>false</tt>, but when <tt>CdcInsertsAndUpdates</tt> is set to
--   <tt>true</tt> or <tt>y</tt>, only INSERTs and UPDATEs from the source
--   database are migrated to the .csv or .parquet file.
--   
--   For .csv file format only, how these INSERTs and UPDATEs are recorded
--   depends on the value of the <tt>IncludeOpForFullLoad</tt> parameter.
--   If <tt>IncludeOpForFullLoad</tt> is set to <tt>true</tt>, the first
--   field of every CDC record is set to either <tt>I</tt> or <tt>U</tt> to
--   indicate INSERT and UPDATE operations at the source. But if
--   <tt>IncludeOpForFullLoad</tt> is set to <tt>false</tt>, CDC records
--   are written without an indication of INSERT or UPDATE operations at
--   the source. For more information about how these settings work
--   together, see <a>Indicating Source DB Operations in Migrated S3
--   Data</a> in the <i>Database Migration Service User Guide.</i>.
--   
--   DMS supports the use of the <tt>CdcInsertsAndUpdates</tt> parameter in
--   versions 3.3.1 and later.
--   
--   <tt>CdcInsertsOnly</tt> and <tt>CdcInsertsAndUpdates</tt> can't both
--   be set to <tt>true</tt> for the same endpoint. Set either
--   <tt>CdcInsertsOnly</tt> or <tt>CdcInsertsAndUpdates</tt> to
--   <tt>true</tt> for the same endpoint, but not both.
--   
--   <a>$sel:datePartitionSequence:S3Settings'</a>,
--   <a>s3Settings_datePartitionSequence</a> - Identifies the sequence of
--   the date format to use during folder partitioning. The default value
--   is <tt>YYYYMMDD</tt>. Use this parameter when
--   <tt>DatePartitionedEnabled</tt> is set to <tt>true</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:rowGroupLength:S3Settings'</a>,
--   <a>s3Settings_rowGroupLength</a> - The number of rows in a row group.
--   A smaller row group size provides faster reads. But as the number of
--   row groups grows, the slower writes become. This parameter defaults to
--   10,000 rows. This number is used for .parquet file format only.
--   
--   If you choose a value larger than the maximum, <tt>RowGroupLength</tt>
--   is set to the max row group length in bytes (64 * 1024 * 1024).
--   
--   <a>$sel:cdcPath:S3Settings'</a>, <a>s3Settings_cdcPath</a> - Specifies
--   the folder path of CDC files. For an S3 source, this setting is
--   required if a task captures change data; otherwise, it's optional. If
--   <tt>CdcPath</tt> is set, DMS reads CDC files from this path and
--   replicates the data changes to the target endpoint. For an S3 target
--   if you set <a>PreserveTransactions</a> to <tt>true</tt>, DMS verifies
--   that you have set this parameter to a folder path on your S3 target
--   where DMS can save the transaction order for the CDC load. DMS creates
--   this CDC folder path in either your S3 target working directory or the
--   S3 target location specified by <a>BucketFolder</a> and
--   <a>BucketName</a> .
--   
--   For example, if you specify <tt>CdcPath</tt> as
--   <tt>MyChangedData</tt>, and you specify <tt>BucketName</tt> as
--   <tt>MyTargetBucket</tt> but do not specify <tt>BucketFolder</tt>, DMS
--   creates the CDC folder path following:
--   <tt>MyTargetBucket/MyChangedData</tt>.
--   
--   If you specify the same <tt>CdcPath</tt>, and you specify
--   <tt>BucketName</tt> as <tt>MyTargetBucket</tt> and
--   <tt>BucketFolder</tt> as <tt>MyTargetData</tt>, DMS creates the CDC
--   folder path following:
--   <tt>MyTargetBucket/MyTargetData/MyChangedData</tt>.
--   
--   For more information on CDC including transaction order on an S3
--   target, see <a>Capturing data changes (CDC) including transaction
--   order on the S3 target</a>.
--   
--   This setting is supported in DMS versions 3.4.2 and later.
newS3Settings :: S3Settings

-- | In response to a request by the
--   <tt>DescribeReplicationSubnetGroups</tt> operation, this object
--   identifies a subnet by its given Availability Zone, subnet identifier,
--   and status.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSubnet</a> smart constructor.
data Subnet
Subnet' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe AvailabilityZone -> Subnet

-- | Create a value of <a>Subnet</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:subnetStatus:Subnet'</a>, <a>subnet_subnetStatus</a> - The
--   status of the subnet.
--   
--   <a>$sel:subnetIdentifier:Subnet'</a>, <a>subnet_subnetIdentifier</a> -
--   The subnet identifier.
--   
--   <a>$sel:subnetAvailabilityZone:Subnet'</a>,
--   <a>subnet_subnetAvailabilityZone</a> - The Availability Zone of the
--   subnet.
newSubnet :: Subnet

-- | Provides information about types of supported endpoints in response to
--   a request by the <tt>DescribeEndpointTypes</tt> operation. This
--   information includes the type of endpoint, the database engine name,
--   and whether change data capture (CDC) is supported.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSupportedEndpointType</a> smart constructor.
data SupportedEndpointType
SupportedEndpointType' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe ReplicationEndpointTypeValue -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> SupportedEndpointType

-- | Create a value of <a>SupportedEndpointType</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:engineDisplayName:SupportedEndpointType'</a>,
--   <a>supportedEndpointType_engineDisplayName</a> - The expanded name for
--   the engine name. For example, if the <tt>EngineName</tt> parameter is
--   "aurora," this value would be "Amazon Aurora MySQL."
--   
--   <a>$sel:endpointType:SupportedEndpointType'</a>,
--   <a>supportedEndpointType_endpointType</a> - The type of endpoint.
--   Valid values are <tt>source</tt> and <tt>target</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:engineName:SupportedEndpointType'</a>,
--   <a>supportedEndpointType_engineName</a> - The database engine name.
--   Valid values, depending on the EndpointType, include <tt>"mysql"</tt>,
--   <tt>"oracle"</tt>, <tt>"postgres"</tt>, <tt>"mariadb"</tt>,
--   <tt>"aurora"</tt>, <tt>"aurora-postgresql"</tt>, <tt>"redshift"</tt>,
--   <tt>"s3"</tt>, <tt>"db2"</tt>, <tt>"azuredb"</tt>, <tt>"sybase"</tt>,
--   <tt>"dynamodb"</tt>, <tt>"mongodb"</tt>, <tt>"kinesis"</tt>,
--   <tt>"kafka"</tt>, <tt>"elasticsearch"</tt>, <tt>"documentdb"</tt>,
--   <tt>"sqlserver"</tt>, and <tt>"neptune"</tt>.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:replicationInstanceEngineMinimumVersion:SupportedEndpointType'</a>,
--   <a>supportedEndpointType_replicationInstanceEngineMinimumVersion</a> -
--   The earliest DMS engine version that supports this endpoint engine.
--   Note that endpoint engines released with DMS versions earlier than
--   3.1.1 do not return a value for this parameter.
--   
--   <a>$sel:supportsCDC:SupportedEndpointType'</a>,
--   <a>supportedEndpointType_supportsCDC</a> - Indicates if change data
--   capture (CDC) is supported.
newSupportedEndpointType :: SupportedEndpointType

-- | Provides information that defines a SAP ASE endpoint.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSybaseSettings</a> smart constructor.
data SybaseSettings
SybaseSettings' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> SybaseSettings

-- | Create a value of <a>SybaseSettings</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:serverName:SybaseSettings'</a>,
--   <a>sybaseSettings_serverName</a> - Fully qualified domain name of the
--   endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:secretsManagerAccessRoleArn:SybaseSettings'</a>,
--   <a>sybaseSettings_secretsManagerAccessRoleArn</a> - The full Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role that specifies DMS as the trusted
--   entity and grants the required permissions to access the value in
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt>. The role must allow the
--   <tt>iam:PassRole</tt> action. <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> has the
--   value of the Amazon Web Services Secrets Manager secret that allows
--   access to the SAP ASE endpoint.
--   
--   You can specify one of two sets of values for these permissions. You
--   can specify the values for this setting and
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecretId</tt>. Or you can specify clear-text values
--   for <tt>UserName</tt>, <tt>Password</tt>, <tt>ServerName</tt>, and
--   <tt>Port</tt>. You can't specify both. For more information on
--   creating this <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> and the
--   <tt>SecretsManagerAccessRoleArn</tt> and
--   <tt>SecretsManagerSecretId</tt> required to access it, see <a>Using
--   secrets to access Database Migration Service resources</a> in the
--   <i>Database Migration Service User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:username:SybaseSettings'</a>, <a>sybaseSettings_username</a> -
--   Endpoint connection user name.
--   
--   <a>$sel:password:SybaseSettings'</a>, <a>sybaseSettings_password</a> -
--   Endpoint connection password.
--   
--   <a>$sel:databaseName:SybaseSettings'</a>,
--   <a>sybaseSettings_databaseName</a> - Database name for the endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:secretsManagerSecretId:SybaseSettings'</a>,
--   <a>sybaseSettings_secretsManagerSecretId</a> - The full ARN, partial
--   ARN, or friendly name of the <tt>SecretsManagerSecret</tt> that
--   contains the SAP SAE endpoint connection details.
--   
--   <a>$sel:port:SybaseSettings'</a>, <a>sybaseSettings_port</a> -
--   Endpoint TCP port.
newSybaseSettings :: SybaseSettings

-- | Provides a collection of table statistics in response to a request by
--   the <tt>DescribeTableStatistics</tt> operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTableStatistics</a> smart constructor.
data TableStatistics
TableStatistics' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> TableStatistics

-- | Create a value of <a>TableStatistics</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:validationState:TableStatistics'</a>,
--   <a>tableStatistics_validationState</a> - The validation state of the
--   table.
--   
--   This parameter can have the following values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Not enabled â€“ Validation isn't enabled for the table in the
--   migration task.</li>
--   <li>Pending records â€“ Some records in the table are waiting for
--   validation.</li>
--   <li>Mismatched records â€“ Some records in the table don't match between
--   the source and target.</li>
--   <li>Suspended records â€“ Some records in the table couldn't be
--   validated.</li>
--   <li>No primary key â€“The table couldn't be validated because it has no
--   primary key.</li>
--   <li>Table error â€“ The table wasn't validated because it's in an error
--   state and some data wasn't migrated.</li>
--   <li>Validated â€“ All rows in the table are validated. If the table is
--   updated, the status can change from Validated.</li>
--   <li>Error â€“ The table couldn't be validated because of an unexpected
--   error.</li>
--   <li>Pending validation â€“ The table is waiting validation.</li>
--   <li>Preparing table â€“ Preparing the table enabled in the migration
--   task for validation.</li>
--   <li>Pending revalidation â€“ All rows in the table are pending
--   validation after the table was updated.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:fullLoadRows:TableStatistics'</a>,
--   <a>tableStatistics_fullLoadRows</a> - The number of rows added during
--   the full load operation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:inserts:TableStatistics'</a>, <a>tableStatistics_inserts</a> -
--   The number of insert actions performed on a table.
--   
--   <a>$sel:fullLoadEndTime:TableStatistics'</a>,
--   <a>tableStatistics_fullLoadEndTime</a> - The time when the full load
--   operation completed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:fullLoadCondtnlChkFailedRows:TableStatistics'</a>,
--   <a>tableStatistics_fullLoadCondtnlChkFailedRows</a> - The number of
--   rows that failed conditional checks during the full load operation
--   (valid only for migrations where DynamoDB is the target).
--   
--   <a>$sel:fullLoadReloaded:TableStatistics'</a>,
--   <a>tableStatistics_fullLoadReloaded</a> - A value that indicates if
--   the table was reloaded (<tt>true</tt>) or loaded as part of a new full
--   load operation (<tt>false</tt>).
--   
--   <a>$sel:validationFailedRecords:TableStatistics'</a>,
--   <a>tableStatistics_validationFailedRecords</a> - The number of records
--   that failed validation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:validationSuspendedRecords:TableStatistics'</a>,
--   <a>tableStatistics_validationSuspendedRecords</a> - The number of
--   records that couldn't be validated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:schemaName:TableStatistics'</a>,
--   <a>tableStatistics_schemaName</a> - The schema name.
--   
--   <a>$sel:validationStateDetails:TableStatistics'</a>,
--   <a>tableStatistics_validationStateDetails</a> - Additional details
--   about the state of validation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tableState:TableStatistics'</a>,
--   <a>tableStatistics_tableState</a> - The state of the tables described.
--   
--   Valid states: Table does not exist | Before load | Full load | Table
--   completed | Table cancelled | Table error | Table all | Table updates
--   | Table is being reloaded
--   
--   <a>$sel:fullLoadErrorRows:TableStatistics'</a>,
--   <a>tableStatistics_fullLoadErrorRows</a> - The number of rows that
--   failed to load during the full load operation (valid only for
--   migrations where DynamoDB is the target).
--   
--   <a>$sel:ddls:TableStatistics'</a>, <a>tableStatistics_ddls</a> - The
--   data definition language (DDL) used to build and modify the structure
--   of your tables.
--   
--   <a>$sel:deletes:TableStatistics'</a>, <a>tableStatistics_deletes</a> -
--   The number of delete actions performed on a table.
--   
--   <a>$sel:updates:TableStatistics'</a>, <a>tableStatistics_updates</a> -
--   The number of update actions performed on a table.
--   
--   <a>$sel:validationPendingRecords:TableStatistics'</a>,
--   <a>tableStatistics_validationPendingRecords</a> - The number of
--   records that have yet to be validated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:fullLoadStartTime:TableStatistics'</a>,
--   <a>tableStatistics_fullLoadStartTime</a> - The time when the full load
--   operation started.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastUpdateTime:TableStatistics'</a>,
--   <a>tableStatistics_lastUpdateTime</a> - The last time a table was
--   updated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tableName:TableStatistics'</a>,
--   <a>tableStatistics_tableName</a> - The name of the table.
newTableStatistics :: TableStatistics

-- | Provides the name of the schema and table to be reloaded.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTableToReload</a> smart constructor.
data TableToReload
TableToReload' :: Text -> Text -> TableToReload

-- | Create a value of <a>TableToReload</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:schemaName:TableToReload'</a>, <a>tableToReload_schemaName</a>
--   - The schema name of the table to be reloaded.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tableName:TableToReload'</a>, <a>tableToReload_tableName</a> -
--   The table name of the table to be reloaded.
newTableToReload :: Text -> Text -> TableToReload

-- | A user-defined key-value pair that describes metadata added to an DMS
--   resource and that is used by operations such as the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>AddTagsToResource</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>ListTagsForResource</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>RemoveTagsFromResource</pre></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTag</a> smart constructor.
data Tag
Tag' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Tag

-- | Create a value of <a>Tag</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:Tag'</a>, <a>tag_value</a> - A value is the optional
--   value of the tag. The string value can be 1-256 Unicode characters in
--   length and can't be prefixed with "aws:" or "dms:". The string can
--   only contain only the set of Unicode letters, digits, white-space,
--   '_', '.', '/', '=', '+', '-' (Java regular expressions:
--   "^([\\p{L}\\p{Z}\\p{N}_.:/=+\\-]*)$").
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceArn:Tag'</a>, <a>tag_resourceArn</a> - The Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN) string that uniquely identifies the resource for
--   which the tag is created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:key:Tag'</a>, <a>tag_key</a> - A key is the required name of
--   the tag. The string value can be 1-128 Unicode characters in length
--   and can't be prefixed with "aws:" or "dms:". The string can only
--   contain only the set of Unicode letters, digits, white-space, '_',
--   '.', '/', '=', '+', '-' (Java regular expressions:
--   "^([\\p{L}\\p{Z}\\p{N}_.:/=+\\-]*)$").
newTag :: Tag

-- | Describes the status of a security group associated with the virtual
--   private cloud (VPC) hosting your replication and DB instances.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newVpcSecurityGroupMembership</a> smart constructor.
data VpcSecurityGroupMembership
VpcSecurityGroupMembership' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> VpcSecurityGroupMembership

-- | Create a value of <a>VpcSecurityGroupMembership</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:VpcSecurityGroupMembership'</a>,
--   <a>vpcSecurityGroupMembership_status</a> - The status of the VPC
--   security group.
--   
--   <a>$sel:vpcSecurityGroupId:VpcSecurityGroupMembership'</a>,
--   <a>vpcSecurityGroupMembership_vpcSecurityGroupId</a> - The VPC
--   security group ID.
newVpcSecurityGroupMembership :: VpcSecurityGroupMembership
